A long 24 years struggle, along with Spanish defeat in the Thirty Years War (1648), peace with France (1659) would lead to a renewed independence for Portugal, under the new Braganza dynasty, which would turn to Stuart England as an ally and protector (marriage of Catherine of Braganza with Charles II and transfer of Bombay to England as a dowry).
translation: “自从1578年艾维兹王朝垮台，1640年葡萄牙已被西班牙国王统治60多年了.然而1640年，葡萄牙人起义造反并开始一场对抗西班牙的长期解放战争.伴随西班牙在三十年战争中战败（1648年），与法兰西议和（1659年），24年的漫长抗争达致葡萄牙在布拉干萨王朝治下重新独立，它求助于英格兰斯图亚特王朝以为同盟和保护者（布拉干萨的凯瑟琳与查理二世成婚，并把孟买作为嫁妆转让给英格兰）.”

original: In 1647, popular revolutions broke out in Naples and Palermo, and soon these two cities were in the hands of revolutionary governments. In Naples, at least, it was again the excessive taxation, imposed for Spain's war effort that had precipitated the rebellion. The Spanish monarchy, wrote the Venetian ambassador to Madrid at the time, 'resembled that great colossus that during an earthquake had collapsed in a few moments while everyone hurried along to enrich himself with the fragments.' In fact, Spain survived and even managed to hold on to much of its empire. The revolts of Naples and Sicily, directed as much against the local nobility as against Spain, were put down in 1648.
translation: “1646年，那不勒斯和巴勒莫爆发大众革命，两城市很快落入革命政府手中.在那不勒斯，至少又是为西班牙战争而强加的过度课税积淀了这次起义.西班牙君主写信给当时驻马德里的威尼斯使节道，‘恰似地震时庞然大物片刻间崩溃，每个人都慌忙捡拾碎片发家致富’.事实上，西班牙挺了过来并甚至成功攥住了帝国大部.那不勒斯和西西里的起义，反抗当地贵族与反抗西班牙的成分相当，于1648年被镇压下去.”

original: Born in 1664 the son of a gardener in Fiorenzuela (near Placentia, Italy), Giulio Alberoni owned his political career and success to the Duke of Vendôme, the French general whom he served in Italy, France and Spain. Agent of the Duke of Parma, he facilitated the wedding of Philip V of Spain with Elizabeth Farnese and become a Cardinal in 1717. His bellicose policy in Spain had him expelled in 1719. He was cunning and sly, but Spain did not have the resources needed to fulfill his ambitious plan. The Age of Spanish Supremacy was long gone.
translation: 生于1664年，来自费奥伦佐拉（在意大利的普拉杉西亚附近），有一个园丁父亲的朱利奥·阿尔贝罗尼开始了他的政治生涯，他在意大利，法国和西班牙为法国将军文多姆公爵服务，并大获成功.作为帕尔玛公爵的代理人，他促成了西班牙的菲利普五世跟伊丽莎白·法尔内塞的婚礼，并且在1717年成为了一位枢机主教.因为他的黩武政策，他在1919年被驱逐.他十分地狡诈，可惜西班牙并没有可以用来实现他的雄心壮志的资源.因为西班牙的霸权已经成了历史.

original: In the late 18th century Spain was far from its former power and glory. However the creation of the Viceroyalty of Rio de la Plata 1776 to get a better rule of the colonial areas as well as manage a better defense of its colonial areas quickly made a big difference in revenues by tripling the income to the Spanish government. Of course not all subjects in the colony areas liked the stricter control and thus higher taxes.
translation: 18世纪末，西班牙远非昔日的强权和辉煌。然而，为了更好地统治殖民区，以及更好地保卫殖民区，1776年建立的里拉普拉塔总督一职很快带来了巨大的收入变化，西班牙政府的收入增加了两倍。当然，在殖民地地区，并不是所有的人都喜欢更严格的控制和更高的税收。

original: After the expulsion of the Jesuits from Spain (1767), Moñino was sent to Rome as ambassador to obtain the papal suppression of the Society of Jesus. He was ennobled (1773) for the success of his mission. In 1776 Charles III appointed him chief minister. Under Conde de Floridablanca, as he was simply known in Spain, the Spanish enlightened despotism reached its peak, and his internal reforms, notably in finance, helped centralize the state. This, however, brought him into conflict with especially the Aragonese faction at court who accused him of embezzlement. After serving a three-year sentence he withdrew from public life. At the age of eighty he made a comeback into political life as he accepted the title of President of the Supreme Central and Governmental Junta that led the defense against Napoleon in 1808.
translation: （1776年）在驱逐了来自西班牙的耶稣会士后，莫尼诺作为大使前往罗马，以求获得教宗对耶稣会的镇压令。因为他成功地完成了自己的任务，他在1773年被封为贵族。在1776年查尔斯三世任命他为首相。在康德弗洛里达布兰卡，因为他在西班牙的名望，西班牙的开明专制到达顶峰，他的改革，尤其是金融方面的，对增强中央集权起到了相当重要的作用.这也给他带来了麻烦，尤其是法庭里指控他贪污的阿拉贡派系。在遭受了三年的牢狱生活后，他离开了政治舞台.在他80岁的时候，他又再一次踏入政治舞台，这一次为了对抗拿破仑在1808年的入侵，他从中央军政府处接受了最高法院中央主席的头衔，领导防御工作。

original: The Cortes, when they met at Cadiz in 1810, were dominated by liberals who wished to go beyond the mere support of the war effort and establish a constitution that would make impossible the revival of rule by a favorite like Godoy. The Constitution of Cadiz gave Spain a strictly limited monarchy (the king must work through his responsible ministers), a single-chamber Parliament with no special representation for the Church or the nobility, and a modern centralized administrative system based on provinces and municipalities.
translation: 科尔特斯，当在1810年加的斯会议时，是由希望获得超过仅仅是战争方面的支持并且建立一个宪法使戈多伊这样的统治不会再卷土重来的自由派人士主导的。科尔特斯宪法为西班牙带来了一个在严格限制下的君主制度（国王必须与对应负责的部长共同工作），一个没有给予贵族跟宗教特权的议会和一个建立在省市基础上的现代中央管理系统。

original: The internal situation of Spain, with the struggle between absolutists and liberals, contributed to the independence of the colonies. The deathblow to Spain's ability to keep her American colonies happened in 1820, when the troops, commanded by General Rafael del Riego, prepared to go overseas, revolted in Cadiz (Spain) in favor of the Constitution of 1812, ending provisionally the absolutist regime.
translation: 西班牙内部专制主义者跟自由主义者之间的斗争，加速了其殖民地的独立.对西班牙在美洲的殖民地位最大打击的事情发生在1820年：当准备出发到海外的拉斐尔·德尔·黎亚戈上校率领他的军队为了支持1812年宪法而在加的斯（西班牙）发动政变，暂时结束了专制政权.

original: In his early twenties novelist and poet Miguel de Cervantes served as a soldier in the Spanish navy. He was captured by Algerian corsairs in 1575 and kept hostage for five years, until ransomed by his parents and a Catholic religious order. In 1585 he published his first novel, La Galetea, but continued to support himself as a purveyor and tax collector. His break as an author came in 1605 with the publication of 'The Ingenious Gentleman Don Quixote of La Mancha' which became an immediate success and was later followed by a second part in 1615.
translation: 在小说家和诗人——米格尔·德·塞万提斯二十岁的时候，他曾经服役于西班牙海军。他曾经与1575年被阿尔及尔的海盗所俘虏并且直到他被他的同伴和天主教团所赎回的时候他已经做了5年的人质了。 在1585年，他出版了他的第一部小说《加拉特亚》，但是他之后成为了一个军需官和税吏。直到1605年他才重新成为了一个作家，这一年他出版了名作《堂·吉诃德》 ，随着这部书获得的巨大的成功，他在1615年出版了《堂·吉诃德》 的下卷。
托马斯·路易斯·德·维多利亚

original: Although an accomplished organist and singer, Tomás Luis de Victoria preferred the more quiet life of a composer to that of a performer. He was considered the most famous composer of 16th century Spain and one of the best-regarded composers of sacred music.
translation: 虽然他是一个多才多艺的风琴手和歌手，托马斯·路易斯·德·维多利亚更喜欢作为一个平静的作曲家而不是表演者.他被认为是16世纪最有名的作曲家之一以及最值得尊敬的宗教作曲家.

original: Juan II succeeded his father as an infant of less than two years of age, under the joint regency of his mother, Catherine of Lancaster, and his uncle, the infant Ferdinand, who became king of Aragon (as Ferdinand I) in 1412. Juan took the reins in 1419 but his political weakness led him to rely on his tutor, Álvaro de Luna, who, despite the hostility of the king's Trastámara cousins and their supporters among the old aristocracy, became the virtual ruler of Castile. He was appointed constable of Castile in 1423. Álvaro de Luna contested the influence of Ferdinand's rebellious sons in Castile. This led to factional struggles among the nobles, which saw de Luna ousted from power twice (1427 and 1438). However, the supporters of Juan and his constable rallied and finally put an end to the strife by defeating the rebel army of Prince Enrique (future Enrique IV) at the Battle of Olmedo in 1445.
translation: 胡安二世在不到两岁的时候继承了他父亲的王位，她的母亲兰开斯特的凯瑟琳和后来成为阿拉贡国王（斐迪南一世）的叔叔（1412）小斐迪南成为了他的摄政。胡安在1419年亲政，但是他的政治弱点导致了她过分依赖他的导师依文托·德·鲁瓦。虽然依文托·德·鲁瓦是极度敌视国王的特拉斯马特家族的堂兄弟以及她们在旧贵族中支持者，但他成为了卡斯蒂利亚的实际统治者。依文托·德·鲁瓦在1423年被任命为王室总管。依文托·德·鲁瓦极力指责斐迪南的叛逆儿子，这引起了贵族的不满，也导致了他两次被驱逐出权力中心（1427和1438）。但是胡安二世和他的总管集结了他们的军队，并于1445年的奥尔梅战役击败了恩里克王子（未来的恩里克四世），为这场内战画上了句号。

original: Disputes between the nobility and the leader of the [From.GetAdjective] Regency Council has finally caused the nobles to revolt. This gives us an opportunity to intervene in the internal affairs of [From.GetName] without declaring war...
translation: 贵族阶层与 [From.GetAdjective] 摄政委员会领袖之间的争端最终引起了贵族们的反抗.这给了我们一个兵不血刃干涉 [From.GetName] 内政的机会…
我们不会支持这些叛军

original: Soldiers are sent to aid the revolt
translation: 士兵们将会被派去援助起义

original: Seizing the opportunity to meddle in our internal affairs, [From.GetName] has sent soldiers to support the recent revolt!
translation: 为了抓住这个机会来干涉我们的内政，[From.GetName] 已派出士兵支持最近的叛乱!

original: We will deal with them in time

The inability to pacify the country has given ample time for dissidents in other provinces to whip up support for their own grievances against the crown. The province of [Root.GetName] has now joined the rebellious side!
translation: 由于治理国家的无能，他省异议者有了足够的时间去煽起他们对国王不满政见的支持. [Root.GetName] 的这个省份现在已经加入了叛军一边！

original: The Italian Wars were a series of wars between 1494 and 1559 that involved most Italian city-states, the Papal State and drew in major powers like France, Spain and the Holy Roman Empire. The earlier War of Lombardy against the Republic of Venice had left the Duchy of Milan seeking an ally and turned to Charles VIII of France for help. Using the House of Valois' old claim to the throne of Naples as a pretext when Ferdinand I of Naples died, Charles invaded the peninsula in 1494. With his army followed a large and mobile siege train that battered down the medieval city walls in a matter of days - triggering the reforms that led to the fortification style called 'Trace Italienne.' Despite tactical victories in the field, Charles became cut off from France and was forced to return home in 1498. The conflict over Italy was, however, far from over and the wars between Spain and France would go on for another 61 years.
translation: 意大利战争是1494-1559年间发生的一系列战争的总称，战争牵涉大多数意大利城邦、教宗国，并且像法国、西班牙、神圣罗马帝国这样的强国亦被牵入战事. 早期的伦巴第战争针对威尼斯共和国离开米兰公国去寻找新盟友并且转而向法国的查理八世寻求帮助. 那不勒斯的费兰特一世去世后，查理八世利用华洛亚王朝对那不勒斯王位的旧时宣称，在1494年入侵了意大利半岛. 随着他的军队协同一个巨大的移动攻城火炮在数日之内对中世纪腐朽的城墙的毁灭打击——触发了一场名为“Trace Italienne”（意大利之痕）的堡垒风格的变革.查理八世尽管取得了战术领域的胜利，但是却被法国剥夺了继承权并且被迫于1498年返回家乡.遍布意大利的硝烟虽然渐渐飘散，但是这场西班牙和法国之间的战争将要再持续61年.

original: Claim all French land in Italy!
translation: 我们宣称所有在意大利应归属法国的领土！

original: Italy lies outside our sphere of interest
translation: 意大利在我们的利益范围之外

original: The Italian Wars were a series of wars between 1494 and 1559 that involved most Italian city-states, the Papal State and drew in major powers like France, Spain and the Holy Roman Empire. The earlier War of Lombardy against the Republic of Venice had left the Duchy of Milan seeking an ally and turned to Charles VIII of France for help. Using the House of Valois' old claim to the throne of Naples as a pretext when Ferdinand I of Naples died, Charles invaded the peninsula in 1494. Despite tactical victories in the field, Charles became cut off from France and was forced to return home in 1498. The conflict over Italy was, however, far from over and the wars between Spain and France would go on for another 61 years.\n\n[From.GetName] has now claimed all our provinces in Italy!
translation: 意大利战争是1494-1559年间发生的一系列战争的总称，战争牵涉大多数意大利城邦、教宗国，并且像法国、西班牙、神圣罗马帝国这样的强国亦被牵入战事. 早期的伦巴第战争针对威尼斯共和国离开米兰公国去寻找新盟友并且转而向法国的查理八世寻求帮助. 那不勒斯的费兰特一世去世后，查理八世利用华洛亚王朝对那不勒斯王位的旧时宣称，在1494年入侵了意大利半岛. 随着他的军队协同一个巨大的移动攻城火炮在数日之内对中世纪腐朽的城墙的毁灭打击——触发了一场名为“Trace Italienne”（意大利之痕）的堡垒风格的变革.查理八世尽管取得了战术领域的胜利，但是却被法国剥夺了继承权并且被迫于1498年返回家乡.遍布意大利的硝烟虽然渐渐飘散，但是这场西班牙和法国之间的战争将要再持续61年.\n\n[From.GetName] 现在已经宣称了我们在意大利的所有省份！
接下来轮到我们反过来宣称所有 [From.GetAdjective] 的省份!

original: We should back down in Italy
translation: 我们应该在意大利问题上退让

original: Our move to claim all [From.GetAdjective] provinces in Italy has met with a response from [From.GetName]. They have now claimed all of our provinces in Italy!
translation: 我们宣称 [From.GetAdjective] 所有意大利省份的行动已经得到了 [From.GetName] 的回应. 他们现在宣称我们在意大利的所有省份！

original: How dare they?! Italy is ours!
translation: 他们竟敢如此大胆？！ 意大利是我们的！

original: As France grows stronger and begins to exert her power across Western Europe, those of us unfortunate enough to be her neighbors have to take action. In order to counter the rising threat, we have skillfully devised a political marriage with the Habsburgs of Austria, ensuring good relations between our countries for all time.
translation: 当法国变得更强大并开始在西欧发挥她的影响力时，我们这些不幸成为她邻居的国家就必须采取行动了。为了遏制不断增长的威胁，我们巧妙地设计了与奥地利哈布斯堡家族的政治联姻，以此确保我们之间持久的亲密关系。

original: Glory to the Habsburgs! Glory to $COUNTRY$!
translation: 荣耀属于哈布斯堡！荣耀属于$COUNTRY$！
西班牙，一顶属于哈布斯堡的王冠

original: As a response to our common enemy, France, the heirless [From.Monarch.GetTitle] [From.Monarch.GetName] of $FROM$ has married their line of succession into a branch of the glorious house of Habsburg. This will ensure good relations and cooperation across Habsburg Europe for all eternity.
translation: 为了应对我们共同的敌人——法国，绝嗣的$FROM$ [From.Monarch.GetTitle][From.Monarch.GetName]已经通过联姻将继承权转移到了荣耀的哈布斯堡家族的一个支系。这将确保整个哈布斯堡家族掌控的欧洲势力永远保持良好的关系和合作。

original: One house, united against one enemy.
translation: 同一个家族，携手对抗同一个敌人。
一场战略性十足的联姻

original: As France grows stronger and begins to exert her power across Western Europe, those of us unfortunate enough to be her neighbors have to take action. In order to counter the rising threat, we have skillfully devised a political marriage with the Habsburgs of Austria, ensuring good relations between our countries for all time. If we make the right moves, we might even be able to secure parts of the von Habsburg lands under the [Root.GetAdjective] crown.
translation: 当法国变得更强大并开始在西欧发挥她的影响力时，我们这些不幸成为她邻居的国家就必须采取行动了。为了遏制不断增长的威胁，我们巧妙地设计了与奥地利哈布斯堡家族的政治联姻，以此确保我们之间持久的亲密关系。如果我们采取了正确的行动，我们甚至能将冯·哈布斯堡家族的部分领地置于[Root.GetAdjective]王冠之下。

original: Secure an heir with territorial claims.
translation: 确保得到一名拥有领土宣称的继承人。

original: §Y[Root.GetName]§! will take over all of §YAustria's§! provinces in the Low Countries.
translation: §Y[Root.GetName]§!将获取§Y奥地利§!在低地的所有省份。

original: Keep Austrian and [Root.GetAdjective] lands completely separate.
translation: 奥地利和[Root.GetAdjective]的土地要彻底分开。

original: Our motherland has adopted colonial policies in alignment with Sepúlveda's reasoning that Indians are naturally disposed to be slaves and that slavery is also the best way for their Christian overlords to encourage them to convert to the true faith.
translation: 祖国采取了与塞普尔韦达意见相同的殖民政策，认为印第安人生来就该被奴役，奴役他们是让他们的基督徒主人鼓励他们皈依正信的最好方法。

original: We have adopted colonial policies in alignment with Sepúlveda's reasoning that Indians are naturally disposed to be slaves and that slavery is also the best way for their Christian overlords to encourage them to convert to the true faith. As a result the land owners in our colonies have little to worry about in terms of retribution for the way they treat the local population and as a result are able to extract greater profit from the land.
translation: 我们采取了与塞普尔韦达意见相同的殖民政策，认为印第安人生来就该被奴役，奴役他们是让他们的基督徒主人鼓励他们皈依正信的最好方法。我们殖民地的地主们因此不用为对待原住民的方式受罚而担心，并可从这片土地中榨取更大利益。
殖民政策：德拉斯·卡萨斯

original: Our motherland has adopted colonial policies in alignment with Las Casas reasoning that Indians are not barbarians and have a free will. They should therefore convert to Christianity out of their own free will and cannot be enslaved without consequences.
translation: 祖国采取了与德拉斯·卡萨斯意见相同的殖民政策，认为印第安人并不是野蛮人，他们有自由意志。他们当以自由意志皈依基督，而不能无故奴役他们。

original: Madrid has gone from being a small Castilian city to the capital of the Kingdom of Spain. As a result the city is growing very quickly as all the people of our court and administration settle there. Royal architects are also overseeing the expansion of the city in order to create a capital suitable to rule a growing empire such as ours.
translation: 马德里从一个卡斯蒂利亚的小城市成长为西班牙王国的首都。因为宫廷及政府都建设于此，所以马德里才能如此快速的发展。皇家建筑师亦指导马德里的扩张，使其成为配得上是我们如日中天的帝国的首都。

original: All Jews have been forced to either leave the country or convert. As a result a great number of people with very old roots in this area has left our country forever, leaving a more unified Catholic people behind but hurting many sectors of our economy.
translation: 所有犹太人被强令离开或改宗。因此大量扎根许久的人被迫永远离开该地区，使当地成为一个统一的基督教社会，但许多经济部门受到打击。

original: We have reduced the power of the local Cortes in Spain and our new national Parliament is therefore not as bound by their old powers as previous rulers have been. We are now truly a united country.
translation: 我们削弱了地方衙门的力量，新议会因此不再同先前统治者一般，受旧有势力的节制。我们现在真正统一了国家。

original: Instead of reducing the power of the local Cortes around the lands of Spain we have guaranteed their rights in our new constitution and their approval is now required for all important decisions.
translation: 不再削弱全西班牙地方议会的势力，我们给予他们在新宪法中权利，他们现在对所有重大决定有表决权。

original: Despite the multitude of languages prevalent inside our Kingdom we are promoting the use of our court language as the language for all administration.
translation: 尽管在王国中盛行各路语言，我们还是开始在所有行政事务上推行宫廷语言。

original: Rather than try to force our court language on the administration in the various parts of our country we have chosen to as far as possible use the old languages of authority in the regions we control.
translation: 比起强制在我国各地行政使用宫廷语言来，我们选择尽量使用该地区旧有的权威语言来行政。

original: The creation of a Spanish Bible translation has only strengthened our resolve to do what we can to suppress the Protestant movement in our lands. They may not be many but it is our duty to make sure the menace does not spread.
translation: 西班牙语圣经的发行加强了我们对压制我国新教运动的决心。这些新教徒虽然可能数量不多，但我们的使命就是确保他们的威胁不再扩散。

original: While some parts of the clergy disapproves we have allowed the newly created translation of the Spanish Bible to circulate without trying to hinder it too much. This will undoubtedly make the paltry Protestant community in our lands a bit calmer and we trust the rest of our subjects to be strong enough in their convictions to see it for the falsehood it surely is.
translation: 虽然有一些神职人员的反对，但是我们还是对新版西班牙语《圣经》的翻译开了绿灯，而不是百般阻挠。这无疑会使我国那些微不足道的新教徒们安分一些，其他臣民也会坚定自己的信心，看穿谎言，因为谎言终究是谎言。

original: We have reformed our colonial administration and modernized many of the rules that govern our colonial subjects. Revenue collection has become much more efficient and the economies of the colonies themselves seem to be developing. The great number of newly appointed colonial administrators from the mainland has, however, created tensions between the Creole population present in many of our colonies.
translation: 我们改革了殖民地行政并革新了许多管理殖民地臣民的法规。收税变得更有效率，殖民地的经济也在发展。但大量从本土来的新任殖民地官员却和许多殖民地的克里奥尔人（出身于殖民地但是父母均为白人的人）关系紧张。

original: Our mother country has decided to expel all Jesuits from our land and have deported them to the Papal States. As the Jesuits have up until now made a sizable contribution to our society by educating the Creole population and by spreading the true faith to the natives the long term effects of this are substantial.
translation: 我们母国决定驱除所有耶稣会士，将他们赶至教宗国。但至今耶稣会士已为我们社会作出了巨大贡献，教育克里奥尔人，并向原住民传播正信，这些影响极其深远。

original: Our mother country has reformed our colonial administration and modernized many of the rules that govern us. Revenue collection has become much more efficient and the economy is developing but the great number of newly appointed colonial administrators from the mainland has created tension between the Creole population and our motherland.
translation: 我们母国改革了殖民地行政并革新了许多管理我们的法规。收税变得更有效率，殖民地的经济也在成长。但大量从本土来的新任殖民地官员却造成了克里奥尔人（出身于殖民地但是父母均为白人的人）和母国的关系紧张。

original: The treatment of the native population in our colonies has become the subject of great debate among the [Root.Culture.GetName] intellectuals. A priest named Bartolomé de las Casas have made himself the spokesman of the natives and demand that we recognize their free will to receive Christ rather than force them into slavery and compelled conversions. The discussion has been going on for some time in various publications and has now culminated in a great debate being held in Valladolid at the request of [Root.Monarch.GetName].\nLas Casas main opponent, Juan Ginés de Sepúlveda, argues that the natives are naturally disposed towards slavery and that this is the only sure way to get them to stop their barbaric customs of cannibalism and human sacrifice in order to make them convert to the true faith.
translation: 如何对待殖民地土著居民成了[Root.Culture.GetName]知识阶级中一个极具争议的话题。一名叫巴托罗缪·德·拉斯·卡萨斯的神父为土著居民仗义执言，要求我们认可他们以自由意志归信基督，而不是强逼他们为奴，迫使他们转教。争论已在各类出版物上持续了好一段时间，并在[Root.Monarch.GetName]的要求下，在巴利亚多利德召开的会议上达到高潮。\n拉斯·卡萨斯的主要反对者，胡安·希内斯·塞普尔韦达，认为这些土著生来就该被奴役，奴役他们是阻止他们进行吃人的野蛮习俗和人祭，让皈依正信的最好方法。
同意塞普尔韦达的意见。

original: A good debate is always valuable in itself.
translation: 一场好的辩论本身就价值无穷。

original: Let us follow Las Casas reasoning.
translation: 同意德拉斯·卡萨斯的意见。

original: With the fall of Granada the last Muslim bastion of the Iberian Peninsula is now in Christian hands. Among our subjects there are still, however, a large number of Jews, Muslims and converts of questionable sincerity known as Marranos and Moriscos.\nIn order to create a truly universal Catholic state it has been suggested that we force our Jewish population to either convert or leave the country forever with what possessions they have that are not of precious metals.
translation: 随着格兰纳达的陷落，穆斯林在伊比利亚半岛最后的堡垒已握于基督徒之手。但我们的臣民中还有为数众多的犹太人、穆斯林，一般被称作马拉诺人和摩尔人，他们的忠诚度十分可疑。\n为了建立一个真正普世的天主教国家，我们必须采取如下政策：我国犹太人要不改宗就要被永远驱逐出境，留下他们所有非贵金属的财产。

original: Up until now the Spanish [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] has technically been the ruler of many states that together have been known as Spain. With the recent centralization of the government, however, and the creation of a new type of Parliament in [Root.Capital.GetCapitalName] [Root.Monarch.GetName] has suggested that it is time that we abolish the power of the local Cortes of the Spanish states. While this will not be an easy undertaking the alternative is to risk having the local Cortes stifle our new Parliamentary system with their old provincial interests.
translation: 直到现在，西班牙[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]在法理上还只是许多统称为西班牙的小国的君主。然而随着进来政府的中央集权化及在[Root.Capital.GetCapitalName]新式议会的创立，[Root.Monarch.GetName]认为该是时候免去西班牙地方诸邦的小衙门权利了。然此意绝非简单的事体，执行此意将冒着使地方衙门与我们的新议会系统对立之危险，以保卫他们旧有的地方权力。

original: One Cortes for a United Spain.
translation: 统一的西班牙只有一个议会。

original: We cannot infringe on their ancient rights.
translation: 我们不能侵犯他们古老的权利。

original: Spain is a country of many languages and while some attempts have been made to create a standardized overview of grammar for the [Root.Culture.GetName] language it's far from the only language used in our administration even in the core of our lands. Recently a particularly well researched and thorough new Grammar for the [Root.Culture.GetName] tongue was presented to [Root.Monarch.GetName]. When our [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] asked what use this might be to the state the bishop of Avila offered this simple suggestion:\n'After Your Highness has subjected barbarous peoples and nations of varied tongues, with conquest will come the need for them to accept the laws that the conqueror imposes on the conquered, and among them will be our language.'
translation: 西班牙境内有诸多语言，有人尝试建立标准全面的[Root.Culture.GetName]语语法，这种语言与我们行政使用的唯一语言大相径庭，甚至在我国核心区域也是如此。近来一本全新完备的[Root.Culture.GetName]语法著作被呈献给[Root.Monarch.GetName]。当我们的[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]问起这书有什么用时，阿维拉主教奏说：\n“当野蛮人和各种语言不同的民族臣服于陛下之时，随征服而至的是被征服者需要的是征服者加在他们之上的法律，这其中之一便是我们的语言。”

original: Adopt [Root.Culture.GetName] as the language of our administration.
translation: 把[Root.Culture.GetName]语作为行政语言之一。

original: We must try to incorporate all languages of our realm instead.
translation: 我们要同化境内所有语言。

original: The unification of Spain has created a kingdom consisting of many former realms. [Root.Capital.GetCapitalName] has served our predecessors well but it has been suggested that the small city of Madrid with its central position and welcoming climate would be a better location from which to rule all the Spanish realms. The existing Real Alcázar de Madrid could be expanded into a suitable royal residence while the city in general is still undeveloped enough to offer a blank sheet for the city planners of our kingdom. Let us build a new capital fit to rule a Great Empire!
translation: 西班牙的统一建立了一个包含许多旧有国家的王国。[Root.Capital.GetCapitalName]已为各个前任君主服务多年，但小城马德里因其位置在中央，切气候宜人，是统治西班牙的理想地点。既存的马德里王家城堡可以扩建为适宜的王宫，但马德里城还未有开发，不能为我国的城市规划者提供一张合适的白纸。让我们营建新都，称得上我们伟大的帝国！

original: [Root.Capital.GetCapitalName] will remain the capital of our dynasty.

The Christian clergy has always regarded the Morisco converts to Christianity with suspicion. This is all the more true in the recently conquered kingdom of Granada where the policies to encourage conversions have been too efficient according to some. Whether the Christian suspicions have been proven right or if it is a result of their actions to persecute feared Crypto-Catholics we cannot know but it is clear the Moriscos in the former kingdom of Granada feel they have had enough.\nOn the slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountains the Moors have enthroned a new king of Granada and as the revolt spreads reports reach us of the destruction of churches, torture and murder of Christian priests and open defiance of our most Catholic kingdom.
translation: 基督教牧师一直怀疑摩尔人是否会真心皈依基督教。在新近征服的格拉纳达王国，这个怀疑变得更加真切，有些人说，该地政策鼓励归信的效率太高了。我们不是到基督徒们的怀疑是否被证实，还是只是他们迫害担惊受怕地下天主教徒的行动的结果，但清楚的是，前格拉纳达王国的摩尔人觉得他们受够了。\n在内华达山脉的山坡上，摩尔人推举了一位格拉纳达的新王，随着起义蔓延，摧毁教堂，折磨、屠杀基督教牧师，反抗我们这个最天主教的王国的消息像雪片般传来。

original: Fate of the Kingdom of Granada

With all important locations in Granada once again under our control we must decide what to do with the Morisco population. It is true that most of them never supported the rebellion but how could we trust them not to turn on us in the future?
translation: 随着格拉纳达每一处要隘都再次落于我手，我们要决定如何对待摩尔人。虽然他们中大多数确实没有参预过任何叛乱，但我们要如何相信他们是否将来会对我们反戈相向？
驱逐所有格拉纳达摩尔人！

original: We must mend these wounds, not cut off the limb.

With its strongly Catholic history and identity the kingdom of Spain has not seen widespread interest in the Protestant reformation. There are, however, rumors of small groups of intellectuals secretly meeting to discuss these matters in larger cities. It is therefore with some concern that news has reached our most catholic majesty that the New Testament has been translated into Spanish by our countryman Francisco de Enzinas. While the printing presses in Spain itself are tightly controlled by the state it seems the printers of the Low Countries feel no obligation to protect the tender minds of our subjects. The Holy Inquisition has asked us to make an example of any Protestants they can find in our country to track down those who would bring the book into Spain as well as any Crypto-Lutherans inside our borders.
translation: 有着强烈的天主教历史和认同，西班牙王国对新教改革没有广泛的兴趣。但有流言说大城市有一小撮知识分子秘密聚会，讨论有关事宜。所以我们还是要关心一下以下事体：我们最天主教的陛下听闻我国人弗朗西斯科·德·恩西纳斯将《新约》翻成了西班牙语。西班牙本土的印刷出版被国家严格控制，但低地国家的出版商们却没觉得有任何义务保护我们臣民脆弱的思想。宗教裁判所要求我们杀鸡儆猴，找到国内所有新教徒，顺藤摸瓜找到将这些书籍带入西班牙的人，以及国内隐藏的地下路的教徒。

original: Best to nip this in the bud.
We can tolerate a few Protestants as long as they keep in line.
translation: 我们可以容忍这一小撮新教徒，只要他们不过界。

original: Ottoman Expansion in the Western Mediterranean
translation: 奥斯曼在西地中海的扩张

original: The expanding Ottoman Empire has long been cause for concern for the Christian countries with interest in the Eastern Mediterranean and the Balkans. With the fall of Tunis to the Ottomans they are now also present in the Western Mediterranean and seem destined to quickly supplant the weak Muslim dynasties that control most of the area. Interestingly enough the Emir in Tunis, recently ousted by Ottoman forces, has taken refuge in our country and is imploring us to retake his lost city. Perhaps his cooperation is just what we need to be able to stop the Ottoman menace before it is too late?
translation: 奥斯曼帝国的扩张早已引起在东地中海和巴尔干有利益的基督教诸国的注意。随着突尼斯陷落于奥斯曼人，他们亦出现在西地中海，看起来将很快取代控制该地区孱弱的穆斯林王朝。有意思的是，刚被奥斯曼人废黜的突尼斯埃米尔逃到我国避难，恳请我们夺回失地。也许与他合作正好能满足我们消除奥斯曼威胁的需要，亡羊补牢，为时未晚。

original: We must act to contain this threat!
translation: 我们必须处理这一威胁！

original: The Spanish Colonial Empire is one of the oldest in the world and as such has one of the oldest systems of administration. [Root.Monarch.GetName] has recently taken an interest in how the government of the colonies might be improved in order to increase our revenue extraction from them. The advisors of [Root.Monarch.GetName] are all men of the Enlightment and have suggested a number of ways to improve the situation, among other things the colonies should be allowed to trade freely rather than through a few select ports, Intendants appointed directly by the crown should be sent out to ensure the efficiency and honesty of our administration and tax reductions for vital sectors might stimulate the growth of the colonial economies.
translation: 西班牙殖民帝国是世界上最老牌的殖民国之一，因此有着最老旧的行政系统。[Root.Monarch.GetName]近来对如何改善殖民地政府以增加从中榨取的收入感起了兴趣。[Root.Monarch.GetName]的顾问都是启蒙派，给出了改善状况的数条建议，包括：允许殖民地自由贸易，而不是仅在几个选定的港口进行；派出由君主直接任命的行政长官，确保行政和关键部门的税收的效率和忠诚，以刺激殖民地经济增长。

original: Let us not mend what is not broken.

The Society of Jesus has played a very active part in the history of our country through the years both as agents of the Counter-Reformation and as facilitators of the colonization and conversion of the Americas. Through the centuries the order has come to wield considerable political power, especially in the colonies, where it has over time grown to become something of a nuisance. Our colonial administrators and landowners complain that the Jesuits protect runaway Indian slaves and that some of their reductions take up valuable land that would serve much better as a direct part of our country. The Order has also used its influence more than once to deflect or prevent our political goals and many suspect they support autonomy for our colonial possessions. The defenders of the Jesuits, however, claim that they bring many indirect benefits to our colonies and that we will see far from beneficial long term effects from expelling the order.
translation: 耶稣会一直以来都在我国历史上扮演者十分积极的角色，既是反教改的执行者，也是殖民化和使美洲人皈依的促进者。经过数个世纪，耶稣会掌握了极大的政治力量，特别是在殖民地，他们成长成了一个阻碍。我们的殖民地官员和地主抱怨说，耶稣会士庇护出逃的印第安奴隶，而且还占有大量肥沃土地，如果直接处于我国手下的话这些土地会更好地发挥其价值。耶稣会还运用他们的影响力，不止一次弯曲或阻碍我们的政治目标，许多人怀疑他们支持殖民地自治。但耶稣会拥护者称，他们给我们的殖民地带来了许多非直接的好处，如果我们驱逐耶稣会的话，我们将会失去这些长期好处。

original: Expel all Jesuits and auction of their property.
translation: 驱逐所有耶稣会士并拍卖他们的财产。

original: Their contributions to society more than make up for the problems they bring.
translation: 他们对社会的贡献大于他们带来的问题。

original: By embarking on a policy of toleration we are promising not to try to convert the moors of Granada. Should we backtrack on this promise we can expect consequences.
translation: 我们承诺将推行宗教容忍的政策，不会让格林纳达的摩尔人改宗。一旦收回这个承诺，我们可以想象后果会如何。

original: During the tumultuous time of the French Wars of Religion, certain countries saw their chance to intervene in our internal affairs without much risk of retribution. With our internal conflicts finally put to rest, these countries will now learn that [Root.GetName] don't forget that easily...
translation: 在法国宗教战争的混乱时期，某些国家看到他们不必冒太多风险干涉我们内政的机会 随着我们的内部冲突最终平息，这些国家现在将会明白：[Root.GetName] 不会简单地忘掉这些事.

original: End of the Wars of Religion in France
The armed religious conflicts that have plagued France during the last decade seem to finally be over. Our nation has been through a tumultuous time but seems to have come out of it stronger.
translation: 在过去十年里一直困扰法国的宗教武装冲突似乎终于要结束了.我们的国家已经度过了这个动荡的时期，但是似乎已经落后于其他更强大的国家.

original: The armed religious conflicts that have plagued France during the last decade seem to be coming to an end. However, as long as the capital is held by religious fanatics, our authority will be questioned. Perhaps converting to the [Root.Capital.Religion.GetName] faith might be the way out of the conflict?
translation: 从上世纪就令法兰西民不聊生的大规模宗教战争终于有结束的迹象了.但是，在那群宗教疯子被赶出王都之前，政府的权威就如浮沙上的城堡一般. 也许我们该尝试改宗[Root.Capital.Religion.GetName]来试图换取王都稳定？
为了巴黎，做场弥撒也无不可

original: Never! Paris will fall by the sword!
translation: 绝不！让血与火洗刷巴黎！！

original: The armed religious conflicts that have plagued France during the last decade seems to be coming to an end. However, as long as the capital is held by religious fanatics, [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] [Root.Monarch.GetName]'s authority will be questioned. It has been suggested that if [Root.Monarch.GetName] would drop [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] support for the religious minorities and instead publicly embrace the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, a way out of the conflict might be found.
translation: 从上世纪就令法兰西民不聊生的大规模宗教战争终于有结束的迹象了.但是，在那群宗教疯子被赶出王都之前，[Root.Monarch.GetName]陛下的权威很难得到国民们的承认.王室顾问很早便强调过：如若[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]陛下退让一步，放弃对宗教少数派的支持，改宗[Root.Religion.GetName]的话，冲突便能被化解了.
为了巴黎，做场弥撒也无不可

original: Never! Paris will fall by the sword!
translation: 绝不！让血与火洗刷巴黎！！

original: Paris has come under the control of religious fanatics! They have fortified the city and refuse to hand it back as long as [Root.Owner.Monarch.GetName] continues to support their enemies.
translation: 巴黎已经沦陷于一群宗教狂徒之手！他们巩固城防并拒绝在[Root.Owner.Monarch.GetName]停止支持其敌前归还该城.

original: How will I ever get it back?
[From.Monarch.GetTitle] [From.Monarch.GetName] of [From.GetName] is most concerned over the Religious Wars in France and has sent a contingent of soldiers to help the heretics in their struggle.
translation: [From.GetName]的[From.Monarch.GetName][From.Monarch.GetTitle]对法兰西的宗教动乱指手划脚，甚至还派遣一支军队来支持这些异端！
愿路西法收割这些罪人的灵魂！

original: [From.Monarch.GetTitle] [From.Monarch.GetName] of [From.GetName] is most concerned over the Religious Wars in France and has sent us a contingent of soldiers to help in our struggle to eradicate the heretics.
translation: [From.GetName]的[From.Monarch.GetName][From.Monarch.GetTitle]对法兰西的宗教动乱表示强烈关注，该国甚至还派遣一支军队来助我国平叛！

original: France has for years now been torn apart by a string of religious civil wars between the [FRA.Religion.GetName] [FRA.Monarch.GetTitle] [FRA.Monarch.GetName] and religious minorities. Should we take this chance to show our support for [FRA.GetName]? Or should we intervene on the minorities' side?
translation: 笃信[FRA.Religion.GetName]的法兰西[FRA.Monarch.GetTitle][FRA.Monarch.GetName]与宗教少数派之间旷日持久的激烈斗争已经将法兰西化为一片焦土.我国是否要对深陷泥潭的[FRA.GetName]伸出援手呢？还是再添把火？
派遣军队维护法兰西的和平
派遣军队保护宗教少数派
我国军队已经在前往法国的路上了

original: Heretic fanatics have taken control of [Root.GetName]. Many [Root.Owner.Religion.GetName] followers have been murdered or forced to flee and vast amount of property has been burnt to the ground.
translation: [Root.GetName]陷入了那些宗教疯子的手里.无数信奉[Root.Owner.Religion.GetName]的无辜百姓遭到残忍屠杀，家破人亡、背井离乡者不知凡几.
这种日子什么时候才是个头啊？

original: These [Root.Owner.Religion.GetName] followers must be rooted out!
translation: 那些愚信[Root.Owner.Religion.GetName]的无知之人合该受死

original: Justified as self-defense against attacks from [Root.Owner.Religion.GetName] believers, heretic fanatics have risen up in [Root.GetName] to take matters into their own hands. Should they get control of the province there is risk of massacres and widespread destruction.
translation: [Root.GetName]省的异端分子以抵制宗教迫害的名义迅速完成了武装.若是让这些家伙控制了整个省份，[Root.GetName]怕是要生灵涂炭、赤地千里了.

original: [Root.Owner.Religion.GetName] fanatics have taken control of [Root.GetName]. Many heretics have been murdered or forced to flee and vast amount of property has been burnt to the ground.
translation: [Root.Owner.Religion.GetName]狂信者已经掌控整个[Root.GetName]了.无数信奉异端的无辜百姓遭到残忍屠杀，家破人亡、背井离乡者不知凡几.
这种日子什么时候才是个头啊？

original: In reaction to what is seen as too weak a policy towards heretics, [Root.Owner.Religion.GetName] religious fanatics have risen up in [Root.GetName] to take matters into their own hands. Should they get control of the province there is risk of massacres and widespread destruction.
translation: [Root.GetName][Root.Owner.Religion.GetName]狂信者对于政府对宗教异端的怀柔政策已是忍无可忍.他们迅速完成了武装还宣称要“自己动手解决害虫”.若是让他们掌控了整个省份，[Root.GetName]可能将生灵涂炭、赤地千里.

original: The Assassination of Henri of Guise

After the Day of the Barricades Henry III refused to return to Paris out of fear for his own security. He had personally witnessed what a dangerous threat to the Crown the leader of the Catholic League, Henri of Guise, had become and now decided to strike back. On December 23, 1588, Henri and his brother, the Cardinal de Guise, were lured to a private meeting with the King at the Château de Blois. Entering the meeting room, the Kings guardsmen attacked Henri and stabbed him in the heart while others arrested the Cardinal who was killed shortly after. To rid himself of further opposition, the King had Henri's son arrested as well. The Catholic League now declared open war against the Crown and were supported by the Parliament of Paris, who brought criminal charges against the King. Henry III responded by joining forces with his cousin, Henry of Navarre.
translation: 自街垒之日后，亨利三世便因担心个人安全而拒绝返回巴黎.同时，惊魂不定的亨利也终于明白了与他同名的天主教“神圣联盟”领袖，吉斯公爵对他的王位有多么大的威胁了.惊怒交加之余，他也下定决心，要一劳永逸地解决掉这个心腹大患.1588年12月23日，亨利三世以私人会面的名义，将吉斯公爵与吉斯主教（刀疤亨利的哥哥）诱至布卢瓦城堡.吉斯兄弟二人刚一进入会客室，便遭到了国王亲卫的袭击.吉斯公爵未及反应便被利刃一刀插入心脏，当场殒命.而其兄吉斯主教亦于不久之后于监禁之中被处死.为了防备吉斯家族的反扑，亨利三世还将吉斯公爵17岁的嫡子一并收押狱中.自此之后，天主教“神圣联盟”便在巴黎议会（议会宣判亨利三世有罪）的支持之下，与国王彻底撕破脸皮.作为回应，亨利三世也与其表哥，那瓦拉国王亨利三世（亦即后来的法国国王亨利四世，波旁王朝的创始人），缔结盟约，共同镇压叛军.

original: Day of the Barricades was a public uprising on 12 May 1588 in Catholic Paris against Henry III who was considered too moderate and hesitant in dealing with Protestants. It was led by the head of the Catholic League, Henri of Guise, who despite a royal interdict had returned to the city. The King called in several regiments of Swiss Guards and the Gardes-Françaises, an act that violated a Paris city privilege not to have foreign troops quartered in the city. After a rumor spread that Henri of Guise were to be arrested, a city militia quickly barricaded many streets, hindering the royal troops. Fearing for his own security, the King was forced to flee the city. From his new position of power, Henri of Guise forced the King to sign a new edict, where he promised to never conclude peace with the heretics.
translation: ‘街垒之日’是1588年5月12日发生于巴黎的天主教徒暴乱.天主教徒普遍认为法国国王亨利三世在对待新教徒的问题上优柔寡断且软弱不堪.于是，天主教“神圣联盟”领袖，吉斯公爵无视国王发来的王室禁令，趁机挑动民心.亨利三世心急之下，不顾巴黎都市法中‘不许外来军队驻扎城内’这一条，召法国近卫队和瑞士近卫队（法王两大非正编御林军团）入城拱卫.近卫欲要逮捕吉斯公爵的谣言刚一传出，巴黎民兵便用路障将巴黎街道封锁，阻滞近卫军团的行动.发现事态不妙，急于自保的亨利三世连忙逃离巴黎.大势所逼之下，国王被迫签署吉斯公爵草拟的公告，宣布绝不向异端妥协.

original: The French Catholic League was founded by Henry I, Duke of Guise, in 1576. Its primary function was to defend the Catholic faith against the growing influence of Huguenots and keep Henry of Navarre off the throne. But it also suited Henry as a political tool to try and usurp the throne for himself. The League became a powerful player in the French Wars of Religion, often finding itself in conflict with both the Huguenots and the King.\n\nHow shall we respond to the formation of a [Root.Religion.GetName] League?
translation: 吉斯公爵亨利一世（又名刀疤亨利）于1576年建立了‘神圣联盟’.其建立主旨便是捍卫天主教国教地位、避免纳瓦拉国王亨利三世这个异端登上法兰西王座.但若是能够借这一机遇把自己送上王座，刀疤亨利自是不会反对.神圣联盟这个法国宗教战争中的重要势力与法国国王和胡格诺派异端都势同水火.\n\n我等应对这个[Root.Religion.GetName]联盟报以什么态度呢？

original: The unrest that led to the St. Bartholomew's Day Massacre in 1572 started with a failed assassination attempt on Admiral Gaspard de Coligny, the military and political leader of the Huguenots. In fear of Huguenot reprisals, King Charles IX decided to strike first and ordered the elimination of the Protestant leaders. The severely injured Coligny was dragged from his bed, killed and thrown out the window. Paris now exploded in a wave of popular violence as citizens began to hunt down and kill Protestants. Despite the king's attempts to stop it, the massacre lasted for three days. Charles also ordered his provincial governors to prevent further violence, but the massacre spread to another twelve cities, killing thousands of Huguenots.
translation: 1572年，法兰西又一大惨剧以凯瑟琳太后对加斯帕尔·德·科利尼（胡格诺派军政领袖）的失败刺杀拉开帷幕.事败之后，出于对胡格诺派的恐惧，查理九世在母亲的怂恿之下决定先下手为强，对新教徒领袖痛下杀手.其手段也是颇为血腥：科利尼先是于混战中被一剑刺穿了胸膛.随后，身负重伤的他又被从窗户扔下了楼.最后，奄奄一息的科利尼还被拖到吉斯公爵（刀疤查理）脚前一斧头砍掉了脑袋.这大大激发了巴黎市民们血液中的嗜血本性——他们开始自发地抓捕、虐杀所有视线内与异端扯得上关系的人.即使惊慌失措的国王极力劝阻，巴黎城中屠杀仍然持续了整整三天.查理九世政府的禁令也未能阻止情况的持续恶化：屠杀波及到了另外十二个城市，撕下文明面具的法国人将数以千计的胡格诺派信徒残忍虐杀，伤者更是不计其数.

original: Let it spread to the provinces
translation: 让他们化作潮水，席卷法兰西！

original: The Wars of Religion in France lasted between 1562 and 1598. The first seven wars (1562-1563, 1567-1568, 1568-1570, 1572-1573, 1575-1577, 1577, 1579-1580) had common features: a split society between Catholics and Protestants, fragmented and erratic military operations, and peace edicts that were more like truces than real peace. The question of the royal succession put the very existence of the kingdom at stake, even dividing Catholics in opposing fractions. After 1589 and the murder of King Henry III, Spanish intervention transformed the civil war into an outright international conflict. The violence and hatred between Protestants and Catholics had increased all over France in the years 1562-1572. The powerful Duke of Guise (from the Lorraine province) set up a Catholic League to react against the Protestants and what he considered a weak royal power. Although he was assassinated on 23rd December 1588 upon the order of King Henry III, the League then openly revolted and refused to recognize the king or his designated heir, and called for Spanish military aid, going so far as to offer the throne to the Spanish infant. Henry III was in turn murdered but named his cousin Henry of Navarre as his heir before he died. Henry IV sought foreign aid from England and the German Protestant princes but realized that he would not be able to assert himself as King of France unless he held Paris, and the capital was resolutely Catholic. In 1593 Henry thus converted to Catholicism, reputedly stating 'Paris is well worth a Mass.' Trying to unite his shattered Kingdom, Henry issued the Edict of Nantes which gave certain guarantees to both sides.\n\nWhat side should we support?
translation: 发生在1562年-1598年之间的法国宗教战争是七场独立战争的统称（分别为1562-1563，1567-1568，1568-1570，1572-1573，1575-1577，1577，1579-1580）.它们都具有几个共同点：天主教徒与新教徒的纷争、此起彼伏的武装动乱、形同白纸的和约.而王位继承问题更给这个复杂局面中又添了一把火——甚至连天主教徒内部都因此分成了针锋相对的不同派别.在亨利三世于1589年被谋杀后，西班牙势力的介入更将这场战争从法国内战变成了一场浩大的欧陆战争.天主教徒与新教徒的仇恨也在1562年-1572年，这十年间变得越发不可调和.实力雄厚的吉斯（位于洛林行省）公爵建立了天主教联盟-‘神圣联盟’，来应对新教徒势力与在他眼中软弱不堪的王室势力.即使在他被亨利三世谋杀后，神圣联盟仍然顽强地与国王进行斗争.联盟甚至为了得到西班牙的支持而认同西班牙王子对法国王位的宣称权.讽刺的是，亨利三世不久后也被刺杀，并将王位传给了他的表亲，纳瓦拉王国的新教徒国王，后来的波旁王朝创始人，亨利四世（担任纳瓦拉国王时，被称为亨利三世）.自幼受新教教义熏陶的亨利四世，虽然争取到了英国和神圣罗马帝国中新教势力的支持，但是他清楚地认识到：他一日未入主巴黎，他的王位便一日不得稳固.为了得到巴黎这一天主教大本营的支持，他决定改宗天主.他还为此说出了‘为了巴黎，做场弥撒也无不可’的名言.为了挽救分崩离析的法兰西，他还签署了南特敕令来缓和天主教势力与新教势力之间的矛盾.\n\n我们该站在哪一边？

original: The Birth of a Permanent Taxation System

Charles VII remodeled French finances, established heavy taxation, particularly through the taille, a direct land tax. Extracting the wealth of the land has always been a tough nut to crack for the centralizing French kings. To tap the vast riches of the French lands new and improved taxation methods were needed time after time. Throughout history the methods used became more and more rationalized to optimize gains for the treasury. The Birth of a Permanent Taxation Systems was a major step towards this aim.
translation: 查理七世重塑了法兰西的财政体系，他还通过国家地税这一项增加了各种繁重的税务.从土地上收税一向是法国国王最头疼的问题.国王们不得不一次又一次的税制改革来保证地税收入.随着时间的推移，税制在无数次改革中变得越发合理、有效.也许现在是该推行一个稳固的税收体制了？

original: The End of the Hundred Years War

Louis XI benefited from the outcome of the hundred year war. The virtual destruction of the feudal nobility enabled him to unite France more solidly under the royal authority and to promote and ally with the middle class.
translation: 路易十一世因百年战争而得到了莫大的好处：由于传统封建贵族势力在战争中遭到毁灭性打击，他得以建立起中央集权统治.与此同时，他还扶持了一大批中产阶级作为自己的忠实盟友.

original: Time to build a stronger nation
translation: 重建一个强盛的全新法兰西！

original: The Anjou Claims to the Kingdom of Naples

In 1442 René of Anjou lost control of the Kingdom of Naples to the Trastamara dynasty. Though he would never reacquire the crown himself René continued to style himself King of Naples throughout his life. With René now gone the Anjou claims to the kingdom are looking increasingly inconsequential.\nThe Neapolitan Kingdom is not without its enemies, however, and some Italian princes have approached [Root.Monarch.GetName] suggesting that [Root.Monarch.GetSheHe] could claim the Kingdom of Naples for [Root.Monarch.GetHerselfHimself] by citing the marriage ties between King René and our own dynasty in the past as a pretext. Normally this would be seen as a very weak claim but due to the impopularity of the Neapolitan rulers this might be overlooked.
translation: 那不勒斯王国和西西里一度是西班牙的领地.在安茹的拉涅被击败后，阿方索五世登上了那不勒斯王位.原本，他的王国多半最终会被并入西班牙之中.但是，法国国王查理八世，安茹家族的后裔，恰好也拥有对那不勒斯的继承权.虽然查理八世的侵略在福尔诺沃战役受挫后宣告失败，但是米兰继承危机、瑞士势力的介入、儒略二世明里暗里的手段种种因素影响下，意大利仍是暗流涌动、兵戈不断.在1494年（意大利战争爆发）到1559年（哈布斯堡与瓦尔瓦家族缔结卡托-康布雷齐和约）这六十多年间，亚平宁半岛这片多灾多难的土地上总计发生了六场战争.在此期间，战局数次反复，战火甚至一度烧到了法国境内.

original: Let us claim what is rightfully ours!
Let us drop our claims for good!
The State takes control of the Guilds

The word gilde, or ghilde, is but one of many terms used formerly in France and in the Low Countries to denote what the more modern word corporation stands for. In France and the Low Countries a guild was originally a sort of fraternity for common support, protection, and amusement. The members paid each a certain contribution to the common fund. After the end of the fifteenth century, under the despotic rule of the French kings, the guilds ceased to be a means of protection for a majority of their members. Their privileges became a means of filling the royal coffers at the expense of the employers.
translation: 公会一度是公司、法人在中世纪欧洲的代名词.在法国与低地国家，公会原本是某种近似于互助会形式的原始基金会.会员统一捐献一定款项以获得公会所提供的保护、娱乐、救济服务.十五世纪末，在法国国王横征暴敛之下，公会渐渐失去了其原本意义，转变成了王室榨取民脂民膏的工具.

original: Do not mess with the Guilds
Give more control to the Guilds

translation: 失去对意大利的继承权

original: During the period 1524-1529 the French King experienced several setbacks. Not only did he start and lose several campaigns in Italy, but in 1525 he was also captured and brought to Madrid in chains where he had to denounce all his claims. It did not end with that though. Once set free, the French King refused to denounce his claims and again and again attacked in Italy. However, slowly he understood that the Italians would not accept a French monarch. For them belonging to a weak Holy Roman Empire was much better, and the French King also found that his opponents never had a problem with getting the majority of the lesser Italian states into their alliance. So at last after numerous fruitless wars the French King gave up his claims in Italy.
translation: 1524年到1529年之间，法国国王遭受了几次严重的打击：他不止屡次在意大利被击败，甚至还一度沦为阶下囚.他因此不得不放弃对意大利的继承权.但是当他重获自由后，法国国王一再强调他仍然拥有对意大利的合法继承权.然而，他还是明白了，意大利注定不属法国.对意大利人而言，有神圣罗马帝国这样一个体制松散的宗主比中央集权的法兰西对他们要有利得多.而意大利人也因此永远不会站在他这一边.最终，在多次侵略无果之后，他还是放弃了对意大利的继承权.

original: No one seems to acknowledge our claims
translation: 早已无人承认我们的继承权了

original: We will never drop our claims on what is ours

translation: 勒 泰利耶和卢福瓦

original: Michel Le Tellier (1603-1685) was the son of a counselor at the Account Chamber. Pinpointed by Prime Minister Cardinal Mazarin, he was named Secretary of War in 1643. He started the needed reformation of the French army and war administration as minister till 1666 and Chancellor till 1677. His eldest son, Marquis de Louvois, continued and perfected his reforms and offered his master, Louis XIV, the largest and best army of the last half of the 17th century.
translation: 米歇尔·勒·特里尔(1603-1685)出生在书香门第.他因儒勒·马扎然赏识得以在1643年成为陆军大臣.自此之后，他一直受命监督陆军改革事务，即使之后改任首相、总理等职的三十多年中都毫不松懈.而他的长子，马尔凯斯·德·卢瓦在接过陆军大臣一职后，一如其父，尽心竭力改革陆军.他为'太阳王'路易十四留下了一支称霸十七世纪后半叶的庞大强军.
真是个杰出的陆军专家！

original: Samuel de Champlain and the Hurons
translation: 萨谬尔·德·尚普兰与休伦人

original: Samuel de Champlain was sent by a man named Aymar de Clermont who had been given the privilege to establish a fur trading company by the king of France. During his travels Samuel de Champlain made friends with the Indians. He spent time with the Algonquin and Huron Indians exploring the area.
translation: 艾马·德·克莱蒙上将得到法国国王建立皮毛公司的授权后，派遣探险家萨谬尔·德·尚普兰探索北美.萨缪尔成功地获得了当地印第安人的善意.他还在阿尔冈琴人和休伦人的帮助下探索了大片未知区域（现在的魁北克地区）.

original: Marie de' Medici was married to Henry IV in 1600. After his assassination in 1610 she became regent for her son Louis XIII and went on to reverse a lot of the policies set by her husband.
translation: 玛丽·德·美第奇在1600年嫁给亨利四世.在1610年亨利四世遇刺后，她成为她的儿子路易十三的摄政，并推翻了她的丈夫统治时期制定的很多的政策.

original: Treat the Noble Rebels with Dignity
translation: 让叛乱的贵族有点尊严

original: Kill them and expropriate their land
translation: 杀了他们并剥夺她们的土地

original: In the reign of King Louis XIII, Cardinal Richelieu decided to suppress Protestant political privileges. An uprising (1621-22) against the introduction of Catholicism in Bearn was put down by Richelieu, and the Protestants lost all the strongholds given to them under the Edict of Nantes, except Montauban and La Rochelle.
translation: 在路易十三统治时期，枢机主教黎塞留决定，打压新教的政治特权.一场反对在贝亚恩引进天主教的起义（1621年至1622年）被黎塞留所镇压，新教徒几乎失去了南特敕令给与她们的所有的据点，除了蒙托邦和拉罗谢尔.

original: Armand Jean du Plessis, Cardinal of Richelieu, was 39 years old when he became Chief Minister of King Louis XIII in 1624. His main successful efforts in domestic policy were the fight against the upper nobility and the Protestant political privileges. He also supported overseas trade, colonial expansion and the constitution of a permanent royal navy. Its most notable achievement remained the diplomatic game he played during the Thirty Years War, pushing with French gold the Swedish intervention in 1630 and ultimately joining the war in 1635. His aims had been the reduction of the House of Habsburg and the extrication of France from encirclement by enemy lands. He is considered as the inventor of the concept of Real Politik.
translation: 阿尔芒·让·迪普莱西，黎塞留的枢机主教.他在39岁之时成为国王路易十三世的首席大臣，他的主要功绩是在国内削弱上层贵族和新教徒的势力.他同时支持海外贸易、殖民扩张，并建立起一支常备的皇家海军.他以在三十年战争中所展现出的卓越外交手腕而著名，在法国的资助下瑞典军队于1630年介入战争，而在1635年，法国最终也加入了战争.他的努力成果最终使法国摆脱了敌对势力的包围网.人们将他视为真正意义上的政治的发明者.

original: The Fronde (1648-1653) was mostly the last revolt of the French nobility against royal absolutism. It had started by the revolt of the Parliament of Paris (at the time the highest French court with jurisdiction over royal edicts) against the domestic policies of Cardinal Mazarin, who acted as Prime Minister of the 5-year-old Louis XIV. It was followed by that of the upper nobility (Fronde des Princes), but the rebellion was finally suppressed by a combination of Machiavellian diplomacy, betrayals and reverses of fortune. The Parliament was muzzled (it would not be convened again before 1789) and the upper nobility deprived of political power, preparing the advent of total royal absolutism under the Sun King, Louis XIV, after 1661.
translation: “投石党”动乱（1648-1653）是在法国发生的最后一次由贵族反抗王室专制统治的叛乱.它始于国会对枢机主教马萨林——5岁的路易十四国王的首相——的国内政策的公然反对（当时法兰西最高法院的司法权高于皇室法令），随后由法兰西的大贵族（投石党亲王）领导了叛乱，最终，这场起义的命运在阴谋和妥协之下走向背叛和失败.国会遭到解散（直到1789年前都不再召开），上层贵族也被剥夺了权力，为太阳王路易十四在1661年后实现真正的王室专制统治铺平了道路.

original: Crush the Parliament and the Nobles

Cardinal Richelieu, a liberal patron of literature, created l'Academie française in 1636 in order to promote French language and literary pursuits. Although the scientific part of the academy never matched the literary one in fame, it did make a number of important scientific discoveries in the eighteenth century. It was French expeditions in 1735 and 1743, for instance, which established the oblate shape of the earth.
translation: 枢机主教黎塞留，一位学术界的慷慨赞助人.他在1636年创建了法兰西学术院，并致力于促进法兰西语言和文学水平的发展.尽管这所学院的科学院从未达到与文学院相等的声望，却在十八世纪做出了许多重要的科学探索.比如说，正是法兰西的远征队在1735年至1743年间确定了地球是椭圆的这一事实.

original: Nominated Minister of Finance in 1661, Jean-Baptiste Colbert (born 1619) developed the first national economy of the modern age. His state-guided economy included better tax collection, statistical planning of the budget and regular bookkeeping. An advocate of Mercantilism (also Colbertism), he aimed at a favorable French balance of trade through the export of valuable finished products (like luxury items) and high import tariffs. He encouraged a more efficient domestic trade (roads, canals, suppression of local duties), established state monopolies, subsidized manufactures, promoted navigation and trade associations, fixed agricultural prices, encouraged marriage and prohibited emigration (except to Canada). To support his policies, he also greatly enlarged the size of the royal navy. While mercantilism promoted commerce and crafts, thereby increasing prosperity, peasants were not stimulated to increase their production. When he died in 1683, his son Colbert de Seignelay pursued his task till 1690.
translation: 于1661年被任命的法兰西财政大臣，让.巴蒂斯特.科尔伯特（1619年生）开创了国民经济的首个时代.他的国家经济调整包括更好的税收政策和统筹计划的收支预算，并定期清点账目。他提倡重商主义（也即科而伯特主义），通过增加昂贵商品（如奢侈品）的出口和更高的进口关税，使法兰西的贸易顺差趋向有利。他支持鼓励更有效的国内贸易（道路、运河、减少地方关税），建立国家垄断，补贴生产业，促进了新航道和商会，固定农产品的价格，鼓励婚姻并禁止移民（除了加拿大）。为了支持他的政策，他还大大提升了皇家海军的规模。当重商主义促进了商业和手工业，从而带来了繁荣时，农民并没有被鼓励去加大生产.当他在1683年逝世时，他的儿子科而伯特.德.塞涅勒继续推行他的任务直至1690年。

original: Build a Navy and modernize the Infrastructure
translation: 建造一支海军以及现代化的基础设置.

original: The major influence which France did exert over the baroque age was one of courtly opulence. In 1669 Louis XIV (1638-1715) decided to convert an old hunting lodge at Versailles into a palace of unprecedented magnificence. It was completed in 1682, and the court moved there in 1683. There was not a kingly or princely court in Europe which could match Versailles for the opulence of its gilded interiors, its mirrors and chandeliers, with an appropriately matching flamboyance of courtly ceremony, and there was not a kingly or princely court in Europe which did not, either openly or secretly, aspire to match this model.
translation: 法兰西对巴洛克时代最主要的影响是其宫廷的奢华之风.路易十四世（1638-1715）在1669年决定将凡尔赛镇的一处狩猎小屋改造成一座前所未有的华丽宫殿.宫殿在1682年竣工，国王的宫廷也在次年搬到这里.在整个欧洲，没有其他任何一位国王、亲王或是哪位权贵的宫廷中有堪与凡尔赛宫相媲美的镀金内饰、灿烂明镜与辉煌吊灯，以及无比高贵的宫廷礼仪.在整个欧洲，也没有一位国王、亲王或是哪位权贵，不是公开或暗中将凡尔赛宫作为典范，渴望与之比肩的.

original: We need it for the Glory
Such a project will not benefit us
translation: 如此奢侈的工程对我们是无益的.
凡尔赛宫屹立在天国般的荣耀之中

original: The huge structure, representing French classical style at its height, was the work of Louis Le Vau, J. H. Mansart, and Charles Le Brun. Andre Le Nôtre laid out the park and gardens, which are decorated with fountains, reservoirs, and sculptures by such artists as Antoine Coysevox. A huge machine was built at Marly-le-Roi to supply water for the fountains. The park contains two smaller palaces, the Grand Trianon and the Petit Trianon, as well as numerous temples, grottoes, and other decorative structures. The scene of the beginnings of the French Revolution, Versailles never again became a royal residence.
translation: J.H.蒙萨尔，路易.勒沃和查尔斯.勒布朗的工作将以宏大为代表性的法兰西古典建筑风格发挥到了极致.精美的林场和花园中点缀着喷泉和水池，和出自像安东尼.克瓦兹沃克斯这样的大师之手的雕塑.一座来自马尔利勒鲁瓦的巨大装置为人造喷泉提供源源不断的水源.园林包含两座小些的宫殿——大特里农宫和小特里农宫，以及许多教堂、岩洞和一系列装饰性建筑.而随着法国大革命的序幕拉开，凡尔赛宫再也没有重新成为皇室的住宅了.

original: Aiming at European hegemony and the rounding of French frontiers in the North and in the East (to the Rhine), Louis XIV had established the Chambers of Reunion, courts that advanced claims to Imperial lands. These expansionist policies were at first tolerated by France powerless neighbors. It reached its climax in 1681, with the annexation of the free city of Strasbourg in Alsace and the 1684 occupation of Luxembourg. The reunion was recognized by the Empire in the 1684 Truce of Regensburg, mostly because the Emperor was preoccupied by the Turkish menace (siege of Vienna in 1683) and this led to the creation of the anti-French League of Augsburg (1686).
translation: 为了法国的霸权以及环绕在北部和东部（到莱茵河）的法国边境，路易十四建立联合会议来加强对对神圣罗马帝国领土的宣称权.起初法国那些弱小的邻居容忍了法国这样的扩张政策.但是这种容忍在法国与1681吞并了阿尔萨斯的自由城市斯特拉斯堡和1684年占领卢森堡达到了极限.联合会议之所以能够在1684年的雷根斯堡休战条约中被皇帝认可，很大程度是因为土耳其人对帝国的威胁（1683年的维也纳之围困），这种妥协最早到底1686面奥格斯堡反法同盟的建立.

original: One of the preoccupations of Louis XIV had been the restoration of national unity, in particular religious unity. Safeguarding the Catholic Church by royal privileges and censoring Papal decrees (Gallicanism), he also sent dragoons to harass French Protestant families, persecuting them into conversions. In 1685, his revocation of the Edict of Nantes prompted nearly half a million Huguenots (French Protestants) to flee the country, to more tolerant places such as Holland (from where many migrated to South Africa) or realms that welcomed them, like Brandenburg-Prussia who alone welcomed 20,000. With them, France lost commercial, judicial and cultural elite, to the benefit of her enemies.
translation: 路易十四世所专注的事务之一就是法兰西的国家统一，尤其是宗教的统一.他颁布皇家法令维护天主教堂的特权，检查教宗的信令（高卢主义），他还派骑兵骚扰法兰西的新教家庭，强迫他们转信天主教.1685年他撤销了南特赦令，使上百万胡格诺派（法国新教徒）逃离这个国家，迁移到了更为宽容荷兰（经此许多人迁移至南非）和其他欢迎他们的国家，如普鲁士独自就接纳了两万移民.法兰西因此而失去了很多商业、法律和文化界的精英，这助长了他的敌人.

original: Have Mercy with these Misguided Creatures
translation: 怜悯这些误入歧途的人.

original: In a foolish decision of faith over economy [From.GetName] has chosen to expel all Protestants still living in their land. This is an opportunity to enhance our own economy. Should we allow them to settle in our provinces?
translation: 出于一项宗教高于经济的愚蠢决策，[From.GetName]已经驱离了所有仍居住在他们国内的新教徒.这是一个提振我们的经济的机会，我们应该允许这些人在我们的省份定居吗？

original: No, close our borders to them

In a foolish decision of faith over economy [From.GetName] has chosen to expel all Reformed still living in their land. This is an opportunity to enhance our own economy. Should we allow them to settle in our provinces?
translation: 出于一项宗教高于经济的愚蠢决策，[From.GetName]已经驱离了所有仍居住在他们国内的改革宗徒.这是一个提振我们的经济的机会，我们应该允许这些人在我们的省份定居吗？

original: No, close our borders to them

In 1717 the Mississippi Trade Company was founded. It had a Royal Monopoly on the utilization of the large colonial areas along the Mississippi River in America. In 1719 the Government borrowed 1.5 billion livres from the company. The company was more of a financial institution than a Company of Trade and Industry and the price of shares hit the roof. In 1720 the French hausse turned into a baisse and the fact that the shares of the Company were overvalued was evident even to the man on the street. Soon panic broke out and the Company was declared bankrupt. John Law was forced to flee from France.
translation: 密西西比贸易公司在1717年成立，他拥有密密西比河流域大片殖民地的皇室垄断权.1715年政府从公司借贷了15亿里弗.这家公司更像是金融机构而非普通的贸易行业公司，他的股票也一度涨到顶点.1720年法国的国力由盛转衰，公司股票被明显高估的事实连街上的普通人都知道了，很快恐慌爆发，公司宣布破产，约翰.罗被迫逃离了法兰西.
这听起来似乎很容易挣钱！
密西西比贸易公司的失败

original: After the early success with John Law's Bank and the Mississippi Trade Company the government bought the Bank and borrowed 1.5 billion livres from the Trade Company to pay mortgage on its huge national loans. These events brought a hausse to the French industry and the government lacked all restrains printing stockpiles of money without any security. When the overheated economy started to recycle with reality the shareholders of the trade company panicked driving both the Bank and the Trade Company into bankruptcy. As much of two years of collected tax money disappeared in the catastrophe and France thus was forced to declare bankruptcy in 1724.
translation: 在约翰.罗的银行和密西西比贸易公司的前期成功之后，政府收购了银行并从贸易公司借贷了15亿里弗去抵押国家的庞大债款.这些事给法国带来了一段工业上升期，而政府失去了对印刷储备货币的安全管控.随着经济热潮开始退去，惊慌失措的股东将银行和公司迅速推向了破产.这场灾难使法兰西两年的税收不翼而飞，政府不得不在1724年宣布破产.

original: The rapid expansion in North America seems to have sustained the shareholder's faith in the Mississippi Trade Company, and the rumors of both the company and the State going into bankruptcy have been dispelled.
translation: 在北美的迅速扩张似乎已经鉴定了密西西比贸易公司股东的信心，公司和国家即将破产的传闻已经消除了.
查理-弗朗索瓦·德·布罗意

original: Charles-François de Broglie was an Earl of France that became the master spy organizer of King Louis XV. Under the King's direction and ideas, he organized the first complete and structured secret service, Le Secret du Roy. His network covered most of Europe and, if its first mission in the Polish succession question failed, his major achievement was the role played during the American War of Independence, in providing the first and precious help to the Insurgents (military supplies, finance, diplomatic support to Franklin's mission in Paris, etc.)
translation: 查理-弗朗索瓦·德·布罗意伯爵成为了法兰西国王路易十五的间谍总管，在国王的指示和授意下，他组建了第一个完整和结构化的秘密组织，罗伊的秘密.他的网络覆盖欧洲大部分地区，如果不考虑组织在波兰王位继承问题上的失败，他的主要成就是在美国独立战争中，为大陆军提供最早的宝贵援助（军事物资，财政，富兰克林的争取法国外交支持任务等）
安德烈 - 赫丘勒弗勒里

original: Born in 1653 the son of a tax collector, Andre-Hercule de Fleury becomes the preceptor of the young Louis XV on 23rd August 1715. A great confidence always prevailed between master and student and in 1726, at 73 years of age, Fleury becomes Prime Minister, and this till his death in 1743. Faithful, honest, Fleury was above all a partisan of peace and did his best to maintain it. Under his government, France enjoyed the longest peaceful period of its history for the last 3 centuries.
translation: 安德烈 - 赫丘勒弗勒里在1953年出生于一个税吏家庭，在1715年8月23日，他成为年轻的路易十五的导师.在师生之间拥有极强的信赖感，在1726年，他出任总理直到1743年去世.弗勒里是一个诚实虔信又不失强硬的和平主义者，在他的内阁统治下，法国享有近3个世纪以来的历史最长的和平时期.

original: When Jean-Baptiste de Machault became controller-general of the finances in France in December 1745, he found the country on the verge of bankruptcy. Neither the aristocracy nor the clergy were paying the general land tax, the taille. In 1749, Machault tried to reform the system by proposing to substitute the old tax of a tenth, which many of the clergy and the nobility evaded, with a five percent tax without exceptions. The proposal was met by such loud protests from the clergy and the nobility, which cited their historical privileges, that Machault was unable to see it through.
translation: 当1745年12月，让 - 巴蒂斯特·马肖尔成为法国财政总管后，他发现法国处在破产的边缘.贵族和神职人员只支付基本的地税，租税.在1749年，马肖尔试图重组税收系统，以无差别的5%税收取代古老的什一税.这遭到了许多神职人员和贵族的反对.这个提案被神职人员和贵族声讨，他们列举了他们的历史权利，使得马肖尔无法通过议案.
推行该法案，不过这个法案的适用对象不包括贵族和神职吧

original: Introduce it, except for Nobles and Priests

Turgot issued his 'Six Edicts' eliminating the forced labor system of building roads, dissolved the guild system, lifted all sorts of tariffs and foreign trade controls, and implemented the Physiocrats' favorite policy - a single tax on landowners.
translation: 杜尔哥发行他的「六条诏令」消除建设道路的强制劳役，解散行会制度，取消各种关税和外贸控制，实行重农学派的喜爱政策——地主的单一税。
内克尔宣布财政预算赤字

original: Jacques Necker was originally a conservative compromise to the post as minister of finance. He, however, introduced a number of financial reforms, including a more equitable system of taxation and a plan for the funding of the national debt. In 1781 Necker was forced to announce the budget deficit in an effort to get new loans. The figures were highly colored, but everyone could now see what absurd sums the Court spent.
translation: 雅克·内克尔就任财政部长是一个保守的妥协.不过他引入了一些金融改革，包括一个更公平的税收制度和国家债务计划资金.内克尔在1781年被迫宣布预算赤字用以获得新的贷款.数字有夸大，但现在每个人都可以看到宫廷花了多么荒谬的款项.

original: In 1786 William Pitt the Younger signed an important commercial agreement, the Eden Treaty, with France. It was in keeping with the argument made by the economist Adam Smith in his The Wealth of Nations (1776) that Britain should be less economically dependent on trade with America and become more adventurous in exploring trading opportunities in continental Europe.
translation: 1786年威廉·皮特雅戈尔与法国签署了一个重要的商业协议，“伊甸条约”.它是基于经济学家亚当·斯密的国富论（1776年）中提出的论点，即英国应该减少在经济上对美洲大陆依赖，并更加冒险的探索在欧洲大陆的交易机会.

original: Rousseau was one of the first modern writers to seriously attack the institution of private property and is therefore considered a forebearer of modern socialism and Communism. Rousseau also questioned the assumption that the will of the majority is always correct. He argued that the goal of government should be to secure freedom, equality and justice for all within the state regardless of the will of the majority.
translation: 卢梭是最早严厉攻击私有财产制度的现代作家之一，他也被认为是社会主义和共产主义的先驱.卢梭也质疑多数人的意愿始终是正确的假设.他认为，政府的目标应该是确保国家内部所有人的自由，平等和正义，而不是服从多数人的意愿.
伏尔泰出版了“哲学快报”

original: In 1729 Voltaire returned to France from his exile in England. Determined to present England as a model to his countrymen the great writer of the Enlightenment began writing plays in discrete imitation of Shakespeare. He also commenced work on his biography of the great Swedish King Charles XII. His greatest achievement to date, however, was published in 1734. 'Philosophical Letters' was an incisive critique of the religious establishment and the Christian philosopher Blaise Pascal. A warrant of arrest was issued in May and Voltaire was once again forced to flee Paris.
translation: 1729年，伏尔泰结束了流亡生涯，从英国回到法国.他想要以英国为代表向自己的同胞介绍启蒙运动时期的伟大作家莎士比亚，并模仿沙瓮写戏剧.与此同时伏尔泰也在写瑞典伟大的国王查理十二的传记.而他的最伟大的成绩就是1734年出版的“哲学快报”，其中尖锐的批评了宗教机构和基督教哲学家帕斯卡.于是他又收到了一张逮捕令并被迫逃离巴黎.
孟德斯鸠出版“论法的精神”

original: In 1750 Charles-Louis de Secondat baron de La Montesquieu published the crowning achievement of his literary career - 'The Spirit of Laws.' This monumental 1086 page work was most celebrated for three of its numerous theories: the classification of governments, the political influence of climate, and the most important one, the theory of the separation of powers. Montesquieu argued that in the state that most effectively promotes liberty, the Legislative Executive and Judicial powers must be confided to different individuals or bodies acting independently. This idea was soon to become central to the Constitution of the United States.
translation: 夏尔·德·塞孔达，孟德斯鸠男爵1750年出版他的文学生涯的最高成就——《论法的精神》。这本1086页的巨著因为众多理论中的3点而成名：政府的分类，政治气候的影响，以及最重要的，三权分立的理论。孟德斯鸠认为如果想要最有效的促进自由，立法行政和司法权力必须由不同的个人或机构掌管，独立行事.这个想法很快就成为美国宪法的核心。

original: French mathematician, scientist and philosopher Rene Descartes has been called the father of modern philosophy because he was one of the first to oppose scholastic Aristotelianism. He began by methodically doubting knowledge based on authority the senses and reason then found certainty in the intuition that when he is thinking he exists - this he expressed in the famous statement 'I think therefore I am.' Descartes developed a dualistic system in which he distinguished radically between mind the essence of which is thinking and matter the essence of which is extension in three dimensions.
translation: 法国数学家，科学家和哲学家笛卡尔一直被称为现代哲学之父，因为他是第一个反对学者亚里士多德的学者之一。他的思考层层递进，逐步深入。他质疑那些源自于感性与理性的知识的权威，并在思索自我存在的过程中感受到了直觉的确定性，当他思考的时候他就存在——他在著名的声明中表示：「我思故我在。」笛卡尔阐述了一种二元对立的世界观。他将世界划分为两个部分：思维，即思想领域；存在，即整个三次元的延伸部分。

original: Sebastien Le Prestre de Vauban was a French military engineer who revolutionized the art of siege craft and defensive fortifications. He fought in all of France's wars of Louis XIV's reign (1643-1715) and went on frequent tours around the frontiers redesigning and improving numerous fortifications. His design for the fortification of Landau in Bavaria is sometimes reckoned as his greatest work.
translation: 塞巴斯蒂安·勒普雷斯特雷·德·沃邦是法国革命性的工程师，他拥有艺术性的堡垒设计和攻城技艺天赋.他几乎参与了法国路易十四的统治时期（1643-1715）的所有战争，经常巡视前线并重新设计和改进许多防御工事.巴伐利亚的兰道城堡还在像世人展示他的伟业

original: The Treaty of Versailles in 1783 was a success for France and revenge from previous defeats. However, it did nothing to ease the financial problems but rather increased the burden of debts. The success of the American independence movement also reinforced criticism of the regime. The 1786 commercial treaty with Britain was followed by a sharp decline in domestic industrial production, a very severe famine resulting from bad harvests, unrest and finally public bankruptcy in 1788. The King was forced to recall the Estates General, a feat unseen since 1626. On 5th May 1789, the Estates General convened at Versailles and soon pronounced itself a National Assembly (17th June), pledging to stay until they devised a constitution. Louis XVI acknowledged the changes in the situation, but the dismissal of his popular finance minister Necker and troop concentrations in the suburbs prompted the Paris masses to storm the state prison of La Bastille on 14th July 1789. The French Revolution had started.
translation: 虽然在1783年的凡尔赛条约中，法国成功复仇。但是他的财政问题仍然无法缓解，反而增加了债务负担。美国独立运动的成功却导致对政府的批评声越来越大。1786年的英国商业条约导致国内生产总值急剧下降，加上另一场非常严重的歉收导致的饥荒，财政破产汉和动荡终于在1788年到来。国王被迫召开三级会议，这是1626年以来的首次。三级会议在1789年5月于凡尔赛宫召开，并在6月17日迅速宣布这是一个国民大会，并且在制定宪法前不会结束。路易十六被迫接受了新局面，但是解雇他广受欢迎的财政部长内克尔和陈兵巴黎郊外导致了巴黎群众于1789年7月14日强攻巴士底狱，这就是法国大革命的开端。

original: Economic Reforms, but no Social Change
translation: 执行经济改革，无视社会改革.
法国大革命：共和君主制

original: On 5th May 1789 the General Estates met at Versailles. The different sections of the French society were somewhat divided on issues and couldn't agree. Only farmers wanted a social reform, while both noblemen and bourgeois could accept a partial social reform. However, that both financial and constitutional reform was needed was beyond doubt to all members. At first the king tried counteracting initiatives to produce a constitutional and social reform, but on 11th July he had to face facts and issued the popular minister of finance, Necker, to create a good proposal for financial reform. Unfortunately the farmers and petty bourgeois were held outside the negotiation as Necker believed them to crave impossible social concessions. While refining the final Constitution and signing the Financial reform, the effects of the government's denial to subside the bread prices was seen on the streets of Paris. The king ordered in troops, but the soldiers refused to shoot at the people and instead joined the revolts. Soon the frustration reached a boiling point and on 14th July the Bastille was stormed. A revolutionary wave went through the masses, and as the politicians failed to produce food for all, people took the matters in their own hands. The French Revolution had begun...
translation: 大会于1789年5月5日在凡尔赛庄园召开，不同阶层在法国社会问题上有分歧，无法达成共同意见，只有农民伯伯们希望社会改革，而贵族和资本家们介绍部分社会改革。然而，所有代表都同意财政和宪法改革是必须的。起初，国王试图反对宪法和社会改革，但7月11日，他不得不面对现实，并授命广受欢迎的财政大臣内克尔起草一份好提案。不幸的是，农民和小资产阶级在三级大会以外的谈判中表示是他们无法在社会改革方面让步。在细化宪法条文和签署金融改革文件的同时，政府拒绝平价面包导致了群众走上巴黎街头。国王命令军队镇压，但是战士们违抗军令并加入了起义。怒火很快达到了沸点，并导致了7月14日的围攻巴士底狱。革命的浪潮在群众中蔓延开来，既然政治家无法解决食物问题，人民就自己来解决，法国大革命已经开始。

original: As Robespierre's militantly radical faction was brought to power in the People's Assembly, a campaign to root out the 'Enemy within' started. Mass arrests of 'thought-to-be' royalist sympathizers were followed by the September massacres, after which Madame Guillotine was held warm by the blood of the people.
translation: 随着激进而好战的罗伯斯庇尔派在人民大会掌权，深挖“内在的敌人”的活动开始，紧随而来的是9月的大屠杀，人民大会大规模逮捕保皇主义的同情者，并将他们送上断头台.

original: Execute the enemies of the Revolution!

The Directory was the French revolutionary government set up by the Constitution of the Year III, which lasted four years, from November 1795 to November 1799. The Directors chose governmental ministers, ambassadors, army generals, tax collectors, and other officials. However, they had no funds to finance their projects or courts to enforce their will. The Directory was perhaps the most corrupt regime that France has ever known. Its policies were aimed, first, at protecting and increasing the profits of those in political and economic power and, second, at preventing the return of the Bourbons or the establishment of any other regime that might endanger those in power by such means as the redistribution of national property. The period was also noted for extravagant fashions in dress, excesses in entertainment, and a loose morality. However, the most important aspect of the directory and what gave it legitimacy in the eyes of the people, even as it was corrupt, was that it had ended the Reign of Terror. Anything was judged better then the 'Today you, Tomorrow me' logic of the Terror.
translation: 督政府是法国大革命时期的政府，是在革命后的第3年依据宪法设立并历时4年的，即从1795年11月到1799年11月的法国革命政府.督政府选举政府部长，大使，军队将领，税吏和其他官员.然而，他们没有资金来资助他们的项目和法院以执行自己的意志.督政府也许是法国历史上最腐败的政府，他们政权的目的，首先是保护政治家和富人并为他们增加利润.其次是防止波旁王朝复辟和其他任何可能危及政权的行为并以再分配的方式建立国家财产.这个政权还以他们华美的服饰，过度娱乐和缺乏道德约束出名.最重要的是，即使督政府政权已经堕落，在人民眼中，他的合法性来自结束了恐怖统治，那个“今天是你，明天就轮到我”的恐怖逻辑.

original: A Coup d'etat has brought Order

After the failed flight of the royal family on June 20, 1791 the king was forced into house-arrest. When the Reign of Terror started the nobility was beheaded en-masse and the king was declared to have conspired with foreign powers and thus considered a traitor. The king was first forced to abdicate, imprisoned and called 'Citizen Capet.' On January 15, 1793 the National Convent voted for a proposal to execute the king with the figures 361 votes against 360. On January 21, 1793 King Louis was beheaded.
translation: 在一场失败的出逃后，王室家族被逮捕.在恐怖统治开始时，贵族被集体斩首，国王也被宣布勾结外国势力，并因此被视为叛徒.国王被迫退位，被关入大牢并被称为“公民卡佩”.在1793年1月15日，在国民大会投票表决处决国王的结果，361票赞成，360票反对.于1793年1月21日，路易十六被斩首.

original: As the French revolution dragged on and saw permanent turmoil and the outburst of war, the people of the western provinces of France (Poitou, Vendee, Brittany) came to regret overthrowing the old regime and its relative stability, if not liberty. The unwise move of the Republican government to suppress the old clergy and replace the Catholic cult, combined with the return of some Royalist nobles, were the sparks that ignited a terrible revolt in 1794 that would force the diversion of large number of troops and mass massacres.
translation: 因为法国大革命一再拖延，持续动荡和战争爆发，法国西部省份（普瓦图，旺代，布列塔尼）人民后悔推翻旧政权并怀念其相对稳定性，假如没有自由.共和政府打压旧神职人员和立天主教为邪教的不明智之举，加上保皇党人的回归相结合导致了1794年这场起义的爆发并迫使共和政府投入大量军队并执行了大屠杀.

original: Royalists and Religious Rebels are on the move
translation: 保皇党和宗教叛乱分子在行动

original: Born in Corsica on 15th August 1768, Napoleon Bonaparte undertook military education at the royal military college of Brienne (graduated in 1785). A young artillery lieutenant when the French revolution erupted, he grabbed his first opportunity at the siege of Toulon in 1793 and then become the youngest general in the French revolutionary armies. A military genius, his victories in Italy in 1796 (and again 1800) and his campaign in Egypt 1798 would sharpen his thirst for power and he would become consul, then Emperor, marking the dawn of a new age.
translation: 拿破仑·波拿巴于1768年8月15日诞生在科西嘉岛，并在布列讷皇家军事学院接受军事教育（1785年毕业）.在法国大革命爆发时，他是一位年轻的炮兵中卫.他抓住了在1793年围攻土伦的机会，并晋升为法国革命军最年轻的将军.他是军事天才，于1796年在意大利获胜（并在1800年再次获胜），1798年的埃及战役强化了他对权力的渴望，他要成为了领事，然后是皇帝，标志一个新时代的到来
我们需要英名的领导者！

original: We don't want a new Caesar!

In 1809 Austria had been crushed and also Prussia was occupied. France was at war with England, but had managed to vassalize Spain. Russia was her ally and everything looked perfect until 1812, The Russians did not fulfill their obligations when come to the Continental Blockade and they had become wary of French power. In June France invaded Russia with more than a half million men. The Russians made a slow retreat to even the odds as the French army was shrinking from attrition. The Battle of Borodino (September 5-7) started as a bloody struggle, but thanks to luck and a diversion attack by Marshal Ney, the Russian Army was annihilated. Napoleon though decided to hold his Grand Armee, spreading it out for winter. Supply lines where secured and a lesser task force called L'Armee Baltique moved up occupying the Baltic coast up to St Petersburg which it took by assault. When late spring came, Napoleon again had more than half a million men in Russia and was advancing. During the winter Napoleon had restructured Poland under Poniatowski and recreated the Kingdom of Ukraine under Chielmkowski easing the supply effort. On 30 June 1813 Russia surrendered, unwilling to let Moscow perish in flames. France was the master of Europe...
translation: 1809年，法兰西击溃奥地利，占领普鲁士，虽然仍和英格兰作战，但成功地附庸了西班牙，并与俄罗斯结盟。一切都很完美，直到1812年，在新一轮大陆封锁中，俄罗斯拒绝履行盟约，他们为法兰西所警惕。6月，法兰西以超过50万大军入侵俄罗斯，俄罗斯人缓慢的后撤，通过让法兰西陆军自己损耗来扳回劣势。博罗季诺战役（9月5日至7日）开始，这是一场血腥的斗争，但由于运气和内伊元帅分队的攻击，俄罗斯军队被歼灭。虽然拿破仑决定停止大军的前进，但是随着冬天的到来，补给线保护困难，另有一只特遣部队波罗的海军移动占领了波罗的海沿岸并突袭了圣彼得堡。当迟来的春天到来，拿破仑再次组织起50万以上的大军深入俄罗斯腹地。在东季，拿破仑重组了波兰王国划归波尼亚托夫斯基，乌克兰划归海乌科夫斯基并以此缓解了后勤的压力，1813年6月30日俄罗斯因为不愿意莫斯科在烈焰中毁灭而投降。法兰西成为了欧洲之王……

original: We are the Masters of Europe!
The Economic Reforms of Mehmed II
translation: 穆罕默德二世的经济改革

original: Prior to his conquest of Constantinople Mehmed II signed several generous agreements with the mercantile empires of Venice and Genoa to ensure their neutrality, but when the great city had fallen he was not late in breaking the western merchants' strangle-hold on the Black Sea trade. Mehmed was a mercantilist who strived to maintain state control over the merchants, yet his protectionist measures had the intended effect and the Ottoman economy thrived.
translation: 在征服君士坦丁堡之前，穆罕默德二世和威尼斯与热那亚商业帝国大方的签署了多项条约，以确保他们的中立性，但是当这座伟大的城市陷落之后，他仍然及时地打破了西方商人对黑海贸易的控制.穆罕默德是一个重商主义这，他努力保持国家对商人的控制而他的贸易保护主义措施已达到预期效果奥斯曼帝国的经济蓬勃发展..

original: The reigns of Mehmed I and Murad II saw the Ottoman Empire reunified after the crushing defeat it had suffered at the hands of Tamerlane. The military was expanded and reformed to match any potential threat and ensure further expansion. It was also during this period that the Ottomans started to realize the vital importance of a strong navy.
translation: 在穆罕默德一世和穆拉德二世的治理下，奥斯曼帝国重新统一了自遭受跛子帖木儿之鞭沉重打击后的混乱。更进一步的对军队进行了扩充和改革，以确保能粉碎任何潜在的威胁，也正是这一时期，奥斯曼人开始意识到强大的海军至关重要。

original: In order to train administrators for his expanding empire, Mehmed II established an educational institution in the inner courtyard (Enderun) of the newly constructed Topkapi Palace. Students were chosen from among the most promising devshirme recruits (conscripted Christian youths mostly from the Balkans), and were trained in the Islamic faith, the sciences, and the military arts. They were expected to develop competency in the three languages of Turkish, Arabic, and Persian. This prepared them to serve in the Sultan's household, from which they could hope to graduate as government administrators with the rank of bey or pasha. The staffing of government posts with devshirme recruits trained in the palace school and loyal to the sultan formed the backbone of the Ottoman system of patrimonial rule throughout the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries.
translation: 为了培养行政官员充实日益庞大的帝国，穆罕默德二世在新修建的托普卡帕宫内院（恩德仑）修建了一所教育机构。从被德芙什美系统招募的壮丁（被征召的青年基督徒主要来自巴尔干）中挑选最有前途的出来作为学生，让他们皈依伊斯兰信仰，接受科学和军事艺术方面的训练。他们学习土耳其语、阿拉伯语和波斯语。让他们侍奉于苏丹的宫殿，从中他们有希望官至帕夏或者贝伊那样的行政官员。这些在宫廷学校接受训练并忠于苏丹的政府官员成为了15和16世纪奥斯曼帝国统治制度中的骨干力量。
用扩展提玛尔系统替代
穆罕默德二世的土地改革

original: "Mehmed II was a centralizing monarch, who sought to expand his personal power within the Ottoman Empire at all costs. Near the end of his reign he sought to reduce the power of the ulema by rerouting revenues from the foundations (waqf) which supported them to the timar system instead, further strengthening the Ottoman army. This move, illegal under Islamic Law, caused widespread resentment and was quickly reversed by his son Bayezid upon Mehmed's death in 1481.
translation: 穆罕默德二世是一位中央集权的君主，他不惜一切代价在奥斯曼帝国中扩张自己的权力。在统治的晚期，他支持用蒂玛尔制度来取代调整宗教财产的收入（瓦克夫）以削弱了乌理玛的权力，且进一步增强了军队。这个举动违背了伊斯兰教法并引起了广泛的不满，很快在1481年穆罕默德死后由他儿子巴耶济德废止。
威尼斯与土耳其的冲突

original: Since the capture of Constantinople by the Turks on May 29th, 1453, Venice had seen its commercial positions in the Black Sea deteriorate. Numerous wars had been fought between 1456 and 1490, pitching the Republic against the Ottomans, with the consequence of Venice losing more pieces of her commercial empire (inherited from the 4th Crusade in 1204) in the Aegean Sea and in Greece (Athens in 1460, Negropont in 1470). A war erupted again in 1499, Venice losing fortresses in Morea such as Modon, Coron and Navarrin.
translation: 自从1453年5月29日君士坦丁堡被土耳其人攻克以来，威尼斯人看到他们在黑海的商业地位恶化.从1456到1490年间双方进行了许多战争，共和国不停的和奥斯曼作对，最终的结果是威尼斯失去了他的商业帝国的（从1204年十字军东征以来不断继承的）在爱琴海和希腊（1460年在雅典，1470年在埃维亚岛）的许多领土.1499年，战端再起，威尼斯失去了摩尼亚地区的许多要塞，比如美索尼，科罗尼和納華林
土耳其波斯冲突：什叶派叛军

original: Ever since the young Ismail, head of the Safavid order, threw off the yoke of the Aq Qoyunlu to proclaim himself Shah of Iran in 1501, the Qizilbash heresy had grown stronger in Anatolia. Near the end of the reign of Bayezid II, the Qizilbash (Shiite-leaning Turkmen) rose up in revolt against the centralization efforts of the Ottomans' Sunni regime. Supported by Shah Ismail, and taking advantage of the succession struggle between Bayezid's sons, the rebels threatened to change the course of Ottoman history...
translation: 自从年轻的伊斯梅尔，萨法维教团的领袖，在1501年摆脱了白羊王朝的桎梏并且宣称自己是伊朗的沙赫之后，安纳托利亚的基齐勒巴什异端日渐强大。在巴耶济德二世统治的晚期，基齐勒巴什（什叶派倾向的土库曼人）起义反抗奥斯曼逊尼派政权的集权统治。在沙赫伊斯梅尔的支持和利用巴耶济德之子王斗争下，叛军威胁要改变奥斯曼帝国的历史……
穆罕默德三世对波斯的战术

original: Murad III, a Sultan ruled by women, fought the Persians in an exhausting war (1578-90) that severely strained the Empire and forced heavy taxes upon the citizens. Though the war was not for nothing - Persia had to cede Azerbaijan, Tiflis and Hamadan to the Ottomans - the resources might have been better spent elsewhere.
translation: 穆罕默德三世，由妇女统治的苏丹，在一场给人民带来苛捐杂税和给帝国带来极大压力的辛苦战争中与波斯交战（1578-90）.虽然战争并非没有收获-波斯割让阿塞拜疆，第比利斯和哈马丹给奥斯曼-但是资源花在别处会更好.

original: Persians take advantage of Ottoman instability
translation: 波斯人利用奥斯曼不稳定局势

original: The Spahi revolts in Eastern Anatolia encouraged the Persian Shah to seek revenge for the humiliating losses incurred by Murad III. War broke out yet again in 1603.
