translation: 阿尔及利亚人在安纳托利亚东部的叛乱鼓励波斯国王寻求报复穆罕默德III给予的屈辱的.战争于1603年再次爆发.

original: Crush the rebels and prepare for war!
The Expansion of the Royal Bureaucracy

Süleyman I was probably the greatest of the Ottoman Sultans. Called Kanuni (Lawgiver), he was an unsurpassed administrator who realized that the power of the provincial Beys had to be curbed by a strong central government. Thus he struggled to promote a powerful royal bureaucracy which was not popular in all camps...
translation: 苏莱曼可能是奥斯曼历史上最伟大的苏丹.被称为立法者.他是一个卓越的管理者意识到贝伊的权力需要被一个强大的中央政府限制.他努力打造一个强大的官僚体系但是在各个阵营中并不流行.

original: Selim I, called the Grim, was an ascetic man with a sharp mind. Seeing the threat of the great Christian navies, especially the Venetian one, he realized that the Ottoman Empire had to greatly expand its navy. In emulation of the Arsenale in Venice, he thus ordered the construction of the 'Imperial Halic Shipyard' in Constantinople. The great shipyard stood complete in 1517.
translation: 塞利姆一世，被称为冷面者，是一个清心寡欲的人.他敏锐的头脑.看到伟大的基督教海军，尤其是威尼斯的威胁，并意识到奥斯曼帝国不得不大大扩充其海军.模仿威尼斯的港口，他在君士坦丁堡建造了“御哈里克船厂”.这个伟大的船厂在1517年完成.

original: Cem Sultan, the governor of Karaman and Konya rebelled against his older brother Sultan Bayezid II upon the death of their father. However, Bayezid had broader support in court and Cem was ultimately defeated. He fled to Rhodes, where he remained a captive of the Knights of St. John until his death in 1494.
translation: 卡拉曼和科尼亚的统治者杰姆苏丹，苏丹巴耶塞特二世哥哥在父亲死后叛乱.不过，巴耶塞特在宫廷有更广泛的支持，并最终击败哈利.他逃到了罗得岛，在那里他成为约翰骑士团的俘虏直到1494年他去世.

original: Yet again the Shiites of Eastern Anatolia rose up in rebellion, this time led by a charismatic man named Celal. For centuries, subsequent uprisings in Asia Minor, whether of religious nature or not, were to be called Celali.
translation: 然而安纳托利亚东部的什叶派再次揭竿而起，这次是由一个名为塔拉巴尼的有魅力的男人领导.几个世纪以来，不论是否属于宗教性质，小亚细亚的起义都被称为贾拉利.

original: Following the spectacularly successful Mamluk campaign, Sultan Selim I accepted the homage of the sharif of Mecca and adopted the title "Servant of the Two Holy Places" (Khadim al-Haramayn), pledging to protect the security of the pilgrims traveling to Mecca and Medina each year for the hajj rituals required by the Muslim faith. Defense of the pilgrimage routes henceforth became one of the most significant sources of legitimacy and prestige for the Ottoman dynasty, as it was a role of immeasurable importance for all Muslims which no other dynasty could claim to fulfill.
translation: 继非常成功的征服马穆鲁克后，苏丹塞利姆接受了麦加谢里夫对他的敬意，并接受了“两圣地的监护人”称号，保证保护每年到麦加和麦地那参加朝觐仪式的朝觐者旅途的安全。保护朝圣之路从此成为维持奥斯曼帝国合法性和威望的最重要的来源之一，这对所有的穆斯林来说都有着不可估量的重要性，此前没有一个王朝可以满足这个要求。

original: Assume the title of Khadim al-Haramayn.
The treacherous governor of the newly conquered Mamluk Syria, Janbirdi al-Ghazali, rose up in rebellion against the Ottomans hoping to re-establish the Mamluk state under his own leadership.
translation: 新被征服的马穆鲁克叙利亚行省狡猾的总督，坎伯迪·安萨里，起义反抗奥斯曼帝国并希望在自己的统治下重建马穆鲁克
米马尔·希南的伟大建设

original: Mimar Sinan planned and oversaw the construction of countless mosques, aqueducts, bathhouses, bridges, palaces, caravanserais and schools during his half-a-century long career. His masterpieces were the Selimiye and Suleymaniye Mosques in Adrianople and Constantinople respectively.
translation: 米马尔·希南在他的半个世纪的漫长的职业生涯规划和监督建设了无数的清真寺、引水渠、澡堂、桥梁、宫殿、旅店和学校。他的代表作是在阿德里安堡和君士坦丁堡的塞利米耶清真寺和苏莱曼清真寺。

original: Enlist his services for a short time
translation: 在很短的时间内请他服务

original: Sultan Süleyman I became known as Kanuni - Lawgiver - to his own people thanks to his extensive legal reforms and just rule. While further codifying the dynastic laws, 'kanun', he worked in conjunction with the famous Sheikh al-Islam Ebussuud Efendi to bring them in line with Muslim Shari'ah laws, creating a more harmonious legal system for the empire.
translation: 苏丹苏莱曼一世被誉为卡努尼-立法者，他的人民感激他广泛的法律改革和公正的统治。再进一步编纂王朝法典“卡农”的同时，他与著名的谢赫穆罕默德·艾布苏尤德·伊马迪一起工作，使之符合穆斯林沙里亚法，为帝国创造了一个更加均衡的法律体系。

original: In 1598 a sekban leader, Karayazici Abdülhalim, united the dissatisfied groups in Anatolia, forcing the towns to pay tribute and dominating the Sivas and Dulkadir provinces in central Anatolia. When Ottoman forces were sent against them the Celalis withdrew to Urfa in southeastern Anatolia, making it the center of resistance. Karayazici rejected offers of governorships in Anatolia and died in 1602. His brother Deli Hasan then seized Kutahya, in western Anatolia, but later he and his followers were won over by grants of governorships. The unrest, however, continued under the leadership of Janbuladoglu in Aleppo and Yusuf Pasa and Kalenderoglu in western Anatolia. They were finally suppressed by the grand vizier Kuyucu Murad Pasha, who by 1610 had eliminated a large number of Celalis.
translation: 在1598年，一个奥斯曼农民雇佣军领袖，卡拉亚·阿卜杜勒，联合安纳托利亚的不满群体，迫使城镇交保护费，并称霸安纳托利亚省中部色瓦斯和杜卡迪地区.当奥斯曼军队前来攻打的时候，他们撤回安纳托利亚中部的乌尔法，并以此为中心抵抗.卡拉亚拒绝了安纳托利亚省长身份的招安，并于1602年去世.他的弟弟德利哈桑随后攻陷了安纳托利亚西北的屈塔希亚，但是随后被政府军击败.不过残部如简步拉杜格在阿勒颇和优素福婆娑在西安纳托利亚持续抵抗，最终在1610年被维齐尔库于苏穆拉德帕夏镇压.

original: Ahmed I married a beautiful Greek slave girl who would prove a very mixed blessing to the people of the Ottoman Empire. Kösem Sultan ruled her husband as she would rule no less than four of his successors - with an iron grip. Kösem was the real power behind the throne, and although she was a very able ruler, she was not a very popular one.
translation: 艾哈迈德一世迎娶了一位希腊奴隶女孩，这对于奥斯曼人民来说是一个非常复杂的祝福，柯塞姆苏丹以铁腕统治掌控丈夫正如掌控（他丈夫的）至少四位继承者一样。作为垂帘听政者，虽然她是能干的统治者，但并不受欢迎。

original: In 1658 Central Anatolia once again rose up in revolt under a new breed of Jelalis. Local concessions in power and taxes were again at stake.
translation: 在1658年，安纳托利亚中部又爆发了一波杰拉里叛乱.当地的权利和税收特许权再次危在旦夕.

original: Old Kösem Sultana, still meddling in high politics, probably attempted to have her grandson Mehmed IV killed, but was herself strangled by men in the entourage of her daughter-in-law, Turhan Sultan. Although the old conniving witch was hardly missed by most, she still had loyal supporters among the Janissaries, who were outraged by her murder.
translation: 在柯塞姆蘇丹晚年她仍然插手政治，甚至可能杀害她孙子穆罕默德IV，但是却被她儿媳吐菡苏丹身边的人给勒死了.尽管年迈并且老谋深算的老巫婆并不被大多数人怀念，但苏丹亲兵里她的忠实支持者仍然感到十分愤怒

original: Born around 1575 in the village of Radnick in Albania, Mehmed Köprülü was a young Christian boy taken by the devshirme system (abducted and raised in the Muslim faith, just like most Janissary troops). He started his career as a cook, then moved to the Treasury. A pasha in central Anatolia, he gained a name for himself as an excellent and honest administrator - a rare creature in the Ottoman Empire. On 15th September 1656 he was appointed Grand Vizier by the mother of the young sultan Mehmed IV. A fierce fighter of corruption, he enacted many successful reforms, balanced the budget and led the war against Venice. After his death in 1661, his son Fazil Ahmed 'the Virtuous' succeeded him and governed till 1676. Other Grand Viziers such as Kara Mustafa (1676-1683), Mustafa Pasha (1689-1691) and Hussein Pasha (1697-1702) were his direct heirs.
translation: 穆罕默德科普路在1575年左右出生于阿尔巴尼亚的一座名叫瓦迪思琪的小村庄，他是被德芙什美系统（绑架基督教孩童，培养穆斯林信仰，就像苏丹亲兵）选取的基督教男孩.他以厨师开始他的职业生涯，并随后被委派管理库房.他因为自己的杰出管理才能和诚实的品格，成为了安纳托利亚中部的一个帕夏——这在奥斯曼是非常罕见的.在1656年9月15日，他被年轻的穆罕默德IV的母亲任命为大维齐尔.在与腐败的激烈斗争中，他制定了许多成功的改革，平衡财政并指挥对威尼斯的战争.在他1661年去世后，他的儿子法兹尔艾哈迈德“贤良者”接替他做大维齐尔直到1676年，而其他的大维齐尔如穆斯塔法·卡拉（1676年至1683年），穆斯塔法·帕夏（1689-1691）和侯赛因·帕夏（1697-1702）是他的直系继承人.

original: During the reign of Ibrahim I, 'Kemankes' Kara Mustafa Pasha, was the Sadrazam, or prime minister. He tried to curtail overspending and revitalized the navy, but was finally executed by the Sultan in 1644. The Sultan had instead started to heed Jinji Hoja - a minor religious official with a reputation for occult powers who was brought into the palace to remedy the sultan's lack of heirs.
translation: 易卜拉欣一世在位期间，'切曼齐兹'卡拉穆斯塔法·帕夏，是大维齐尔或首相.他力图减少超支和振兴海军，但最终在1644年由苏丹处决.苏丹任命金鸡霍加-一个号称拥有神秘力量而被带到宫廷以解决无后问题的小宗教官.

original: The Treaty of Kasr-i Sirin, signed between the Ottoman Empire and Persia in 1635, established borders that have changed little to this day. Hostilities between the two great empires decreased remarkably following the treaty as their relations steadily improved until 1722 when war broke out again. However, the treaty was dusted off and renewed in 1747.
translation: 丝琳卡斯里条约于1635年由奥斯曼帝国和萨非王朝签署.两国建立的边界直到今天都没太大改变.在条约后，随着关系的稳步提升两国的敌对活动大大减少直到1722年战事再起.不过条约被重新提起和更新.

original: Our embassy sent to [From.GetName] has returned with good news! They agreed to the terms of the treaty. May peace reign between our nations.
translation: 我们派往[From.GetName]的特使已经带来的好消息！他们同意该条约的条款.愿我们两国之间和平永存.

original: Our embassy sent to [From.GetName] has returned. They did not agree to the terms of the treaty!
translation: 我们派往[From.GetName]的特使回来了，他们不同意我们的和解！

original: They will pay for this insult
translation: 他们将会为这次羞辱付出代价

original: In the first decades of the 18th century the Beys and Deys (Janissary leaders) of Northern Africa were in a rebellious mood in the wake of the Peace of Carlowitz between the Ottoman Empire and the Holy League. In 1705, Hussein bin Ali Agha of Cretan origin staged a coup and founded the Husseinic dynasty which ruled Tunisia until 1957. Tunisia did not become truly autonomous at once, but it gained a large measure of independence.
translation: 在18世纪的前十年，北非的贝伊和禁军领导人弥漫在奥斯曼帝国和神罗签订的卡尔洛夫奇条约引发的叛逆情绪下.1705年，克里特的侯赛因·阿里建立起直到1957年持续统治突尼斯的侯赛因王朝.虽然王朝一次也没有完全自治，但是获得了很大程度上的独立性.

original: In 1711, Ahmad Karamanli, a Turkish cavalry officer and Janissary Dey, killed the Ottoman governor of Tripolitania and prevailed upon the Sultan to name him Bey. The post of governor remained hereditary in the Karamanli family until 1835. While the Karamanlis formally answered to Istanbul, Tripolitania was in effect an autonomous state.
translation: 1711年，艾哈迈德卡拉曼利，一位土耳其苏丹亲兵骑兵军官，杀死了奥斯曼的黎波里塔尼亚省长，并说服苏丹任命他为贝伊.卡拉曼利家族世袭州长一职直到1835年.虽然卡拉曼利斯效忠于伊斯坦布尔，的黎波里塔尼亚是一个自治的国家.
阿里·贝伊在埃及的叛乱

original: When war broke out between Russia and Turkey, Ali Bey declared Egypt's independence and proposed to fight on the Russian side, refusing to pay any more taxes to the Ottomans. Next, he invaded Syria, but he was betrayed by his rival Ismaïl Bey and killed in 1773.
translation: 当俄土战争爆发，阿里·贝伊宣布埃及的独立，并提出为俄方而战，并拒绝向奥斯曼帝国纳税.随后他入侵叙利亚.但是他被他的对手伊斯梅尔贝伊背叛，并在1773年被处决.
可怕的瘟疫在安纳托利亚

original: During the 18th and early 19th centuries, Anatolia was afflicted with intermittent outbreaks of cholera and the bubonic plague.
translation: 在18和19世纪初，安纳托利亚传播着间歇性爆发的霍乱和鼠疫.

original: There is nothing we can do

Your Excellency, with Constantinople in our hands, we must decide the fate of the Christian Patriarch. There are many Christians still in the city, and it might therefore be prudent to show some leniency. Furthermore, its survival might serve as a means of continuity between ourselves and the Roman Empire.
translation: 阁下，君士坦丁堡在我们手中，我们必须决定东正教的命运.有很多基督徒仍然在城市中，也许一定程度的宽大处理会比较稳妥，那么这次我们该怎么做？

original: Use the Patriarchate as proof for our claim of being the Second Rome.
translation: 允许东正教存在，并保持在任的牧首

original: Close down the Patriarchate and confiscate its properties.
translation: 关闭东正教，并没收财产

original: In the first decades of the 18th century the Beys and Deys (Janissary leaders) of Northern Africa were in a rebellious mood in the wake of the Peace of Carlowitz between the Ottoman Empire and the Holy League. In 1710, it was the turn of the Bey of Algiers to begin to start down the road to independence.
translation: 在18世纪的前十年，北非的贝伊和禁军领导人弥漫在奥斯曼帝国和神罗签订的卡尔洛夫奇条约引发的叛逆情绪下.1710年，轮到阿尔及尔的贝伊们开始他们的独立之旅.

original: The Decentralizing Effect of the Provincial System

The provincial governors, or 'Beys', were powerful men, usually ambitious, and not always loyal. Although the Ottoman Empire did not have a noble class or a feudal system like most European nations, the Beys were a close equivalent with many of the same intrinsic problems. The Beys were reluctant to give up their powers and usually demanded even more concessions... even to the point of outright independence.\n\nThe Beys are now demanding more power.
translation: 各省的省长，或者贝伊，掌握 大权并且雄心勃勃而且并不怎么忠诚.虽然奥斯曼帝国并没有欧洲的贵族阶层和封建体质，贝伊也能造成许多相似的内在问题，他们不愿意放弃自己的权利，通常要求更多的让步或者完全独立.\n\n现在 [Root.GetName] 的贝伊要求更大的权力.

original: The Ottoman army was traditionally mainly composed of cavalry. In the mid-14th century, Orhan I and later on his son, Murad I, introduced the Janissaries. Formed from prisoners of war and slaves, the Janissaries went on to become an elite standing infantry, regularly paid and highly disciplined.
translation: 传统奥斯曼军队主要由骑兵组成。在14世纪中叶，奥尔汗一世和他的儿子穆拉德一世引入了耶尼切里。耶尼切里从战争的囚犯和奴隶中招募，成为了定期支付和军纪严明的精英步兵。

original: The Janissaries and the Bektashi Order
translation: 耶尼切里和贝克塔什派

original: With the rising importance of the Janissary Corps in our society we have also seen an increased influence for the Bektashi order of Sufis. The highly unorthodox, quasi-Shiite Bektashi order has maintained a close relationship with the Janissaries since the 15th century, contributing to their unique culture. So long as the Janissaries remain influential, we will have to provide a degree of tolerance even for the most heterodox of religious practitioners.
translation: 随着耶尼切里军团在社会上越来越重要，我们也看到了贝克塔什苏菲派的影响日益增加。自从15世纪以来，耶尼切里和非正统的准什叶派拜克塔什教团保持了密切的关系，为其独特的文化做出了贡献。只要耶尼切里还有影响力，我们就为非正统的宗教信众提供一定程度上的宽容。

original: As the standing army and loyal servants of the Sultan, the Janissaries and other palace troops traditionally expected to be paid a salary bonus upon the accession of each new ruler. Breaking this tradition could cause riots and instability.
translation: 作为苏丹的常备军和忠诚的仆役，惯例上每一位新君登基后都会给耶尼切里军团和其他宫殿禁军进行赏赐。打破这一传统可能会引起骚乱和不稳定。

original: Give a reward and higher wages
translation: 给他们奖励和更高的工资

original: While Janissaries had become active in trades and landholding from an early date, the practice became more widespread due to rampant inflation in the Mediterranean economy. Unable to support themselves on their declining salaries, Janissaries increasingly turned to craft trades in order to make a living, reducing their military discipline.
translation: 然而，耶尼切里军团官兵很早就积极从事贸易并占有土地，地中海经济严重的通货膨胀使这一现象更加普遍。微薄的薪水不足以生存，为了谋生，军人们逐渐转向手工业，从而降低了军纪。

original: Everyone needs to make a living.
Let us increase drilling and salaries instead.
translation: 让我们代之以增强训练和增发薪水

original: Due to the great changes our society has been going through the old Janisary corp has been dissolved. The Janissaries have been absorbed by our regular armies and their special privileges are no more.
translation: 因为社会的巨大变革，古老的耶尼切里解散了。耶尼切里被编入正规军，不再有任何特权。
允许穆斯林进入耶尼切里军团

original: While the intention had originally been for the Janissaries to be raised only through the devshirme, the social status associated with being a Janissary together with a guaranteed state salary is very attractive for many of our subjects. As the Corps grows in size, we find ourselves unable to fill its ranks solely with devshirme recruits, and have consequently begun to allow Muslim-born men to buy their way into the Corps. As these outsiders have not spent their lives in our service, they are more difficult to train and discipline.
translation: 虽然最初的意图只针对通过德芙什美制度选拔出来的近卫军，但吸引很多国民的是与成为近卫军以及能得到稳定薪水相关联的社会地位。随着军队日益庞大，我们发现仅靠德芙什美征募制难以弥补人员空缺，因此开始允许穆斯林男子加入。因为这些新加入者没有长时间服侍的经历，所以他们更难去训练并养成纪律。

original: We must enforce all rules to the letter.
translation: 我们必须执行所有规章制度

original: No harm can come of this.

translation: 德芙什美征募制的衰退

original: By the middle of the 17th century, the Devshirme had run its course in Ottoman history. The ümera class, in addition to being overpopulated relative to state offices available, now got its manpower from new sources, particularly Abkhazian, Circassian, and Georgian slaves. The Janissaries, too, had long since begun to recruit from the empire's Muslim population, rendering the Devshirme obsolete. Although occasional levies would still take place into the early years of the 18th century, by the 1650s the practice had for all intents and purposes come to an end.
translation: 到17世纪中叶，德芙什美制度走到了奥斯曼历史的尽头。除了在国家机关中可得到的多出来的人，乌理玛阶层现在又从新来源获得了人力，尤其是阿布哈兹人、切尔克斯人和格鲁吉亚的奴隶。德芙什美制度废除后，耶尼切里军团也早就在帝国的穆斯林中招募新兵。尽管到18世纪早期仍有零星的征募行动，但到17世纪50年代这种做法已经达到了所有的目的并告一段落。

original: Great commotion was abound in [Root.Capital.GetCapitalName] today as the Janissaries, long discontent with what they see as the misrule of the empire by the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle], rejected the bread given by [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] and overturned their cauldrons in the central square. The Janissaries claim that [Root.Monarch.GetName] is a disgrace to the House of Osman, that [Root.Monarch.GetSheHe] has made the Sheikh-ul-Islam his personal puppet and that he aims to destroy the military strength of the empire.\nThe Janissaries have now moved quickly to seize control over the government and have secured the support of many of the other political groups of the capital. While [Root.Monarch.GetSheHe] is still alive [Root.Monarch.GetName] is no longer in control of [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] empire.
translation: 大规模的骚乱在今天充斥着[Root.Capital.GetCapitalName]，耶尼切里看到[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]在帝国的暴政而感到不满，在中央广场拒绝了[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]提供的俸禄并且掀了饭碗。耶尼切里宣称[Root.Monarch.GetName]是奥斯曼王室的耻辱，因为[Root.Monarch.GetSheHe]让伊斯兰谢赫成为了自己的傀儡而且打算摧毁整个帝国的军事力量。\n耶尼切里现在已经快速的控制了政府并且确保了首都内其他政治集团的支持。[Root.Monarch.GetName]不再拥有[Root.Monarch.GetHerHis]帝国的控制权了，尽管[Root.Monarch.GetSheHe]仍然活着。

original: Great commotion was abound in [Root.Capital.GetCapitalName] today as the Janissaries, long discontent with what they see as the misrule of the empire by the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle], rejected the bread given by [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] and overturned their cauldrons in the central square. The Janissaries claim that [Root.Monarch.GetName] is a disgrace to the House of Osman, and that he aims to destroy the military strength of the empire.\nThe Janissaries have now moved quickly to seize control over the government and have secured the support of many of the other political groups of the capital. While [Root.Monarch.GetSheHe] is still alive [Root.Monarch.GetName] is no longer in control of [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] empire.
translation: 大规模的骚乱在今天充斥着[Root.Capital.GetCapitalName]，耶尼切里看到[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]在帝国的暴政而感到不满，在中央广场拒绝了[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]提供的俸禄并且掀了饭碗。耶尼切里宣称[Root.Monarch.GetName]是奥斯曼王室的耻辱，因为[Root.Monarch.GetSheHe]让伊斯兰谢赫成为了自己的傀儡而且打算摧毁整个帝国的军事力量。\n耶尼切里现在已经快速的控制了政府并且确保了首都内其他政治集团的支持。[Root.Monarch.GetName]不再拥有[Root.Monarch.GetHerHis]帝国的控制权了，尽管[Root.Monarch.GetSheHe]仍然活着。

original: [Root.Monarch.GetName]’s attempts to satisfy the Janissary coup-makers in [Root.Capital.GetCapitalName] has led to no avail, and now opposition to [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] rule has grown so great that they see [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] deposal as the only remaining solution. Having secured the support of other interest groups in the capital a large group of Janissaries today stormed the palace and captured the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle].\nThey paraded the sovereign through the streets of the capital and, waving a legitimizing fatwa from the Sheikh-ul-Islam, strangled [Root.Monarch.GetName] to death. [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] successor, still in shock from the day's events, has been brought out from the harem to be enthroned. It is apparent to all that the new ruler is little more than a puppet, and that order is far from being restored.
translation: [Root.Monarch.GetName]安抚在[Root.Capital.GetCapitalName]的耶尼切里政变者的尝试最终没有任何效果，现在反对[Root.Monarch.GetHerHis]统治的呼声如此之大，以至于反对者认为处死[Root.Monarch.GetHerHis]是唯一的解决方案。在确保了首都内其他利益集团的支持后，一大帮耶尼切里士兵突袭了宫殿并且抓走了[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]。\n他们抓着曾经的最高统治者在首都的街上游行，挥舞着来自伊斯兰谢赫的合法教令，绞死了[Root.Monarch.GetName]。[Root.Monarch.GetHerHis]继承者仍然震惊于今天发生的事情，但还是被带出了后宫，完成了登基。所有人都清楚，新的统治者仅仅是一个小小的傀儡，秩序仍远没有恢复。

original: This is a disgrace to the [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] line!

With the power of government comes great influence over how offices are assigned. The Janissaries have increasingly begun to place their preferred candidates in offices of government. Nominations that [Root.Monarch.GetName] will have a hard time rejecting without angering the coup makers.
translation: 政府的权力对官员的任命方式有很大的影响。耶尼切里开始越来越频繁地将自己青睐的候选人安排到政府的职位上。[Root.Monarch.GetName]将很难在不惹怒叛乱者的情况下拒绝他们的提名。

original: The Janissaries feel that their current salaries do not reflect the great importance of their corps in times of war as well as the responsibility they are currently taking for the governance of the Empire. They now demand that the state provide them with better compensation.\nGiven their current powers we can hardly refuse.
translation: 耶尼切里认为他们现在的薪水无法反映他们的军队在战时的重要性，以及他们现在管理帝国政府的职责。他们现在要求国家提供更高的待遇。\n由于他们现有的权力，我们很难拒绝他们的要求。
让我们提高他们的薪水。

original: With the Janissaries in total control of the government the local members of the corps are able to exert much greater influence over the rule in our provinces as well. The people of [oppressed_province.GetName] have risen in support of their rightful sovereign, as they believe the local Janissaries are oppressing them with undue taxes and misuse of power.
translation: 耶尼切里彻底控制了政府，而军队的地方成员也极大影响了我们下属省份的统治。[oppressed_province.GetName]的人民开始站起来支持自认的统治者，因为他们认为当地的耶尼切里正用过高的税收与滥用的权力压迫他们。

original: There are some that still support the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] and would see the influence of the Janissaries limited in government. Acting in ways that has made it hard for the Janissaries to target him [Root.great_minister.GetName] has in short time managed to make good use of his influence in government to strengthen [Root.Monarch.GetName]'s position.
translation: 仍然有一些人支持[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]并且看到了耶尼切里的影响在政府中的限制。[Root.great_minister.GetName]采用了一些耶尼切里无法揪出他的策略，在短时间内成功地利用了自身的影响，提升了[Root.Monarch.GetName]的地位。

original: Let us distance ourselves from him.

translation: 耶尼切里要求顾问的首级

original: As the House of Osman is highly revered, revolting troops are more likely to blame the ills of the state on the influence of advisors and favorites rather than the Sultan himself. The Janissaries are now demanding that we hand over several palace figures to them for execution, including numerous treasury officials blamed for paying them in impure coinage as well as the Chief Black Eunuch, a major intermediary between the Sultan and the world outside the palace.
translation: 因为奥斯曼家族受到高度的尊崇，叛乱的军队更多的将国家的弊端归罪于苏丹的顾问与宠信的影响，而不是苏丹自己。耶尼切里现在要求我们交出几位宫廷人士让他们处决，包括数位被指责支付他们掺假钱币的财政大臣，以及作为苏丹与宫殿外世界交流的主要中介的黑人宦官总管。

original: We have no choice but to hand them over.
translation: 除了把他们交出去外，我们别无选择。

original: By forcing the inspection of all rolls of membership in the Janissaries [Root.Monarch.GetName] has finally managed to impose control over the corps again. All bad elements and non-soldiers are being weeded out of the system and will no longer receive state salaries or the status associated with being Janissaries. This is not something the former Janissaries take lightly however, while the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] has the authority to carry out these measures some are taking up arms against their former monarch.
translation: 1622年，17岁的苏丹奥斯曼二世，决定抑制禁卫军的堕落。一年前他在‘摩尔达维亚巨头战争’中被波兰人打败，他将其归咎为禁卫军的胆怯。他同样也忿于‘被自己的奴才管着’。苏丹准备解散禁卫军的谣言很快导致了他们的叛乱，并羁押了苏丹。很快的他被吊死...

original: By forcing the inspection of all rolls of membership in the Janissaries [Root.Monarch.GetName] have finally managed to impose control over the corps again. All bad elements and non-soldiers are being weeded out of the system and will no longer receive state salaries or the status associated with being Janissaries.
translation: 通过对耶尼切里所有成员名单的强制检查，[Root.Monarch.GetName]最终重新掌握了军队。所有不良分子与无关人员都从体系中清除出去，再也不能从国家攫取曾经作为耶尼切里的薪酬与地位了。以前的耶尼切里是不会对此善罢甘休的，虽然[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]拥有权威来推行这些举措，但是一些人已经拿起武器来对抗他们曾经的君主了。

original: 100 years has passed since acquiring the §YJanissaries§! modifier.
translation: 自获得§Y耶尼切里§!效果已经过了100年。

original: The §YJanissary Coup§! Disaster will become available after the §YAge of Discovery§!.
translation: §YJ耶尼切里政变§! 灾难将在 §YAge of Discovery§!后可用
强制耶尼切里接受审查

original: In the payrolls of the Janissaries there are many that are not truly Janissaries or not truly fit for service. Let us force them to undergo a general review of who should still be on the rolls, bringing order and dicsipline to this group.
translation: 在耶尼切里的薪水单上有很多人不是真正的耶尼切里，或者德不配位。让我们强制他们接受一次广泛的审查来确认谁能够留下，让秩序与纪律重归军队。

original: §RThe Janissaries will not appreciate this decision, and some will revolt because of it.§!
translation: §R耶尼切里不会喜欢这个决定，一些人甚至会因此叛乱§!

original: The powerful Janissaries are upset over the recent attempts to Westernize the country. Should their revolt be successful they will roll back the recent changes towards Westernization.
translation: 强大的耶尼切里对西方化感到不高兴，如果他们的叛乱成功，那么他们将取消西方化的转变.

original: They will not be able to stop progress
translation: 他们无法阻挡西方化进程
在安纳托利亚的基齐勒巴什起义

original: Ever since the young Ismail, head of the Safavid order, threw off the yoke of the Aq Qoyunlu to proclaim himself Shah of Iran in 1501, the Qizilbash heresy had grown stronger in Anatolia. Near the end of the reign of Bayezid II, the Qizilbash (Shiite-leaning Turkmen) rose up in revolt against the centralization efforts of the Ottomans' Sunni regime. Supported by Shah Ismail, and taking advantage of the succession struggle between Bayezid's sons, the rebels threatened to change the course of Ottoman history...
translation: 自从年轻的伊斯梅尔，萨法维教团的领袖，在1501年摆脱了白羊王朝的桎梏并且宣称自己是伊朗的沙赫之后，安纳托利亚的基齐勒巴什异端日渐强大。在巴耶济德二世统治的晚期，基齐勒巴什（什叶派倾向的土库曼人）起义反抗奥斯曼逊尼派政权的集权统治。在沙赫伊斯梅尔的支持和利用巴耶济德之子王斗争下，叛军威胁要改变奥斯曼帝国的历史……
让他们面对自己的命运
穆罕默德三世对波斯的战术

original: Murad III, a Sultan ruled by women, fought the Persians in an exhausting war (1578-90) that severely strained the Empire and forced heavy taxes upon the citizens. Though the war was not for nothing - Persia had to cede Azerbaijan, Tiflis and Hamadan to the Ottomans - the resources might have been better spent elsewhere.
translation: 穆罕默德三世，由妇女统治的苏丹，在一场给人民带来苛捐杂税和给帝国带来极大压力的辛苦战争中与波斯交战（1578-90）.虽然战争并非没有收获-波斯割让阿塞拜疆，第比利斯和哈马丹给奥斯曼-但是资源花在别处会更好.

original: The Spahi revolts in Eastern Anatolia encouraged the Persian Shah to seek revenge for the humiliating losses incurred by Murad III. War broke out yet again in 1603.
translation: 阿尔及利亚人在安纳托利亚东部的叛乱鼓励波斯国王寻求报复穆罕默德III给予的屈辱的.战争于1603年再次爆发.

original: Support the Turkish rebels and prepare for war
translation: 支持土耳其叛军并准备作战

original: Throughout Portuguese colonization the salary for officials was only a token sum. However it was assumed that any important position would allow for the person appointed to gain huge personal wealth. It was two sides of the same coin. On one side, the king didn't have to pay high salaries, but on the other hand large parts of the profits stayed in the hands of the officials.
translation: 葡萄牙殖民官员的工资只是象征性的小数目.然而它是基于每个身居要职的职事都被允许获得巨大的个人财富.它就像一个硬币的2个方面.一方面，国王没有支付高薪水，另一方面，大量利润留在官员手中.

original: Every man makes his own fortune
translation: 每个人都可以保留自己的财富

original: King Afonso was only 6 years old when he became king of Portugal. For the first 6 years of his reign the country has been ruled by the Duke of Coimbra. Don Afonso has had no reason for complaint and by most accounts this regency has been a just and efficient one.\nHowever, with the young king reaching majority there are now many in our court who would try to influence their monarch. Jealous of the Duke’s influence a group of noblemen has been trying to sow discord between him and the king, trying to frame him as a would-be rebel.\nIn a last attempt to mend relations the Duke of Coimbra has arrived with a number of retainers to seek an audience with Don Afonso.
translation: 国王阿方索方年六岁就被加冕为葡萄牙国王。他在位的前6年由科英布拉公爵代理执政。唐·阿方索本不应该抱怨，因为大多数情况下这个摄政议会是公正且有效的。然而，伴随着年轻国王逐渐成熟，宫廷内部有很多试图影响他们君主的人。由于对公爵影响力的嫉妒，一群贵族一直在国王与公爵之间挑拨离间，诬陷他可能叛乱。\n出于挽回关系的最后一搏，科英布拉公爵带领着一群亲兵来到宫廷，请求觐见唐·阿方索国王。

original: So it was true! Death to him and his men!
translation: 所以这是真的！处死他与他的部下！

original: We must place trust in our dear friend and mentor.
translation: 我们必须信任我们亲爱的朋友与导师。

original: Commercial Conflict in the Indian Ocean

With the arrival of Portuguese ships in the Indian and Arabian Oceans we finally have the opportunity to attempt to disrupt arab shipping in that region. We are in a position to significantly cut the supply of spices and silk to Alexandria, hurting our trading competition in the Near East and Italy alike.
translation: 当葡萄牙成功殖民印度后，他们开始在阿曼海对阿拉伯进行封锁和走私，有效的阻止和切断了亚历山大的香料贸易，而亚历山大一直是威尼斯进口外国货的地方.这迫使埃及哈里发在威尼斯人帮助下，在苏伊士建设一只舰队，并与1508年在印度港口乌邦附近与阿尔伯特基率领的葡萄牙中队遭遇.葡萄牙的卡拉维尔大炮和航海技术彻底击败了哈里发的船队.而香料贸易比以前更加由卢西塔尼亚掌控.

original: Seek better relations in the region
translation: 寻求在该地区更好的关系

original: Will increase relations by §G25§! with all members of the §YGulf of Aden§! Trade Node.
translation: 将与所有在§Y亚丁湾§!贸易节点的国家提升§G25§!点关系。

original: The Holy Inquisition came from Spain also to Portugal in 1536 and stayed until 1668, however, it had more influence with the Spanish monarchs than the Portuguese ones.
translation: 宗教裁判所在1536年从西班牙也来到了葡萄牙并且在这儿呆到了1668年，但是他们在西班牙有着比葡萄牙更高的影响力

original: Governor Martim Afonso de Sousa in Brazil
translation: 总督马丁·阿方索·德·索萨在巴西

original: Leading colonists were given strips of land that extended from the Brazilian coast reaching into the interior. The land owners, often captains, settled colonists in their respective captaincies and were required to provide them with protection and justice. As the captaincies were independent, they were unable to defend themselves from foreign pirates. João III appointed a governor general with authority over the captaincies. De Sousa established his capital at São Salvador da Baia. He defeated French pirates in a naval engagement in the bay of Rio de Janeiro. De Sousa also intensified colonization and created stability in Brazil.
translation: 殖民者先头部队沿着狭长的土地从巴西海岸深入内陆。土地的所有者往往是船长，定居的殖民者的各自将军辖区，为殖民者们提供公正和保护。既然将军辖区是独立的，他们就无法为自己抵御外国海盗。若昂三世任命一位管理者管辖将军辖区，德·索萨在圣萨尔瓦多建立了他的总督府。他借着海军的帮助在里约热内卢海边击败了法兰西海盗，他还加强殖民地建设并为巴西创造安定的环境。

original: King Sebastião's Expedition to North Africa
translation: 塞巴斯蒂昂国王的北非远征

original: In the year 1578, King Sebastião of Portugal embarked on an expedition to conquer Morocco, where Portugal already held the regions of Tangiers and Ceuta. Shortly after his landing, at the battle of Al-Khazar Kebir, the Moroccan Berbers of Moulay Ismaïl so soundly defeated the Portuguese army that the King was killed, along with most of the Portuguese nobility fighting with him. This disaster led the way to Spanish control of Portugal and was the starting point of Portugal's decline.
translation: 在1578年，葡萄牙国王塞瓦斯蒂昂踏上远征摩洛哥之旅.葡萄牙已经控制丹吉尔和休达地区.在他登陆不久，在阿尔卡塞尔·吉比尔三王之战中.摩洛哥柏柏尔人穆莱伊斯梅尔完胜葡萄牙军队，国王和随同他作战的葡萄牙贵族身亡.这场战争导致了葡萄牙被西班牙控制，是葡萄牙衰落的起点.

original: Crusade against the Heretics in Africa
translation: 对非洲异教徒发起十字军

original: The plague comes sweeping in over the country from Spain with devastating effects and horrible losses.
translation: 瘟疫从西班牙席卷全国各地，造成毁灭性的效果和可怕的损失.

original: John Methuen was born in 1650. An accomplished diplomat, he is well remembered for the treaty signed in 1703 between England and Portugal. The main purpose of the treaty was to allow free introduction of English wool and cloths to Portugal in exchange of free entry of Portuguese wine into England (Port wine). The treaty made in effect Portugal an economic and political satellite of England, was effectively in place all the way to 1750, when King D Jose I choose to ignore it, even while it was still formally in effect until 1836. John Methuen died in 1706 shortly after his greatest success.
translation: 约翰·梅休因出生于1650年.作为一名杰出的外交官，他因1703年英格兰和葡萄牙之间签署的条约被人铭记.条约以英格兰布料出口葡萄牙免关税为条件换葡萄牙葡萄酒（波特酒）出口英格兰免关税.这个表明葡萄牙成为了英格兰在经济和政治上的卫星国的条约于1750年生效，尽管国王唐·何塞一世选择忽视它，这个条约直到1836年仍然有效.约翰·梅休因于这个伟大成功不久后的1706年去世.
将约翰·梅休因召到宫廷

original: Dom Luis de Meneses, the Count da Ericeira was a strong believer of Mercantilism and helped reform the Portuguese state towards a higher control of the Portuguese trade.
translation: 埃里塞拉伯爵唐·路易斯·德·梅内塞斯是个重商主义的坚定支持者，并且帮助改革葡萄牙省份所以可以更好的控制葡萄牙的贸易
他也许是我们的政界新星！

original: The Earthquake that destroyed Lisboa was a catastrophe of huge proportions that resounded all across Europe and even into the new world. 1 November 1755, a beautiful day, when next to everyone was in the churches celebrating a holiday the ground suddenly started to shake and the churches started caving in, crushing the visitors. For those that escaped it was far from over as a heavy breeze of wind suddenly started to come in over the area beating the small fires into a virtual inferno incinerating thousands. But yet thousands of people would fall victim for the grand tidal wave reaching land just a few minutes later. The death count was estimated to 20.000-40.000 people at the time and given all four elements (wind, fire, earth & water) the explanation 'punishment by god' was a view widely spread both in Portugal and elsewhere.
translation: 里斯本大地震是人类史上破坏性最大的灾难之一，地震的回声遍布全欧洲甚至连新大陆都能听见.1755年11月1日，是一个美好的一天，当大家在教堂庆祝节日，地面突然开始摇晃，教会开始崩塌，压碎了游客.对于那些逃脱了的人，灾难远没结束.大风突然在这一区域刮起来，跳动的小火成为一个焚烧数千人的虚拟地狱.还有数千人在紧随其后的巨浪中也难逃受害者的命运.死亡人数达到了20000-40000，而考虑到这场灾难中四个元素（风，水，火，土）全都发动，这是“神罚”的观点在葡萄牙和周围国家广为流传.

original: Literally from the ashes of Lisboa, a new leader rose to the power and managed to shake entire Portugal out of the trauma caused by the earthquake. He forced through many far reaching reforms. During his rule Lisboa was rebuilt and Portugal entered into the pre-industrial era. In many ways his excellent governing would, for a time, bring back Portugal almost to its former level of glory a few hundred years back.
translation: 一位新的领导人从里斯本的废墟中掌握权力，并设法从地震造成的创伤中撼动葡萄牙.他强行通过了许多深远的改革，在他的统治下，里斯本被重建，葡萄牙也进入了准工业时代.他的出色治理在许多方面将葡萄牙带回到了几百年前的黄金时代.
他也许是我们的政界新星！

original: A conspiracy to kill King Don Jose I (1750-1777) was revealed and prevented, by Marquês de Pombal. Pombal used this event to forge his power into a virtual dictatorship. Pombal was a radical reformer, but he was also very power-hungry and without remorse he hunted down anyone that could threaten him in the name of the King.
translation: 一个杀害国王唐·何塞一世(1750-1777)的阴谋被彭巴侯爵发现和阻止了.彭巴利用这一事件强化自己的权利，并成为了影子独裁者.彭巴是一个激进的改革者，但是也拥有极强的权力欲，以国王的名义逮捕和追杀别人毫不留情.

original: The Expulsion of Marquês de Pombal

After the death of the king the forces that had been conspiring to end his life earlier now turned their attention towards the person that had been the real ruler of the Portuguese kingdom, Marquês de Pombal. With no support from a king, Pombal's position was hazardous at best and he was forced to flee. Consequently the reforms he had started that had gotten Portugal back on the path to prosperity were not to last. Instead, grossly reactionary policies implemented by the 'Old Nobility and the Men of the Church' again moved Portugal backwards, threatening to let her end up in the backwater of most of the other European powers in the centuries to come.
translation: 在国王死后，那些早前想要密谋杀害国王的人将他们的目标转向了葡萄牙王国的真正统治者，彭巴侯爵，在没有国王的支持下，彭巴侯爵处境很危险，并被迫逃亡.因此他的带领葡萄牙回到繁荣道路上的改革无法持续.与此相反，“老贵族和教会”派在葡萄牙实行严重的反动统治以回到改革以前，并最终让他停止了追赶其他欧洲列强的步伐.

original: In 1492 Christopher Columbus undertook his famous journey for Castile and sailed west across the Atlantic in search of a western route to the Orient. Seven years earlier in 1485, Christopher Columbus had presented the same plan to the King of Portugal, John II, who after submitting the proposal to his experts had rejected it. Columbus had made yet another attempt to convince the King in 1488 but as the Portuguese explorer Bartholomeu Dias around this time had successfully rounded the Cape of Good Hope, an eastern sea route to Asia seemed more likely and the King once again rejected Columbus's proposal.
translation: 1492年，克里斯托弗·哥伦布为卡斯蒂利亚进行了著名的探险，他向西横渡大西洋寻找达到东方的路径。7年前的1485年，克里斯托弗·哥伦布向葡萄牙国王约翰二世提交过同样的计划，但是国王在询问了他的幕僚后拒绝了他。哥伦布在1488年曾再次企图说服国王，但此时葡萄牙探险家巴尔托洛梅乌·迪亚士已经成功地绕过了好望角，东部通过海路到达亚洲似乎更具可能性，所以国王再次拒绝了他的建议。

original: The exploitation of land and resources in the New World colonies led to an extensive use of slave labor. As a large part of the indigenous population died from overwork and diseases spread from Europe, the labor shortage soon became problematic. Indentured servitude lessened this somewhat but failed to provide the workforce needed. The solution became the Atlantic slave trade, where slaves captured or bought along the West Africa coast were transported to Brazil. Over 3 million African slaves were sent to Brazil, mainly to work on the vast sugar plantations.
translation: 对新世界殖民地的土地和资源的开采导致了奴隶的大量使用.大部分土著人口死于过度劳累和欧洲传来的疾病，在欧洲，劳动力短缺很快就成了问题.契约奴隶虽然一定程度上减缓了问题，但未能提供足够的劳动力.解决方案变成了大西洋奴隶贸易，沿西非海岸捕获或购买奴隶被运到巴西.超过300万非洲奴隶被送往巴西，主要是为了广大甘蔗种植园工作.

original: The Crown should not get involved

The archipelago of Moluccas was historically known as the 'Spice Islands' and became an important part of the Portuguese trade network in Southeast Asia during the 16th century. After their expulsion from Ternete, the Portuguese established their new center of trade on the island of Ambon, which had been discovered in 1513. Though the Portuguese were regularly attacked by native Muslims in the region, missionaries managed to convert a large number of natives. By the end of the 16th century there were more than 50.000 Christians in the Moluccas, most of them living on Ambon.
translation: 摩鹿加群岛的历史上被称为“香料群岛”在16世纪成为在东南亚葡萄牙贸易网络的一个重要组成部分.在他们被驱逐出特尔纳特后，葡萄牙人1513年在安汶岛建立了自己的新的贸易中心.葡萄牙人虽然经常遭到当地穆斯林攻击，传教士设法转换了大量的当地人.在16世纪末在摩鹿加群岛有超过50.000基督徒，他们大多居住在安汶.

original: We need to efficiently oversee and administer Portuguese interests and possessions in India and Africa. It has been suggested that the best way to achieve this is to create an institution directly under the Royal Treasurer with monopoly rights to all related trade connections and goods.
translation: 我们需要有效监管葡萄牙在印度及非洲的利益和财产。最好的方法是建立一个直属皇家国库的机构，在相关贸易路线及货物上拥有垄断权。

original: The Portuguese carrack Santa Catarina was captured in February 1603 off the coast of Singapore by three ships of the Dutch East India Company (V.O.C.). The cargo, worth 2.2 million guilders, doubled the capital of the V.O.C., but legality of keeping the prize was questionable under Dutch statute and led to protests from Portugal. The incident was a contributing reason for the Dutch-Portuguese War that lasted between 1602 and 1663.
translation: 葡萄牙大帆船圣卡塔琳娜州于1603年2月在新加坡外海被荷兰东印度公司（VOC）的三艘船捕获.船内的货物，价值220万荷兰盾，使得荷兰东印度公司的资本翻了一番，但是这笔资金的合法性根据荷兰人的法规是有问题并导致了葡萄牙抗议.该事故是1602间1663葡荷战争的直接原因.

original: Request the return of the cargo!

The Portuguese carrack Santa Catarina was captured in February 1603 off the coast of Singapore by three ships of the Dutch East India Company (V.O.C.). The cargo, worth 2.2 million guilders, doubled the capital of the V.O.C., but legality of keeping the prize was questionable under Dutch statute and led to protests from Portugal. The incident was a contributing reason for the Dutch-Portuguese War that lasted between 1602 and 1663.
translation: 1603年2月，尼德兰东印度公司（缩写为V.O.C.）的三艘船在新加坡海岸附近捕获了葡萄牙的大帆船圣卡塔琳娜号。这批价值220万盾的货物使尼德兰东印度公司的资本翻了一番，但根据尼德兰的法令，公司保留战利品的合法性受到质疑，同时这一行为招来了葡萄牙的抗议。这一事件是引起尼德兰与葡萄牙于1602年至1663年间进行战争的一个重要原因。

original: The Dutch have recognized the validity of our protest and agreed to return the cargo.
translation: 荷兰已确认我们的抗议的有效性，并同意归还货物.

original: The Dutch refuse to return the seized cargo from Santa Catarina!
translation: 荷兰拒绝退还被捕获的圣卡塔琳娜上货物！

original: Commissioned by Manuel I, the Tower of Belem was built in the early 16th century in order to defend the mouth of the Tagus River. It was built in the Manueline, or Portuguese late Gothic, style. The tower was improved in 1571, but fell after only a few hours siege in 1580 to the forces of the Spanish Duke of Alba. The dungeons of the Tower later served as a prison.
translation: 在曼努埃尔一世委托下，贝伦塔于16世纪初兴建以保卫塔霍河河口.它始建于曼努埃尔或以葡萄牙晚期哥特式风格兴建.该塔于1571年强化，但在1580年的西班牙阿尔巴公爵的军队几个小时的围困下陷落.贝伦塔后来用做监狱.
我们我们有其他优先事项有别的

original: Construction of the Jerónimos Monastery began in 1501 and was originally funded by Manuel I using the income from the 'Vintena da Pimenta' tax on goods from Africa and the Far East. Work stopped in 1580 when Portugal after the death of Sebastian I of Portugal and a succession crisis entered into a union with Spain. When Portugal became independent again in 1640, the monastery saw further construction with the addition of a gold tiled ceiling in 1669 and large frescos completed at the end of the 18th century. The monastery also became the burial place for the royal family.
translation: 热罗尼姆斯修道院的建设始于1501年，最初是由曼努埃尔一世用“辣椒廿一税”即来自非洲和远东的货物税的收入资助.工作在葡王塞巴斯蒂安一世和葡萄牙继承危机与西班牙联合统治后停止.当葡萄牙1640年再次独立，修道院再次开工，在1669年教堂增添了金色瓷砖天花板，而大型壁画完成于18世纪末.修道院也成为王室的埋葬地点.

original: Vasco da Gama became the first Portuguese to reach India when he landed near Calicut on May 20, 1498. Despite protests from Arab merchants, da Gama managed to secure trading rights with the Zamorin ruler, but later failed to produce the gold required to pay for custom fees. On the whole, da Gama's expedition turned out to be very profitable as the value of the cargo brought back was sixty times the cost of the expedition.
translation: 瓦斯科·达伽马于1498年5月20日在科泽科德附近登陆并成为了第一个到达印度的葡萄牙人.尽管阿拉伯商人的抗议，达伽马仍然与土邦统治者签订了贸易协议，但后来未能支付定金的黄金.就整体而言，达伽马的远征被证明获利甚多，因为远征带回的货物价值是成本的60倍.

original: Let's not strain ourselves too much.
translation: 这次投资含有太多的风险。

original: The Effects of the Pragmatic Sanction

The Pragmatic Sanction, solemnly rendered by Emperor Charles VI on 19th April 1713, established the indivisibility of the Habsburg patrimony, and ruled the order of succession by order of first born child, even to a woman. This made Maria-Theresa, born in 1717, the heir of the Empire. The Pragmatic Sanction was recognized by Spain in 1725 (confirmed in 1731), Russia in 1726, Prussia in 1728, the United Provinces in 1731, Hanover in 1732, the Holy Roman Empire (except Bavaria) in 1732 and France in 1738. Bavarian refusal would lead to the War of the Austrian Succession.
translation: 1713年4月19日皇帝查理六世郑重签署了国事诏书，建立了哈布斯堡王朝遗产的不可分割性，并规定了继承顺序.依照规定，头生子即使是一个女人也可以继承.这使得这使得1717年出生的玛丽亚特里萨成为帝国的继承人.国事诏书于1725年（1731年确认）在西班牙，1726年在俄罗斯，1728年在普鲁士，1731年在，1732年在汉诺威，同年在（除了巴伐利亚的）整个神圣罗马帝国，1738年在法国得到承认，巴伐利亚的拒绝将导致奥地利王位继承战争.

original: The Pragmatic Sanction, solemnly rendered by Emperor $EMPERORNAME$ on [GetDateText], established the indivisability of his lands and established succession by order of first born child, even to a woman. No doubt $EMPERORNAME$ also plans for his female heir to in time take his seat on the Imperial Throne.
translation: 《国事诏书》，于[GetDateText]由皇帝$EMPERORNAME$郑重签署，确保了他的领地的不可分割性，并规定了由长至幼的继承顺序，即使是女性也有继承权。$EMPERORNAME$亦准备让他的女性继承人准时继承他的皇位。
克里斯蒂安二世的改革

original: Upon succeeding to the throne, [Root.Monarch.GetName] bypassed the Rigsråd and used the chancellery to grant commercial privileges to merchants, overriding the claims of Danish nobles and traders of the Hanseatic League. In 1517 [Root.Monarch.GetName] accused the governor of Copenhagen Castle of poisoning his lover Dyveke, and thereafter he ignored the Rigsråd and the royal charter. He created an essentially bourgeois government with the burgomaster of Malmø, Hans Mikkelsen, as his special counselor.
translation: 继承王位后， [Root.Monarch.GetName绕过枢密院和大臣授予商人商业特权，驱逐丹麦贵族和汉萨同盟商人.1517年[Root.Monarch.GetName]指责哥本哈根省长毒杀他的情妇迪弗克，此后他甚至无视枢密院和皇家宪章.他任命马尔默镇长，汉斯·米克尔森，作为他的特别顾问并建立起实质上的资本主义政府。

original: Rule with the support of the bourgeoisie.

In 1481 King Christian I died and left the throne to his son Hans. Since the Battle of Brunkeberg in 1471, Sweden had not been a part of the Union in anything but name. In 1483 the Councils of the Scandinavian kingdoms drafted the Halmstad Recess, an attempt to provide a Scandinavian constitution which asserted the supremacy of the high nobility, but Sten Sture, the chancellor of Sweden, refused to send a delegation to Halmstad. The Swedes delayed signing the document until 1484, and then with certain provisos.
translation: 在1481国王克里斯蒂安去世，将王位留给他的儿子汉斯。在1471年布魯克贝里之战后，瑞典只名义上存在于卡尔马联合。1483年，斯堪的纳维亚王国在哈尔姆斯塔德行宫，试图起草斯堪的纳维亚宪法以赋予贵族们至高无上的权利，但是斯滕·司徒雷，瑞典总理，拒绝派代表团去哈尔姆斯塔德。瑞典人推迟到1484年加上了某些限制性条款才签署文件。
签署斯堪的纳维亚“宪法”

original: Under King Hans, who came to the throne in 1481, the fleet was given a more organized structure, and during his reign large ships were built by royal order. The 'Engelen' was built in Sønderborg, where there was a good supply of oak for shipbuilding. The 'Maria', which was just as big, seems to have been built in Copenhagen, which has gradually become the home port of the fleet. By 1509 Denmark had one of the largest and best navies in Europe.
translation: 在1481年登基的汉斯国王的统治下，战舰获得了更好的组织机构，在他统治期间，大型船舶被敕命建造，恩格伦号始建于森讷堡.那儿有造船用的优良橡木.同样规模的玛利亚号貌似是在哥本哈根建造，而哥本哈根逐渐的成为了舰队的母港.

original: The End of the Kalmar Union

The crown councils of Norway, Sweden and Denmark had agreed in 1397 to the Union of Kalmar, a kind of united monarchy of northern nations where Danish influence was dominant. Constant fighting in the late 1470s between Sweden and Denmark led to the dissolution of the Union in 1523, under the reign of Swedish king Gustav I Vasa (1523-1560), long after Regent Sten Sture the elder of Sweden had defeated the Danes at the battle of the Brunkeberg (1471). The Union has fallen.
translation: 挪威，瑞典和丹麦冠议会已同意在1397年建立卡尔马联合，是以丹麦为主导的北方民族联合王朝.在1470年代末期瑞典和丹麦之间的持续战斗，尤其是1471年瑞典执政官老斯滕·司徒雷于布魯克贝里之战击败丹麦军队，并最终导致1523年在瑞典国王古斯塔夫一世·瓦萨（1523年至1560年）的统治下联合不复存在.

original: When Frederik I died in 1533 the bishops and most of the aristocracy were initially opposed to the election of his son Christian, duke of Holstein, as new king because he was a Lutheran. The burghers and peasants on their part wanted a return of the deposed Christian II who was imprisoned at Sønderborg. The mayors of Copenhagen and Malmö devised a plan together with the Hansa to free Christian II and turn the two largest Danish cities into partners of the Hanseatic League. The Danish Council gained the help of arch-enemy Gustav Vasa to thwart the plot, which became known as 'Grevefejden' (The Count's Feud) because the rebel forces were led by Count Christoffer of Oldenburg.
translation: 当弗雷德里克一世于1533年死后.主教和大多数的贵族起初反对选举他的儿子克里斯蒂安，荷斯坦公爵，作为新的国王，因为他是一个路德派.一部分市民和农民想要让被囚禁在森讷堡的废王重登王位.哥本哈根和马尔默市长汉莎同克里斯蒂安二世一起制定了计划，并把两个丹麦最大的城市变成汉萨同盟的合作伙伴.丹麦枢密院寻求他们的宿敌古斯塔夫·瓦萨的帮助以挫败阴谋.这因此被称为“伯爵战争”因为叛军由由伯爵克里斯托弗·奥尔登堡统率.
支持荷斯坦的克里斯提安

original: Peder Oxe was a financial genius who was recalled from exile by Frederik II when the Nordic Seven Years War had ruined the Danish economy. With Oxe at the helm from 1567 it did not take long before the state finances had recovered. He convinced the aristocracy to contribute more and reorganized the Sound Due so that the revenues tripled. He also improved the agriculture and educational system. Until his death in 1577, Peder Oxe and a few other lords were the de-facto rulers of Denmark.
translation: 佩德尔·奥克斯是一个金融天才，在北欧七年战争摧毁了丹麦经济后被弗雷德里克二世从流亡中召回.奥克斯1567年执掌财政后没多久丹麦的经济就恢复了.他说服了贵族作出更大的贡献，并整编了足够的款项，使得收入翻了3倍.他还改善了农业和教育系统.直到他于1577年去世，佩德尔·奥克斯和其他几个领主是丹麦事实上的统治者.

original: The Mercantile Reforms of Christian IV
translation: 克里斯蒂安四世的商品改革

original: Christian IV was inclined to occupy himself with every minor detail of his administration while losing sight of the larger problems. Not only did he personally lay down the lines of Denmark's mercantilist policy, he even established the import duties, he started state-subsidized and privileged trading companies and manufactories - all of them with no marked success - and insisted on auditing their accounts personally.
translation: 克里斯蒂安四世亲力亲为的处理政府的方方面面，但是却在大事上目光短浅.他不仅亲自制定丹麦的重商主义政策的每条法规，甚至还设立了进口关税，他开始国家资助给予贸易公司和厂家贸易特许权-所有这些，没有明显的成果-？？他甚至亲自审查账目.

original: Absolutism in Denmark was a result of the lengthy political crisis and the acute state of emergency which resulted from the last of the Karl Gustav wars against Sweden in 1657-60. Despite his weak position when elected king in 1648, Frederik III's political skill allowed him to succeed in ousting two of his main adversaries in the Rigsråd as early as the 1650s. The two were the seneschal Corfitz Ulfeldt and the governor of Norway Hannibal Sehested, who were both married to Frederik's half-sisters. The king's heroic conduct during the siege of Copenhagen in the winter of 1659 had, in addition, made him widely popular at a time when the nobility and the Rigsråd were increasingly being discredited. In October 1660, these events led the estates - the nobility only reluctantly - to create a hereditary monarchy. The new system meant that the king was no longer dependent on the Rigsråd, and he immediately used his new power to introduce absolutism, which was temporarily established on 10 January 1661 in the Hereditary Monarchy Act before being fully set out in Kongeloven (the King's Law) of 1665, the basic law of Danish absolutism.
translation: 漫长的政治危机和与卡尔·古斯塔夫统治的瑞典的战争（1657-60）导致的严重紧急状态导致了丹麦的专制君主制.尽管在1648年参选国王时，弗雷德里克三世处于弱势地位，但是他的政治技巧使得他在1650年代的枢密院击败了他的两位政敌.他们是哥菲茲·烏爾費德总管和汉尼拔·伊斯伊登，他们都和弗雷德里克三世的同父异母的妹妹结婚.在1659年冬哥本哈根之围间的英勇行为与贵族和枢密院的懦弱怕事为他赢得了广泛的支持.这一事件导致1660年贵族只能忍痛创建一个世袭君主制.新的体制意味着国王不必再被枢密院摆布.他立刻用手中的权利引入专制政体，这在1665年的《国王法》之前先被1661年10月暂时发行的《世袭君主制法》所记载，国家进入君主制.

original: The reign of Frederik II saw a marked increase in Danish sea power, and the king took a deep personal interest in building up the fleet. This policy was continued and further developed by his legendary son, Christian IV, who sailed with the fleet every year during his reign. Christian IV's intense interest in the fleet was manifest at all levels, from the naval base at Bremerholm to the duties of his admirals and the equipment of the ships.
translation: 弗雷德里克二世在位时丹麦海上力量显着增加，国王对扩建海军有着很大的兴趣.这项政策由他的传奇儿子，克里斯蒂安四世继续和进一步发展，在他统治时期，每年都与海军同行.克里斯蒂安四世对海军的兴趣表现在各个方面，从不萊默霍姆海军基地到舰船的装备和提督的职责.
佩德 格里芬菲尔德

original: Peder Griffenfeld was perhaps the most brilliant advisor a Danish king has ever had. Peder was born Schumacher to a wealthy Copenhagen family. After study and travel abroad in 1654-62, he returned to enter state service as royal librarian. Soon winning the favor of the absolutist king Frederick III, he became secretary of the king's chamber, in which post he drafted the 1665 Kongeloven ('King's Law'), which was a justification of absolutism. In 1670, the year of the king's death, Schumacher was made Count Griffenfeld. By 1674 he had risen to the post of high chancellor of Denmark under King Christian V.
translation: 佩德·格里芬菲尔德也许是丹麦国王有过的最辉煌的顾问.佩德作为一个富裕的哥本哈根家庭成员出生于舒马赫.在1654年至1662年在国外学习和旅行后，他回到丹麦作为皇家图书馆馆长效力.很快赢得专制国王弗雷德里克三世的青睐，他成为国王的秘书后，起草了1665 Kongeloven（“国王法”），这是一部专制法.

original: In 1697, the 15 years old Charles XII ascended the Swedish throne. Seeing the opportunity, the Russian Czar Peter I allied with Denmark and Poland-Saxony in 1699. However, with British and Dutch naval assistance, Charles XII landed on Zealand and promptly defeated the Danes, then moved to Estland where his badly outnumbered Swedes (1 to 5) won a crushing victory over the Russians. Instead of finishing the Russians, Charles moved against August II of Poland-Saxony and drove him out of Poland in 1704, having the pro-Swedish Stanislaw Leszczynski elected King. Then he subjugated Saxony in 1706. While the Russians started the construction of St Petersburg (1703) and rebuilt their armies, they also took parts of Estland (1704-1706). Charles then decided to march to Moscow via the Ukraine where the Cossacks under Mazeppa had again risen in revolt (1708). The harsh winter and Russian raids decimated his army and he was finally beaten at the battle of Poltava in 1709. The wounded king escaped to the Ottomans. The Russians were encircled by the Ottomans on the Prut River, but Peter succeeded through bribery to obtain a safe conduct in exchange for Azov. While Charles was still exiled in Turkey, Russian, Danish, Hanoverian and even Prussian troops captured most of the Swedish lands around the Baltic. Having emerged from Turkish internment, Charles got killed in 1718 in front of the Norwegian fortress of Frederickshald. Sweden lost most of her Baltic empire in the peace treaties that followed.
translation: 在1697年，15岁的查理十二世登上瑞典王位.俄国沙皇彼得一世看到机会在1699年与丹麦和波兰萨克森结盟.然而，在英国和荷兰海军帮助下，查理十二在西兰半岛登陆，并迅速打败了丹麦人，然后移动到爱沙尼亚他少量的瑞典精兵（1至5）赢得了对俄罗斯的大胜.查理并不急于解决俄罗斯，而是对萨克森的奥古斯特二世作战并在1704年将它撵出波兰并扶持斯坦尼斯瓦夫·莱什琴斯基成为波兰国王.随后他在1706年征服萨克森.与此同时俄罗斯开工建设圣彼得堡（1703年），并重建他们的军队，他们也占领了爱沙尼亚的部分土地（1704-1706）.查理然后决定借道乌克兰进军莫斯科因为马泽帕率领的哥萨克起义再次爆发（1708）.严冬和俄罗斯突袭重创了他的军队，他终于在1709年在波尔塔瓦战役中被击败.受伤的国王逃到了奥斯曼.俄国人在普鲁特河被奥斯曼包围，但彼得成功地通过贿赂以亚速获得安全的撤退.当查理仍流亡土耳其的时候，俄罗斯，丹麦，汉诺威，甚至普鲁士攻占波罗的海周围的瑞典领土.摆脱土耳其拘留，查尔斯在挪威堡垒Frederickshald前于1718年被害.在和平条约中瑞典失去了她的大部分波罗的海领土.

original: The Mercantile Reforms of Christian VI
translation: 克里斯蒂安六世的商业改革

original: Christian VI was a firm believer in heavy-handed mercantilism and large state controlled manufactories. Although his protectionist reforms did have a positive effect on the for Denmark all-important agriculture, they were mostly costly failures that retarded the commercial development of the nation for decades to come.
translation: 克里斯蒂安六世是严厉的重商主义和国家控制大型工厂的坚定信徒，虽然他的保护主义改革对丹麦的所有重要的农业确实有积极的作用，但是这个改革是一个残酷的失败，阻碍了国家几十年的商业发展.

original: Like his consort, Sophie Magdalene of Brandenburg-Kulmbach, Christian VI was imbued with German pietism and devoutly encouraged a pietistic national church. He banned theater performances on Sundays and holidays, and after 1738 actors and entertainers were not even allowed to enter the country. Frivolous amusements were also banned at court, but the royal couple's love of splendor led to costly buildings, such as Christiansborg Castle (built 1733-45).
translation: 和他的配偶勃兰登堡库姆巴赫索菲·马德莲纳一样，克里斯提安六世是狂热的德国虔信派信徒并且虔诚的想要建立虔信派国家教堂.他在星期日和节假日禁止剧场演出后，1738名演员和艺人甚至不允许进入该国.无聊的娱乐活动也在宫廷内被禁止，但辉煌的王室夫妇的热爱导致昂贵的建筑物，如克里斯蒂安城堡（建于1733年至1745年）
约翰·哈特维希恩斯特·冯·斯托夫的摄政

original: In 1766 Christian VII was crowned king of Denmark, succeeding his father Frederik V. Christian was unfortunately quite insane. His mental instability has been attributed to a brutal childhood governor and to morally corrupt court pages. After his 1766 marriage to Caroline Matilda, the daughter of Frederick, Prince of Wales, he gave himself up to debauchery. During his entire reign the country was run by others. First up was the foreign minister J.H.E. Bernstorff, a devious and competent man who managed to get Catherine II of Russia to renounce some of her claims to parts of the duchy of Holstein. However, Bernstorff's position grew increasingly precarious and he was dismissed from office on Sep. 15, 1770.
translation: 1766年克里斯蒂安七世加冕丹麦国王，接替他的父亲弗雷德里克五世，令人遗憾的是克里斯蒂安七世是相当精神错乱的。他的精神状态不稳定是因为童年时的残酷的监护者和到道德败坏的宫廷.他在1766年迎娶威尔士亲王弗雷德里克之女卡罗琳明德，结婚后他放荡不羁。在他整个统治时期，国家都是由他人管理，第一个就是外长约翰·哈特维希恩斯特·冯·斯托夫。他是狡猾而能干的人设法使俄罗斯的叶卡捷琳娜二世放弃她要求的荷尔斯泰因公国的部分土地。然而，斯托夫的地位变得越来越不稳，并在1770年9月15日被罢官。

original: Johann Friedrich Struensee took over as the real ruler of Denmark after Bernstorff was dismissed. Originally a German physician, Struensee came to know the Danish king when he was named to accompany the mentally unstable Christian VII on a European tour (1768-69), a post that led to Struensee's appointment as court physician in 1769. Dominating the king, he became the lover of Queen Caroline Matilda in 1770. He was soon able to abolish the council of state and the office of statholder (governor) of Norway in 1770. In June 1771 he had the king name him privy Cabinet minister, and in July he was made a count. From March 1771 until January 1772 Struensee introduced a number of reforms, including freedom of the press, reduction of peasant labor service, a unitary judiciary, and reform of Copenhagen's municipal government. Having alienated many officials, however, he was the victim of a conspiracy in January 1772, when he was arrested and tortured to death for his liaison with the queen.
translation: 约翰·弗里德里希·施特林泽接任成为丹麦真正的统治者后，斯托夫被撤职.施特林泽原本是一个德国医生，当他被任命陪同精神上不稳定的克里斯提安在欧洲旅游的时候（1768年至1769年）才认识丹麦国王，并使得施特林泽在1769年被任命为七世的宫廷御医.作为王国的实际掌控者，他在1770年成为卡罗琳明德王后的情人.在1770年他很快就取消了挪威国务委员会办公室总督.1771年6月，他被国王提名枢密院内阁部长，7月他变成伯爵.从1771年3月至1772年1月，施特林泽出台了多项改革，包括新闻自由，减少农民劳务，建立统一司法机构，哥本哈根市政府改革.在疏远了许多官员后，但是，他却成为了一个阴谋的受害者，在1772年1月，当他与女王联络时，被逮捕并折磨致死.

original: Denmark was and is primarily an agricultural nation, and it was one of the first to adopt the new farming methods and tools that were invented in the late 18th and early 19th centuries. Fields were reallotted, improved plows were used, crop rotation was introduced and new high-yield crops (potato, Indian corn) from the new world were taken into wide use. Not all of the reforms were greeted with joy by the peasants, but the most unpopular by far involved the splitting of villages into separate farms so that the peasants could live closer to their fields.
translation: 丹麦主要是一个农业国家，它是发明于18世纪末和19世纪初的新的耕作方法和工具的第一个采用者。土地被重新配发，使用了改进的犁，轮作被引入，新大陆的高产作物（马铃薯，印度玉米）被广泛使用。并非所有的改革带给农民喜悦，但迄今为止最不受欢迎的涉及村庄分裂成独立的农场，让广大农民群众可以住得近接近他们的田地。
奥乌豪厄格·古尔伯格摄政

original: Høegh-Guldberg was of humble background. He earned a theology degree in 1753, and in 1761 became professor of rhetoric at Sorø academy. He was appointed tutor to Prince Frederik, half brother of the future king Charles VII, in 1764. As Frederick's private secretary in 1771, he shared Frederik's hostility to Count Johann Friedrich Struensee, then supreme in Denmark through his domination of Christian VII - Høegh-Guldberg took part in a conspiracy that led to Struensee's arrest and execution in 1772. Thereafter, Høegh-Guldberg, along with Prince Frederik and the dowager queen Juliana Maria, gained significant power in the Danish state. In 1774 Høegh-Guldberg was made confidential cabinet secretary. Soon, without consulting the other council ministers, he was issuing orders signed by the incompetent Christian VII. He took over control of foreign policy after dismissing foreign minister Count A.P. Bernstorff in 1780. Høegh-Guldberg was forced out of power during a 1784 coup d'etat led by Prince Frederik.
translation: 奥乌豪厄格·古尔伯格背景并不起眼. 1753年，他获得了神学学位，并在1761年成为索勒学院修辞学教授.在1764年他被任命为未来的国王查理七世的同父异母的弟弟弗里德里克王子的导师.在1771年作为弗雷德里克的私人秘书，他分分担弗雷德里克对伯爵约翰·弗里德里希施·特林泽的敌意.随后奉丹麦至高无上的统治者克里斯提安七世的旨意，H？egh-Guldberg参与了1772年导致施特林泽的逮捕？？和执行的阴谋.此后，古尔伯格，同弗雷德里克王子和太后朱丽安娜·玛丽亚一起在丹麦执掌大权. 1774年，古尔伯格出任内阁机要秘书.不久，在没有咨询其他议会部长的情况下，他签署由无能的克里斯蒂安七世发布的命令.他在1780年开除了外长安德烈亚斯·彼得·斯托夫后，夺取了外交政策的控制权. 古尔伯格在1784弗雷德里克王子率领的政变后被迫交出权力.
安德烈亚斯·彼得·斯托夫摄政

original: Recalled to office in April 1784, Bernstorff, until his death, served as foreign minister in a moderate liberal government. He supported a series of reform measures including the regulation of landlord-peasant relations and the emancipation of the serfs. In foreign affairs, Bernstorff carefully pursued a policy of neutrality. When the French Revolution broke out, he condemned any interference in the domestic affairs of France and avoided every anti-French coalition. In March 1794 he negotiated a neutrality treaty with Sweden for protecting the merchant shipping of both countries by combined squadrons. Bernstorff's foreign policy won him the respect of European diplomats - his domestic policy gained him such popularity among the Danes that his death (June 21, 1797) was regarded as a national calamity.
translation: 在1784年4月，斯托夫被召回执政，直到他死前，在适度宽松的政府担任外相。他支持了一系列的改革措施，包括地主农民关系的调节和解放农奴。在外交领域，斯托夫小心的奉行中立政策。当法国大革命爆发，他谴责任何干扰法国内政的行为，避免了一次反法联盟。在1794年3月，他与瑞典谈判派遣保护两国商船联合中队的中立条约。斯托夫的外交政策赢得了欧洲外交官对他的尊重——他的国内政策使他获得了丹麦人的普遍关系，他的死（6月21日，1797）被视为一个国家的灾难。

original: Tycho Brahe was a Danish astronomer whose work in developing astronomical instruments and in measuring and fixing the positions of stars paved the way for future discoveries. His observations - the most accurate possible before the invention of the telescope - included a comprehensive study of the solar system and accurate positions of more than 777 fixed stars.
translation: 一个丹麦天文学家第谷·布拉赫在发展天文仪器和测量和确定恒星位置的工作为未来的发现铺平了道路。他的观察——在望远镜发明之前，可能是最准确的 ——包括太阳系全面的研究和超过777恒星的准确位置。

original: 'In the evening a great storm and bad weather rose from the southwest out of the sea. The wind began to blow so hard that no sleep could touch our eyes. When we had been lying in bed for about an hour my son said to me, 'Father, I feel water dripping into my face.' The waves were rising up at the sea dike and onto the roof of the house. It was a very frightening sound.'\n\nA sudden storm tide has struck the coast of Slesvig and Dithmarschen, overrunning dikes, and covering the entire North Frisian countryside in water. As water levels rise thousands of people are killed or displaced. Entire islands and settlements have been washed away by the waves never to be seen again.
translation: “夜晚，一场巨大的风暴伴随着糟糕的天气从西南方的海面上席卷而来。狂风呼啸，睡意迟迟无法触及我们的眼皮。当我们在床上躺了大约一个小时后，我的儿子说：“爸爸，我觉得水漫到我脸上了。”海浪越过堤坝扑上了屋顶。那声音令人恐惧不已。”\n\n一场突如其来的风暴潮袭击了石勒苏益格和迪特马尔申的海岸，漫过堤坝，甚至将整个北菲仕兰的乡间淹作了一片泽国。随着水位的上升，成千上万人溺亡或是失踪。岛屿和村镇被整个冲走，就此消失不见。

original: King Christian I of Denmark founded the University of Copenhagen 1479 as a studium generale. The university became a center of Roman Catholic theological learning, but also had faculties for the study of law, medicine, and philosophy.
translation: 1479年，国王克里斯提安一世创立了哥本哈根大学，是一所中世纪大学.大学成为罗马天主教神学学习的中心，也有法律，医学，哲学学院的研究.

original: King John I and Queen Christina founded the St. Clare's Monastery in Copenhagen in 1497 with a gift of the former royal vegetable gardens in an area known as Rosengård. The Queen made a donation of 40 Rhenish Guilders for construction of the monastery in 1498. Seven years later, in 11 August 1505, the monastery was completed and consecrated. The monastery consisted of a dormitory, refectory, church, infirmary, cellars and places for lay sisters and a priest to stay.
translation: 国王约翰一世女王克里斯蒂娜在1497年于哥本哈根的一个叫做罗森德的地方用一个从前的皇家菜园作为礼物创办圣克莱尔的修道院.女王为1498年建造的修道院捐赠40礼贤荷兰盾.7年后，于1505年8月11日，该寺建成并供奉.寺院包括宿舍，食堂，教堂，医务室，酒窖和修女住宿处和一位牧师临时过夜的地方.

original: Since 1439 the entirety of the Duchy of Schleswig has been a hereditary fief under the Danish crown ruled by Count Adolf of Holstein. Adolf's death has now left Schleswig without a clear line of succession even though he tried to make arrangements for his eldest nephew to inherit his titles. This presents an opportunity for us. The local nobles worry that the Duchy and County could be separated, parting their possessions and costing them dearly.\nBy guaranteeing the rights of the estates of Schleswig and Holstein as well as compensating other claimants we might be able to acquire both titles.
translation: 自1439年起，石勒苏益格公爵领就成为了丹麦下属的一块世袭采邑并为荷尔斯泰因伯爵阿道夫所有。虽然阿道夫试图安排他最年长的外甥继承他的头衔，但现如今他的逝世还是没给石勒苏益格留下明确的继承顺位。这给了我们一个机会。当地贵族担心公爵领和伯爵领可能会被拆开，导致他们的财产被分离，给他们造成巨大的损失。\n只要确保石勒苏益格和荷尔斯泰因各阶层人士的权利并对其他宣称者进行补偿，我们就能够同时获得这两个头衔。

original: Since 1439 the entirety of the Duchy of Schleswig has been a hereditary fief under the Danish crown ruled by Count Adolf of Holstein. Adolf's death has left Schleswig without a clear line of succession, however, even though the deceased duke tried to make arrangements for his favorite nephew, [Root.Monarch.GetName] to inherit both of his titles. The local nobles worry that the Duchy and County could be separated, parting their possessions and costing them dearly.\nBy guaranteeing the rights of the estates of Schleswig and Holstein as well as compensating other claimants we might be able to acquire both titles.
translation: 自1439年起，石勒苏益格公爵领就成为了丹麦下属的一块世袭采邑并为荷尔斯泰因伯爵阿道夫所有。虽然已故的公爵曾试图安排他最疼爱的外甥[Root.Monarch.GetName]继承他的头衔，但现如今他的逝世还是没给石勒苏益格留下明确的继承顺位。这给了我们一个机会。当地贵族担心公爵领和伯爵领可能会被拆开，导致他们的财产被分离，给他们造成巨大的损失。\n只要确保石勒苏益格和荷尔斯泰因各阶层人士的权利并对其他宣称者进行补偿，我们就能够同时获得这两个头衔。
我们必须获得这两个头衔！

original: The estates of Holstein will expect their rights to be guaranteed.
translation: 荷尔施泰因各阶层可以期待自己的权利得到保障。

original: Another claimant will inherit the Holstein while we inherit the province of Schleswig.
translation: 由我们来继承石勒苏益格，而另一个宣称者则会继承荷尔斯泰因。

original: The nobles of Holstein and Schleswig have agreed to support [Root.Monarch.GetName] as the new Duke of Schleswig and Count of Holstein. In return we have promised to keep the lands of the two titles undivided to further the interests of the landholders there. Schleswig and Holstein are now an indivisible part of our domain even if one is a Danish duchy and the other a Holy Roman County.\nIn order to keep the titles equal in rank the Holy Roman Emperor has now agreed to elevate the County of Holstein to a duchy, confirming our right not only to the county that Adolf VIII left behind but also to the small province of Dithmarschen to the west.
translation: 石勒苏益格和荷尔斯泰因的贵族同意支持[Root.Monarch.GetName]成为新的石勒苏益格公爵和荷尔斯泰因伯爵。作为回报我们保证这两个头衔下的土地永不分割，以此促进地主的利益。石勒苏益格和荷尔斯泰因现在是我们国土中不可分离的一部分，虽然其中一个是丹麦辖下的公爵领而另一个是神圣罗马帝国的伯爵领。\n为了让头衔在等级上平等，神圣罗马帝国皇帝已经同意把荷尔斯泰因从伯爵领提升为公爵领，并确认我们的权利不仅可以行使于阿道夫八世留下的伯爵领，还能延伸至西边狭小的迪特马尔申省。

original: The nobles of Holstein and Schleswig have agreed to support [Root.Monarch.GetName] as the new Duke of Schleswig and Count of Holstein. In return we have promised to keep the lands of the two titles undivided to further the interests of the landholders there. Schleswig and Holstein are now an indivisible part of our domain even if one is a Danish duchy and the other a Holy Roman County.\nIn order to keep the titles equal in rank the Holy Roman Emperor has now agreed to elevate the County of Holstein to a duchy, confirming our right to all lands that Adolf VIII left behind.
translation: 石勒苏益格和荷尔斯泰因的贵族同意支持[Root.Monarch.GetName]成为新的石勒苏益格公爵和荷尔斯泰因伯爵。作为回报我们保证这两个头衔下的土地永不分割，以此促进地主的利益。石勒苏益格和荷尔斯泰因现在是我们国土中不可分离的一部分，虽然其中一个是丹麦辖下的公爵领而另一个是神圣罗马帝国的伯爵领。\n为了让头衔在等级上平等，神圣罗马帝国皇帝已经同意把荷尔斯泰因从伯爵领提升为公爵领，并确认我们在阿道夫八世留下的伯爵领上的权利。

original: Ever since the treaty of Kalmar in 1397 it has been stipulated that the crowns of Norway, Sweden and Denmark rest on one head. Denmark is the seat of this union, the dominant state in the north, and a would-be contender to the influence of the Hanseatic League. Newly crowned [Root.Monarch.GetName] has not inherited a Baltic empire however. His predecessor was deposed after having been defeated by the Hanseatics and now leads a life as a pirate on Gotland in the middle of the Baltic Sea. While the recently introduced Sound Toll is a great source of income the Crown has also been forced to pawn many of its lands to the major noble families of Thott, Gyldenstierne, Rosenkrantz, Rønnow, Frille to pay for the many expenses of keeping the union together and the failed wars of our predecessors.\nIf we are to prevent royal power from weakening we must get that land back, by any means possible.
translation: 自从1397年《卡尔马条约》规定丹麦，挪威，瑞典的王位同属一人后，丹麦就一直是这个联盟的领导者和北方的主宰者，也是汉萨同盟势力潜在的竞争者。然而，新登基的[Root.Monarch.GetName]未能继承这一波罗的海帝国。他的前任在被汉萨同盟击败后遭到废黜，如今在波罗的海中部的哥特兰岛上过着海盗的生活。虽然新近出现的海峡通行税能够带来大笔的收入，国王还是被迫抵押了许多土地给诸如托特、吉尔登斯吞、罗森克兰兹、劳诺及弗里这些显贵家族以筹集资金，支付维持联盟统一及处理前任国王败战的一系列费用。\n倘若我们想要阻止王权继续衰落，就必须不惜一切代价把那些土地夺回来。

original: Nobility must aid and advise, never rule.
translation: 贵族们必须支援国家，辅佐国王，从不乱政。

original: We will confiscate large numbers of pawned off castles from the nobility. With arms in hand if need be.
translation: 我们将从贵族手中收回大批抵押出去的城堡，必要时不惜使用武力。

original: The nobles carry this kingdom on their shoulders, we must give them what they are owed.
translation: 贵族是整个国家的中流砥柱，我们必须给他们应得的权利。

original: With the death of Johann of Palatinate-Neumarkt in 1443 Christopher inherited the family holdings in Oberpfalz. Their importance may pale in comparison to the Crowns Christopher holds in the north but they still provide a nice source of income on the side in these dire times.
translation: 在1443年普法尔茨-诺伊马尔克特家族的约翰死后，克里斯托弗继承了在上普法尔茨的家族领地。这些领地的重要性可能比不上克里斯多夫在北方的王室领地，但也能在要紧时成为一处不错的收入来源。

original: As [Root.Monarch.GetName] is not getting any younger the royal council has begun to look around for suitable heirs in the widest sense. One of our most powerful vassals, [count_of_holstein.Monarch.GetName] of Schleswig-Holstein, has put forth the idea that [count_of_holstein.Monarch.GetHerHis] nephew and heir Christian, a descendant of Valdemar the Victorious, would be a suitable candidate.\n[count_of_holstein.Monarch.GetName] has also made it clear that [count_of_holstein.Monarch.GetSheHe] will support the candidacy of Christian out of his own pocket.
translation: 鉴于[Root.Monarch.GetName]不再年轻，王室参政会已经开始广泛考察合适的继承人。我们最强大的附庸之一——石勒苏益格-荷尔斯泰因的[count_of_holstein.Monarch.GetName]提出了一个建议：[count_of_holstein.Monarch.GetHerHis]侄子和继承人、胜利王瓦尔德马的后裔克里斯蒂安会是一个不错的候选人。\n[count_of_holstein.Monarch.GetName]还声称[count_of_holstein.Monarch.GetSheHe]将出资支持克里斯蒂安。

original: We cannot make any promises ahead of time.
translation: 我们不能提前做出承诺。

original: Once the waters off Skanör-Falsterbo in Skåne were so full of herring that you 'could cut them with a dagger'. Ever since the market of Skåne has been the major entrepôt for Fish export in the Baltic as well as the main entrepôt for any goods coming from Western Europe to the eastern ports.\nLately, however, the herring has been less bountiful and this year the catch has been so poor that it is impossible to support the market itself. As the Skåne Market dies so does one of the major sources of income for the crown.
translation: 斯科讷的斯卡讷-法尔斯特布外海曾经布满了鲱鱼，你甚至可以“用一支匕首捉到他们”。自那时起斯科讷的鱼市就成为了波罗的海鱼类出口的主要贸易中心，同时也成为了从西欧运往东方港口的各式商品的转口港。\n然而后来鲱鱼的数量却越来越少，今年的捕获量甚至不能满足市场本身的需求。随着斯科讷鱼市的衰落，王国的一项主要收入也逐渐萎缩。

original: A group of Merchants lead by Jan de Willum, Herman Rosenkrantz and Roland Crappe, has approached [Root.Monarch.GetName] asking to be given a charter to establish a Danish colony in India. The merchants are varyingly claiming to have already established ties with the 'King of Ceylon' and the Raja of Tanjore and while it is unclear how much is actually behind these claims, it is clear that they do know the area quite well. Should we grant them an Indian Charter they will attempt to establish a Danish presence in India and to further our interests in the region.
translation: 一个由扬·迪威勒姆、赫尔曼·罗森克兰兹和罗兰·克拉皮领导的商人团已经觐见了[Root.Monarch.GetName]并请求获取在印度建立丹麦殖民地的特许权。他们提出各种言论声称自己已经与“锡兰之王”及坦贾武尔拉者建立了联系。尽管这些声称背后的真实情况我们不得而知，但很显然他们对那片土地的情况确实了然于胸。如果我们授予他们在印度的特许权，他们便会努力在印度组建丹麦的驻军，并拓展我们在那里的利益。

original: An expedition will be sent out to establish a trading mission in India. Should the expedition succeed the investment will be paid back together with profit.
translation: 派出一支考察队前往印度组织开拓商路。如果考察成功，投资将会获得回报。

original: We have concerns closer at hand.
translation: 我们手头有更要紧的事务。

original: A man presenting himself as Captain Pike has approached [Root.Monarch.GetName]. He claims to represent the [From.Monarch.GetTitle] of Denmark and ask that we let them create a trading factory in our port in [dansborg.GetName]. In return he offers financial compensation and 'protection' from other Europeans.
translation: 一个自称是派克船长的人觐见了[Root.Monarch.GetName]。他自称代表丹麦[From.Monarch.GetTitle]，请求我们允许他们在[dansborg.GetName]的港口建立一处贸易商行。作为回报，他将提供经济补偿和来自其他欧洲人的“保护”。

original: I do not trust small fish.

Our first expedition to India has returned with news from Captain Gjedde. It seems he has convinced the local [From.Monarch.GetTitle] to agree to a Danish colony in the general area of [dansborg.GetName].\nAccording to the good captain a new fort has already been constructed together with a small but profitable factory.
translation: 我们的第一支印度考察队已然凯旋，而队长杰德也带回了新的消息。看起来他已经说服了当地的[From.Monarch.GetTitle]同意在[dansborg.GetName]一带建立丹麦殖民地。\n根据这名优秀的队长的说法，他们已经在那里建立了一座据点以及一处规模虽小但利润丰厚的商行。

original: Our expedition to India has returned with nothing but bad news. It seems the crew found their way to the island of Ceylon and immediately proceeded to occupy a local temple to use as a base of operations. As soon as the authorities found out they stormed the temple together with troops from another European nation already established in the area and ejected our men.\nThe ships continued to visit a number of ports but were met with similarly negative responses wherever they went, with many insisting that the Danish sailors were in fact pirates.
translation: 我们的印度考察队带回了一堆坏消息。队员们似乎是找到了去锡兰岛的路，并立即前往占领了一座当地的寺庙作为基地。当地政府一发现他们，便立即与已在当地落脚的另一个欧洲国家的部队一起攻击了寺庙，并驱逐了我们的队员。\n探险队的船只继续访问了一些港口，但都遭到了类似的抵制，许多人坚持认为丹麦的水手其实是海盗。

original: What started as a small accident where two children played with candles has grown into a great fire engulfing all of Copenhagen. For four days the fire has spread from house to house in the old medieval city center, entire blocks are gone and tens of thousands have become homeless or killed. The fire has consumed a number of old and prominent buildings, among them the Copenhagen University Library with many of the works from the great minds of our country's past.\nAn ambitious restructuring plan has been suggested by our architects to rebuild what was lost, with a ban on half-timbered houses and a new network of orderly streets and blocks, far from the old medieval city that was destroyed by the fire. Others, however, point out that we would be wise to rebuild as quickly as possible, thousands are without homes and there is little room to waste any time...
translation: 一切始于两个小孩玩蜡烛时发生的小意外，最终却发展成为了吞没整个哥本哈根的大火。整整四天，大火在古老的中世纪城区中心肆虐，从一幢房屋蔓延至另一幢，整个街区都被烧成白地，成千上万的人无家可归或者死亡。这场大火摧毁了许多古老而著名的建筑，其中包括了哥本哈根大学图书馆及其馆藏的诸多我国先代伟人的著作。\n我们的建筑师已经提出了一个雄心勃勃的计划来重建失去的一切：禁止再建砖木结构的房屋，崭新而有序的街道与街区网络，远离被火摧毁的中世纪城区。然而，其他人指出明智的行动是尽可能快地进行重建，毕竟成千上万人居无住所，没有一丁点时间可供浪费……
按照那雄心勃勃的计划去做！
按照现实一点的计划去做！

original: The leader of the Royal Council and one of the richest men in the country, Poul Laxmand, has been murdered in broad daylight in Copenhagen. According to eyewitnesses two well-known nobles assaulted Laxmand with a knife and then threw him into a canal. As leader of the Royal Council Laxmand was a force to be reckoned with and not always on good terms with [Root.Monarch.GetName]. There are suspicions that he has not always served the good of the realm first. We might make good use of this incident to further weaken his supporters and confiscate his property. It is, however, very likely that such actions would reflect very poorly on us and some would think that [Root.Monarch.GetName] might be behind the murder [Root.Monarch.GetHerselfHimself].
translation: 作为王室参政会的领导人和国内最富有的人之一的波尔·拉克斯曼于光天化日之下在哥本哈根遭到谋杀。据目击者称，两位知名的贵族持刀袭击了拉克斯曼并其扔进了运河。作为王室参政会的领导人，拉克斯曼有着举足轻重的势力，而他与[Root.Monarch.GetName]的关系却并不太和睦。有意见怀疑他并不总是以国家的福祉为优先考量。我们可以善用这个事件进一步消弱他的支持者，并没收他的财产。然而，这样的行动很可能会对我们造成非常不好的影响，一些人会认为[Root.Monarch.GetName]本人可能是谋杀案的幕后凶手。

original: 'Your name is Lax, surely you can swim!'
translation: “既然你的名字是拉克斯鳗，想必很会游泳！”

original: We will confiscate the holdings of Poul Laxmand and accuse him openly of treason now that he cannot defend himself.
translation: 我们将没收波尔·拉克斯曼的财产，并公开指控他叛国，毕竟他现在已经无法辩解了。

original: We must find and punish his killers!
translation: 我们必须找到并严惩杀人凶手！

original: Due to our shared position as a Maritime power in the North Sea and the Baltics we have always had close relations with the trading cities of the Low Countries. While Royal Power has traditionally remained strongly tied to the nobility in Denmark, however, political power has come to rely more and more on the Burghers in the Low Countries. Now, however, our interests and challenges are so closely aligned that [Root.Monarch.GetName] has been eyeing Dutch political and economic structures for inspiration.\nGiven free hands our [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] is confident that [Root.Monarch.GetSheHe] could implement a set of far-reaching reforms to empower the Danish Burghers and strengthen our economy significantly.
translation: 作为身处北海和波罗的海交汇处的海军强国，我们一直与低地的贸易城市有着密切的联系。丹麦的王权依旧遵照传统与贵族们保持着牢固的联系，但低地国家的政治权力却已经开始越来越依靠市民。然而，现如今机遇与挑战接踵而至，[Root.Monarch.GetName]已经开始从荷兰的政治与经济结构中寻求灵感。\n只要能够放手去干，我们的[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]相信[Root.Monarch.GetSheHe]能够推行一系列意义深远的改革，促进丹麦市民阶层的发展，并显著地提高我国的经济实力。

original: This is the future for our country.

As the ideas of the Reformation spread through Europe a schism is growing in our country between those who defend the old and those who wish to reform the Church. A staunch follower of Lutheran teachings theologian Hans Tausen has built quite a following and have been able to rely on the protection of local burghers against his opponents within the Church. Others, like the Carmelite Poul Helgesen are critical of the Catholic establishment but reject the ideas of reformation.\nThe faith of Denmark is clearly swinging in the wind right now and small actions by [Root.Monarch.GetName] can likely have a great influence on our future.
translation: 随着宗教改革的思想在欧洲蔓延，持遵循旧制和改革教会两种思想者之间的分歧越来越大。路德宗教义的坚定支持者、神学家汉斯·陶森已经培养了一大批追随者，依靠着当地市民的保护对抗教会内的对手。而其他人，例如加尔默罗会的保罗·赫尔格森抨击着天主教会，但却拒绝改革派的思想。\n如今，丹麦的信仰已然在风中摇摆，[Root.Monarch.GetName]的一个小小的举动都将对未来产生巨大的影响。

original: Let us take Tausen under our wings.
Let us promote voices of reason.
translation: 我们要发扬真理的福音。

original: For centuries the Oxen Road has carried armies and merchants up and down the center of Jutland. More than anything, however, it is used to bring thousands of cattle to the great market of Wedel. From there the oxen are brought via Stade, Hamburg and Lübeck and resold all over northern Germany. As population in the late 16th century continues to soar, both in northern Germany in general and the Baltic region in particular, the demand for cattle, grain and fish is rapidly rising. The size of the herds brought south are now approaching 40 000 oxen for each market.\nExport of agricultural produce and especially oxen is earning a fortune of German and Dutch money for our landed nobility and market town burghers. Some worry, however, that this development is empowering the large estates of the nobility while small time free peasants suffer...
translation: 几个世纪以来军队与商人沿着群牛大道进出日德兰半岛的中心。更重要的是，这条路曾运送成千上万的牛到达韦德尔的大市场。从那里，牛经由施塔德、汉堡和吕贝克，再转售至北德意志各地。随着十六世纪末人口的持续飙升，不论是整个北德意志，还是单独的波罗的海沿岸地区，对牛肉、谷物和鱼类的需求都在与日俱增。就运往南方的牲畜数量而言，如今每个市场已经达到了40000头牛。\n出口的农产品，尤其是牛，从德意志和荷兰那里为我们的有产贵族和市镇居民赚了大量的钱。然而有些人则烦忧，这样的发展是拥有大片土地的贵族才享有的特权，空闲时间很少的农民却仍在受苦……

original: More money has never harmed anyone!

The growing economy of Copenhagen, Malmø and other rich Market Towns has seen the emergence of a new breed of burgher aristocrats. These men are eager not only to find opportunity to enrich themselves but are ready to ally with the state to create future wealth for both themselves and us.\nFew embody this ideal as much as Markus Hess, the mayor of Copenhagen and personal head of trading enterprises from the Netherlands to Spain and from Iceland to Estonia. Hess has a number of close ties to the crown, at times single-handedly taking responsibility for supplying the navy and army with certain goods as well as by facilitating financial contacts with the Dutch.
translation: 哥本哈根、马尔默及其他富饶市镇的经济增长见证了一个新兴市民贵族阶层的诞生。这些人并不仅仅热衷于寻求自己的生财之道，还与政府联合共同致富。\n很少有人能像马库斯·赫斯那样完美的展现这些信条。马库斯·赫斯，哥本哈根的市长，同时也是荷兰至西班牙及冰岛至爱沙尼亚的贸易企业的领头人。赫斯与国王有着极为紧密的联系，有时甚至会独立承担为海军与陆军提供补给以及促进与荷兰的经济联系的责任。

original: Let him do what he does best!
Corfitz Ulfeldt and the Royal Council
translation: 柯菲茨·乌费尔德与王室参政会

original: The Danish Royal Council of the Realm and the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] have a long history of disagreeing on the limits of power. The current Rigshofmester, Count Corfitz Ulfeldt, is also the brother-in-law of [Root.Monarch.GetName] and has ambitiously tried to extend the power of the council and the noble families of the realm. Attempts to divorce the count from his office has ended in failure as he has the support of the Nobility and full power of the administration. Ulfeldt is a skilled intrigue-maker and has in the past several times managed to outplay royal power and other adversaries, demonstrating his own authority through various devices.\nAs the sole administrator of the Sound Toll it is also believed that Ulfeldt may be siphoning significant state income but using this excuse to depose him would likely come at a high political cost.
translation: 丹麦国家王室参政会与[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]在权力划分上有着漫长的历史分歧。现任王国总管——[Root.Monarch.GetName]的妹夫柯菲茨·乌费尔德伯爵雄心勃勃地试图扩大参政会与贵族的权力。由于这位伯爵得到了贵族阶层与政府的全力支持，我们使他卸任的计划最终以失败告终。乌尔菲是一个十足的阴谋家，过去他曾多次成功击败王权及其他政敌，并用各种手段展现自己的权威。\n作为海峡过境费的唯一管理者，乌尔菲从中吸取了大量国家财富，但就以此理由罢黜他需要耗费高昂的政治成本。

original: Let us be rid of this traitor in our midst!

Throughout his professional life the Bishop of Ribe, Jens Dinesen Jersin, has been a man of renown. Early in his life he attempted to reform Latin education by introducing explanations and translations in Danish rather than Latin itself. Secondly the Bishop is a proponent of a practical pious approach to faith, authoring two immensely popular religious texts, 'Vera via vitae, en riktig vei til det evige liv' and 'Troens kamp oc seier'.\nRecently, however, Jersin has been fighting popular superstition through a text titled 'Om miracler, tegn oc obenbaringer oc deris udleggelse', attempting to free the minds in his diocese of worries about the supernatural.
translation: 在里伯主教任内，延斯·迪内森·耶尔新一直极富名望。在早年，他试图改进拉丁语教学，引入丹麦语而非使用拉丁语自身来解释和翻译拉丁文献。此外，主教还是对信仰虔诚实践的倡导者 ，创作了两本广受好评的宗教著作《永生正路》和《信仰之战及胜利》。\n最近耶尔新发表了一篇名为《论奇迹、预兆及神启》的文章与迷信观点作斗争，试图缓解其教区民众对超自然现象的焦虑。

original: Putting his experience of dutch shipbuilding and his apprenticeship under Maarten Tromp and Michiel de Ruyter to good use Niels Juel is a force to be reckoned with.
