Juel is constantly trying to improve and modernize the tactics and organization of the Danish Navy in times of peace. In times of war he has proven that he is greatly skilled in the practice of Naval warfare itself, achieving shockingly effective results against superior foes.\nWhile Juel has had to deal with the traditionalists in the navy his brilliance is becoming increasingly obvious both at home and abroad. It is time we reward him with the recognition his talent deserves.
translation: 尼尔斯·尤尔充分发挥了其在荷兰的造船经验及在马顿·特罗普及米歇尔·德·勒伊特尔门下的学徒经历，已然是一股不可小觑的势力。尼尔在和平年代便不断的尝试改进并将丹麦海军的战术与组织结构现代化；而到了战争时期，他证明了自己在海军作战方面的惊人才能，在对阵优势敌军时取得了惊人的战果。\n虽然尤尔依旧不得不与海军里的守旧主义者周旋，他的才华却逐渐享誉国内外。现在是我们认可他的才能的时候了。

original: Let us put his administrative ability to use.
translation: 我们要好好运用他的行政能力。

original: He will serve us as an admiral at sea.
translation: 他将成为一名海军将领为我们效命。

original: When Frederik I died in 1533 the bishops and most of the aristocracy were initially opposed to the election of his son Christian, duke of Holstein, as new king because he was a Lutheran. The burghers and peasants on their part wanted a return of the deposed Christian II who was imprisoned at Sønderborg. The mayors of Copenhagen and Malmö devised a plan together with the Hansa to free Christian II and turn the two largest Danish cities into partners of the Hanseatic League. The rebel forces were led by Count Christoffer of Oldenburg, thus the name 'Grevefejden' (The Count's Feud).
translation: 1533年弗雷德里克一世去世，主教们和大部分贵族起初反对选举他的儿子，荷尔斯泰因公爵克里斯蒂安为王。因为克里斯蒂安是一名路德宗信徒。市民和农民这边都希望囚禁于森讷堡的被废黜的克里斯蒂安二世重登王座。哥本哈根和马尔默市长与汉萨合谋释放克里斯蒂安二世并将丹麦最大的两座城市加入汉萨联盟。叛军领袖是奥尔登堡伯爵克里斯托弗，因此战争得名‘Grevefejden’(The Count's Feud).

original: Protesting the ascent of Christian III to the throne over the deposed Christian II, the peasants of Vendsyssel and North Jutland rose up against the nobles. The privateer captain Skipper Clement had instigated them at Count Christoffer's request and Aalborg became the rebel's headquarters. A large number of manors were burned down in northern and western Jutland due to this.
translation: 为了抗议克里斯蒂安三世越过了克里斯蒂安二世的继承顺位，文德斯尔和北日德兰的农民们揭竿而起反抗贵族。在奥尔登堡伯爵克里斯托弗的要求下，私掠船首领克莱蒙特船长煽动农民起事并将奥尔堡变成了叛军大本营。因此日德兰北部和西部的众多庄园被烧为平地。

original: When Frederik I died in 1533 the bishops and most of the aristocracy were initially opposed to the election of his son Christian, duke of Holstein, as new king because he was a Lutheran. The burghers and peasants on their part wanted a return of the deposed Christian II who was imprisoned at Sønderborg. Both the new monarch and the pretender have sent emissaries to Sweden to ask for help.
translation: 1533年弗雷德里克一世去世，主教们和大部分贵族起初反对选举他的儿子，荷尔斯泰因公爵克里斯蒂安为王。因为克里斯蒂安是一名路德宗信徒。市民和农民这边都希望囚禁于森讷堡的被废黜的克里斯蒂安二世重登王座。新君和篡位者都向瑞典派出了使者寻求帮助。

original: The Swedish army sent to aid Christian III by the Swedish King Gustav Vasa invaded Scania at Loshult and plundered, burned, and murdered their way throughout the Gønge area as it advanced toward the town of Vä. Another Swedish army invaded and destroyed Halland by fire and sword later on. Tyge Krabbe in Helsingborg Castle supported Count Christoffer, the regent of Christian II while some of the Scanian nobles sided with the Swedes. The army of Danish nobles and Swedes advanced on Helsingborg in January 1535 while an army consisting of residents of Lübeck and Malmö under Jørgen Kock was entrenched outside of the castle. The castle's cannon suddenly opened fire against its defenders under order of Tyge Krabbe, who then opened the castle to the Swedes. His reward was a burnt down Helsingborg, a town reduced to ashes. Denmark east of the Sound was lost for Count Christoffer and Christian III.
translation: 瑞典国王古斯塔夫·瓦萨援助克里斯蒂安三世的军队入侵了斯堪尼亚的洛斯胡尔特，并在通往维镇的甘吉地区沿路烧杀抢掠。另一支瑞典军队随后入侵蹂躏了哈兰。很多斯堪尼亚贵族站在了瑞典人那边，而驻扎在赫尔辛堡的蒂厄·克拉贝支持克里斯蒂安二世的摄政，克里斯托弗伯爵。1535年一月丹麦贵族和瑞典军队推进到了赫尔辛堡，同时一支由包括吕贝克和马尔默居民的军队在乔吉安·考克带领下在城外安营扎寨。蒂厄·克拉贝下令城堡守军对友军开火突袭，之后向瑞典人开门献城。他得到的奖赏是被夷为平地的赫尔辛堡，城镇已化为废墟。丹麦厄勒海峡东面的领土在克里斯托弗伯爵和克里斯蒂安三世之间反复争夺。

original: Klemen 'Skipper Clement' Andersen was a privateer captain who had earlier been in Christian II's service and allied himself to Count Christoffer, Christian II's regent. He instigated the peasants of Vendsyssel and North Jutland to rise up against the nobles. On 16 October 1534 the Jutland nobility that had been sent to crush the revolt met Clement's peasant army, enforced with professional soldiers from Count Christoffer. The nobility army was thoroughly defeated at the Battle of Svenstrup and the revolting peasants controlled a major part of northern Jutland for a couple of months. Noblemen were expelled and their manor houses were burned down by the peasants. The peasant army proved to be too poorly armed and too undisciplined though and King Christian III of Denmark made a separate peace with Count Christoffer. General Johan Rantzau was sent to fight the peasant revolt. The peasant army had retreated to Aalborg and strengthened the defenses of the city but after a hard battle in December 1534, Johan Rantzau's army defeated the peasants, overcame the defenses, sacked the city and killed 2000 people. Clement managed to escape, but was betrayed and captured by his enemies. He was kept in prison until the end of the civil war and was then executed by the breaking wheel.
translation: ‘克莱蒙特船长’克莱门·安德森是一名私掠船船长，早先侍奉克里斯蒂安二世，之后与他的摄政克里斯托弗伯爵结盟。他煽动文德斯尔和北日德兰的农民起事反抗贵族。1534年十月16日，前去平叛的日德兰贵族遇到了被克里斯托弗伯爵的职业军队压阵的农民军。斯文斯楚普之战中贵族军队彻底击败了农民叛军，并控制了北日德兰的主要地区好几个月。农民曾赶走贵族，并将他们的庄园焚毁。农民军被证明太缺乏武装同时也毫无训练，不过丹麦国王克里斯蒂安三世还是和克里斯托弗伯爵单独签订了和约。约翰·兰曹将军被派往镇压农民反叛。农民军撤往奥尔堡并加强城市防御。但是在1534年12月的一场硬仗之后，约翰·兰曹的军队打败了农民们，摧毁了防御工事攻陷城市，并杀了2000人。克莱蒙特设法逃走但是被他的敌人出卖并抓获。他被关押直到内战结束后处以轮碎之刑。

original: After the victory at Aalborg, General Rantzau and his army fought the Battle of Øksnebjerg on 11 June 1535. The rest of Count Christoffer's army was decisively defeated. Copenhagen and Malmö were able to hold out until 1536, when they were forced to capitulate after several months' siege. The Count's Feud was officially over. The nobles regrouped and healed the rifts through inter-marriage. The most powerful Danish nobility in Scania at this time, Bille and Brahe, protected their families and wealth through marriage. Beate Bille and Otte Brahe married to protect their families and formed a political alliance between the families with the marriage. The peasant consequences cost all parties dearly. Many were forced to purchase their lives with great gifts both to the king and to the nobles. The peasant's dissatisfaction was only made worse, as the nobility began to stick together even more after this incident. Christian III's rule saw the rise of royal absolutism in Denmark, and, with it, greater repression of the peasant classes. Another consequence of the Count's Feud was the introduction of a Swedish army into Scania, which whetted the Swedish appetite to gain the land for themselves...
translation: 奥尔堡之战胜利后的1535年6月11日，兰曹将军带领军队打了欧克斯讷堡战役。克里斯托弗伯爵的残军无可置疑的战败了。1536年哥本哈根和马尔默经过几个月的围城战后失守，标志着伯爵战争正式结束。贵族们重振旗鼓，通过联姻弥补之间的裂痕。这时候斯堪尼亚最具权势的丹麦贵族，比勒和布拉赫通婚来保卫家族和财富。伯爵战争的后果之一，农民让各方都付出了相当沉重的代价，因此许多人被强迫卖身充当送给国王和贵族的大礼。当贵族们在这次事件后串通一气加深了农民的不满。克里斯蒂安三世的统治见证了绝对王权在丹麦的崛起和对农民的进一步镇压。另一个后果是伯爵战争使瑞典军队介入了斯堪尼亚，吊起了瑞典本身对领土扩张的胃口...

original: The largest wave of germans immigrating into Hungary occurred due to a deliberate settlement policy of the Habsburg government, after the Ottoman Empire has been forced away from Hungarian lands. Between 1711 and 1780, German-speaking settlers from Southern Germany, Austria, and Saxony immigrated to the Southwest of Hungary. This influx of immigrants helped to bring economic recovery and cultural distinction to these regions. At the end of the 18th century, the Kingdom of Hungary contained over one million German-speaking residents. During this time, a flourishing German-speaking culture could be found in the kingdom, with German-language literary works, newspapers, and magazines being produced.
translation: 有赖于哈布斯堡当局刻意推行的移民政策，在奥斯曼帝国被迫放弃他们占据的匈牙利领土后匈牙利出现了史上最大的日耳曼人移民潮.1711至1780年间，来自日耳曼,奥地利和萨克森的德语人口不断移民到匈牙利西南部. 移民的涌入促进了这些地区的经济复苏和文化繁荣.  18世纪末，匈牙利王国境内已有超过一百万德语居民.这一时期王国里出现了一种欣欣向荣的德语文化，涌现出一批德语文学作品，德语报纸和德语书刊.

original: A temporary doctrinal agreement was proclaimed in May 1548 between German Catholics and Protestants and became imperial law on June 30, 1548. It was prepared and accepted at the insistence of the Holy Roman Emperor Charles V, who hoped to establish temporary religious unity in Germany until differences could be worked out in a general council of the Catholic Church. The Augsburg Interim primarily reflected a Catholic viewpoint. It did, however, allow clerical marriage and communion in both kinds (bread and wine) for the laity. Several Protestant electors objected to the Catholic emphasis of the Augsburg Interim and refused to abide by it. Charles attempted to force its acceptance, an action that led the Protestants to adopt the Leipzig Interim, which upheld Protestant doctrines, at a subsequent Diet. Neither interim was fully accepted so a German religious settlement was not brought about until the Peace of Augsburg in 1555.
translation: 一个临时的教义协议在1548年5月德国天主教徒和新教徒之间签订，并在1548年6月30日成为帝国法律.它是在神圣罗马帝国皇帝查理五世的坚持下准备和接受的，他希望建立临时的宗教团结，留到天主教大会上解决问题.奥格斯堡协定主要反映了天主教的观点.然而，它没有允许教士结婚和一般人享用圣餐（面包和酒）.几个新教选侯反对天主教强调的奥格斯堡条约，并拒绝遵守.查理试图强迫他们接受，这一动作使得新教徒采用莱比锡协议，坚持新教教义和附加的关于圣餐的条款.两个协议都被完全接受，使得德国无法宗教和解，直到1555年的奥格斯堡和约、

original: Pressed by the Estates of Bohemia and fearing the increasing power of his brother Ferdinand, Emperor Rudolf issued the Royal Letter of Bohemia. The letter gave religious freedom for all Protestants in Bohemia and the later recall of the letter would be one of the causes for the Thirty Years War.
translation: 在波西米亚的安置和惧怕他的兄弟费迪南德的力量，皇帝鲁道夫发出了波西米亚皇家函件.信函给予波希米亚新教徒宗教自由而信件被召回也是三十年战争的原因之一.

original: The revolt began in Prague in May, 1618, after the royal letter of Bohemia had been recalled. Two royal officers and their secretary were hurled from a window by Protestant members of the Bohemian diet - the so-called Defenestration of Prague. Ferdinand was declared deposed and the Bohemian throne was offered to Frederick V, the elector palatine.
translation: 这场反抗开始于1618年5月，一封波西米亚的皇家信件被召回之后。两位帝国大臣和他们的书记官被波西米亚的清教徒掷出窗外，此即为「第二次抛窗事件」。斐迪南国王被废黜，腓特烈五世被推举为新的国王。

original: The 1620s were characterized by long and cold winters, late springs and cold and wet summers, leading to crop-failure and sharp increases in grain prices. Into this atmosphere of enhanced tension broke a climatic event of unusual severity. In 1626, during the last week of May, in the middle of the vegetation period, winter returned. The temperature fell so that lakes and rivers froze and trees shed their leaves. The unexpected return of winter caused panic and anxiety among the peasants who could not remember ever experiencing such destruction of their fields. This event, combined with the brutal persecution of Protestants, led the mainly Protestant peasants of Upper Austria, pledged to Bavaria, to revolt. The peasants were defeated after heavy fighting, and in 1628 the country passed into the hands of the emperor again.
translation: 1620年代的特点是漫长而寒冷的冬天，迟来的春天和阴冷潮湿的夏天，导致作物歉收和粮食价格的急剧增加.在这种氛围下，一件事情打破了局面，1626年，在5月的最后一周，在植物生长期的中间，冬天回来了.气温下降，树木落叶，湖泊和河流被冻结.冬季的突然回归造成了农民的恐慌和焦虑，因为他们谁也不曾知道土地蒙受这么可怕的损失，加上野蛮的迫害新教徒，导致上奥地利州的主要信仰新教的农民，支持巴伐利亚叛乱.农民经过激战后被击败，并在1628年国家再次回到皇帝手中.

original: As struggles came and went the ruling family of Hungary, the Habsburgs, had established the following pattern in treating their nobility. During times of foreign war, nobles were granted rights which the crown then tried to recall as soon as peace came. This, naturally, often triggered revolts. Following this pattern, taxes and military drafts were imposed upon the nobles after Hungary's decisive victory over the Turks in 1699. But, when Austria went to war with France in 1703, the nobles revolted once again, and forced the Emperor Charles V to restore the old system of noble privileges, in the Peace of Szatmar of 1711.
translation: 在来来去去的斗争中，统治家族，哈布斯堡王朝，建立了以下模式来对待他们的贵族.在对外战争的时候，贵族被授予权力，然后再和平到来后尽快收回.自然，这往往是引发叛乱.按照这个模式，在匈牙利对土耳其人1699年的决定性胜利后，税收和征兵被强加在匈牙利贵族身上.但是，当奥地利与法国于1703年开战后，贵族再次起兵，迫使查理五世恢复贵族特权，在1711索特马尔和约中.
他们要考虑自己的地位

original: The Purge of the Archbishop of Salzburg

In 1731 the Archbishop of Salzburg purged his lands from Protestants. The Protestants had grown in number over the years and the Archbishop had started to feel his powers threatened by their existence. More than 26000 ethnic German Protestants fled for their lives. 17000 of them were welcomed in Prussia in 1732 and most of them settled in East Prussia. Several Protestant countries started nation-wide collections to help the fugitives.
translation: 1731年，萨尔茨堡大主教开始驱逐他土地上的新教徒.新教徒的数量近些年来不断增长，大主教已经已经开始认为他们的存在威胁到了他的权力.超过两万六千名德国新教徒逃离他们的家园.其中的一万七千人于1732年受到了普鲁士的欢迎，其中大多数定居在东普鲁士.一些新教国家开始全国性的集会以帮助流亡者.

original: Let the Archbishop Purge the Protestants

translation: 文策尔 安东 考尼茨

original: Wenzel Anton, Earl and then Prince of Rittberg-Kaunitz (1711-1794) was a noble from Bohemia. Impregnated of the culture of the Enlightenment, a devoted civil servant, he always had the full confidence and support from Empress Maria-Theresa. After a diplomatic career, he became Chancellor of Austria in 1753, till 1792. A partisan of alliance shifts, he worked out the closer ties with France that led to the Seven Years War, but also managed to renew with Frederick II of Prussia in time to be part of the first partition of Poland.
translation: 文策尔·安东伯爵，同样也是里特贝格-考尼茨王子（1711年至1794年），是来自波希米亚贵族.他受到启蒙文化的影响，成为了奉献自我的公务员，他深受皇后玛丽亚·特里萨的信任和支持.在作为外交官的生涯结束后，他于1753年成为奥地利总理，直到1792年.作为改革派，他曾与法国的关系日趋紧密，最终导致七年战争，但也成功说服普鲁士腓特烈二世继续承认其为波兰的一部分

original: Metternich began his state career in 1797 as representative of the Westphalian College of counts at the Congress of Rastatt, but in less than a decade, he had managed to become ambassador of Saxony and Preussen as well as the Austrian representative in France. His career primed in 1809 when he was assigned the post as minister of Austrian foreign affairs. Until 1813 Metternich will pursue a policy of acquiescence to French supremacy. A policy which ends with the creation of the Quadruple Alliance, the war against France, and the allied victory the very same year. The following 35 years have been called the Age of Metternich for during this time he was the chief arbiter of Europe. The Metternich system depended upon political and religious censorship, espionage, and the suppression of revolutionary and nationalist movements. This system holds part of the blame for the revolutions of 1848.
translation: 梅特涅在1797年作为威斯特伐利亚伯爵教座的代表参加了拉施塔特会议，此后正式开始了他的政治生涯。在不到十年间，他已成为了萨克森和普鲁士的大使以及奥地利驻法国代表。他于1809年被任命为奥地利帝国的外交大臣，这标志着他职业生涯的成功。此后直到1813年，梅特涅一直奉行对法国霸权的默许政策，这一政策随着四国同盟的成立和同年联盟军对法的胜利而终结。接下来的35年被称为梅特涅时代，因为在此期间他是欧洲的主要仲裁者。 梅特涅体系依赖于政治和宗教审查，间谍活动以及镇压革命和民族主义运动。 该体系一定程度上导致了1848年革命。

original: Religious antagonism played an important part when war between the empire and the Turks broke out again in 1591. In the so-called Long War, imperial troops entered Transylvania, and their commander, George Basta, behaved there and in northern Hungary with such insane cruelty toward the Hungarian Protestants that a Transylvanian general, István Bocskay, formerly a Habsburg supporter, revolted. His army of wild hajduks drove out Basta, and in June 1606 Bocskay concluded with Rudolf the Peace of Vienna, which left him prince of an enlarged Transylvania and also guaranteed the rights of the Protestants of Royal Hungary.
translation: 宗教对立在帝国与土耳其人之间发生的战争中扮演了重要角色.在所谓的“长期战争”中，帝国军队进入特兰西瓦尼亚.他们的指挥官乔治·巴斯塔，在匈牙利的北部残酷的对待新教徒.而特兰西瓦尼亚将军，伊什特万·博奇凯，曾经的哈布斯堡支持者发动叛乱.他的军队驱逐了巴斯塔，并于1606年的6月在维也纳和鲁道夫签订和平协议，协议承认他为泛特兰西瓦尼亚王子，也保证了新教徒在匈牙利的权利.

original: The Enlightened Reforms of Joseph II
translation: 约瑟夫二世的开明改革

original: Joseph II, 1741-90, Holy Roman Emperor (1765-90), King of Bohemia and Hungary (1780-90). After his father's death in 1765, Joseph acted as emperor and co-regent with his mother but had little real influence. Resenting this fact, he took to traveling until his mother's death in 1780. He then began reforms largely based on his own philosophy and principles, rather than those originating in the Enlightenment. These reforms consisted of nothing less than the abolition of hereditary and ecclesiastic privileges as well as the creation of a civil service based on merit and loyalty rather than birth.
translation: 约瑟夫二世（1741至1790年）是神圣罗马帝国皇帝（1765年至1790年）和波希米亚，匈牙利国王（1780至1790年）.1765年他的父亲去世后，约瑟夫作为皇帝与他的母亲共同摄政，事实上在这期间，他没有什么实际的影响.这种情况一直持续到1780年他母亲去世.随后，他开始按照自己的哲学观点进行改革.这些改革包括继承权和教会的特权的废除，以及靠能力和忠诚上位，而非靠出身继承的基本原则

original: The Reichshofrat was instituted by Maximilian I in 1497 and consisted of 21 advisors appointed by the emperor, with the exception of the vice-chancellor who was appointed by the Elector of Mainz. It was done to rival the Imperial Chamber Court which the Imperial Diet had forced upon him earlier. Six of the councilors were Protestants and a unanimous vote by them was effectively a veto.
translation: 帝国宫庭议会是由马克西米连一世在1497年任命的21名顾问组成，除了副法官由美因茨的选民投票确认。这最早是用来对抗帝国议会对他的压迫。六名议员为新教徒，他们拥有一票否决权。

original: Let the Nobility run these mundane things
translation: 让贵族运行这些世俗的东西

original: The Turkish occupation of central Hungary remained a volatile issue, for every Hungarian resented the Habsburgs' policy of leaving the Turks unmolested while pursuing ambitious objectives in the west. Emperor Leopold sent a force against the Turks - but, although the Austrian general Raimondo Montecuccoli defeated the Turks at Szentgotthárd on Aug. 1, 1664, the subsequent Peace of Vasvár recognized all the sultan's gains. After that even the highest magnates of Royal Hungary plotted to expel the Habsburgs with Turkish and French help.
translation: 土耳其对匈牙利中部的占领导致一系列问题，匈牙利对哈布斯堡王朝无视土耳其人威胁而对西部雄心勃勃的政策十分反感.皇帝利奥波德曾派出一直部队对抗土耳其人.但是，尽管1664年的8月1日.奥国将军雷蒙·蒙泰库科利在赛特古特哈德击败土耳其人，但后来的沃什瓦尔和平协议承认了苏丹的所有利益.在那之后，即使是匈牙利的皇室成员也在密谋获得土耳其和法国的帮助，驱逐哈布斯堡家族
从我们的首都集中管理

original: The Insurrection of Duke Imre Thököly

A young Transylvanian, Imre Thököly, led a revolt that forced Leopold in 1681 to restore the constitution and revoke many of his harshest measures. Encouraged by Thököly's successes against the empire, the Ottoman Empire sent into Hungary a vast army that in 1683 reached the walls of Vienna.
translation: 一名年轻的特兰西瓦尼亚人，伊姆雷·托库里率领起义迫使利奥波德在1681年恢复宪法，并撤销他的许多严措施.在托库里的鼓舞下，奥斯曼帝国派出了一只强大的军队，于1683年抵达维也纳的城墙外

original: Maria Theresa determined from the outset of her reign that the Habsburg monarchy would never again be perceived as too weak to defend itself. Consequently, even while the war was under way she had been studying reforms, and when it ended she immediately began implementing them. First and foremost was the reform of the army. Maria Theresa realized, however, that no military reform would be effective without financial reform and in this area, advised by the brilliant Friedrich Wilhelm, Count von Haugwitz, she achieved her perhaps greatest accomplishments. Following the military and financial reforms other changes came, generally in administrative matters. Although these reforms were subjected too many modifications and changes throughout Maria Theresa's reign and after, the result was a government far more centralized than it had ever been before.
translation: 玛丽亚·特里萨希望哈布斯堡王朝将永远不会被看做一个弱小的不能保护自己的国家.因此，即使在战争中，她也在一直研究改革.一到战争结束，她就立刻开始实施.首先是军队改革，玛丽亚特里萨意识到，必须有财政改革，军事改革才可能实施.在明智的豪格维兹伯爵弗里德里希·威廉的建议下，她实现了她最伟大的成就.随着军事和财政改革后，政治改革也开始.在其统治期间，改革有所修改和波折，但其结果是政府比以往任何时候都更为集中

original: Reforms to centralize and strengthen the state.
translation: 集中和加强国家的改革。

original: Joseph II was a controversial ruler. He began his reign with liberal reforms like the Edict of Toleration, which gave Lutherans, Calvinists, and Orthodox near equality with Roman Catholics. He also abolished serfdom and (temporarily) eased up on official censorship. However, Joseph was also an extreme centralist. In 1784 he informed the Hungarian government that its official language, Latin, was really not effective for modern government and would be changed to German. To add to their horror, Joseph refused to submit to a coronation in Hungary lest he have to swear to uphold laws that he did not wish to, and then he had the sacred crown of the kingdom moved to Vienna. In March 1787 Joseph swept away the constitution of the Austrian Netherlands and announced that from then on it would be ruled according to absolutist principles. Resistance simmered in the Austrian Netherlands until 1789 when it boiled over into open revolt. By that time there also were rumors of rebellion in Hungary and in Galicia, and for a time it appeared as if revolution might erupt in many parts of the monarchy.
translation: 约瑟夫二世是一个有争议的统治者.他颁布了宽容敕令，这给路德，加尔文主义者，罗马天主教徒和东正教平等与自由的权利.他还废除了农奴制，（暂时）停止了官方审查.然而，约瑟夫是一个极端的中央集权主义者.在1784年，他告知匈牙利政府，其官方语言拉丁语对现代政府不方便，将其改为德国.为了恐吓他们，约瑟夫拒绝在匈牙利加冕免得他必须宣誓拥护法律，从此，神圣王冠移居维也纳.在1787年3月，约瑟夫将奥属荷兰宪法扫进垃圾桶，并宣布，从此以后，他会按专职宪法统治此处.此后，奥属荷兰反抗不断，直到1789年爆发公开叛乱.当时，也有谣言说匈牙利和加利西亚发生叛乱，一时间，似乎所有君主制的土地都会爆发革命.

original: The Privilegium Maius document was forged in the 1350s by Duke Rudolf IV of Austria. It declared Austria an 'archduchy' with similar rights to those of the Electors. The document was heavily based on the earlier Privilegium Minus which had elevated Austria from a march to a duchy in 1156. The Privilegium Maius was, however, not officially confirmed until Frederick V of Austria was elected Holy Roman Emperor in 1452, after which he could confirm it himself.
translation: 奥地利公爵鲁道夫四世于1350年伪造了特权文件.它宣布奥地利为“大公”，并拥有选帝侯的权利.此文件主要基于1156年将奥地利提升为公国的伪造文书.然而，文件直到1452年才被承认，主要原因是奥地利弗雷德里克五世当选神罗皇帝，他自己给自己承认的

original: This is important for our Prestige

translation: 如果这既是他们希望的战争……

original: The Golden Roof was a three-story balcony that was added to the Neuhof building in central Innsbruck by Emperor Maximilian of Habsburg at the turn of the 16th century. The roof of the balcony was decorated with 2657 fire-gilded copper tiles and was built in honor of Maximilian's second marriage to Bianca Sforza of Milan, but also to symbolize his wealth and power.
translation: 金色屋顶是一个三层楼的房屋，位于因斯布鲁克的城中心.16世纪初由哈布斯堡皇帝马克西米连建造.房屋上装饰有2657片火镀金铜瓦，主要是纪念马克西米连与米兰的比安卡·斯福尔扎的第二次婚姻，也象征他的财富和权力.

original: This will show the glory of our dynasty
translation: 这将显示我们的王朝的荣耀

original: In 1512 emperor Maximilian commissioned a woodcut print called the Triumphal Procession which was to reflect magnificence of the Emperor. It was designed to decorate the walls of city halls and palaces. When Maximilian died in 1519 the woodcut was still unfinished. With more than 130 wood blocks and measuring over fifty meters, it is one of the world's largest prints ever produced.
translation: 1512年皇帝马克西米委托木工雕刻反映皇帝凯旋场景的木雕版画.版画被用来装饰城镇大厅和宫殿.在1519年皇帝去世之时，木刻仍未完成.整个木刻用了超过130个木块，长度超过50米，是有史以来最大的版画

original: The Triumphal Procession is a woodcut print which measures over fifty meters and reflect the magnificence of the Emperor.
translation: 《凯旋仪式》是一个木刻版画，长度超过50米，反映了帝国的辉煌

original: The nobility of Styria rose against Emperor Frederick III in 1467. Supported by the King of Hungary, Matthias Corvinus, the rebels attacked the city of Marburg and later threatened the Styrian capital of Graz. The revolt ended in 1471 after the leader of the rebellion, Andreas Baumkircher, was arrested and executed.
translation: 贵族反对皇帝腓特烈三世的起义在1467年爆发.在匈牙利国王马蒂亚斯·科维努斯的支持下，反叛分子袭击了马尔堡市，随后威胁施泰尔马克首府格拉茨.叛乱结束于1471年，起义军领袖安德里斯·包姆克彻被逮捕和处决

original: On November 7, 1492, a meteorite weighing 127 kilograms fell in a field outside the town of Ensisheim in Alsace, Further Austria. When villagers tried to remove parts of the meteorite, a local magistrate interfered in order to preserve it for Maximilian, the future Emperor. He declared it to be a wonder of God, and after removing two small pieces for himself and Archduke Sigismund of Austria, he returned the meteorite to the city to be preserved in the parish church.
translation: 1492年11月7日，重达127公斤的陨石坠落在阿尔萨斯的昂西塞姆的一座小镇外，当时属于奥地利领土.当村民试图毁坏部分陨石时，当地官员介入并保护了他，未来的皇帝马克西米连宣称这是神的奇迹.自己与奥地利大公西吉斯蒙德取出两小块后，他将陨石送往教区教堂保存

original: The powerful House of Habsburg has been around since the 12th century and came to rule Austria in 1278 when Emperor Rudolph I became the duchy's sovereign ruler. The dynasty was presumed to have died out but it now seems that there still exists a member, although their claim to the throne is considered weak. Since [Root.Monarch.GetName] currently lacks an heir, should we perhaps acknowledge this Habsburg as a legitimate heir?
translation: 强大的哈布斯堡家族自12世纪来到了奥地利，并在皇帝鲁道夫一世之时成为了大公国的最高统治者.现在王朝被推定死亡，尽管家族成员仍然存在，但是他们对皇位的宣称十分孱弱.由于[Root.Monarch.GetName]目前缺乏继承人，也许我们应该承认哈布斯堡王朝为合法继承人？

original: The House of Habsburg dynasty must return!
translation: 哈布斯堡家族必须返回

original: Ludwig van Beethoven was a universal genius widely regarded as the greatest composer who ever lived. He dominated a period of musical history as no one else before or since. Rooted in the Classical traditions of Haydn and Mozart his art reaches out to encompass the new spirit of humanism expressed in the works of Goethe and Schiller, his elder contemporaries in the world of literature, and above all in the ideals of the French Revolution with its passionate concern for the freedom and dignity of the individual.
translation: 贝多芬被认为是是有史以来最伟大的天才作曲家之一.他与海顿，莫扎特一起主宰着音乐史，这前无古人，后无来者的.他的乐曲中包含了歌德和席勒作品中含有的新人文主义精神，古典传统和法国大革命的理想，以及植根于个人的自由和尊严的热情关注
沃尔夫冈·阿马德乌斯·莫扎特

original: Mozart is widely recognized as one of the greatest composers in the history of Western music. With Haydn and Beethoven he brought to its height the achievement of the Viennese Classical school. Unlike any other composer in musical history he wrote in all the musical genres of his day and excelled in all of them. His taste, his command of form and his range of expression entitle him to be considered the most universal of all composers.
translation: 莫扎特被认为是西方音乐史中最伟大的作曲家之一.和海顿，贝多芬一起成为了维也纳古典音乐学派的最高成就.与其他音乐史中的作曲家不同，他的作品覆盖了所有的音乐流派，而且都在其中出类拔萃.他的品味，他指挥的形式和他音乐表达的广度，都成为后来音乐家模仿的对象

original: The incorporation of Prussia into Brandenburg

After inheriting and ruling the Prussian duchy for a few generations the Hohenzollern officially incorporated the area into Brandenburg. However the area was still formally in a state of vassalage under the Polish king and treading easily was advisable. Angering the Polish king could lead to war, but the savings for not having to pay taxes to Poland would be substantial.
translation: 经过霍亨索伦几代人统治，普鲁士公国正式纳入到勃兰登堡国土内。但是，该地区名义上仍然是波兰王国的附庸。如今小心行事可能更为明智，因为激怒波兰国王可能会导致战争，但这样也能省下一笔巨额税款。

original: The Elector Friedrich Wilhelm (1640-1688), known as the Great Elector, had been one of the major winners of the Thirty Years War, increasing the size of his Prussian realm by nearly a third. His major achievement was to achieve the administrative unity and the setting up of a small professional army of 24,000 men. He also managed to get his country free of Polish lordship over Prussia, and to welcome 20,000 French Protestant refugees. On 28th June 1675, his army fought a tactical stalemate with the Swedes at the battle of Fehrbellin. The Swedes were unable to go on the offensive due to poor preparations, and thus lost the war. That Sweden was unable to carry the sword of Gustavus Adolphus had a striking resonance all over Europe and Prussia occupied Swedish Pomerania until 1679.
translation: 选帝侯腓特烈·威廉（1640年至1688年）被称为伟大的选帝侯，是三十年战争的大赢家之一，他的普鲁士王国的大小增加了近三分之一.他的主要成就是实现管理的统一并建立了一支人数近两万四千人的小型部队.他还设法让他的普鲁士脱离波兰，成为主权国家，还收纳了两万名法国新教徒难民.1675年6月28日，他的军队与瑞典人在费尔赫林之战中陷入了战术僵局.瑞典人无法继续进攻，而由于补给缺乏而战败.而在1679年，瑞典曾经震惊全欧，占领普鲁士波美拉尼亚的古斯塔夫之剑折断
普鲁士的非洲贸易公司

original: As all major nations of this period, Friedrich Wilhelm also tried to duplicate the enormous success of the Dutch Veerinigte Oostindische Companie and tap into the richness it brought its investors and the Dutch economy from 'The New World'. However as most other duplication attempts, especially by countries with little tradition of Naval Power, it would ultimately fail to deliver anything but grief to its investors.
translation: 作为此期间的所有主要国家，腓特烈·威廉也试图复制取得的巨大成功的荷兰东印度公司，想在荷兰带来新世界的财富中分一杯羹.然而，大多数尝试过的国家，尤其是海军力量不强的国家，最终获得的是悲痛
我们将会开发这里的贸易！

original: Kant was the foremost thinker of the Enlightenment and one of the greatest philosophers of all time. In him were subsumed new trends that had begun with the Rationalism (stressing reason) of Rene Descartes and the Empiricism (stressing experience) of Francis Bacon. He thus inaugurated a new era in the development of philosophical thought.
translation: 康德是最重要的启蒙思想家和整个时代最伟大的哲学家之一.他的理论融合了当时最新的笛卡尔理性主义（强调原因）和培根的经验主义（强调体验）.他的哲学思想开创一个新的时代.
腓特烈·威廉的专制主义

original: King Frederick William of Prussia endowed the Prussian state with its military and bureaucratic character. He was fanatically addicted to work and a firm autocrat. Frederick William reorganized the administrative system, raised the army to 80,000 men (equivalent to 4 percent of the population) and geared the whole organization of the state to the military machine. Prussia thus became a militaristic and absolutist state - the new great power of Northern Europe.
translation: 普鲁士国王腓特烈·威廉建立了普鲁士军事和官僚体系。他狂热地沉迷于工作，也是坚定的独裁主义者。腓特烈·威廉重组行政体制，将军队增加到了80000人（相当于4％的人口），把国家改造成了军事机器。此后，普鲁士成为一个军国主义和专制主义国家——北欧新生的伟大力量。
伟大的普鲁士军事改革

original: Under its 2nd and 3rd Kings, Frederick William I and Frederick II (the Great), Prussia became a thoroughly militaristic state boasting the most efficient army in Europe. Without a doubt the great military reforms were an absolute necessity for an expansionist country so precariously positioned between vengeful neighbors.
translation: 在其第二和第三位国王腓特烈·威廉一世和腓特烈二世（腓特烈大帝），普鲁士成为一个彻底的军国主义国家，拥有全欧洲最强大的军队.毫无疑问，伟大的军事改革是一个扩张主义的国家在强邻之间的必要措施

original: The Enlightened Reforms of Frederick the Great
translation: 腓特烈大帝的开明改革

original: After the end of the reign of Louis XIV in France and the following wars of the Spanish succession, the age of enlightenment slowly began to spread all over Europe by the words of writers and philosophers of the time such as Locke, Rousseau, Diderot, Hume, Leibniz and Montesquieu. The New Ideals included religious freedom, education, freedom of speech and political opinion. The monumental work that captured the essence of the enlightenment was Diderot's Encyclopedie, taking 25 years for its completion and in the end totaling a collection of no less then 35 volumes of 1000 pages each describing everything from how to knit a sock to methods of improving the manufacturing of artillery pieces. Of the monarchs of Europe none was a stronger believer of these ideas than the Prussian King, Friedrich II, also known as Frederick the Great.
translation: 法国路易十四统治的终结和西班牙王位继承战争结束后，启蒙时代开始慢慢地遍布欧洲，代表作家和哲学家有洛克，休谟，卢梭，狄德罗，莱布尼茨和孟德斯鸠.新的理想包括宗教自由，教育，言论和政治观点的自由.收录启蒙运动的精髓是狄德罗的《百科全书》，他花了25年完成了超过35卷，多达1000页的记录，里面描述了小到如何编织一个袜子，大刀改善制造火炮配件的方法的一切知识.腓特烈二世，也就是如今常说的腓特烈大帝，是该思潮的铁杆崇拜者.

original: Von Scharnhorst's and Von Stein's Reforms
translation: 冯·沙恩霍斯特和冯·斯坦的改革

original: After the humiliating defeat against Napoleon's armies and the harsh terms that followed in the peace, the need for drastic measures for Prussia to regain its former military and economic strength was obvious. A wide range of reforms implemented led to the abolishment of serfdom, privileges being revoked and an efficient decentralized government as well as compulsory military service. However this was not a sure thing as different segments of society wanted different types of reforms. It could have been quite differently.
translation: 被拿破仑近乎羞辱性的击败之后，普鲁士需要毅然改革，重拾昔日的军事和经济实力.改革包括大范围废除农奴制，取消贵族特权，权利下放以及义务兵役制.然而，没有事情是一帆风顺的，因为不同的社会阶层需要不同类型的改革.

original: Frederick II's desire and determination to build a residence on the island of Spree was met with Unwille (indignation) by the citizens of Berlin and in 1448 the indignation against the cession of the city's lands for an electoral stronghold culminated in open revolt. The citizens of Berlin flooded the excavation of the residence Stadtschloss but Frederick II prevailed and the palace was finally built, the city's rights decisively curtailed.
translation: 腓特烈二世决定在施普雷岛建造居所的想法惹怒了柏林市民，而1448年由于割让领土以获得选票的做法激起了公开的叛乱.柏林市民团团包围了宫殿，但腓特烈二世拒绝妥协，宫殿最终建成，城市权利受到了极大的削减

original: Joachim II Hector was compelled by his father, Joachim I Nestor, to sign an inheritance contract in which he promised to remain Roman Catholic. Joachim Nestor had co-financed his younger brother's, the Archbishop-Elector Albert of Mainz, elevation to the episcopal see of Halberstadt and accumulation of the sees of Magdeburg and Mainz by incurring huge debts with the banking house of Fugger in order to pay the Holy See. To pay off the debts, Joachim Nestor agreed to recover these costs from the population of his electorate by permitting the sale of indulgences.
translation: 赫克托·约阿希姆二世受其父亲，内斯特·约阿希姆一世的胁迫，签署继承协议，承诺他虔信罗马天主教.约阿希姆·内斯特曾和其弟，美因茨大主教出资参与选举，并欠了马格德堡，美因茨巨额债务以偿付“圣见”.为了还清债务，约阿希姆·内斯特同意向人民出售赎罪券弥补财产不足

original: Albert of Prussia, the last Grand Master of the Teutonic Knights, erected an academic gymnasium in 1542 on a piece of land behind Königsberg Cathedral on the Kneiphof island of the Pregel River from the Samland chapter. The University of Königsberg was inaugurated on August 17, 1544, after Albert of Prussia had issued the deed of foundation of the Collegium Albertinum on 20 July 1544. The University of Königsberg's first rector was the poet Georg Sabinus, son-in-law of Philipp Melanchthon and the two Lithuanian scholars Stanislovas Rapalionis and Abraomas Kulvietis were among the first professors of the university.
translation: 普鲁士主教，条顿骑士团最后的大图按照于1542年在柯尼斯堡修道院的尼佛岛上建立了一所学术机构.在普鲁士主教与1544年7月20日签署主教协议之后，1544年8月17日柯尼斯堡大学开办.柯尼斯堡大学的第一任成员为诗人乔治·萨宾派，女婿菲利普梅兰希和两位立陶宛学者斯坦尼斯洛瓦斯·拉普利尼斯和阿布拉马斯·库维提斯

original: Joachim II Hector, Elector of Brandenburg, died in 1571, leaving his son John George of Brandenburg deep in debt. John George instituted the Grain Tax to deal with the debts but it drove part of the peasantry into dependence on the nobility that was exempt from taxation.
translation: 勃兰登堡选帝侯约阿希姆·赫克托二世于1571年去世，留下他儿子勃兰登堡的约翰·乔治的是高筑的债台.约翰·乔治制定了粮食税以解决债务，但最终导致农民投奔他们的贵族以免除税收.

original: While seeking a cure for his ailing wife, Elector John George of Brandenburg met Leonhard Thurneysser, a metallurgist and pharmaceutical doctor, who successfully cured his wife from her ailment. Grateful, the Elector appointed Thurneysser his personal doctor and took him to Berlin at a salary of 1352 Taler. The former Franciscan monastery was made available to Thurneysser and he led the construction of a glass studio at Grimnitz Castle. Thurneysser had served the Medical Professor John Huber as Famulus, helped to gather and prepare herbs and medicines. While he worked with Huber, Thurneysser had access to the writings of Paracelsus, which impressed him deeply. Thurneysser sold medicine of his own creation, astrological calendars, horoscopes and talismans for protection against evil and became very wealthy. His print shop produced writings in various scripts, including German, Latin, Greek, Hebrew and Arabic.
translation: 为了给生病的妻子寻求治疗方法，勃兰登堡选帝侯特约翰·乔治会见了莱昂哈德特恩内瑟尔，冶金学家及医生.他成功的治好了病.为了表示感谢，选帝侯任命特恩内瑟尔为他的私人御医，并给与丰厚的薪水.特恩内瑟尔领导建设了哥梅内兹的玻璃工作室.特恩内瑟尔曾担任医学教授约翰·胡伯的学徒，帮助收集和准备药材和药品.在和胡伯一同工作期间，特恩内瑟尔阅读了帕拉塞尔苏斯的著作，这给他留下深刻印象.特恩内瑟尔出售自己制作的药品，还有占星历法，占星术和免遭邪恶侵害的符咒，这让他变得非常富有.他的印刷厂印刷了大量包括德语，拉丁语，希腊语，希伯来语和阿拉伯语的著作.

original: The astronomer Erasmus Reinhold was supported and financed by Albert I, Duke of Prussia, who also financed the printing of the Prutenic Tables. They were also called the Prussian Tables and were an ephemeris or astronomical tables. The astronomical tables were calculated by Reinhold and based on Nicolaus Copernicus' 'De revolutionibus orbium coelestium', the epochal exposition of Copernican heliocentrism published in 1543. Reinhold intended to replace the Alfonsine Tables with his Prutenic Tables and added redundant tables to his new tables so that compilers of almanacs familiar with the older Alfonsine Tables could perform all the steps in an analogous manner.
translation: 天文学家伊拉斯谟·莱因霍尔德获得了普鲁士公爵阿尔贝一世的支持和资助，制作了普鲁士表，又称星历表或天文表.莱因霍尔德的天文表和计算都是基础上哥白尼发表于1543年《天体运行论》中具有划时代意义的论述，也就是哥白尼的日心说.莱因霍尔德旨在用自己的普鲁士表取代阿方索表，他还制作了许多新表用于两个表中的替换工作
涅沙瓦特权 - 特别会议

original: After the concessions to the Nobility in 1425 and during the Thirteen Years War Kazimierz IV was again forced to new concessions. To be able to raise troops, among them a lot of mercenaries, the King needed money from the Szlachta. In an effort to solve the monarchy's pressing problems he had to accept the Nieszawa Privileges implying that the Nobility had the right to hold local Conventiones Particulares, without which no troops could be raised and no taxes extracted. In this way the Nobility got an efficient and powerful organization with a joint mutual interest, and power of the military and the taxation legislative procedure.
translation: 在1425年和13年战争期间对贵族们做出让步之后，卡齐米日四世不得不再次面临新的让步。为了能够筹集军队，其中包括许多雇佣军，国王需要什拉赫塔（贵族）的经济援助，为了解决君主制最为紧迫的问题，他不得不接受涅沙瓦特权，这意味着贵族有权保留在地方上的特定代表权，没有这些，将很难筹集到军队，也很难征收到税款。通过这种方式，贵族们获得共同利益，一个保障军队和税收的高效而强大的组织也能通过立法确立起来。

original: Due to lack of funds and due to an unstable political situation our predecessors have seen fit to first pawn and then sell the lands of Neumark to the Teutonic order. The area was once claimed by settlers from Brandenburg, however, and the burghers of the province claim the Order is neglecting them.\nThe Teutons have already tried to pawn Neumark to the Polish King but the Burghers of Neumark have rejected that solution. As long as order is duly compensated we have every reason to believe the Grand Master would accept if we offered to re-purchase the province.
translation: 由于资金的匮乏和政治局势的动荡，我们的先辈们觉得把诺伊马尔克的土地作为抵押、而后将其卖给条顿骑士团的生意很合宜。不过，来自勃兰登堡的移民曾经宣称过对这里的所有权，而当地的市民也声称骑士团完全不管他们。\n条顿骑士团已经准备将诺伊马尔克抵押给波兰国王，但诺伊马尔克的市民阶层却反对这一决议。只要骑士团得到充分的补偿，我们有充分的理由相信大团长会接受我们回购该省份的提议。

original: Make the Grandmaster a generous offer.
translation: 给大团长开一个慷慨的价格。
§R支付100§!¤ 用以赎回省份§Y诺伊马尔克§!。

original: We will not get another opportunity to acquire Neumark diplomatically.
translation: 我们再也没有通过外交手段收回诺伊马尔克的机会了。

original: While originally part of Brandenburg, the Margraves have in the past first pawned and then transferred Neumark to us in order to raise money. Distant and plagued by robber barons the province has generally been more trouble than it was worth for our order.\nWe have received an offer to pawn the province back to Brandenburg. Should we accept it seems unlikely that we will ever get Neumark back, still the Elector is willing to pay good money for it and we could certainly make good use of those funds.
translation: 诺伊马尔克虽然原为勃兰登堡的一部分，但过去的边境伯爵为了筹集资金，先将其作为抵押，而后干脆将这片土地卖给了我们。距离遥远并时常受到强盗贵族的侵扰，这片土地带来的麻烦可比它在我们统治下能提供的价值高多了。\n我们已经收到了勃兰登堡赎回诺伊马尔克的提议。我们是否应该接受？一旦接受提议，我们似乎不太可能重新收回诺伊马尔克；而选帝侯则愿意为此支付大笔赎金，我们当然也能够好好利用这笔资金。

original: Neumark shall remain ours until the end of days.
translation: 诺伊马尔克永远都是我们的。

original: Brandenburg will not make another offer for Neumark.
translation: 勃兰登堡不会再提议赎回诺伊马尔克了。

original: The Grandmaster has accepted our offer and will transfer Neumark to our control in return for a lump sum of money. Neumark will once again be united with Brandenburg.
translation: 大团长已经接受了我们的提议，将把诺伊马尔克归还我们以换取一大笔资金。诺伊马尔克将重新成为勃兰登堡的一部分。

original: The Grandmaster of the Teutonic Order has declined our request to acquire Neumark. If we want to regain the province we will have to fight for it.
translation: 条顿骑士团团长拒绝了我们想要赎回诺伊马尔克的请求。如果我们想要重新得到它必须要以武力征服。
霍亨索伦王朝治下的勃兰登堡

original: When the Hohenzollerns acquired the March of Brandenburg in 1411 the state had a long history of being very loosely governed under Wittelsbach and Luxembourg overlords. Local nobility, clergy and the city councils have grown used to being left to their own devices. Robber barons and lawlessness are prevalent in many parts of the realm.\n\nOur dynasty has had some success in curtailing the power of the Nobility and the Burghers, often turning their strongholds into rubble in the process. We are, however, still far from the undisputed masters of these lands. Recently even the clergy, common in all parts of our administration, seem to be working against us. If we are to avoid becoming just another temporary dynasty in this region we must strongly assert our authority and build a government apparatus that we can trust.
translation: 当霍亨索伦王朝在1411年取得了勃兰登堡藩侯的地位时，勃兰登堡已在维特尔斯巴赫王朝与卢森堡王朝君主的粗放式统治下度过了长久的年岁。当地的贵族、神职人员和市政议会已经习惯于自行其是，强盗贵族与不法行为在这个国家的许多地方普遍存在。\n\n我们的王朝在剪除贵族与市民的势力方面取得了一些成功，经常在行动中将他们的要塞化为瓦砾。然而我们仍然远远不是这片土地上无可质疑的主人。最近，甚至连在我们行政机构中随处可见的神职人员似乎都在对付我们。如果我们想要避免成为这个地区的另一个短命王朝，我们必须坚决维护我们的权威并建立一个可以信任的政府机构。

original: We must build our own government institutions!
translation: 我们必须建立我们自己的政府机构！

original: Instead of relying too much on the clergy [Root.Monarch.GetName] will create his own chancellery of secular officials of proven loyalty. This will strengthen our government in the long run at a cost.
translation: 为避免过于依赖神职人员，[Root.Monarch.GetName]将创立他自己的行政官署，并充实以确信忠诚的世俗官员。从长远来看这将加强我们的政府，但却是有代价的。

original: Through bribery and nepotism we can ensure loyalty to the state.
translation: 通过贿赂与裙带关系，我们可以确保对国家的忠诚。

original: The twin cities of Berlin-Cölln have long served efficiently as the capital of the state of Brandenburg. The swampy and forested lands beneath and around the city is holding its growth back, as is the generally low population of the Brandenburger lands. As a state with ambitions we must overcome these problems as an ever-growing bureaucracy and court demands a larger and statelier royal residence.\nIf the city is to grow we must embark on a series of renovations, from greatly expanding the surrounding fortifications, to draining the swamps and planning new, efficient, suburbs outside the current limits of the city. This must be accompanied by a renovation of our royal residence to create a more fittingly impressive place of audience for foreign and internal dignitaries wishing to confer with our [Root.Monarch.GetTitle]s.
translation: 柏林-科隆双子城长年以来一直都有效发挥了作为勃兰登堡国都的作用。由于勃兰登堡地区的人口较少，在城市周围与下方的沼泽与林地正在逐渐恢复。作为一个雄心勃勃的国家，我们必须克服这些问题，而日益膨胀的官僚系统和宫廷也需要一座更大更宏伟的王宫。\n如果想要城市成长，我们就必须着手进行一系列的整修工作，包括极力扩建周边的防御工事，排干沼泽并规划新的、高效率的城市并在城区范围外规划郊区。必须与这些工作一同进行的还有对王宫的翻新，我们要为希望与[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]进行商谈的国内外要人提供一个更适宜、也更加令人印象深刻的会见地点。

original: Berlin will suffer reduced tax income until the renovations of the city are complete.
translation: 在城市改造完成之前，柏林的税收将会减少。

original: Why spend money on such superficial matters?
translation: 为什么要把钱花在这种表面功夫上？

original: Our extensive renovations of the twin cities of Berlin and Cölln have finally paid off. Swamps have been drained, fortifications built and a number of new well-connected suburbs have grown up around the city to house our administrators, court functionaries and the local industry needed to supply the luxury goods they require. So much has our city grown that it is no longer useful to speak of the cities of Berlin and Cölln, they have now merged to one which we will simply call Berlin.\nMost impressive of all, however, are the palaces, churches, roads, bridges and gardens in and around our new capital. In a properly grand setting such as the Albastersaal visitors can now marvel at the glorious [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] family ancestry in the form of statues of our ancestors along with the major emperors of the Roman Empire.
translation: 我们对双子城柏林和科隆的大规模翻新终于完工了。沼泽被排干，防御工事修筑完毕，城市周边还建成了很多精心规划的近郊城区来安置我们的行政人员和宫廷雇员，并就地配置工场来生产满足这些人所需的奢侈品。我们的城市经历了如此之大的成长以至于不能再用柏林市与科隆市这样的说法来描述，现在它们合而为一，我们可以简单地称之为柏林。\n不过最令人印象深刻的还是我们的新首都及其周边区域的宫殿、教堂、道路、桥梁与花园。在像雪花殿这样宏伟又符合威仪的地方，宾客们会观赏到我们的祖先与罗马帝国主要的皇帝们的雕塑，赞叹于[Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]家族世系的荣耀。

original: Truly we have built a proper temple to the fame of the [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]s!
translation: 我们建成了一座真正与[Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]之盛名相匹的殿堂！
法兰克尼亚系霍亨索伦家族

original: At the death of Friedrich I of Brandenburg the Hohenzollern lands were split between his sons.\nWith the rule of Friedrich II over Brandenburg coming to an end the title has passed to his brother, Albrecht Achilles. Since Albrecht is already the ruler of Brandenburg-Ansbach in Franconia he will now be ruler of both Brandenburg and Ansbach. The Hohenzollern lands are now once again united.
translation: 在勃兰登堡藩侯腓特烈一世去世后，霍亨索伦家族的土地为他的儿子们所瓜分。\n随着腓特烈二世在勃兰登堡的统治结束，他的头衔传给了他的兄弟“阿喀琉斯”阿尔布雷希特。由于阿尔布雷希特已经是在法兰克尼亚的勃兰登堡-安斯巴赫的统治者，他现在将统治勃兰登堡和安斯巴赫两地。霍亨索伦的领地现在又一次联合起来了。

original: And so the lands of our family are reunited!
translation: 如此一来我们家族的领地便再次一统了！

original: Ansbach will become the §Rjunior partner§! in a union with Brandenburg.
translation: 安斯巴赫将成为勃兰登堡的§R被联统国§!。

original: Albrecht must leave the throne to another member of the Family.
translation: 阿尔布雷希特必须把爵位让给另一位家族成员。

original: The Hohenzollern lands are now all in the hands of [Root.Monarch.GetName] but worried minds fear that they may be split and be divided once again in the future. Indeed the March of Brandenburg itself might be split among an overabundance of sons. It is clear that once strong lands such as Saxony or Thuringia have suffered hard from being parceled out to the many heirs of the principal title holders, something [Root.Monarch.GetName] would rather avoid. Indeed even at the Imperial court we have received worried warnings that we have not sufficiently protected our succession. An Electorate is expected to be indivisible.\n\nIf we are to protect the Brandenburg Electorate forever, however, we might well have to let go of the Franconian holdings of our dynasty in Ansbach to our younger sons.
translation: 如今霍亨索伦家族的土地都尽在[Root.Monarch.GetName]的手中，但是有忧虑者担心在未来它们可能会再次分裂。实际上勃兰登堡藩侯国本身确实可能会由于子嗣过多而分裂。众所周知，即使强极一时的萨克森与图林根也曾由于把国土均分给数目众多的继承人而吃尽苦头，这正是[Root.Monarch.GetName]试图避免的。甚至就连帝国朝廷也忧心忡忡地警告我们没有在确保顺利继承方面足够尽力。一个选侯国始终不应分裂。\n\n如果我们想永远保住勃兰登堡选侯国，我们就不得不放弃家族在安斯巴赫的法兰克尼亚诸领地，分予幼子们。

original: The lands of Brandenburg are now all in the hands of [Root.Monarch.GetName] but worried minds fear that the March of Brandenburg might be split among an overabundance of sons. It is clear that once strong lands such as Saxony or Thuringia have suffered hard from being parceled out to the many heirs of the principal title holders, something [Root.Monarch.GetName] would rather avoid. Indeed even at the Imperial court we have received worried warnings that we have not sufficiently protected our succession. An Electorate is expected to be indivisible.
translation: 如今霍亨索伦家族的土地都尽在[Root.Monarch.GetName]的手中，但是有忧虑者担心在未来勃兰登堡藩侯国会因子嗣众多而走向分裂。众所周知，即使强极一时的萨克森与图林根也曾由于把国土均分给数目众多的继承人而吃尽苦头，这正是[Root.Monarch.GetName]试图避免的。甚至就连帝国朝廷也忧心忡忡地警告我们没有在确保顺利继承上足够尽力。一个选侯国始终不应分裂。

original: §RAnsbach will no longer be ruled from Brandenburg.§!
translation: §R安斯巴赫将不再由勃兰登堡联统。§!

original: This is only a problem in families that don't stick together.
translation: 这只是一个不再铁板一块的家族的问题。

original: A man of Law and Integrity

A state like ours has an insatiable hunger for good administrators, jurists and scholars. The legal system in particular needs to not only be maintained but also at times reformed, expanded or repurposed. In times such as those it is great to have access to men of talent. In Samuel von Cocceji we believe that we have sound such a man. Active as a professor of law and a judge since his early 20s von Cocceji has the integrity and character to stand up to anyone, [Root.Monarch.GetName] included, for a strong, fair and righteous legal apparatus.
translation: 像我们这样的国家对优秀的管理者、法学家和学者有着无尽的渴求。法律体系不仅需要维护，还需不时进行改良、扩充或变更。在这样的时代，最好的事就是拥有资质出众的人才。我们相信萨缪尔·冯·柯克采伊就是这种人材。自弱冠以来，作为法学教授和法官而活跃的冯·柯克采伊拥有正直的品格，敢于为一个强大、公平、正义的法律机构而直面包括[Root.Monarch.GetName]在内的任何人。

original: As our [Root.GovernmentName] has expanded and aged the complexity and extent of overlapping and often inconsistent legal practices has grown out of all control. Legal cases are decided by local, often privately employed, judges according to rules that differ so much from case to case that it is impossible to guarantee any form of legal certainty. Some courts are rendered impotent by a maze of feudal, imperial and traditional jurisdictions while others see judges make a fortune by corrupting the authority of our laws.\nNonetheless the education institutions of our state have produced a great number of legal minds and scholars. It is time we put them to use planning a new, uniform and consistent and well-regulated legal system for our state. Let us reform the [Root.GetAdjective] courts to ensure efficient handling of litigation, impartial judges paid for by the state and hired based on merit, a reduction of overlapping jurisdictions and a clear hierarchy of appeals.
translation: 随着我们的[Root.GovernmentName]不断扩大和老化，其复杂性及管辖范围的重叠，再加上常常前后矛盾的法律实践，已经大大超出了我们的控制。法律案件通常由地方私雇的法官根据不同个案中大相径庭的裁决结果而定，以至于无法确保任何形式的法律确定性。一些法院迷失在了由封建的、帝国的及传统的裁判权交织而成的迷宫中，而另一些则发现法官们通过腐坏我们法律的权威以牟利。\n不过，我们国家的教育机构已经培养了大量的法律人才与学者。是时候让他们为我们的国家制定一个新的、统一的、一致的、规范的法律体系了。我们要改革[Root.GetAdjective]的法院，以确保能对诉讼进行有效的处理，公正的法官从国家领取薪水并因功受命，从而减少司法辖区的重叠程度并明确上诉制度。
是的！以上帝的名义开始吧！

original: We have no time for legal Procedure and other formalities…
translation: 我们没有遵守法律程序与其他手续的时间了……

original: For over a century now Europe has seen the effects of the Reformation and Counter-Reformation. As religious borders begin to solidify many Protestants or Reformed subjects of Catholic rulers find themselves on the run. With the revocation of edicts of tolerance hundreds of thousands seek a new home.\nBrandenburg is not a densely populated region. If we were to offer these men and women refuge and pay for new homes and perhaps a tax exemption until they get stabilized we could undoubtedly harbor many of them.
translation: 一个多世纪以来，宗教改革和反宗教改革的影响已经在欧洲显现。随着宗教边界开始固化，天主教统治者的许多新教或改革宗臣民发现自己正不为国法所容。随着宽容法案的废止，成千上万的人们不得不前往寻找新家园。\n勃兰登堡并不是一个人口稠密的地区。如果我们为这些男女提供庇护并为他们提供新的家园——或许再加上豁免赋税直到他们稳定下来——我们将毫无疑问地收容他们中的大多数。

original: Let it be known that they can settle in Brandenburg!
translation: 让他们知道可以在勃兰登堡定居！

original: Relations with all §YCatholic§! rulers in Europe decreased by §R30§!.\nThis effect will dissipate over the next 30 years.
translation: 与欧洲所有§Y天主教§!统治者之间的关系减少§R30§!。\n该影响将在30年内消除。

original: We cannot afford to receive them.
translation: 我们无法承受接收他们的代价。

original: ‘Everything in war is very simple. But the simplest thing is difficult', [Root.Mil_Advisor.GetName] says solemnly during a council meeting. 'That is profound!', our [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] exclaims, to which our military advisor reddens and admits to having stolen the phrase from a philosophical young man who has been rising through the ranks of our army over the past few years. In addition to being an experienced commander, this person is apparently making something of a name for himself even in the higher circles of society. He is also described as spending a lot of his time contemplating and discussing the moral aspects of war – some say that given enough time he is likely to publish a book on the subject... Perhaps he could be of use to us?
translation: 「战争中的每件事都是很简单的。但是最简单的事情往往最麻烦」，[Root.Mil_Advisor.GetName]在议会中郑重其事地说道。这让我们的[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]非常意外：「说得太精辟了！」巨大的褒奖使我们的军事顾问面红耳赤，并承认自己是从一个近几年在军中地位急速上升的青年俊彦处拾取牙慧。这个青年不仅是一个身经百战的指挥官，也在上流社会中挣得了名望。据悉，他投入了很多精力对战争中的道义进行思考和研讨。有人说，要是时间足够，他完全有可能出一本这方面的书……也许，他有可能为我们所用？

original: He is clearly a man of great thought – make him our advisor.
translation: 他显然是一个胸藏韬略的人——让他成我们的顾问。

original: An experienced soldier? We want him in charge of our troops.
translation: 身经百战的军人？让他统领我们的军队。

original: We have enough philosophers in our realm.
translation: 我们国家的思想家已经够多了。

original: With all the reforms taking place in our great [Root.GovernmentName] these days there is bound to be some friction between the different ruling classes. The Burghers of Königsberg are currently particularly dissatisfied, strongly opposing the idea of only being allowed to convene their council at the leisure of [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] [Root.Monarch.GetName]. Led by an articulate and well supported alderman by the name of Hieronymus Roth the Burghers are now threatening to seek the aid of [some_neighbor_country.Monarch.GetTitle] [some_neighbor_country.Monarch.GetName] in [some_neighbor_country.Country.GetName], if we refuse to agree to their terms.
translation: 随着我们伟大的[Root.GovernmentName]一系列改革的逐步实行，不同统治阶层之间势必会产生摩擦。柯尼斯堡的市民阶层目前十分不满，他们强烈反对只在[Root.Monarch.GetTitle][Root.Monarch.GetName]闲暇时才允许他们召开议会。在口才极佳且深受欢迎的市议员希罗尼穆斯·罗斯的带领下，市民阶层现在威胁我们说，如若他们的请求遭到拒绝，将向[some_neighbor_country.Country.GetName][some_neighbor_country.Monarch.GetTitle][some_neighbor_country.Monarch.GetName]寻求帮助。

original: Let our regiments to deal with this.
translation: 让我们的军队处理此事。

original: We will have to make concessions.

Over the centuries [Root.GovernmentName] has seen its share of war. However, it has also begun to experience an increase in the enlightened pursuit of the finer things in life, such as philosophy, art and music. Evidence of this is for instance found in our very own [Root.Monarch.GetTitle], often entertaining [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] guests with music composed by [Root.Monarch.GetName] [Root.Monarch.GetHerselfHimself].\nHowever, something is missing from [Root.Monarch.GetTitle]'s life as [Root.Monarch.GetSheHe] spends [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] days in [Root.Capital.GetName], constantly surrounded by pomp and ceremony. A summer residence, sans souci, without a care, away from the busy city-life is what [Root.Monarch.GetName] desires and [Root.Monarch.GetSheHe] has already personally drawn up sketches for a modest one-story building, enveloped by a magnificent garden.
translation: 在过去几个世纪中，[Root.GovernmentName]一直处于战火中。然而，它也逐渐觉醒了对哲学、艺术和音乐这些生活中美好事物的渴望。最明确的例子就是，我们的[Root.Monarch.GetTitle][Root.Monarch.GetName]时常邀请[Root.Monarch.GetHerHis]客人们欣赏由[Root.Monarch.GetHerselfHimself]创作的音乐。\n然而，当[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]在充斥着各种仪式和庆典的[Root.Capital.GetName]享受生活时，[Root.Monarch.GetSheHe]总还是觉得少了点什么。一个避暑行辕，无忧宫，无忧无虑，远离忙碌的城市生活，正是[Root.Monarch.GetName]所渴求的，[Root.Monarch.GetSheHe]已经亲自为这个简约的单层建筑绘制了草图，并准备用一座华美的花园妆点它。

original: The [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] already has a home in [Root.Capital.GetName].

The [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] has been jubilant ever since construction of [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] summer palace was completed and [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] vision realized. Provided that [Root.Monarch.GetName] is not busy with war, this is where [Root.Monarch.GetSheHe] will spend [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] days from early May to the beginning of October, entertaining the brightest minds of our era, be it over political debate or philosophical discussion, to the delicate tones of the current popular music. The social elite of [Root.Country.GetName] are, and will remain, very impressed by the royal addition to [potsdam_province.GetName].
translation: 自从[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]夏宫竣工，心愿实现后，[Root.Monarch.GetSheHe]一直兴奋不已。如果不是[Root.Monarch.GetName]一直忙于战事，这将会是[Root.Monarch.GetSheHe]度过从五月初到十月初这段时间的行宫。无论是进行政治辩论还是哲学探讨，亦或是欣赏时下新潮音乐的精妙音律，我们这个时代最耀眼的天才大师们都将共聚此处同乐。[Root.Country.GetName]的社会精英，都将会被这个修建在[potsdam_province.GetName]的王宫所折服。

original: The visionary ruler who set out to build Sanssouci sadly never got to experience the finished palace. If they could see it now however, they would surely have enjoyed the many gatherings now taking place there. The great philosophers and artists of our age will often be invited to spend time at this sophisticated refuge and the magnificent gardens surrounding the palace are bound to stand as a beacon of enlightened pastime for centuries.
translation: 着手建立无忧宫的这位统治者很遗憾地没有能够看到宫殿的完工。假使他今天有幸得见，他一定会很享受在这个宫殿举行的各种盛大宴会。诸多我朝伟大的哲学家与艺术家经常被邀请到这个精致的世外桃源小聚，而这座宫殿外的华美庄园必将在未来几个世纪内引领新式娱乐的潮流。

original: The [Root.GetAdjective] estates have watched with increasing concern as we have increased the size of our standing army and the administration required to keep it running. Traditionally the landed nobles and the burghers of our cities are the guarantors of our finances and they are very suspicious of our intentions going forward.\nThis situation will need to be resolved quickly and efficiently. Let us offer the diet a deal they can accept wholesale or face the very armies they fret about!\nThe nobles can retain some of their privileges and even receive our help to force their peasants to remain enserfed in these times of change. In return nobles and cities must surrender their traditional functions of revenue collection the state. [Root.GetName] will run its own finances from now on!
translation: 对我国最近扩编常备部队和为供养军队而加强内政管理等举措，[Root.GetAdjective]的各个阶层展现出越来越强烈的担忧。从传统上，地主贵族和城市市民是我们财政的保障，但他们目前对我们今后的意图抱有很大的怀疑。\n这个情况需要得到快速有效的解决。现在，我们要么向议会提供一个可以让他们全盘接受的方案，要么就干脆直接让使他们焦虑的军队跟他们“谈谈”！\n贵族们可以被允许保留他们的部分特权，甚至我们可以帮助他们在这个变革的时代中继续奴役农夫。作为回报，这些贵族和市民必须在传统的税收权利上向国家让步。[Root.GetName]的财政从此掌握在它自己手中！

original: They shall dance to my tune or the devil will fetch me!
The Nobility will align with us in the diet and protect this deal against the other estates.
translation: 贵族阶层将在议会支持我们，并为维护这个方案同我们一起对抗其他阶层。

original: Money talks, we need the support of the Burghers.
translation: 金钱是万能的，我们需要那些市民的支持。

original: The Burghers will align with us in the diet and protect this agreement against the other estates.
translation: 市民阶层将在议会支持我们，并为维护这个方案同我们一起对抗其他阶层。

original: We could never trample their ancient rights!
translation: 我们绝对不能践踏他们自古已有的权利！

original: Abstain from trying to rein in the estates of [Root.GetName].
translation: 放弃驾驭[Root.GetName]各阶层的尝试。

original: The heartlands of [Root.Country.GetName] have long suffered a structural disadvantage from not being connected to the waterways in the area. To remedy this we have arranged for a canal to be built between the Oder and the river Spree which runs through our capital of [berlin_province.GetCapitalName]. The trade and transport this could allow for would increase local revenue and prosperity in our land for many years to come and due to this the amount of money already invested is not insignificant. However, the task has proven more difficult than anticipated and the construction has now ground to a halt... The project is out of funds and the workers have put down their tools.
translation: [Root.Country.GetName]的中心地区长期缺乏水道连接。为了改善这一状况，我们已经计划在奥德河和流经我国首都[berlin_province.GetCapitalName]的施普雷河间开凿运河。这样，改善后的贸易运输将在今后数年间不断提升我们当地的收入，促进当地繁荣发展，因此，已经投入的金钱并非空费钱财。然而，这项任务被证明比预期更困难，现在工程已经陷入停顿……该项目资金耗尽，工人们停下了工作。

original: An additional investment is clearly in place.
translation: 另一笔投资显然会到位的。

original: Using money from our own treasury the project will be finished.
We should persuade the Nobility to aid us.
The Nobility are eager to come to our aid, in exchange for a heavy gain of influence. The project will be finished.
translation: 贵族们迫切地希望以对我们的帮助来换取他们影响力的大幅提升。这个项目会完成的。

original: The Cantor and teacher at the Zum Grauen Kloster Gymnasium in Berlin, Johann Crüger, has come to reach quite some renown as a composer of concerts and an extensive writer on Musical Education. Crüger has also spent years putting together a great book of over 240 hymns known as the Praxis Pietatis Melica or the Practice of Piety. The intention is for new hymns to be added for the benefit of the many faithful across the German lands. The book has already gained widespread popularity among the faithful Protestants in Germany and its popularity continues to grow.
translation: 在柏林的灰色修道院中学，一位名叫约翰·克鲁格的合唱指挥家兼教师已经成为了一位相当出名且音乐素养颇深的作曲家。克鲁格花费了多年时间将超过240首赞美诗进行编辑，由此产生了著名的《敬虔歌曲集》。这是为了让那些新创作的赞美诗也能造福于德意志土地上虔诚的信众。该书在德国的新教徒中广受欢迎，它的知名度仍在日益增长。

original: While various ways to increase the standing army the country could support have been undertaken in the past they have not been sufficient for our needs. Now that our bureaucracy is advanced enough to support a more rigorous system [Root.Monarch.GetName] has drawn up a plan to reshape the old provincial militias and mercenaries entirely.\nThe country will be divided into cantons and each residing male will be expected to enroll in the army. Civilian involvement should remain limited, instead [Root.Monarch.GetName] intends for the military administrators of each regiment to be responsible for recruitment within a Canton.
translation: 虽然国家过去已经采用了各种办法来提升可维持的常备军数量上限，但依然无法满足我们的需求。当下我们的官僚体系已足以支持一个更加严密的系统，于是[Root.Monarch.GetName]制定了一个彻底重组旧有的省民兵和雇佣兵体系的计划。\n国家将会被划分为多个征兵区，每个男性居民都被要求参军。平民参军仍应受到限制，因此[Root.Monarch.GetName]打算让每支部队的军事管理人员负责在征兵区内募兵。

original: Prussia is an army with a state, not a state with an army.
translation: 在普鲁士是军队拥有一个国家，而不是国家拥有一支军队。

original: The Canton system allows us to recruit an army many times the size one would expect from our population.
translation: 征兵区体系使我们能够招募到的军队规模远超我国人口所应匹配的水平。

original: We cannot let military needs dictate the needs of the state!
translation: 我们不能让军事需求成为国家需求的主导。

original: The strength of our newly forged government institutions will be put to use to extract revenue instead of people.
translation: 新成立的政府机构将被用来榨取钱财而不是榨取人力。

original: The multi-lingual Jewish scholar and philosopher Moses Mendelssohn is of humble origin. Originally intended to become a rabbi, his religious education, however, led him to [berlin_province.GetCapitalName], where he has instead risen to become a published author, highly regarded among Christians and Jews alike. His writings and publications, which are made in both German and Hebrew, along with the open discussions taking place even in his own home, are paving the way for tolerance between people on a scale unseen in [Root.Country.GetName] before. A fascinating person of high intellect and deep thought, some call him a 'German Socrates'.
translation: 掌握多门语言的犹太学者兼哲学家摩西·门德尔松出身寒微。他原打算成为一名拉比，但他的宗教教育却将他指引到了[berlin_province.GetCapitalName]，在那里他反而成为了一名同时倍受犹太人和基督徒尊敬的作家。不论是他撰写出版的著作（用德语和希伯来语双语撰写），还是他家中开放的讨论，都为[Root.Country.GetName]人与人之间前所未有的深刻交流铺平了道路。他是一个富有智慧、思想深邃的人，有人将他称为“德国的苏格拉底”。

original: The death of Count Wichmann, the last of the Lindow-Ruppin line the Ruppiner lands have been reverted to the rule of the [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]s of Brandenburg. Though the region was considered part of wider Brandenburg the counts were immediate subjects of the empire. Many of the Ruppiner lands had been pawned of over the years but the extinction of the last prince means that we can now directly confiscate both the city of Neuruppin and many of the lands surrounding it.
translation: 维希曼伯爵的故去，标志着最后一片林多夫——鲁平一线的土地被收归勃兰登堡治下。虽然该地区确为大勃兰登堡的一部分，但这里的伯爵却是皇帝的直属封臣。虽然多年来鲁平地区许多原来的伯爵已经失去了他们的头衔和领地，但直到最后一个公爵的绝嗣才意味着我们终于可以将诺伊鲁平及其周边地区收归国有。

original: Our hold over this province has now solidified!
translation: 我们对这个省份的控制权已经牢牢确立。

original: Originally one of Martin Luther's theological closer allies, Johannes Agricola has had a bitter falling out with the great reformer. Agricola's stance in whether Mosaic Law applies to Christians is directly opposite of Luther's and the reformer is now in search of a new base from which to work and propagate. His insistence on the Gospels alone as the source for Christian conduct as well as having been seen to be favorable to a settlement with the Catholics has also made Agricola ill-regarded by the more radical reformers. His theological views would make him an excellent superintendent for the newly formed Brandenburg church, however, and a good court preacher of the [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]'s.
translation: 约翰内斯·阿格里科拉原是马丁·路德在神学方面的亲密盟友，但他与这位伟大的改革家发生了激烈的争执。阿格里科拉对摩西律法是否适用于基督徒这一问题的立场与路德针锋相对，使得后者只能寻找一个新的根据地以进行工作和传教。因为他坚持福音书是基督徒行为准则的唯一规范并且还倾向于与天主教会和解，他遭到了更激进的宗教改革者的厌恶。他的神学观点足以让他成为一名优秀的管理者管理新建立的勃兰登堡教堂，同时兼为[Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]的优秀宫廷传道者。

original: We cannot abide his reconciliatory views.
translation: 我们无法容忍他的和解主张。

original: The Brandenburger lands are not the richest in Germany and for long periods of time law and order have been hard to come by. As a result many families have a tradition of lining their pockets in times of financial need by violent or coercive means.\nOur countryside is plagued by Robber Barons from the less well-to-do noble families of the realm. They are a menace both to our authority and to the burghers of our already struggling merchant cities. If our state is to thrive here in 'the sandbox of Germany' we must restore order and these destructive traditions of the local nobility.
translation: 勃兰登堡并非德国做富饶的地区，而且长期以来这里都难以维持法律与秩序。因为这个原因，许多豪族都有在手头紧时使用暴力或强制手段掠取钱财的传统。\n我国广大的村镇受到了由国内缺钱豪族组成的强盗骑士的侵袭。他们的行径既是对我们权威的挑战，也威胁到了我们已经陷入窘迫的商业城市市民阶层。如果我们的国家想在这片孕育德意志的土地上发展壮大，我们就必须恢复秩序，并纠正这些豪族的悖逆传统。

original: I never spilled the blood of noblemen, I only executed rogues, robbers and murders.
translation: 我从未溅洒贵族的鲜血，我所做的不过是惩办流氓，强盗和杀人凶手。

original: We will use force to defeat and execute hundreds of Robber Barons throughout the realm.
translation: 我们将使用武力彻底荡平我国境内数以百计的强盗骑士。

original: We cannot risk angering the nobles.
translation: 我们不能冒险激怒贵族。

original: In times of financial needs the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle]s of [Root.GetName] have traditionally been able to ask the estates of the realm for more money. This is often done through a financial institution known as the Kreditwerk which is controlled by the estate but guarantees the finances of the state.\nA recent series of bad harvests and assorted domestic problems have strained the economy of both the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] and the estates themselves as [Root.Monarch.GetName] turns to the Kreditwerk the Estates are weary of the [Root.Monarch.GetName]'s will to pay back what is owed. In order for them to give us better terms they will expect more far-reaching privileges and prerogatives.
translation: 在[Root.GetName]的[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]们手头紧的时候，原则上，可以要求领土上各阶层提供更多钱。这通常通过被称之为信誉社的财政机构执行。这个机构由地主控制以保障国家经济。\n最近一系列诸如庄稼歉收等各种国内问题让[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]和地主们都陷入财政困难。尽管[Root.Monarch.GetName]已经向信誉社求助，地主们却不满足于仅向[Root.Monarch.GetName]收回欠款。他们会期待获得更多的特权，以作为给我们更好优惠的条件。

original: We cannot surrender our finances to these Noble Bankers...
translation: 我们不能把财务交给这些贵族银行家！

original: Refuse to sign it and defy the Magnates

Under Jan Olbracht, the son of Kazimierz IV, the policy of giving concessions to the Nobility continued. In 1496 the Statute of Piotrkow was instituted. It implied that serfdom was strengthened and accepted in law. It forbade all workers to move from their villages, except one every year. It later was extended with a work duty of six days a week. At this point the peasants of Poland had lost not only all power, but also their freedom. The power lay in the hands of the Nobility.
translation: 卡其米日四世之子简·奥波拉特颁布的给予贵族优惠的政策，在1496为彼得库夫提及，这预示着农奴制将在法律上巩固和强化.这份法案禁止所有人离开居住地，也就是说波兰人不仅失去了权力，而且失去了自由.贵族掌控一切

original: The Duchy of Mazovia had long been ruled by a line of the Piast Dynasty, but because of the power of Poland she most often followed the suggestions of Polish foreign policy. In 1526 the last Piast ruler died and the Polish crown inherited Mazovia. Exactly what would be done with the lands was not clear, but in the end it became a Royal fief. And later the new Polish capital would be placed in the sleepy hamlet of Warszawa.
translation: 马佐维亚大公国曾长期为皮亚斯特王朝的一支所统治，但是因为波兰的强权，他经常遵循波兰的外交政策.1525年随着皮亚斯特王朝最后的统治者离去，波兰继承了这片土地.不清楚这片土地将为何用，但他最终成为了一处皇室领地.而这片土地上的一个宁静的小村庄，将是波兰未来的首都——华沙

original: Make it a personal royal fiefdom

Sigismund III was a son of King Johan III of Sweden. His father was a man that ruled a staunch Protestant country, but with a personal leaning toward Catholicism. Sigismund was brought up by Jesuits and preferred their company. Religion was as important to him as politics and one of his great obsessions was to make Catholicism the State-religion of Poland. This was perhaps the most impossible task for a man, even if king, to accomplish in Poland. The Freedom of religion and the ideological principle of religious tolerance was the foundation of Polish society. Sigismund was strong-willed and stubborn, so he tried nevertheless. He of course had the whole country against him and failed. These acts also made him many enemies, which would stop him from reforming the government and strengthening Royal power in the first decade of the 17th century.
translation: 西吉斯蒙德三世是瑞典国王约翰三世之子，其父统治着坚定的新教国家，但是他却是个天主教徒.西吉斯蒙德三世依靠耶稣会和公司.宗教对于他而言十分重要，如同政治和他的一个执念——让波兰把天主教作为国教——这也许是永不可能的任务，纵然他是国王.宗教自由和宽容的思想原则是波兰社会的基础，西吉斯蒙德三世是个偏执者，所以他仍在努力.他自然而然地惹怒全国，令全民失望，并且树敌无数——而这阻止了他在17世纪第一个十年改革政府加强王权的努力.

original: The Catholic Faith is the First among Equals
Hail the King of the Jesuits!
The Pacta Conventa and the Henrykian Articles
translation: 女修道院条约与亨利王约

original: In 1572 the Jagiellon Dynasty was extinct and a new king was to elected. His name was Henri d'Anjou. On his election he was forced to sign what has later been called the Henrykian Articles, which rectified that Poland was an elective monarchy from then on. He also signed the Pacta Conventa, which was a formal contract between the elected monarch and the Sejm. In practice the monarch lost all power over his country. He had no power over governmental officials and he had a mere 3000 men strong Royal Army. To get anything extra he had to plead with the Sejm for permission. At this moment Poland effectively stopped being a monarchy, as the monarch was a mere figurehead, and instead a true Noble Republic.
translation: 1572年雅盖隆王朝绝嗣，选举了一位新国王，他叫亨利·德·安茹.在他当选之后，被迫签署了一份后世著名的亨利王约，在波兰确立了选举君主制.他还签署了女修道院条约，这是选举君主制和众议院的正式法案.实际上君主失去了一切的权力——没有任免权，只有一支由3000人组成的“强大的”皇室军队.如果他要获得其他的权力，则需要恳求众议院.此时波兰有效解决了君主制问题——君主被架空了——成为一个实际上的贵族共和国.

original: There is nothing we can do, my King

When Jan Sobieski became king in 1674 he was already a renowned and glorious military leader. In fact he started out as a general and ended up as a king. His reform of the Polish army thus started long before he became king, but it was under his Royal leadership that the strong effects of the reforms made a lasting impression on history. The New Polish Army saved Vienna from the onslaught of the Ottomans and forever stopped their advance. Unfortunately in the long run it helped Austria more than it helped Poland.
translation: 当扬·索别斯基于1674年成为国王时，他已经是一位著名而光荣的军事领袖——他起于行伍，并最终登基为王。他对波兰军队的改革早在他成为国王之前就开始了，但正是在他的领导下，改革的强大影响力给历史留下了深远的印迹。新的波兰军队从奥斯曼帝国的进攻中拯救了维也纳。不幸的是，从长远来看，这一行为是帮助了奥地利而不是帮助了波兰。

original: Make a strict Army Reform only
Reform the Army and undermine the power of the Sejm
translation: 军事改革和削弱众议院同步进行

original: In 1697, the 15 years old Charles XII ascended the Swedish throne. Seeing the opportunity, the Russian Czar Peter I allied with Denmark and Poland-Saxony in 1699. However, with British and Dutch naval assistance, Charles XII landed on Zealand and promptly defeated the Danes, then moved to Estland where his badly outnumbered Swedes (1 to 5) won a crushing victory over the Russians. Instead of finishing the Russians, Charles moved against August II of Poland-Saxony and drove him out of Poland in 1704 (having the pro-Swedish Stanislaw Leszczynski elected King), then subjugating Saxony in 1706. While the Russians started the construction of St Petersburg (1703) and rebuilt their armies, they also took parts of Estland (1704-1706). Charles then decided to march to Moscow via the Ukraine where the Cossacks under Mazeppa had again risen in revolt (1708). The harsh winter and Russian raids decimated his army and he was finally beaten at the battle of Poltava in 1709. The wounded king escaped to the Ottomans. The Russians were encircled by the Ottomans on the Prut River, but Peter succeeded through bribery to obtain a safe conduct in exchange for Azov. While Charles was still exiled in Turkey, Russian, Danish, Hanoverian and even Prussian troops captured most of the Swedish land around the Baltic. Having emerged from Turkish internment, Charles got killed in 1718 in front of the Norwegian fortress of Frederickshald. In the peace treaties that followed Sweden lost most of her Baltic empire.
translation: 在1697年，15岁的查理十二登上了瑞典王位.俄罗斯沙皇彼得一世看到了良机，在1699年与丹麦、萨克森-波兰联合王国结成联盟.然而由于英格兰和尼德兰的海军援助，查理十二登陆西兰，并且迅速粉碎了丹麦人的军队，之后到埃斯特兰援助他寡不敌众的军队，粉碎了俄罗斯的胜利.但是查理十二并且继续修理俄罗斯，而是提出要在1704年把萨克森-波兰联合王国的奥古斯特二世撵出波兰，然后在1706年征服萨克森.俄罗斯在1703年开始建设圣彼得堡，而且重建了军队，并占据了部分的埃斯特兰（1704-1706），查理十二于是决定通过乌克兰进军莫斯科，而那里的哥萨克人正在马泽帕的领导下再次起义（1708）.俄罗斯的严冬和突袭消灭了他的军队，查理十二于1709年在波尔塔瓦被蹂躏.这位失败的王逃到了奥斯曼，俄罗斯人的普鲁特河被奥斯曼包围，但是彼得一世成功地通过贿赂换取亚速.尽管查理十二仍在奥斯曼流亡，但是俄罗斯、丹麦、汉诺威——甚至普鲁士，都在侵占瑞典的波罗的海领土.摆脱流亡后，查理十二于1718年被杀在挪威的弗雷德里希堡.和谈之后，瑞典失去了它的波罗的帝国.

original: Poland and the Ottoman Empire came into conflict in the 1670's and 80's when the Cossacks in the Polish part of the divided Ukraine submitted to the Ottoman Empire and called for Tatar aid against Poland. Victories won by hetman Jan Sobieski only temporarily forestalled the threat, and in 1672 the Commonwealth faced a major invasion by the Ottoman Empire. The fall of the key border fortress Kamieniec Podolski was followed by the humiliating Peace of Buczacz. In 1683 Sobieski led a relief army to Vienna, besieged by the Ottomans, and as supreme commander of the allied forces won a resounding victory that marked the beginning of Ottoman withdrawal from Europe.
translation: 在1670年和1680年，波兰和奥斯曼发生了危机.当时波兰的一部分——乌克兰哥萨克人向奥斯曼和鞑靼人发出了反抗波兰的援助，简·索别斯基对哥萨克人的胜利只是暂时的.在1672年，波兰-立陶宛面临着奥斯曼入侵的重大威胁.随着边关要卡缅涅茨波多尔斯基的沦陷，在布查签署了屈辱的合约.索别斯基在1683年率领一支援军到维也纳围攻奥斯曼，联军的指挥者赢得了响亮的胜利.这标志着奥斯曼从欧洲撤离.
我们将捍卫基督教世界
可怕的瘟疫流行于立陶宛

original: During 1709-10 Lithuania endured the harshest winter of a century. But as if that was not enough, an epidemic plague spread through the lands killing many thousands. There is talking of the Scourge of God and people pray... pray... pray...
translation: 在1709-1710之际，立陶宛经历着一个世纪以来最严酷的冬日.不过这似乎还不够，瘟疫传遍全国，杀害了成千上万的人.此乃妄谈神祇之罪，以及人们不断地掠夺……掠夺……掠夺……

original: There is nothing we can do

On 12 September 1683 an allied army under the leadership of King Jan Sobieski relieved Vienna from the besieging Ottomans. At this point the King's name flew over Europe. In that very moment Jan Sobieski had such status and personal power coming from his very person that he could have ended the stagnation of Poland or at least he could have tried. Merely the different political climate during the earlier days of his reign is a proof of him being a very special monarch. He was never that limited by vetoes or articles as earlier monarchs, but in the end he chose a different path. He chose to continue the campaign against the Ottoman, a campaign he could not win decisively, while at the same time having to cope with growing dissent from magnates disliking this policy. When he stopped campaigning he suffered heavily from gallstones and he never managed to make the magnates forget that he was just one of them. He never managed to translate his popularity in the Szlachta, as whole, into concerted political action. If he instead had gone home after relieving Vienna and picked a fight with the magnates something completely different might have happened. Well who knows...?
translation: 在1683年9月12日，联军在索别斯基的领导下击败了围攻维也纳的奥斯曼人.从那一刻起，此王之名响彻欧洲.在这种非常时刻，索别斯基有着如此的地位和权力，他或许已经结束了波兰的停滞，或者至少他曾试图结束.只是与他早期政治氛围不同，他最终选择了不同的道路——继续反抗奥斯曼——一个他决不能成功的决断.而在同时，他还要应付不支持这一决断的人，以及不断增长的异见者.当他放弃之后，他患上了严重的胆结石，他从未让贵族忘记索别斯基也是他们的一份子.他从未将他的影响力施加到贵族，而是作为一个整体，达成协调一致的政治行动.如果他在救援维也纳之后不是解甲归田，而是和贵族战斗，完全不同的事情是有可能发生的.那么谁知道呢……

original: No, it's too problematic to change the situation
translation: 不，改变需要解决太多问题了

original: Let us change this depressing situation
translation: 让我们改变这令人沮丧的局面

original: In 1697 Friedrich Augustus II became king of Poland. His reputation was never good. He was a German and because of his inability to win a war he himself had started he is considered a rather bad Polish king. However, when Friedrich Augustus became king he had a plan. He was not a stupid man, and he intended to turn the Commonwealth into a centralized monarchical state. He was a child of the same ideas as his contemporaries in Berlin, Hannover and München, and he needed a war to accomplish it. Like Sobieski, he saw war as the surest way to gain prestige and a free hand to carry out his plan. Now Friedrich Augustus made certain mistakes. He and his allies underestimated the ease with which they would smash the eighteen year old monarch of Sweden and secondly Friedrich August was no Sobieskian General. The failure of the war and his lost prestige from being a lousy soldier and having been forced to a humiliating abdication ruined every chance to reform anything. Instead he ruined any chance for monarchism in Poland as his return was with the arrivals of Russian bayonets. However... had he won the war and Poland had been a winner while Russia had become rather mauled then his position would have been different. Instead of buying art for his castles in Dresden he might very well have used that prestige and military power with boldness and brute force to accomplish the impossible...
translation: 腓特烈·奥古斯都二在1697年成为波兰国王.他的名声永远不会好.他是个德国人，却因为自己的无能而赢得了一场战争，他已经开始被认为是相当糟糕的波兰国王了.然而当腓特烈·奥古斯都二成为国王，他有了个计划.他不是个傻瓜，他打算把波兰-立陶宛改造成中央集权的君主制国家.这个想法在柏林、汉诺威、慕尼黑就像个幼儿，但他却需要一场战争来完成.和索别斯基一样，他看到了战争是最可靠的获得威望的方式，以便自己腾出双手来执行自己的计划.不过现在，腓特烈·奥古斯都二出现了些许失误——他和他的盟友低估了战争的难易程度——他们将被18岁的瑞典君主粉碎，而腓特烈·奥古斯都二没有索别斯基的军事才能.战争的失败令他失去了一切威望，他被迫羞耻地逊位，毁掉每个改过自新的机会.他毁掉了波兰重建君主制的机会，而且使波兰直面俄罗斯的利刃.最后……他赢得了战争——波兰一直是赢家，而俄罗斯则满目疮痍，他的地位会有所不同.若非他为自己的德累斯顿购买艺术品，他或许已经用威望和军力在暴力中完成那不可能的……

original: After the ascension of Stanislaus Poniatowski to the Polish throne, a feverish wave of reforms took place. In 1766 Chancellor Zamoyski laid before the Sejm his project for constitutional reform which included the abolition of the Liberum Veto. This elicited an immediate response from St Petersburg and Berlin, both of which threatened with war if it were not withdrawn, and if the Confederated Sejm was not immediately dissolved. The King and his supporters had little to do but comply, trapped in Warszawa as they were. But people started to wake up from their 'Saxon slumber' and the Confederates refused to comply. At the same time some magnates wanted to get rid of the upstart Stanislaus and united with Russian forces under the young general Suvorov, they fought and destroyed the Confederated troops. Thus the Effort to end stagnation brought the First Partition of Poland.
translation: 当斯坦尼斯劳斯·波尼亚托夫斯基提升波兰王权后，发生了狂热的改革浪潮.1766年，大臣扎莫伊斯基在众议院提出了他的宪法改革计划，其中包括取消一票否决权.这引起了圣彼得堡和柏林的战争威胁——如果法案未被撤回，或者众议院不立即解散，圣彼得堡和柏林将会立即做出反应.国王和他的支持者几乎没有做，但是遵守了——他们被困于华沙.而人们则从“萨克森之眠”中醒来，并拒绝履行盟约.与此同时，一些达官显贵正想摆脱新贵斯塔尼斯劳斯通过年轻的苏洛沃夫将军和俄罗斯团结力量.他们的战斗摧毁了波兰-立陶宛的军队，努力结束停滞带来了波兰的分裂.

original: In 1787 King Stanislaus approached Catherine of Russia with a bargain. Poland will raise a substantial army and support Russia in her war with the Ottomans, and make flanking maneuvers against potential attacks from Prussia or Sweden. The move was smart as it would mean that the king would have an army that could defend the country from enemies abroad and within, but Catherine did not fall for. She preferred having Poland as a piece of no-man's-land in between her and Prussia and Austria. As this failed, the King stood without a plan and a decent foreign policy. The next year members of the so-called 'Patriotic Party' took matters in their own hands in the Great Sejm. It voted an increase of the army and vested control over it in a Sejm Commission. It placed the conduct of foreign policy in the hands of another Sejm Commission. It also abolished the Permanent Council that had governed the country since 1772 and imposed tax on incomes from lands, 10 percent for the Szlachta and 20 percent for the Church. In 1791 the king arrived from his isolation since the failure with Catherine and together with Stanislaw Potocki and Hugo Kollataj he drafted the New Constitution of May 3. This became the first written Constitution in Europe and a satisfactory compromise between the republicanism of Potocki, the radicalism of Kollataj and the monarchism of the king. Again Catherine the Great reacted, and as circumstances went against Poland, peace was signed between the Ottomans and Russia, and 89000 seasoned veterans now stood against the 37000 staunchly heroic, but no less, newly recruited Poles. No one helped Poland and the outcome was devastating. Thus the Effort to end stagnation brought the Second Partition of Poland.
translation: 1787年斯坦尼斯国王接近俄罗斯的卡特琳娜议和.波兰讲大幅提升军队，并且支持俄罗斯和奥斯曼的战争，抵御来自普鲁士和瑞典的侧翼威胁.这是明智之举，意味着国王将有一支从敌人手中保卫国家的军队.但是卡特琳娜并未上钩——她宁愿波兰作为一片在俄罗斯、普鲁士和奥地利之间的无芒地.由于此举失败，国王展开没有计划没有脸面的外交政策.第二年，所谓的爱国党的成员决定在伟大的众议院把事态掌握在自己手中——关于增加军队以及控制权的投票.他把外交政策置于众议院手中，也取消了1772年起在全国执政的理事会，并且从土地上征税，10%来自贵族，20%来自教会.1791年国王从他孤立政策失败以来和卡特琳娜、伊格纳齐·波托茨其、乌戈·克拉塔一起，起草他的新宪法.这成为欧洲第一份成文宪法，并且是共和主义的波托茨其、激进主义的克拉塔以及君主制的国王之间，令人满意的妥协.同样卡特琳娜大帝回应了，并根据情况去反对波兰.奥斯曼和俄罗斯之间和谈了，89000经验丰富的老兵对抗37000坚定地英雄——新招募的波兰人——也毫不逊色.没有人帮助波兰的结果是毁灭性的，努力结束停滞带来的是第二次瓜分波兰.

original: The Sejm refuses to allow the mobilization of more troops
translation: 众议院拒绝调动更多的军队

original: Since the issuing of the Henrykian Articles and the Pacta Conventa the King had very little power of his own. If he was to make policies, of war for example, he had to have the consent of the Sejm.
