Sometimes kings tried to drag the country into conflict and thus force the Sejm to comply out of necessity or by building a domestic political coalition which were changing tit for tat. But often the Sejm plainly said no.
translation: 自从亨里克三世签署约定条款以来，国王几乎失去了自身的权力，如果他想要制定政策，例如战争，那么他就需要经过色姆议会的同意，有时国王们会试图将国家拖入冲突之中，从而迫使瑟姆议会出于必要性而屈服，或是建立一个国內政治联盟来平衡，但瑟姆议会常常都会直白地说“不！”

original: The Sejm comply with your policies
translation: 瑟姆议会遵从您的决策

original: The Veto itself was merely the most obvious symptom of a political disease that went far deeper. The first veto was not repeated for seventeen years, the second not for another ten. Then it became endemic in parliamentary life. The right to cast a veto grew into fetish, particularly among the minor Szlachta who saw it as a symbol of their personal involvement in the Commonwealth, as well as the ultimate guarantee of their freedoms. That the King viewed it differently is obvious. One should know that policy-making in Poland was not frozen because of the power of the veto. The King had to create Grand Compromises to ensure an at least acceptable outcome. However, as the Polish society slowly lost its consensus it was harder and harder to reach a compromise. It was especially cumbersome when planning and scheming had been going on for many months and suddenly in the last minute of passing the proposal in the Sejm, Someone rose and threw a Veto... Then again, sometimes the proposal actually passed.
translation: 否决权本身只不过是这个政治弊端中最明显的表现，它內在的弊端则更多。第一次否决权后有17年没有再次发生，第二次后有10年没再发生。后来，它成了议会活动中的特有项目。行使否决权的权利逐渐变成了一种盲目的虚荣表现，尤其是在小什拉赫塔（小贵族）们之间，他们把否决权视为他们个人参与联邦治理的象征，以及他们自由的最终保障。很明显，国王是有著不同看法的。应该让人们了解，波兰的决策并不会因为否决权就停滞。必要的时候国王将做出很大部分的妥协，以确保至少有个可以接受的结果。然而，随着波兰社会逐渐失去共识，达成妥协越来越难。当政策方针已筹备进行了好几个月，突然在瑟姆议会上通过提案的最后一刻时，有人站出来投了反对票，这就尤其麻烦⋯⋯  同样，有时提案实际上可以通过。

original: The Sejm veto all your policies
translation: 瑟姆议会否决所有政策

original: The Veto itself was merely the most obvious symptom of a political disease that went far deeper. The first veto was not repeated for seventeen years, the second not for another ten. Then it became endemic in parliamentary life. The right to cast a veto grew into fetish, particularly among the minor Szlachta who saw it as a symbol of their personal involvement in the Commonwealth, as well as the ultimate guarantee of their freedoms. That the King viewed it differently is obvious. One should know that policy-making in Poland was not frozen because of the power of the veto. The King had to create Grand Compromises to ensure an at least acceptable outcome. However, as the Polish society slowly lost its consensus it was harder and harder go reach a compromise. It was especially cumbersome when planning and scheming had been going on for many months and suddenly in the last minute of passing the proposal in the Sejm, Someone rose and threw a Veto...
translation: 否决权本身只是表面症状，更深的是政治病.第一，否决权不重复了17年；第二，不再过几十年.之后，他成为了地方性议会的生活.权力在否决权中成为神物.其中尤以小贵族，谁看见了他以个人身份参加了波兰-立陶宛而最终保证了他们的自由？国王看法不同是显而易见的.谁人都明白因为否决权，波兰的政策没有僵化，国王不得不给予更大的妥协以确保结果至少是可以接受的.然而由于波兰社会失去共识导致越来越难以达成妥协，特别是繁琐的规划已经发生了好几个月，并在众议院通过建议的最后一分钟突然涨价——有人投一票否决——话又说回来，有时决策实际上是通过的……

original: In 1543, the year of his death, Nicolaus Copernicus published On the Revolutions of the Heavenly Spheres. The work argued for a heliocentric model of the universe as opposed to the common Ptolemaic view of an Earth-centered universe. This work threatened the literal truth of the Bible as well as the long established geo-centric view of the universe. Copernicus had no mathematical backing for his argument but this would be provided by later generations of astronomers and mathematicians.
translation: 在1543年，他去世一年，哥白尼出版在天球的革命.主张一个以太阳为中心的宇宙模型的工作，而不是常见的托勒密的地心宇宙观点.这项工作威胁字面圣经真理以及历史悠久的地缘为中心的宇宙观.哥白尼有他的说法，但没有数学的支持，这将是后世所提供的天文学家和数学家.

original: Wladyslaw IV Vasa took the Polish throne in 1632 and announced creation of a war fleet according to needs of Commonwealth through his signed and sworn Pacta Conventa. He created a Naval Commission with Gerard Denhoff to fulfill the task of building a new fleet. The Sejm did not support the new fleet due to high costs and reluctance to strengthen the king's power which crippled king Wladyslaw's plans. The king chose wealthy members to the Commission, including the merchant and owner of a merchant fleet from Danzig, Georg Hewel, to finance the new war fleet. Ten ships, of which a few carried small caliber cannons, were given to Wladyslaw IV from Hewel and the new 'Polish Fleet' consisted of 10 ex-merchant ships, six smaller ships and one small galley, under the command of rear admiral Aleksander Seton. Due to unfortunate international alliances, a majority of defensive wars and a new armistice with Sweden removed the last of the king's argument for a Polish fleet and Wladyslaw decided to use his ships to organize the first Polish merchant company. Hewel's death stopped those plans and finally the ships were sold.
translation: 瓦迪斯瓦夫四瓦萨继承了波兰王位，并在1632年宣布舰队参战需通过他的签字和对协定条款宣誓.他和杰拉德创造了一个海军委员会以完成建立新海军的任务.由于成本过高，众议院反对残废王瓦迪斯瓦夫的计划，而且他们不愿加强国王的权力.国王挑选富有的委员会成员，包括但泽的商户和业主格奥尔格，资助新舰队.新舰队十艘船，其中一些携带小口径炮，分别由瓦迪斯瓦夫、格奥尔格和亚历山大·西顿少将指挥.由于不幸的国际关系，大量的防御战争以及和瑞典新的停战协议，波兰国王瓦迪斯瓦夫最终取消了用他的舰队组建波兰第一个商船公司，随着格奥尔格的离世，计划破产，船舶出售

original: Sigismund III Vasa's son and successor, King Wladyslaw IV Vasa, ordered the construction of Sigismund's Column and it was erected between 1643 and 1644. The Italian-born architect Constantino Tencalla designed the column. Placed in Warszawa, the Corinthian column is made of red marble, 8.5 m high, on which a sculpture of Sigismund III Vasa, 2.75-meters high, is placed. The column is adorned by four eagles and the king is dressed in armor, carrying a cross in one hand and wielding a sword in the other.
translation: 西吉斯蒙德三世之子及继承人，瓦迪斯瓦夫四世下令建造的西吉斯蒙德圆柱建于1643至1644年，由意大利出身的建筑师康斯坦丁诺设计。该座柯林斯式立柱位于华沙，由红色大理石制成，高8.5米，其上安置的西吉斯蒙德雕塑高2.75米。立柱周围饰有四只鹰塑像，国王雕塑则身着盔甲，一手持十字架、一手挥剑。

original: There is no need to commemorate King Sigismund III!
translation: 没必要纪念西吉斯蒙德三世!

original: Queen Ludwika Maria Gonzaga and King John Casimir of Poland sponsored the newspaper Merkuriusz Polski Ordynaryjny, published weekly and devoted to contemporary politics, European dynastic affairs, and monarchs' military campaigns. It promoted political reforms and the strengthening of monarchical power, was edited by Hieronim Pinocci and published by the printing house J.A. Gorczyn.
translation: 波兰的卢德维卡·玛丽亚·贡扎加女王和约翰·卡西米日国王赞助发行的波兰语墨丘利常识报每周发刊，希耶罗宁·皮诺奇担任编辑，J.A.戈尔钦出版社出版。它关注当代政治、各王朝内政和君王间的战事，促进了政治改革，加强了君权。

original: Walerian Protasewicz, the bishop of Vilnius, purchased several buildings in the city center and established the Vilnian Academy in 1569, one year after the Lithuanian nobility had asked the Jesuits to create an institution of higher learning in Vilnius or Kaunas. The three divisions at the academy were humanities, philosophy, and theology. In 1570, a library was established, 2500 books were donated to the new college by Sigismund II Augustus and the first students enrolled into the Academy. Stefan Batory, King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania, granted the academy equal status with the Kraków Academy on April 1, 1579, and created the Alma Academia et Universitas Vilnensis Societatis Iesu. Pope Gregory XIII's bull of October 30, 1579 approved his edict and the first rector of the Academy was Piotr Skarga.
translation: 在立陶宛贵族要求耶稣会在维尔纽斯或考纳斯创建一个高等学府的一年后，维尔纽斯主教布洛塔 瑟维奇在市中心购买了几栋建筑，并于1569年在此成立了维尔纽斯学院。学院有三个分支：人文系、哲学系、神学系。1570年学院的图书馆落成，齐格蒙特二世将2500本书捐赠给新建立的学院，而同时第一批学子也入读了。波兰国王，立陶宛大公斯特凡·巴托雷在1578年4月1日签署了法令，该法令授予维尔纽斯学院和克拉科夫大学同等的地位，并将维尔纽斯学院升格为维尔纽斯大学。教宗格里高利十三世在1579年10月30日颁布的圣谕中批准了斯特凡的法令。该大学的第一任校长是皮奥特奥尔。

original: Jan Brozek was a Polish mathematician, astronomer, physician, poet, writer, musician and rector of the Kraków Academy. He worked on the theory of numbers and geometry, solving the problem of why bees create hexagonal honeycombs by demonstrating that the hexagonal form is the efficient way of using wax and storing honey. Brozek was a contributor of Nicolaus Copernicus' theories, an ardent supporter and early prospective biographer of Copernicus. The building Collegium Broscianum at the Jagiellonian University is named after Brozek.
translation: 约翰布鲁兹克是波兰数学家，天文学家，医生，诗人，作家，音乐家和克拉科夫学院校长.他曾在数量和几何的理论，为什么蜜蜂创建蜂巢材料证明，六角形的形式是用蜡和储存蜂蜜的有效途径解决问题.布鲁兹克是哥白尼的一个理论贡献者，热心支持和前瞻性书于哥白尼传记中.雅盖隆大学建筑布罗歇尔姆学院被命名为后布鲁兹克.

original: The Polish alchemist, philosopher, and medical doctor Michal Sedziwój was a pioneer of chemistry. He developed ways of purification and creation of various acids, metals and other chemical compounds. King Sigismund III Vasa was an alchemy enthusiast and conducted experiments with Sedziwój. Sedziwój designed mines and metal foundries and wrote many books, the most famous being 'A New Light of Alchemy'. The book was written in alchemical language, which was understandable only by other alchemists. Sedziwój discovered oxygen 170 years before similar discoveries by Scheele and Priestley, calling it the 'food of life'.
translation: 波兰炼金术士，哲学家，医生米哈尔·情深是化学的先驱.他开发了净化和创造的各种酸，金属和其他化学物质的方法.国王西吉斯蒙德三世瓦萨是一个炼丹爱好者，并进行了实验与情深.情深设计的矿山和金属铸造厂，并写了很多书，最有名的是“炼金术”的新亮点.这本书是写在炼金的语言，这是可以理解的其他方士.情深发现了氧气，比舍勒和普利斯早了170年.他称之为“生命的粮食”

original: Polish Crown Chancellor Jan Zamoyski founded the Zamojski Academy in 1594 and it was the fourth institution of higher education to be founded in the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth. The poet Szymon Szymonowic, aka Simon Simonides, assisted Jan Zamoyski with the founding and became one of the Academy's lecturers. Pope Clement VIII approved the founding and so did the Bishop of Chelm, Stanislaw Gomolinski. The academy opened on 15 March 1595 and King Sigismund III Vasa of Poland confirmed the act in 1601. The three departments at the academy were liberal arts, law, and medicine. It had seven faculty positions for professors and from 1637 the school had the power to award doctor of philosophy diplomas.
translation: 在1594年，波兰王室大臣扎莫伊斯基建立扎莫希奇学院，这是波兰第四高等教育机构.诗人西蒙·思诺莫维基，又叫西门·西蒙尼塔斯，协助约翰·扎莫伊斯基建立学院，并且成为讲师之一.教宗克莱蒙特八世批准斯塔尼瓦夫创立，并且成为海乌姆主教.学院于1595年3月15日开设，波兰国王西吉斯蒙德三世兑现在1601年.在学院的三个部门分别为文科，法律，医学等.它有7个教师职位的教授，从1637年学校有权力哲学文凭奖医生.

original: The death of both the monarch and the heir has left Burgundy in turmoil.
translation: 君主和继承人的死亡留下动荡的勃艮第

original: The great [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] [Root.Monarch.GetName] and his closest followers have tragically been killed! In an effort to win the current war, the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] personally led his troops into battle, valiantly charging his enemies. His naked and disfigured body was later found in a ditch, his head having been cleft in two.\n\nThe death of the last [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] of [Root.GetName] has plunged the country into internal turmoil and left it vulnerable to intervention from powerful neighbors.
translation: [Root.Monarch.GetName]大[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]和他的贴身侍从已经惨遭杀害！为了赢得当前的战争，[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]亲自率部战斗，英勇地向敌军发起冲锋。后来在某条水沟里发现的他的赤裸的尸体已经面目全非，头颅裂成两半。\n\n[Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]王朝最后的[Root.GetName][Root.Monarch.GetTitle]之死使国家内部陷入动乱，在强邻的干预下显得十分弱势。

original: With no heir to inherit the throne, the death of the last ruler of [Root.GetName] has plunged the country into internal turmoil and left the country vulnerable to intervention from powerful neighbors.
translation: 没有继承王位的继承人，最后一位统治者[Root.GetName]的死亡已经陷入到内部动乱的国家，离开该国容易受到强大的邻国的干预。

original: The death of the last Duke of Burgundy has made the future of the country uncertain. Neighboring countries and those connected by royal marriages are already circling the opportunity to intervene. There is even talk about the Emperor wanting to incorporate the remains into his lands.\n\nHowever, no matter how great the Duke of Burgundy's power grew, there was never any dispute that the Duchy of Burgundy itself laid under France's salic law. If we act now, no other country will be able to take it by any claim of marriage.
translation: 最后一位勃艮第公爵的死亡使得这个国家处于动荡之中。周边国家和以及和勃艮第有王室婚姻的家族已经在寻找介入的机会。甚至有人谈论皇帝想让勃艮第成为他的领土。\n\n由于勃艮第的部分领土要么位于法兰西地区要么就和法兰西有一些文化上的联系，或许我们应该合法的宣称这部分领土？

original: The death of the last Duke of Burgundy has made the future of the country very uncertain. Neighboring countries and those connected by royal marriages are already circling the opportunity to intervene and France has already claimed those parts belonging to the French Region.\n\nAs parts of the Burgundian lands lie within the Holy Roman Empire, perhaps we should claim those parts as our legal rights?
translation: 勃艮第的末代国王的死亡作出了国家的未来很大的不确定性。周边国家和连接王室婚姻已经盘旋机会介入。法兰西已经声称属于法兰西地区的那些部分。\n\n由于勃艮第土地的一部分位于神圣罗马帝国内，或许我们应该宣称这些部分是我们的合法权利？

original: The death of the last Duke of Burgundy has made the future of the country very uncertain. There are already rumors of other countries planning to intervene, but through marriage the [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] are the rightful heirs to the last Burgundian ruler. Surely we should claim the land that rightfully belongs to us?
translation: 勃艮第末代公爵的死亡使该国的未来变得非常不确定。已有传言称其他国家计划进行干预，但通过王室婚姻，[Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]将是最后一位勃艮第统治者的合法继承人。毫无疑问，我们应该要求理应属于我们的领土？

original: The death of the last Duke of Burgundy has made the future of the country very uncertain. Several countries have already circled the possibility of inheriting the lands, but as none of them seem to have an eligible claim, surely we as a neighbor should intervene and incorporate the land to help protect the Burgundian people.
translation: 勃艮第公爵之死令国家前途未卜。不少国家已经在盘算继承领土的可能性，不过介于没人有正当的宣称权，并下勃艮第领土保护勃艮第人民是我们作为邻国义不容辞的责任。

original: Certain provinces that came into our possession during the Burgundian Succession Crisis are claimed by other members of the Holy Roman Empire. They demand we restore these provinces to them.
translation: 在勃艮第的继承危机中某些省份为我们占有，神圣罗马帝国的其他成员的声称。他们在这些省份的需求恢复。

original: Our provinces in the Low Countries have long felt that they are being ruled by an oppressive and foreign ruler. This discontent has now finally spilled over into open revolt. The province of [Root.GetName] has renounced their oath to [Root.Owner.GetName] in order to fight for an independent Netherlands. If not put down quickly, more provinces might follow them.
translation: 我们在低地的省份一直以来都感觉他们受到国外统治者的压迫。这种不满现在终于爆发成了公开的叛乱。[Root.GetName]撤回了他们对[Root.Owner.GetName]的效忠以为了一个独立的荷兰而战斗。如果这不被迅速扑灭，更多的省份将会追随他们。

original: The province of [Root.GetName] has joined the rebellion for an independent Netherlands.
translation: [Root.GetName]省已加入尼德兰独立的叛乱。

original: After years of subjugation and alleged injustices forced on them by what is perceived as a foreign rule, our provinces in the Low Countries have signed an act of adjuration, renouncing their oath to [Root.GetName] and declared Independence!
translation: 在经历了多年的征服和所谓的被外国统治强加给他们的不公正待遇之后，我们低地国家的省份签署了一项声明，放弃了他们对[Root.GetName]的誓言，并宣布独立！

original: National fervor is sweeping across the lands of the newly formed Dutch Republic! A strong army and navy have swiftly been gathered to repel those who try to infringe on our newly won freedom!
translation: 民族主义热潮正在席卷新成立的尼德兰共和国的土地！一支强大的陆军和海军已被迅速集结起来，用以击退那些试图侵犯我们新近赢得的自由的人！

original: The newly formed Dutch Republic is looking to incorporate all provinces in the Netherlands region, and has claimed provinces belonging to us.
translation: 最近结成的荷兰共和国正寻求整合所有尼德兰区域内的省份，它也宣称了我们的一些省份。

original: Rather than to succumb to oppressors from outside the Low Countries, [Root.GetName] has decided to join the republic of the Netherlands.
translation: [Root.GetName]已决定加入尼德兰共和国，而非屈服于来自低地外的压迫。

original: Rather than to face the risk of extinction, [From.GetName] has requested to join our republic.
translation: [From.GetName]已决定加入我们共和国，而不是坐以待毙。

original: Tired of being ruled by someone who is considered an outsider, the people of [Root.GetName] want to seek their liberation by joining the Netherlands instead.
translation: 厌倦了被人统治的而沦为边缘族群，[Root.GetName]的人想寻求解放而非加入尼德兰。

original: The Dutch people of the Low Countries have had enough of the rule of our hated enemies in [From.GetName] and have broken free! Should we ally with this fledgling state to support their independence war?
translation: 低地国家的荷兰人民已经受够了我们痛恨的敌人——[From.GetName]的统治，并已宣示了自由！我们是否应该与这个新兴国家结盟以支持他们的独立战争？

original: We must show them our support!
translation: 我们必须向他们展示我们的支持！

original: Mary Takes Control of the Kingdom

Following the death of the male line of Burgundy, the Duchy itself passed back to the French king. The Kingdom of Burgundy itself had no such restrictions on its inheritance law however, and Mary of Burgundy, first dismissed by her grandfather as "only a girl," came to rule the remaining Burgundian lands. \n\nNot only would she have to contend with the powerful neighbors of a now diminished Kingdom, but she also had to negotiate the politics of the provinces of the Netherlands. Seeking independence, these states challenged Mary's authority at every turn. She would finally subdue their challenges by issuing the Great Privilege, ensuring their interests were protected.
translation: 随着勃艮第直系继承人的死亡，公国回到了法兰西国王手中。但勃艮第王国的继承法却并未有这样的限制，而勃艮第的玛丽，之前遭到祖父驱逐的“仅是一个女孩”的女人，已经掌控了勃艮第剩余的领土。\n\n她不仅要凭着衰弱的王国同一个强悍无比的邻国抗衡，还要与尼德兰各省进行政治磋商。为了独立，这些地区动辄挑战玛丽的权威。她最终会分配特权来克服当前的挑战，以确保他们的利益得到保障。

original: Issue the Privilege and settle this.
If they will not cooperate then we are better off abandoning them.
translation: 如果他们不合作，还不如放弃那些累赘。

original: Being able to rely on more modern institutions to the growth of more modern institutions in our country the factions of the court have lost their power, and our $MONARCHTITLE$ is now in direct control.
translation: 西化后，各派已经失去了他们的权力，我们的$MONARCHTITLE$现在是直接管理.

original: This is the age of the Dragon!
The Strategic Decision after Zheng He's Journey
translation: 郑和下西洋之后续抉择

original: Around 1400 China's relations with the outside world began to change. Under the Yuan dynasty China had made contact with the West by reopening the old silk routes and bringing Muslim, Christian, and Jewish traders into China. The expulsion of the Mongols in 1367 and the seizure of power by the Ming reversed the processes that were tying China more strongly to the outside. Following the seven expeditions (1405-1433) of admiral Zheng-He, who sailed the imperial fleet into the Indian Ocean and to the coast of Africa, China folded in on itself and closed off its external connections.
translation: 15世纪是中国对外交流的转折时期。在此之前，中国与世界有密切的交流，诸如宗教、贸易等方方面面。唐朝时，中国与印度进行广泛的接触并使佛教传入中国。宋朝时，中国控制东南亚大部分贸易。元朝时，通过丝绸之路，穆斯林、基督徒、犹太商人都曾来到中国。1367年，朱元璋将蒙古人赶出中国后，派遣三宝太监郑和七次下南洋，最远航行至印度洋和东非海岸。但是当郑和折返后，明朝逐渐闭关锁国，直到400年后帝国主义列强用坚船利炮敲开中国的大门。当蒙古人被赶出中原后，封闭的自然环境和稳定的统治结构让中国皇帝失去了对外探索的兴趣。

original: Ever since the capture of the Emperor Zhengtong by the Mongols, security on the northern frontier has been an important issue. One problem is the sorry state of the Great Wall, built in ancient times, but left to crumble in recent centuries. We could repair the Great Wall, but it would be expensive and the effort, both physical and fiscal, would likely cause some unrest among the people. However, with improved defenses, the provinces in the area would likely become more productive and secure, while without them people may leave to safer havens. What shall we do?
translation: 土木堡之变后，北方游牧民族便成为了大明的心头之患。虽然古时曾修筑过长城，但年久失修导致其防御功能基本缺失。我们可以花大工夫修筑长城，这可能会劳民伤财，但是将让我们北部防线固若金汤。我们该怎么办？

original: Yes, we need to repair the Great Wall!
More Repairs for the Great Wall

Ever since the capture of the Emperor Zhengtong by the Mongols, security on the northern frontier has been an important issue. One problem is the sorry state of the Great Wall, built in ancient times, but left to crumble in recent centuries. We could repair the Great Wall, but it would be expensive and the effort, both physical and fiscal, would likely cause some unrest among the people. However, with improved defenses, the provinces in the area would likely become more productive and secure, while without them people may leave to safer havens. What shall we do?
translation: 土木堡之变后，北方游牧民族一直是明朝的心腹大患.虽然古时曾修筑过长城，但年久失修导致其防御功能基本缺失.皇上，我们可以花大工夫修筑长城，可能劳民伤财，但是这将让我们北部防线固若金汤.我们该怎么办？

original: Recent advances in glazes, painting techniques, and pottery-making have resulted in a product that many experts claim is perfection. Exports in chinaware have increased as our product is in high demand. Provinces especially dedicated to the production of the finest porcelain have grown rich on the trade, increasing our revenue from those areas!
translation: 随着我国工匠对釉料选材、绘画技巧的精益求精，所有商人都对我国出口的瓷器都赞不绝口.是否让这个地区转而生产瓷器呢？这将大大增加我国的贸易输出.

original: European traders seemingly can be found everywhere in China. They are draining the profits away from our own traders and driving them into bankruptcy, causing us much lost revenue in taxes and tariffs. Perhaps we should ban them altogether or confine them to a single city in order to better control them and make it easier to impose trade tariffs. Our experts believe that giving the city of Macao to the Portuguese and only allowing the Europeans to trade there might be the best solution. This will also give us the benefit of expanding trade in our southern regions around Canton. Then again, we could choose to shun outside trade altogether or to open our shores to free and unhindered trade by all. What shall be our policy?
translation: 欧洲贸易者看起来遍布中国各地。他们排挤我们的商人并使商人们走向破产，导致我们损失了许多税收。为了更利于控制欧洲贸易者和征收关税，可能我们应当查禁他们或者把他们约束在某个单一城市。我们的专家认为把澳门给葡萄牙并且只允许欧洲人在那做生意，这是最佳的解决之道。同时广州附近的南方区域也会享受到贸易扩张之利。退而求其次，我们也能完全闭关锁国或者完全开放口岸自由贸易。政当何如？

original: Hold a small breathing hole open in Macao
translation: 设置澳门为唯一通商港口

original: Close China to the outside world

The noted general Qi Jiguang has proposed a series of military reforms which, if implemented, would make our armies stronger and our men fight more effectively. Unfortunately, a thorough overhaul of the military is quite an undertaking. It will take quite a bit of money and effort, and even then the armed forces may not appreciate the changes, leading to instability and desertions. Shall we implement the reforms?
translation: 戚继光提出了一系列军事改革措施.如果实施将大大加强我国的军事实力，但这样做会遭到社会的反对并将花费大量金钱.是否实施改革？

original: No, such reforms are too costly

In 1581, the first Jesuit missionaries arrived in China, bringing gifts to the Emperor and exhibiting various mechanical inventions from Europe. They also exhibited great knowledge by creating a huge map of the world and in proposing sound ideas for calendar reform. But they also brought with them strange religious and philosophical ideas, which started to disrupt the traditional order of China. Should these missionaries be allowed to stay?
translation: 1581年，第一位西洋传教士到达中国，他们带着礼物，将欧洲发明的机械送到了明朝皇帝面前.传教士向皇帝展示了已知世界的范围并提议改革历法.同时他们也带来了奇怪的宗教思想，这会破坏中国的传统秩序.是否留下他们？

original: Yes, we may benefit from their learning
translation: 是，中国需要他们的知识.

original: No, their foreign ideas are not acceptable in our society
translation: 不，这些胡言乱语不符合中国国情.

original: A famine of epic proportions has stricken our nation! A prolonged drought has caused harvests in the last few years to be exceedingly poor, leaving the people with very little, or nothing to eat. Deaths due to starvation or disease are rampant in the countryside, and reports of cannibalism and peasants grinding stones to make flour are commonplace. Many have resorted to banditry in order to feed themselves. The people cry out for the government to relieve their suffering, but to help so many will be costly indeed. Shall we attempt to ease the misery of the people?
translation: 一场规模空前地饥荒袭击了祖国！长期干旱导致粮食歉收，活下来的人非常少，甚至开始易子而食.在农村，疾病和饥荒都是人民死亡的原因.人民需要政府的赈济.尽管开销很大，我们应该试着减轻人民的痛苦么？

original: There is nothing we can do
Use all our resources to aim those in need

The Manchu leader Nurhachi has rallied the Jurchen tribes to his banner. They are reorganizing the Manchu state to our north, and are causing some of our northern provinces to rebel. How shall we deal with this crisis?
translation: 满洲的领袖——努尔哈赤重新集结了女真部落。他们试图在北方发动叛乱。我们该如何处置？

original: We are too weak to crush the rebels
The Cult of the White Lotus

The Cult of the White Lotus, a secret revolutionary society, has once again become popular among the common people. In the closing years of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty, they organized resistance to the foreign overlords, and now they are doing so again, but against the reigning Ming Dynasty! What should be done with these revolutionary cultists?
translation: 秘密叛乱团体白莲教有一次在百姓中流行起来。在蒙元王朝的最后几年，他们组织了对这些外族统治者的反抗运动，如今他们打算故技重施，却是对我大明王朝！我们该如何处置这些邪教叛徒？

original: Bah, surely these cultists can do no lasting harm!
translation: 呸，几个渣渣还动摇不了江山社稷！

original: Let the forces of the Empire crush the Rebellion
translation: 命令帝国军队碾碎他们

original: Due to decades of rebellions, unrest, and corruption, our financial situation is in dire straits. We need a new inflow of cash, but the only way to do so is to institute new unpopular taxes. By doing so, we can temporarily relieve some of our cash flow problems, but the already unstable situation may become even worse. But if we don't, we may lose the ability to raise taxes efficiently in certain provinces due to the unrest. What shall we do?
translation: 随着几十年的动荡，我们的财政陷入了重重危机.现在帝国需要新的财政收入，但设立新的税种会导致社会不安，这可能让问题变的更糟.我们该如何处置？

original: Yes, let us raise the taxes
No, our subjects are already angry enough!
translation: 民怨太高，还是另寻他法吧。

original: An army under the control of Li Zechang has risen up in rebellion! The mutinous soldiers are tired of years of corruption and little or no pay. They have the full backing of the people of China, who grow weary of the incompetent and corrupt rule of the Ming Dynasty. The rebel army is marching toward the capital, and we must act immediately or be overwhelmed! What shall we do?
translation: 李自成率部起义！士兵们已经受够了我们拖欠粮饷的做法.星星之火可以燎原，不堪压迫的各地百姓纷纷响应起义军.我们必须立即采取行动，否则情势将不堪收拾.

original: Let us attempt to destroy the traitor!

Due to recent events, it now seems that the Jesuits may have outlived their usefulness. Although their knowledge is great, it is foreign to us and sometimes causes much commotion among our scholars and the common folk, disrupting the stability of our realm. They have been for decades interfering in the internal affairs of our nation - the final straw was their meddling in the recent succession. Perhaps it is time for them to go.
translation: 从最近发生的事情来看，西洋传教士有百害而无一利。虽然他们的知识比我国先进，但是其毕竟是陌生的，上至学者下至百姓都会因此陷入混乱，严重影响我国社会稳定。数十年来他们一直在干扰我国内政，如今他们又试图插手立储之事。或许是时候驱逐他们了。

original: An up-and-coming minister has recently come to our attention. His name is Heshen, and he is certainly wise in the ways of diplomacy and administration. However, rumor has it that he is also grossly corrupt, mixing his political excellence with greed and favoritism. Should we appoint him our chief minister?
translation: 一个表现突出的大臣最近引起了我们的注意。他叫和珅，在外交和行政方面极具天赋。然而，同时有传闻说他非常腐败，其卓越政绩下往往掩藏着贪腐与徇私。我们是否应该任命他为内阁大学士？

original: No, such corruption could ruin the state!
translation: 不可，如此腐败会毁了我们的国家！

original: Reports have reached us that a diplomatic mission has arrived on our shores from the far-off western barbarian nation of England, led by a certain Lord Macartney. He is said to bring with him the friendly greetings of his King, ideas for facilitating the trade between our nations, and various mechanical wonders. Shall we receive this mission?
translation: 马戛尔尼爵士带来了一份来自极西之邦英吉利的外交信函.据说他是为两国友谊而来，希望促进两国之间的贸易还有文化交流.我国是否应该做出友善的回应？

original: Reject the overtures of these rude western devils!
translation: 天朝上国不需要蛮邦的友谊！

original: We are interested in hearing their ideas
Widespread rumors seem to indicate that the Cult of the White Lotus, a secret revolutionary society, is planning rebellion. What shall we do?
translation: 秘密反叛社团白莲教正在谋划叛乱的流言正在广泛流传。我们该如果处置？
听起来没什么了不起的

original: Erasmus was a humanist and the greatest scholar of the northern Renaissance, the first editor of the New Testament and also an important figure in patristics and classical literature who had great influence on theological debate during his life. As a man of the middle ground, his views made him a beacon for those who valued liberty more than orthodoxy.
translation: 伊拉兹马斯是文艺复兴时期的一位著名学者.他率先编撰了《新约》，对古典文化有极深的研究.他是所有珍视自由的人心目中的一座灯塔.

original: Hugo Grotius was a Dutch scholar and lawyer. His best known book 'De Jure Belli ac Pacis' published in 1625 was a legal masterpiece and laid the groundwork for modern international law. He is also famous for his celebrated escape from prison (where he was incarcerated due to political and religious conflicts) in a bookchest! He also wrote other legal and religious works and poetry.
translation: 胡果·格老秀斯，荷兰法学家、学者。其于1625年出版的法学巨著《战争与和平法》奠定了现代国际法基础。曾因卷入对约翰·加尔文预定论的解释演变的政治斗争之中被捕入狱，而后藏于书箱之中越狱成功。其著有许多法学及神学书籍以及诗作。

original: Huygens was a Dutch mathematician, astronomer and physicist who founded the wave theory of light, discovered the true shape of the rings of Saturn and made original contributions to the science of dynamics - the study of the action of forces on bodies. Forgotten until the early 19th century, his theories on light appear today as one of the most brilliant and original contributions to modern science and will always be remembered by the principle bearing his name.
translation: 荷兰物理学家、天文学家、数学家——克里斯蒂安·惠更斯.他创立了光的波动性理论，观测到土星的光环，研究基础理学.直到19世纪初，他的名字一直默默无闻.但现代人会永远记住他.
杰勒德墨卡托·德·克雷默

original: Flemish geographer, mathematician and cartographer. He studied in Louvain where he had a geographical establishment (1534). From 1537 to 1540 he surveyed and mapped Flanders. In 1538 he produced his first map of the world (based on Ptolemy's map)
translation: 弗兰德斯地理学家、数学家——杰勒德墨卡托·德·克雷默.长期从事地理研究.1538年他画出了他的第一份世界地图（基于托勒密所绘制地图）.

original: In the early 17th century when the northern part of the Netherlands had managed to hold the Spaniards at bay a political conflict started over which type of government the new country should have. Mauritz of Oranien wanted a monarchy while Oldenbarnevelt wanted a confederacy. The conflict ended with a confederacy of semi-autonomous provinces, hence its name, the United Provinces. Still a spark of monarchism was kept which later evolved into something more and lasting.
translation: 十七世纪初，尼德兰北部已经从西班牙统治下独立。人们围绕这新生国家的政治制度问题产生了分歧。奥拉宁的莫里茨支持君主制，奥尔登巴内费尔特赞成邦联制。最后两方达成妥协，成立了尼德兰联省，顾名思义，由半自治的省份组成的邦联。但是君主制的星星之火并未熄灭，随后卷入了闻名遐迩旷日持久的某事件。

original: Creation of the Amsterdam Stock Exchange
translation: 阿姆斯特丹证券交易所创立

original: In the wake of the creation of the Bank of Amsterdam (1609), the city's stock exchange had become more and more active. Having taken over from Antwerp the role of leading financial place, the stock exchange flourished. Funds from all over Europe would become available and loans were easily accessible, at rates unmatched anywhere else. This was enhanced by the capitalistic success of the Dutch East India Company (1602) and even of the less successful West India Trade Company (1621).
translation: 随着阿姆斯特丹银行的创立（1609），这座城市的证券交易变得越来越活跃。证券交易所蓬勃发展，取代了安特卫普在金融领域的领先地位。来自全欧洲的基金汇聚于此，贷款随手可得，且享有其他任何地方无法比拟的利率。这被荷兰东印度公司（1602）的资本主义成功，甚至西印度贸易公司（1621）略逊一筹的成功，所放大增值。

original: In 1621, at the end of the 12 year peace treaty with Spain, the Geoctroyeerde Westindische Compagnie was founded which mainly focused on privateering against the Spanish fleets. Apart from privateering, the objective was to establish as many colonies as possible in the Americas and conquer land. Famous exploits include Manhattan and Piet Heyn raiding the Spanish silver fleet.
translation: “1621年，在与西班牙12年和平协议的末尾，联省西印度公司成立，主要聚焦于以私掠船对抗西班牙舰队.除私掠以外，目标是在美洲建立尽可能多的殖民地和征服尽可能多的领地.著名战绩包括曼哈顿和皮埃特·海因对西班牙银色舰队的突袭.”
我们将会开发这里的贸易！

original: Johann, Count of Nassau-Siegen along with his cousin, Prince Maurits and brother Willem, were at the heart of the Dutch reforms. Relearning the lost skills of Classical armies from translation of Roman military manuals, they reorganized battle formations to make them more flexible and to increase firepower. It was Johann who was the brains behind the most famous of all drill manuals, de Gheyn's Wapenhandelinghe, and the founder of one of the first military academies at Siegen in Germany.
translation: “拿骚-锡根伯爵约翰，同他的表亲莫里斯亲王和兄弟威廉，处于荷兰改革的核心.他们从罗马军事手册译本中重新学习古典陆军的失落技艺，他们重新组织战斗编队以使部队更加灵活和提升火力，约翰是所有军事指南中最著名的《戈恩火器图鉴》的幕后智囊，也是德意志锡根第一批军事学院之一的创立者.”

original: In a clerical meeting in Dordrecht (1618-1619) hard-line Calvinism was made State-religion. This was the end of a long struggle between a pluralistic and humanitarian faction, the Arminians, and a dogmatic, narrow-minded 'True Calvinistic' faction, the Gomarists. Moritz of Oranien supported the Gomarists, composed mainly of petty bourgeois and farmers, while Oldenbarneveld supported the Arminians, composed of intellectuals and rich bourgeois.
translation: “在多德雷赫特的一次教士会议 (1618-1619)，强硬派加尔文宗被确立为国教.这是多元论和人道主义派系阿米尼乌斯派与顽固狭隘的“真加尔文主义”派系戈马尔派之间长期斗争的结局.奥兰治的莫里斯支持戈马尔派，其主要由小资产阶级和农民组成，而奥登巴内维尔德支持阿米尼乌斯派，其由知识分子和富裕资产阶级组成.”

original: In April 13 1598 Henry IV of France announced a new law called Édit De Nantes which granted the Huguenots a large portion of religious and civil rights. Almost a hundred years later his grandson, Louis XIV, striving for unity and stability in the realm, views the co-existence of the two churches as a potential source of disturbances. Having already allowed the persecution of Protestants and the burning of their churches, he revokes the Édit De Nantes in 1685. Within a few years, more than 400,000 Huguenots emigrated to England, Prussia, Holland, and America - depriving France of its most industrious commercial class.
translation: “1598年4月13日，法国的亨利五世颁布一条名为《南特敕令》的新法律，授予胡格诺教徒一大部分宗教和公民权利.将近100年后，他的孙子路易十四正为王国的统一和稳定而奋斗，将两种宗教的共存视为骚乱的潜在来源.在已允许迫害新教徒和焚烧他们的教堂后，他在1685年废除了《南特敕令》.几年内，超过400000名胡格诺教徒移居英格兰、普鲁士、荷兰和美洲——法国丧失了它最勤劳的商业阶级.”

original: We welcome you with open arms
translation: 我们张开双臂欢迎你们

original: Statholder office is made Hereditary in Oranien Dynasty
translation: 执政府制造奥兰治王朝世袭

original: Willem III came to the forefront of Dutch politics, eclipsing the brothers de Witt, amidst a growing support of the Orange dynasty amongst the Dutch people. After being named stadholder, the brothers de Witt resigned and were killed by an unruly mob because of high treason and anti Orangistic ideas. Building on the growing support for them the Oranges in August 1674 were declared hereditary in the stadholder office by the states of Holland and Zeeland.
translation: “威廉三世来到荷兰政治的最前沿，处在荷兰人民对奥兰治王朝上涨的支持氛围中，使德·威特兄弟黯然失色.在被提名为执政后，德威特兄弟辞职，并由于叛国罪和反对奥兰治理念被不受控制的暴民所杀.”以上涨的支持为基础，奥兰治家族在1674年被荷兰省和西兰省宣布在执政府中世袭.”

original: In June 1787, the secular conflict in the United Provinces between the supporters of the Stadhouder William V (grandson of the King of England George II) and the Republicans (supported by France) led to a diplomatic incident when the city officials of The Hague refused entrance to the Stadhouder's wife, the niece of Frederick II of Prussia (died in 1786 and was replaced by Frederick-William II, very hostile to France). Rapidly, Prussia intervened militarily to restore the Stadhouder's power and was not countered by France which was suffering a serious financial crisis. French influence nearly disappeared and Prussia triumphed.
translation: “1787年6月，联省共和国内执政威廉五世（英格兰国王乔治二世的孙子）的支持者与共和党人（受法国支持）之间的长久冲突引发了一场外交事件.当时海牙市政府官员拒绝执政的妻子、普鲁士腓特烈二世（死于1786年并被腓特烈-威廉二世取代，非常敌视法国）的侄女入境.很快，普鲁士以武力干预来恢复执政的权力，未遭到陷入严重金融危机的法国的还击.法国的影响力几近消失而普鲁士大获全胜.”

original: Jan De Witt had been Raadpensionaris (Great Pensioner) in 1653. Holland enjoyed under his guidance some of its most brilliant years. He also spent his life fighting the influence of the house of Orange, the traditional Stadhouder (military affairs) and managed to have the Act of Exclusion voted against them in 1667. However, the defeats in 1672 against France and England made the Orange party come back and have him imprisoned. On 20th August, 1672, he and his brother Cornelis were slaughtered by a mob incited by his political opponents.
translation: “1653年，简·德·威特已是荣退者了.荷兰在其光辉岁月里曾蒙他指引.他也毕生对抗传统执政（军务）奥兰治家族的势力，，并设法于1667年表决反对他们的《排斥法案》.然而，1672年对法国和英格兰的战败让奥兰治党卷土重来，把他灌进监狱.1672年8月20日，他和他的兄弟康纳里斯，被由政敌煽动起来的暴民所屠杀.”

original: Born in 1640, Anthony Hensius had enjoyed the confidence of William III of Orange all his life. Sent to Versailles after the peace of Nijmegen to supervise the execution of its clauses, he became Raad Pensionaris in 1688 after William moved to England. A tough negotiator and obstinate opponent of France, he was at the core of all anti-French coalitions that are set up in all the wars of the late 17th century. He died in 1720.
translation: “生于1640年的安东尼·汉休斯毕生享有威廉三世和奥兰治家族的信任.奈梅亨和约之后，他被送往凡尔赛监督条款的履行，1688年威廉移驾英格兰后他成为荣退者.作为对法国强硬的谈判者和顽固的对手，他处于17世纪晚期所有战争中的反法同盟的核心.卒于1720年.”

original: In the early 17th century Poland was one of the mightiest countries in the world, yet she had great problems. The trade and production of Eastern Europe were based along the Baltic Coast. There laid the future of the next major power in the area. The King saw this and tried to improve Polish position in these areas, but the Szlachta were not remotely interested. Her interests laid in the Ukraine and the lands where the Magnates could rule armies of serfs levied from their vast agricultural estates. This was the first disagreement between King Sigismund III and the Nobility. Another one was the matter of the religious freedom. The king never stopped working towards making the Catholic Faith the official religion in the country. However he was quite unsuccessful. The last disagreement was about Royal power. Sigismund was the grandson of the strong Swedish king Gustavus Wasa and he desired absolutism. Sigismund fought an uneven fight, but his struggle irritated the Poles so much that his reputation is tarnished to this very day. He also managed to upset people with his undiplomatic efforts to increase his power and because of that the Zebrzydowski rebellion stopped his effort for good.
translation: “在17世纪早期，波兰是世界上最强大的国家之一，但她也有巨大的问题.东欧的贸易和生产以波罗的海沿岸为基础，那里放置着该地区下一个主要强权的未来.国王知晓这点并试图提升这一地区波兰人的地位，但是施拉赤塔完全不关心.他们的利益位于乌克兰以及贵族们能从广袤的农业庄园上征召农奴军队的土地.这是国王齐格蒙特三世与贵族之间的第一个分歧.另一个是宗教自由问题.国王从未停止把天主教信仰确立为该国官方信仰的努力.然而他相当不成功.最后的分歧是关于王权.齐格蒙特是强大的瑞典国王古斯塔夫·瓦萨的孙子，他渴望专制主义.齐格蒙特打了一场实力悬殊的战斗，但他的斗争激怒了波兰人，以至于他的名声因这一天败坏.他为增加权力的无外交策略的行为也惹恼了人民，因此泽布日多夫斯基的叛乱阻止了他向善的努力.”

original: Fight a bitter but peaceful conflict
translation: 打一场尖锐但和平的仗

original: Resign completely and read theological books instead
Wage a war on the Nobility

The growing dissatisfaction of the Polish nobles, or szlachta, with the King Sigismund III Vasa was caused by their disapproval of the King's efforts to weaken the Sejm, the Polish parliament, and to replace the elective monarchy with a hereditary one. Mikolaj Zebrzydowski, Jan Szczesny Herburt, Stanislaw Stadnicki, Aleksander Józef Lisowski and Janusz Radziwill formed a rokosz, or semi-legal rebellion, in Stezyca and Lublin. The nobles gathered at the rokosz formed a konfederacja which outlined demands in 67 articles, demanding Sigismund III's dethronement for breaching the Henrykian Articles, the expulsion of the Jesuits from the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth and that the Sejm was to appoint state officials instead of the king. Protestant rights should be expanded and protected and local officials should be elected and not appointed.
translation: 波兰的贵族，亦即什拉赫塔们对国王西吉斯蒙德三世·瓦萨的不满日渐增长，因为他们反对国王削弱波兰国会「色姆」并用世袭制取代选王制的意图。米科拉伊·泽布日多斯基、扬·什琴斯尼·赫布特、斯坦尼斯瓦夫·斯塔德尼基、亚历山大·约瑟夫·利索夫斯基和雅努什·拉齐维尔等人在斯德日察和卢布林召开了罗科什大会——半合法的反叛。贵族们在罗科什大会共立盟约，列出了67条纲领，要求西吉斯蒙德三世因违反《亨利王约》而引咎退位、驱逐波兰立陶宛联邦的耶稣教士、国王向色姆交出国家官员的任免权、新教信徒的权利应当受到保护和扩大、地方官员应当由选举产生而不是上级任命。

original: Try to negotiate with the konfederacja

The Polish nobles had formed a konfederacja and demanded Sigismund III's dethronement, the expulsion of the Jesuits and that the Sejm should appoint state officials instead of the king. The Sejm or Polish parliament rejected their demands. Rebel nobles gathered in Guzów and the Royal Army was sent to pacify the rebels. Under the command of Hetman Jan Karol Chodkiewicz, the rebels were confronted by the Royal Army and led to the Battle of Guzów. The Royalist faction won the battle on July 6.
translation: “波兰贵族已经结成联盟要求齐格蒙特三世废位，从耶稣会中驱逐，以及色姆应取代国王掌管官员任命.色姆或叫波兰议会拒绝了他们的要求.反叛贵族集结在古佐王，王室军队前往平定叛乱.在海特曼·简·卡罗尔率领下，叛军遭遇王室军队，导致古佐战役.7月6日国王一派赢得战役.”

original: The Polish noble rebellion was over by 1609. The rebellious nobles formally surrendered to the king two years after the start of the revolt at the 1609 meeting of the Sejm. The meeting is known as the Pacification Sejm and the nobles surrendered in return for leniency. Hetman Chodkiewicz and many royal supporters successfully argued for amnesty for the rebels. The rebellion, although a failure, ruined any chance that Sigismund III had to strengthen his role in the government.
translation: “波兰贵族叛乱于1609年结束.叛乱贵族在造反开始两年后的1609年色姆会议向国王投降.这次会议被称为“恩抚色姆”，贵族投降以换取宽大处理.海特曼·考迪维茨和许多王室支持者为叛乱者成功争取到特赦.叛乱者，虽然失败了，但毁灭了齐格蒙特三世想要强化他在政府中角色的任何机会.”
贵族们已经正式投降了

original: On the death of the last Piast monarch in 1370, Polish nobles began drawing on ancient claims and historical precedent to assert their independence from the monarchy. At first, only a small part of the szlachta, or 'noble class', would assert its privilege to choose the next king (or, in 1384 and 1523 Queen, since they backed Jadwiga's and Anna's claims). But eventually the right to elect the ruler of Poland was extended to Polish nobles. Keep in mind that in Poland, nobility was inherited by all children of an entitled person, so at its peak, half a million Poles could claim a voice in the election - by far the widest possible franchise in Renaissance Europe and probably the largest 'democratic' system until American and French Republics. True royal elections began in 1573 at the election of Henry of Valois, since foreign princes were always claiming the Polish throne anyway, why not have the nobles choose among them.\n\nDuring the Commonwealth period, the Kings of Poland and Grand Princes of Lithuania were elected by noble gatherings at a field in Wola, just outside Warsaw. Tens of thousands of nobles could be expected to attend, and the richest magnates would mingle with the poorest count in exchanges of favors and votes. This first election took four days to conclude (future ones would be smaller and over in a day or two) and these events would be full of parties, fairs and armed men. While the election was going on, royal power would be vested in an interrex, a temporary regent - usually the Primate of Warsaw, who would oversee the voting.
translation: 1370年，皮亚斯特王朝的末代国王驾崩之后， 波兰贵族们开始稽考旧章，翻查先例，以便能使他们从君主制中独立。 起先，只有小部分的贵族能用他们的特权选出下任国王（在1384年和1523年是女王，因为他们支持雅德维加和安娜成为君主）。 但最终波兰能贵选举君主的贵族的人数增加了。值得注意的是，在波兰，贵族头衔由所有符合资格的人士的子女继承。 所以，再其鼎盛时期，五十万的波兰人可以行使他们的选举权——这说明波兰文艺复兴时期的欧洲是最大限度行使选举权的国家，可能也在美国和法国之前建立了最大的「民主」体制。真正的皇室选举于1573年选举瓦鲁瓦的亨利时肇始,由此开始，外国的诸王子们总来索取波兰王位，为什么贵族不选出他们这些王子中的一位继承王位呢？\n\n在波兰立陶宛联邦时期，波兰国王和立陶宛大公都由贵族们聚集在华沙郊区沃拉的田野选举而产生。数以万计的贵族可以出席，最富有的权贵会与最贫穷的伯爵攀谈，交流他们的支持和选票。 第一次选举结束四天后统计选举结果（未来几次间隔时间变短，只在一两天后就会统计选举结果）而且选举举行时会不时得举行聚会和交易会，军队也会全副武装。 选举进行时，临时执政者（通常是华沙的大主教，他将监督整个选举过程）会行使王权。

original: William, Prince of Orange, the leader of the Dutch Revolt in the Eighty Years' War founded the Leiden University in 1575 as the emerging Dutch Republic did not have any universities. Spain controlled southern Leuven where the only university in the Netherlands was. Prince William decided to found the first Dutch university in Leiden to educate citizens for religious purposes and give the country and its government educated men in other fields. Academic study had become important as the scientific renaissance had begun and Leiden was chosen as a reward for the heroic defense of Leiden against Spanish attacks in the previous year. Philip II of Spain appears on the official foundation certificate, as he was still the de jure count of Holland although he forbade any subject to study in Leiden.
translation: “奥兰治亲王威廉，八十年战争中荷兰起义的领袖，于1575年创办莱顿大学，因为新兴的尼德兰共和国还没有任何大学.西班牙控制的南方的鲁汶有尼德兰唯一的大学.威廉亲王决定在莱顿建立第一所荷兰大学，为宗教目的教化市民，并为国家和政府提供其它领域的受教育人才.学院学习因为科学复兴开始而变得重要，莱顿被选中是其在前一年抗击西班牙进攻的英雄壮举的报偿.西班牙菲利普二世出现在官方的奠基仪式，因为他仍是法理上的荷兰伯爵，尽管他禁止在莱顿的任何学科学习.”

original: The rise of Arminianism caused a National Synod to be held in Dordrecht by the Dutch Reformed Church to settle the divisive controversy initiated. On November 13, 1618, the Dutch Reformed Church and voting representatives from eight foreign Reformed churches held the first meeting. The last and final meeting was held on May 9, 1619 and was the 154th meeting. It settled the controversy over Arminianism, condemned it, rejected the Arminian views and set forth the Reformed doctrine on each point, namely total depravity, unconditional election, limited atonement, irresistible grace, and the perseverance of the saints. The Remonstrants, as the Arminians were known as, were directed to abstain from ministerial activities such as preaching, exhorting, administering the sacraments, and visiting the sick. They were also requested to sign The Act of Cessation, the legalization of the order to desist from the ministry but refused to sign it and were sentenced as 'disturbers of the public peace' and ordered to leave the United Provinces. The Synod condemned the religious doctrine of Arminianism as heresy.
translation: 阿米纽派的崛起导致荷兰归正会在多德雷赫特召开全国宗教会议，来解决分歧与争端。1618年11月13日，荷兰归正会和来自国外的八个改革宗教会的票选代表举行了第一次会议；第154次会议，也是最终会议于1619年5月9日举行。该会议平息了围绕阿米纽派的分歧，谴责该派，驳斥阿米纽派观点，并逐点阐释了改革宗派教义，即性恶论、无条件拣选、有限赎罪、不可抗恩典、一次得救永远得救.”抗辩派，或被称作阿米纽派，被指定禁绝牧师活动，如布道、劝诫、施行圣礼、探访病患等。他们也被要求签署《休止法令》，也就是在政府任命的教会中不作任何教职的工作，并且不可写信函或书籍以推广抗辩派的学说。当阿米纽派的牧师拒绝签字时，他们被判刑「扰动公众安宁」，并责令离开联合省。宗教会议最终宣布阿米纽派教义为异端。

original: The Synod of Dort deemed it necessary to translate the Bible into Dutch as the existing Dutch Bibles were merely translations of other translations. The new translation, the Statenbijbel, was to be based on the original languages in imitation of the King James Bible from 1611. The States-General of the Netherlands commissioned it on the request of the Synod. Johannes Bogerman, Willem Baudartius and Gerson Bucerus were to be the translators for the Old Testament while Jakobus Rolandus, Herman Faukelius, and Petrus Cornelisz would translate the New Testament and apocrypha. Both Herman Faukelius and Petrus Cornelisz died before the translation had started and thus were replaced by Festus Hommius and Antonius Walaeus. The Statenbijbel was completed in 1635 and authorized by the States-General in 1637. Half-a-million copies were printed between 1637 and 1657. The Statenbijbel acted as a cultural unification of the Netherlands and the language, choice of words, and expressions used in the Bible formed the basis of the accepted form of standardized Dutch.
translation: “多德教会会议断定有必要将《圣经》翻译成荷兰语，因为现行荷兰圣经只是翻译自其它语言译本.新的译本，《国译圣经》，将基于原始语言，模仿1611年詹姆士国王钦定版圣经.尼德兰议会应教会会议要求委托此事.约翰尼斯·伯格曼，威廉·巴达修斯和吉尔森·贝赛鲁斯将任《旧约》译者，而雅克布斯·罗兰德斯，赫尔曼·法考留斯和佩特鲁斯·科奈里斯将翻译《新约》和外典.赫尔曼·法考留斯和科奈里斯在翻译开始前死去，由法图斯·荷谬斯和安东尼乌斯·瓦里奥斯替代.《国译圣经》于1635年完成，1637年由议会批准.五十万份复印本在1637年到1657年间印出.《国译圣经》扮演了尼德兰文化统一的角色，而圣经所用的语言和遣词造句，形成了对标准荷兰人接受形式的基本原则.”

original: The Flemish mathematician and military engineer Simon Stevin was active in many areas of science and engineering, both theoretical and practical. The Dutch word for mathematics, wiskunde or 'the art of what is certain', was Stevin's own translation and makes Dutch one of the few European languages where 'mathematics' is not derived from Greek via Latin. He invented a carriage with sails which was propelled solely by the force of wind, and acquired a speed which exceeded that of horses. De Thiende, written by Stevin and published in 1585 is translated in English as 'Decimal arithmetic: Teaching how to perform all computations whatsoever by whole numbers without fractions, by the four principles of common arithmetic: namely, addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.'.
translation: 弗拉芒数学家和军事工程师西蒙·斯特芬活跃于科学和工程学的许多领域，既重理论又务实践。荷兰语中数学一词，wiskunde，意为「确定之物的艺术」，是由斯特芬自己的翻译，使得荷兰语中的该词成了少数不经由拉丁文从希腊文中提取「数学」一词的欧洲语言之一。他发明了只靠风力推进的带帆四轮车，并取得了超过马拉四轮车的速度。《论十进制》，斯特芬写作并出版于1585年的著作，在译成英文时书名为《十进制算：教你如何运用四则运算执行所有分数之外的整数计算》。

original: The anthem Wilhelmus or Wilhelmus van Nassouwe is very popular with parts of the Dutch population and will, in 1932, become recognized as the official national anthem of the Netherlands. Willem van Oranje or William of Orange is the main character of the anthem which tells of him, his life and why he is fighting against the King of Spain, written in a first person perspective. For a national anthem, the text and tune of the song are remarkably peaceful.
translation: “赞歌《威廉颂》或称《威廉·凡·那叟》中荷兰人民和意志的部分非常流行，1932年被认定为荷兰的官方国歌.威廉·凡·奥兰治或叫奥兰治的威廉是歌曲的主角，歌曲讲述他和他的一生，以及他为何与西班牙国王作战，以第一人称视角写成.作为国歌，其内容和曲调相当平和.”

original: The tulip was introduced in Europe in the 1550s from the Ottoman Empire. They quickly became popular among the rich merchants in the Netherlands as a luxury item. The market grew, and in 1634 when demand increased in France, speculators entered the market. In 1636, a futures market was created, and during the autumn and winter the prices skyrocketed until the prices collapsed in February 1637. The result was the bankruptcy of many, and economic disaster.
translation: 郁金香在1550年代从奥斯曼帝国引入欧洲。它们很快成为荷兰富商中的一种奢侈品。市场开始种植，并且在1634年法国需求增加时，投机者进入市场。1636年，一个期货市场被创造出来，在秋冬季节，价格飙升，直到1637年2月价格暴跌。结果导致许多人破产，引发经济灾难。

original: The State could alleviate the losses!
The Tulip Crisis was due to insane speculation on the prices of Tulips, causing many people to lose all their money when the demand and prices collapsed.
translation: 郁金香危机是由对郁金香价格的疯狂投机所引起的，它使得许多人在郁金香的需求和价格垮掉时失去了所有财富。

original: [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] [Root.Monarch.GetName] was not only a great conqueror but also a great consolidator and reformer. His competent rule laid the foundation for the resurrected Persian state. The people, who had suffered terribly under Tamerlane and the Turkmen tribes, regarded their Shah as a saint and set to their tasks with great enthusiasm.
translation: [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] [Root.Monarch.GetName]不仅是一名伟大的征服者，他还是一名伟大的建设者和改革家。他称职的统治奠定了重生的波斯之基石。饱受帖木儿和土库曼部落残暴统治的人民将他们的伊朗王看做是圣人，并以饱满的热情投入工作。

original: The Reforms of Abbas the Great

The reign of Shah Abbas the Great marked the pinnacle of the Safavid dynasty. He developed a disciplined standing army, crushed the Uzbeks and avenged himself on the Ottomans. In 1598, he chose Isfahan as his new capital. A supporter of the arts, especially architecture, he adorned Isfahan with some of the finest Islamic monuments in the world. He built a number of mosques, schools, bridges and a major bazaar. During his reign, Persian craftsmen and artists excelled in creating fine silks, cloths, porcelain, metalwork, calligraphy, miniatures and carpets.
translation: “沙阿阿拔斯大帝的统治标志着萨菲王朝的极盛.他发展出一只纪律严明的军队，碾碎乌兹别克人，并向奥斯曼报了仇.1598年，他选择伊斯法罕作为新都城.作为艺术支持者，尤其是建筑艺术，他用世上最出色的伊斯兰纪念碑装饰伊斯法罕.他建立一批清真寺、学校、桥梁和一座大巴扎.他当政期间，波斯工匠和艺术家擅长于制作精美的丝绸、服装、瓷器、金属制品、书法、微雕和地毯.”

original: The Advisors of Abbas the Great

Shah Abbas greatly admired the military skills of the Western Europeans and gladly accepted Christian missionaries to his realm, even pretending to be on the verge of converting himself. The Shah finally secured the help of two Englishmen - Anthony and Robert Sherley - to reform the Persian army and navy. The results were not long in coming. Abbas took Bahrain from the Portuguese and sacked their base at Hormuz. The European advisors, however, were not popular in all quarters...
translation: “沙阿阿拔斯极为欣赏西欧的君是技艺，乐意接纳基督教传教士到他的王国，甚至自己假装濒临皈依了.沙阿最终争取到两名英格兰人——安东尼和罗伯特·雪莉——的帮助来改革波斯陆海军.结果不久显现.阿拔斯从葡萄牙人手中夺取巴林并洗劫了他们在霍尔木兹的基地.那些欧洲顾问，然而，在所有地区都不受欢迎？？”

original: Safavid power was based on the Kizilbash (Shiite Turkmen) tribesmen of Asia Minor who originally defeated the Ak Koyunlu. Unfortunately, the clans were unruly, constantly fighting each other and vying for control of the Shah. Under Abbas they were kept on a tight leash, but with his passing Persia was once more plagued by their infighting. Eventually their power waned, but they were only to be replaced by rebellious warlords from Afghanistan and Baluchistan in the 18th century.
translation: “萨菲的权力基于亚洲少数的奇兹巴什（什叶派土库曼）部族，他们原本打败了白羊王朝.不幸的是这些宗族难以驾驭，时常相互斗争并争夺沙阿的控制权.在阿拔斯治下，他们被拴在一条牢固的皮带上，但随着他逝去，波斯再次被他们的内讧所折磨.他们的权力逐渐衰减，但竟会被18世纪时来自阿富汗和俾路支的反叛军阀所取代.”

original: Buy the loyalty of the Clans

The death of Abbas consigned Iran to a long and painful slide into chaos. The decline resulted from weak rulers, interference by the women of the harem in politics, the re-emergence of Kizilbash rivalries, maladministration of state lands, excessive taxation, the decline of trade, and the weakening of Safavid military organization.
translation: “阿拔斯的死令伊朗长期而痛苦地滑向混乱.衰落起因于暗弱的统治者，受影响于后宫干政、奇兹巴什对抗的重现、省份土地的暴政、过度征税、贸易衰退，以及萨菲军事组织的弱化.”

original: The Afghans, under the leadership of Mir Ways, have risen up in rebellion in their home provinces!
translation: “阿富汗人，在米尔·维斯的率领下，已在他们的母省起兵反叛了！”

original:
The aging ruler of the Timurid Empire, Shah Rukh, has been ill since the beginning of 1444. In his absence his wife, Goharshad, had taken over the daily rule of the empire but this sign of weakness has set wheels in motion among the princes that rule the Timurid provinces.

In western Iran the young prince Muhammad Baysonqor, an ambitious grandson, has started to accept taxes and tokens of loyalty from a much larger region than his assigned governorate. Having finally recovered and learned of this insolence Shah Rukh has now declared Muhammad Baysonqor a rebel and is moving to strike at him at first opportunity.
If a civil war among all sons and grandsons, like that at the end of Timurs life, is to be avoided Shah Rukh knows he must strike down any sign of rebellion harshly and quickly.
translation:
帖木儿帝国日益衰老的统治者，沙哈鲁，从1444年开头就已身患重病。在他缺席之时，他的妻子高哈儿绍德接管了帝国每日的统治，但是皇帝衰弱的迹象让统治帖木儿各个省份的王子蠢蠢欲动起来。

在西部伊朗，年轻的王子穆罕默德-拜宋豁儿，一个野心勃勃的皇孙，已经开始在远超他被任命的辖区的土地上收税与收买人心。现在沙哈鲁康复过来得知了他的大逆不道，宣布穆罕默德-拜宋豁儿是谋逆者，正准备第一时机对其进行征讨。
沙哈鲁明白，如果要避免像帖木儿晚年那样所有子孙爆发内战，他必须以强硬手段将任何谋反的迹象迅速扼杀。

original: Only time will tell what the other princes will do.
translation: 只有时间能告诉我们其他王子会怎么做。

original: As long as §YShah Rukh§! lives, as the ruler of the §YTimurids§! he will greatly reduce the liberty desire of the remaining vassal countries ruled by his sons and grandsons.
translation: 只要 §Y沙哈鲁§! 还活着并作为 §Y帖木儿§! 的统治者，他将极大的减少由他子孙统治着的其余附庸国的独立倾向。

original: After a lifetime of war and iron fisted rule, Timur's heir and son, Shah Rukh, has finally passed on. His life's work has been to keep the empire his father built together, unifying it after Timur's death and then stamping out any rebellions against his own rule.\nShah Rukh brought peace to many parts of the empire and under his rule the arts and sciences have blossomed. During his last years he has been ill often, however, and his sons and cousins have used this time to prepare for the inevitable war of succession.
translation: 经历了一生的征战与铁腕统治，帖木儿的继承者与儿子沙哈鲁溘然长逝。他穷尽一生维护他父亲建立的帝国的团结，在帖木儿死后维持统一并且消灭任何反对他统治的叛乱。\n沙哈鲁为他帝国的大部分土地带来了和平，在他统治之下艺术与科学蓬勃发展。在生命的最后几年，他经常卧病，然而他的儿子们与堂兄弟们则趁机准备不可避免的继承战争。

original: §RWe will no longer have the benefit of the reputation of Shah Rukh and the Timurid vassal princes will therefore most likely start to plot for the throne themselves.§!
translation: §R我们将不再受益于沙哈鲁的威望，帖木儿附庸的王子们因此将更可能开始密谋夺取皇位。§!

original: After a lifetime of war and iron fisted rule, Timur's heir and son, Shah Rukh, has finally passed on. His life's work has been to keep the empire his father built together, unifying it after Timur's death and then stamping out any rebellions against his own rule.\nShah Rukh brought peace to many parts of the empire and under his rule the arts and sciences have blossomed. During his last years he has been ill often and his sons and cousins have used this time to prepare for the inevitable war of succession.
translation: 经历了一生的征战与铁腕统治，帖木儿的继承者与儿子沙哈鲁溘然长逝。他穷尽一生维护他父亲建立的帝国的团结，在帖木儿死后维持统一并且消灭任何反对他统治的叛乱。\n沙哈鲁为他帝国的大部分土地带来了和平，在他统治之下艺术与科学蓬勃发展。在生命的最后几年，他经常卧病，他的儿子们与堂兄弟们却趁机准备不可避免的继承战争。

original: The §YTimurids§! will no longer have the benefit of the reputation of Shah Rukh and all vassal princes will therefore most likely start to plot for the throne themselves.
translation: §Y帖木儿§!将不再受益于沙哈鲁的威望，所有附庸的王公们因此将更有可能密谋夺取皇位。

original: We can now use the decision §YEnthrone Timurid Prince§! to invite a Timurid claimant to rule our country if we fulfill its requirements.
translation: 如果满足要求，我们现在可以使用 §Y拥立帖木儿的继承者§!的决议，邀请一位帖木儿王位宣称者统治我们的国家。

original: The Disintegration of the Timurid Empire

Ulugh Beg had earlier been viceroy of Transoxiana. After his succession to the throne the Timurid Empire fell into anarchy, the Turkmen horde known as the White Sheep conquered much land, while the Uzbeks looted Samarkand. Petty princes took over the rule, and local dynasties sprang up.
translation: 兀鲁伯早前曾是河中地区的总督。在继承皇位后，帖木儿帝国陷入政治混乱，被称为“白羊”的土库曼部落趁机侵占了许多领土，同时撒马尔罕也遭到了乌兹别克人的劫掠。一些小贵族也趁机割据，地方王朝迅速涌现。
波斯的伊斯玛仪派复兴

original: Ismaïl emerged at the age of 14 to take his father's position as head of the Kizilbash (a Shiite Turkmen tribe). He quickly established a base of power in north-western Persia, and in 1501 he took the city of Tabriz and proclaimed himself Shah of Iran. In a succession of swift conquests he crushed the Ak Koyunlu (White Sheep Turks) and resurrected the nation of Iran under his Safavid dynasty.
translation: 伊斯玛仪14岁时接过父亲位置，成为奇兹巴什（一什叶派土库曼部落名）的首领。他迅速在波斯西北建立起权力根基，于1501年夺取大不里士城并自封为伊朗沙阿。接踵而来的一系列征战中，他击溃了白羊王朝，后来他的萨菲王朝完成了伊朗的复国。

original: Our illustrious monarch, [Root.Monarch.GetName], has indicated that he desires to build a grand observatory so that Samarkand will become the center of astronomical learning for the entire world. His beliefs are summarized by the words he wishes to have carved on its walls: 'Religions rise and fall, empires crumble into dust, but the works of science are for all time'.\nHowever noble his intentions, such projects are very costly however...
translation: 我们杰出的国王，[Root.Monarch.GetName]，表明他想要建立一个大天文台，以便撒马尔罕成为整个世界天文学研究的中心。他希望在天文台的墙壁上雕刻的文字总结了他的信念：「宗教兴起与衰落，帝国终归土灰，唯有科学成果永存」。\n无论他的目的有多么高尚，这个工程终究是非常昂贵的……

original: We have neither the time nor the money for such foolishness!
translation: 我们没时间也没钱来对付这些庸才！

original: Having long served the various masters of the Deccan the Marathas have perfected the guerrilla like warfare of that plateau. Unlike many of the peoples we have come across their leaders have not integrated well within our nobility, instead they are fortifying their hill forts and building a power base of their own.
translation: 经年服役于德干诸王的马拉塔人，已经将高原上的游击型战术打磨到了极致。与其他良好地融入我国贵族的其他民族的高层不同，他们反倒着手修葺他们的山地堡垒，为自己的势力打造基地。

original: We must crush any shred of separatism!
translation: 我们必须粉碎一切分离主义苗头！

original: The Emperor has proposed sweeping reforms in order to modernize and restructure our state. These include economic reforms, a better tax-gathering system, a streamlined bureaucracy, and military restructuring. However, such a plan will be expensive and will cause a fair amount of resentment among the populace, the bureaucracy, and the military. Shall we implement the reforms?
translation: 皇帝准备大刀阔斧改革，力求将国家重构，成为现代化国家.改革包括经济改革、改善税制、官僚改革、重整军事.不过，改革一方面很昂贵，而且更会招怨于国人、官员，还有军人.我们应否实施这将改革？

original: The Guru of the Sikhs has come to our capital to explain his sect's heterodox teachings. Sikhism is a mixture of Hindu and Islamic beliefs, and the Emperor feels such teachings are a heresy to Islam. However, any actions we take against him will have repercussions in our Sikh provinces, where the Guru is revered as a holy man. What shall we do with this accused heretic?
translation: 锡克教的导师来到首都，向我们解释他们教派的邪说.锡克教是印度教与伊斯兰教的混合体.皇帝认为这种学说根本就是伊斯兰正信的异端.不过，任何对付他的手段都有后果，因为这个导师在锡克教流行的地区被视为圣人.我们要怎样对付这个有罪的异教徒？

original: The Afghans, under the leadership of Mir Ways, have risen up in rebellion in their home provinces!
translation: “阿富汗人，在米尔·维斯的率领下，已在他们的母省起兵反叛了！”

original: Turko-Persian Conflicts: Persians take advantage of Ottoman instability
translation: 土波冲突：波斯利用奥斯曼内部的问题

original: The Spahi revolts in Eastern Anatolia encouraged the Persian Shah to seek revenge for the humiliating losses incurred by Murad III. War broke out yet again in 1603.
translation: 阿尔及利亚人在安纳托利亚东部的叛乱鼓励波斯国王寻求报复穆罕默德III给予的屈辱的.战争于1603年再次爆发.

original: Sire, the people of Mysore have grown tired of our rule and are uniting to demand their independence!
translation: 大人，迈索尔人已经受不住我们的统治，联合起来反叛，谋求独立！

original: The poet, philosopher, musician and composer Kanaka Dasa was called Thimmappa Nayaka until he, as a young boy, found a treasure-trove of gold and became known as Kanaka Nayaka - Kanaka means gold in Kannada - he never used the gold for himself. His full name, Kanaka Dasa, was given to him by the scholar Vyasaraja who Kanaka Dasa was a follower of. Born into a warrior community, Kanaka Dasa gave up his profession as a warrior when he suffered a severe injury in a war and was miraculously saved. He devoted his life to composing music and literature with philosophy explained in common man's language. His major works was Nalacharitre, Haribhaktisara, Nrisimhastava, Ramadhanyacharitre and Mohanatarangini.
translation: 诗人卡那卡·达萨，除了是一位哲学家，更是精于音乐与作曲.他原名廷玛巴·那雅卡，年轻时，他挖出一个黄金宝藏，从此被称为卡那卡·那雅卡，卡那卡在卡纳达语里就是黄金的意思.他从来没有将那笔黄金用在自己身上.卡那卡·达萨则是他的毗奢拉惹导师给他起的名字.卡那卡·达萨原是战士出身，但他在一场战争中，奇迹地从重伤中获救后，便舍弃战士本业，转而从事作曲与文学创作，以老妪能通的语言说明哲学道理.主要作品有《那罗故事》、《黑天得道之门》、《那罗辛哈颂》、《一钵小米的故事》、《黑天之河》.

original: This man is vital to our empire!
Send him out to spread his wisdom throughout our land

Kempe Gowda, one of Vijayanagara Empire's local rulers, is building a Nandi temple in the Vijayanagara architectural style. A large granite Nandi monolith will be placed on a plinth in the temple shrine (garbhagriha) and it will only consists of the shrine fronted by a porch. It will also house one of the largest Nandi murthis in the world. The height of the murthi is approximately 4.6 m and it is approximately 6.1 m long. The sacred bull known as Nandi, the close devotee and attendant of Shiva, will be worshiped at the temple. The humble Kempe Gowda has asked for a small donation to help fund the Nandi temple.
translation: 肯佩·高达是一位著名的毗奢耶那伽罗地方领主，他正要建造一所毗奢耶那伽罗风格的南迪神庙。他打算在门廊前的胎室，安放一尊巨大的花岗岩南迪像。这尊南迪化身估计有四点六米高、六点一米长，将会是世上最大的南迪化身。南迪就是人称的神牛，是湿婆神最忠实的随从。肯佩·高达正谦恭地请求我们捐出一笔不多的款项，资助新的南迪神庙。
给他们派几个出色的老匠师

original: The Veerabhadra Temple will set a wonderful example of the Vijayanagara Architectural style and art. The Vishwakarma Brahmin stapathis has already agreed to sculpt the temple dedicated to the deity Veerabhadra. The inside of the shrine will be exquisite, with a wealth of magnificent sculpture in the intricate mandapams. One mandapam shall have pillars with life-size images of dancers, musicians and other sculptures, created by the artisans of our empire. The huge granite Nandi bull promised to be made by the Vishwakarma Brahmin stapathis will be carved out of a single stone and the ceilings will have breathtakingly beautiful mural paintings. The only problem is money...
translation: 毗罗婆多罗神庙将会是毗奢耶那伽罗建筑艺术的典范。维什瓦卡马·婆罗门雕刻师已同意负责神庙的雕塑：大量华丽的雕刻，布满错综复杂的曼达帕殿堂，非常精美。其中一个曼达帕还会有等身大的舞者与乐师像充当廊柱。维什瓦卡马·婆罗门匠师还说要用一块巨大的花岗石刻成一座巨大的南迪牛像；天花上还会有多彩美艳的壁画，美得令人喘不过气。现在问题只在于钱……

original: In the year of 1566 AD, the Vellore Fort was built by Chinna Bommi Nayak and Thimma Reddy Nayak, Chieftains under the Vijayanagara Empire. Its grand ramparts, wide moat and robust masonry have made it famous and it was constructed in granite from the nearby quarries in Arcot and Chittor districts. Inside the fort is a temple dedicated to Jalagandeeswar and noted for its sculptures.
translation: 1566年，毗奢耶那伽罗帝国两位土王，钦纳·博米·纳亚克与蒂马·雷迪·纳亚克，修建了韦洛尔城。此城有巨大的城壁、宽阔的城濠，石工艺坚实有力，闻名遐迩。建城所用的花岗岩，来自附近阿尔果德、奇陶尔一带的石矿场。城内还有惹拉甘地斯瓦拉的神庙，其中的雕刻相当引人注目。

original: Build a fort that will outshine the Vellore fort!
translation: 建一座更好的城，光芒要盖过韦洛尔！

original: The great Vijayanagar Emperor Krishna Deva Raya earned the titles Andhra Bhoja, Mooru Rayara Ganda - 'King of three Kings' - and Kannada Rajya Rama Ramana - 'Lord of the Kannada empire'. By defeating the Sultans of Bijapur, Golconda and the Raja of Odisha, Krishna Deva Raya became the most powerful ruler of the southern peninsula of India. The king was not only an able administrator, but also an excellent general, leading from the front in battle and even attending to the wounded. Together with his Prime Minister Timmarusu, the king administered the Kingdom well, maintained peace in the land and increased the prosperity of the people.
translation: 伟大的毗奢耶那伽罗大王克里希纳·德瓦·拉亚，号称“安德拉·博贾，穆鲁·拉亚拉·甘达”-“三王之王”、和“坎纳达·拉贾·拉马·拉马纳”-“坎纳达帝国之主”。他击败比贾普尔与戈尔孔达的苏丹，还有奥里萨的拉贾，使毗奢耶那伽罗成为印度半岛南部最强大的国家.克里希纳·德瓦·拉亚内政修明，同时又是个不世将材，作战时经常身先士卒，往往负伤而归。他在宰相蒂马鲁苏辅助下，政通人和，百姓富足，帝国鼎盛。

original: The female poet Molla, born in a potters' family in Kadapa, translated the Sanskrit Ramayana into Telugu. She claimed Lord Shiva as her Guru and drew inspiration from the poet Potana, who wrote Bhagavata Purana in Telugu. Though she wrote the story of Rama, Molla refused to dedicate her Ramayana to any king according to general practice for poets. Krishnadevaraya invited her to his Royal court where she recited Ramayana in front of him and his poets. Molla primarily used simple Telugu and only used Sanskrit words very rarely, and her work known as Molla Ramayana is written in Telugu. The opening poem in Molla Ramayana says - 'Ramayana had been written many times. Does someone stop taking food because it has been taken every day? So is the story of Rama and one can write, read and love it as many number of times as possible.'
translation: 女诗人摩罗，生于卡达帕一个诗人世家，是她将梵文《罗摩衍那》翻译成泰卢固文的.她宣称湿婆神是她的导师，而灵感则来自波塔那，就是那位将《薄伽梵往世书》翻译成泰卢固文的诗人.虽然她能写出罗摩的故事，但摩罗谨守诗人的习例，拒绝将译本献给任何一位国王.黑天提婆王曾邀请摩罗到其王廷前，吟诵《罗摩衍那》与他的诗作.摩罗基本上都是用泰卢固语创作，很少用到梵语词汇.《摩罗罗摩衍那》就是用泰卢固文写成的.她在《摩罗罗摩衍那》序章写道：“《罗摩衍那》，覆诵无数；谁以甘饴常在，而鄙谈美食？罗摩故事，着之录之，诵之爱之，无世无之，理固而然.”

original: Considered the first Telugu poetess, Tallapaka Tirumalamma was born into a Brahmin's family and wrote Subhadra Kalyanam. Its 1170 poems are about the marriage of Arjuna and Subhadra. She was the famous singer-poet Annamacharya's wife.
translation: 相传第一位泰卢固女诗人，他拉帕伽·提鲁玛拉玛出身于婆罗门家庭.她的代表作是《妙贤出嫁》，以总共1170首诗歌，描绘阿周那与妙贤的结合.她也是著名的吟游诗人安南马查拉之妻.

original: The emperor Sri Krishna Deva Raya who ruled the Vijayanagara Empire from 1509 until his death in 1529, during which he patronized eight Telugu poets called Astadiggajas. The eight poets Allasani Peddana, Nandi Thimmana, Madayyagari Mallana, Dhurjati, Ayyalaraju Ramambhadrudu, Pingali Surana, Ramarajabhushanudu, and Tenali Ramakrishnudu were regarded as the eight pillars of his literary assembly. The Prabandha Age, as the age of Astadiggajsa is called, continued from 1540 AD to 1600. The court of poets were also called Bhuvana Vijayam or Conquest of the World.
translation: 斯里·克里希纳·德瓦·拉亚自从1509年起就统治毗奢耶那伽罗帝国，直至1529年驾崩为止.他在位时，曾资助八位泰卢古诗人，号称“诗坛八象”。这八位诗人是阿拉萨尼·佩达纳、南迪·蒂马纳、马达亚加里·马拉纳、杜贾蒂、阿亚拉拉久·拉曼巴德鲁杜、平加利·苏拉纳、拉马拉贾布沙努杜、泰纳利·拉马克里希努杜，是克里希纳·德瓦·拉亚文学盛会的八位支柱。普拉班达时代，也就是诗坛八象时代，从1540年持续到1600年，他们论诗的庭园，更被称为“布瓦纳维贾雅姆”或者说“世界征服之堂”。

original: The scholar Vyasatirtha is acclaimed as one of the three spiritual lights or munitrayam of dvaita Vedanta. Even his opponents admired his clear understanding and exposition of all his opposing schools of thought. A master at debate and dialogue in logic and philosophy, Vyasatirtha had great influence over the Vijayanagar Empire under Shri Krishnadevaraya reign. The king had the greatest regard and respect for Vyasatirtha. Shri Krishnadevaraya regarded the scholar as nothing less than his kuladevata and Guru. Vyasatirtha's famous works include Nyayamritam - The nectar of Logic, Tarkatandava - The Dance of Logic, Tatparya Chandrika - The Moonbeams of commentary, Mayavada Khandana Mandaramanjari, Upadhi Khandana Mandaramanjari, Prapancha Mithyatvanumana Khandana Mandaramanjari, Tattvaviveka Mandaramanjari, Bhedojjivana and Sattarkavilasa.
translation: 学者维亚萨蒂塔，人称二元论吠檀多三大灵性之光之一，即使不赞同他的学说，也会为他对其他学派的理解与阐述而折服。维亚萨蒂塔是一位辩论大师，言谈间尽是逻辑与哲理，在斯里·克里希纳·德瓦·拉亚的年代，他的影响力遍及全国，国王亦对他无比敬重。斯里·克里希纳·德瓦·拉亚将维萨亚蒂塔视为与家神及导师同等重要。维萨亚蒂塔的重要著作包括：《尼亚亚姆里塔姆》（《逻辑的甘露》）、《塔卡坦达瓦》（《逻辑的舞姿》）、《塔特帕里亚》（《月光评》）、《马亚瓦达坎达纳曼达拉曼贾里》、《乌帕迪坎达纳曼达拉曼贾里》、《普拉潘恰米蒂亚特瓦努马纳坎达纳曼达拉曼贾里》、《塔特瓦维韦卡曼达拉曼贾里》、《贝多吉瓦纳》、《萨塔卡维拉萨》。
波隆摩·戴莱洛迦纳改革

original: King Boromo Trailokanat has proposed various reforms in order to streamline the government of the state. While many of these proposals make great sense, they will also be expensive and may cause unrest. What shall we do?
translation: 波隆摩·戴莱洛迦纳王提议几项改革令政府更有效率，虽然方案大多十分合理，但也都很昂贵，而且会引发国内不稳。我们要怎么办？
摩诃·查克腊帕军队改革

original: King Maha Chakkrap'at has proposed various reforms for our military forces, including the training of a full-time professional elephant brigade. While many of these proposals make great sense, they will also be expensive and may cause unrest. What shall we do?
translation: 摩诃·查克腊帕王提议改革军事，包括训练一支专业的象兵队。改革方案十分不错，但是要花费一笔大钱，而且会引起国内不稳。我们要怎么办？

original: King Prasat T'ang has proposed various reforms concerning trade and the economic well-being of our kingdom. While many of these proposals make great sense, they will also be expensive and may cause unrest. What shall we do?
translation: 帕拉塞·东王提出几项针对贸易和经济表现的改革，改革立意不错，但是要花费很多钱，而且会引起国内不稳。我们要怎么办？

original: King Ekit'at is an utter fool who is a disaster as king of this land. He ignores the duties of government, preferring to spend his days in endless parties and bouts of drinking and debauchery. Meanwhile, the kingdom is falling to part, and our neighbors eagerly circle like vultures moving in on their prey. Unfortunately, the king refuses all advice to take a more active role in the government, thus causing the nation to slide further into chaos.
translation: 厄伽陀王是一个彻底的蠢材，他即位为王，如同为这片土地带来灾难。他终日吃喝玩乐，不理国政。不久，王国便四分五裂，邻国如兀鹫环伺，等候王国破灭的一刻。不幸地，国王拒绝一切意见，不肯对国事多加留心，这将要令我国陷入混乱之中。

original: Why are we stuck with such an incompetent fool?
translation: 为什么我们会摊上这个不可救药的傻子？

original: The Foundation of the Modern Thai State

The chaos of King Ekit'at's reign is now behind us, and the new king, Phya Taksin, has placed the nation on a new course. He wishes to refound the state by moving its capital a few miles to Bangkok and undertaking a thorough administrative reform. Should we follow his wishes?
translation: 厄伽陀王带来的乱局已经远去，而我们的新国王披耶·达信将我国带上一条新轨道。他希望以迁都重新建立这个国家，决定在几哩外的曼谷营造新城，并彻底改革行政制度。我们应否圆他的愿？

original: It is the beginning of a new era!

The king Prasat Thong constructed the first temple of his reign in 1630, the Wat Chaiwatthanaram, as a memorial of his mother. The temple's name means 'Temple of long reign and glorious era' and it was designed in Khmer style. Religious ceremonies and the cremation of princes and princess were held there. One hundred and twenty sitting Buddha statues, painted and black and gold, adorn the wall. Eight chedi-shaped chapels surrounds the central platform, the exterior walls decorated by 12 reliefs depicting scenes from the life of Buddha and painted inside., which must be 'read' clockwise. In each of the rectangular chedis are two sitting Buddha statues and in each of the four middle chedis is one big sitting Buddha statue, also lacquered in black and gold. The ceiling over those statues is of wood with golden stars on black lacquer.
translation: 帕拉塞·东王在1630年建立他治下第一座寺庙贵妃寺，用以纪念他的母亲。寺庙以高棉风格建造，名为「柴瓦塔那兰」，意思是「长治荣世」。宗教仪式，还有王子公主的火葬仪式都在这举行。寺壁饰有一百二十座坐佛像，涂成黑金两色。八座玉米形的小塔围绕中间的高台，外墙也有十二幅浮雕表达佛的一生，也有画作在内。这些故事都要顺时针看。每一座长方形的小塔都有两座坐佛像，而中间的四座中型小塔都有一座大的坐佛像，也是涂上黑色与金色.雕像上的天花是木制的，涂上黑色的光漆，也饰有有金色的星星。

original: Help fund the restoration of the temple

translation: 帕巴颂德 帕 猜罗阇

original: Our reign has been compared to that of Phrabat Somdet Phra Chairachathirat, who reigned between 1534–1546 as King of the Ayutthaya kingdom of Siam. An influx of Portuguese traders, mercenaries and warfare technology happened during his reign.
translation: 我们的统治可与帕猜罗阇王时期相提并论了，他是暹罗阿瑜陀耶王朝1534年–1546年间的统治者，在他执政期间，葡萄牙商人大量涌入，同时雇佣兵和战争技术也在他统治期间得到发展。

original: A puddle of water resembling a large footprint was found by a hunter and it was declared a footprint of Buddha. Buddhist legend holds that during his lifetime the Buddha flew and left his footprints in all lands where his teachings would be acknowledged. As the mark has been acknowledged as a footprint of Buddha, voices have been raised in support of building a temple around it.
translation: 一个猎人说，他发现一个小水潭，看起来就像一个大脚印。大家都说这是一个佛足。佛教传说：佛陀在世时常常飞来飞去，并在佛教会盛行的地方留下脚印。既然大家都说那是个佛足，有人认为应该在周围建一座寺庙。

original: The Greek adventurer and merchant Constance Phaulkon, who became first counselor to King Narai of Ayutthaya, came to Siam in 1675 after working for England's East India Company. He worked at the court of King Narai as a translator as he was fluent in Thai, English, French, Portuguese, and Malay. Not long after, Phaulkon became a counselor of the king. Phaulkon rose to become highly influential at the Siamese court of king Narai. The French called Phaukon 'Monsieur Constance' as he had engineered a Franco-Siamese rapprochement leading to the exchange of numerous embassies between France and Siam, as well as the dispatch of an expeditionary force by the French in 1687. Thai members of the royal court envied Phaulkon's closeness to the king and that became his undoing. Pra Phetracha, the foster brother of Narai, used rumors about Phaulkon wanting to use Phra Pui, the heir to the throne, as a puppet and become ruler himself, to stage a coup d'etat, the 1688 Siamese revolution.. Phaulkon, his followers and the royal heir were executed on June 5, 1688 in Lopburi. King Narai died several days later, and Phetracha proclaimed himself the new king of Siam.
translation: 希腊探险家和商人康斯坦丁-法尔孔，阿瑜陀耶那莱王的第一位外国顾问，他原是受雇为英国东印度公司工作之后，于1675年以商人的身份来到暹罗。他本身精通英语、法语、葡萄牙语和马来语，来到暹罗仅仅几年以后就精通了泰语。并成为了阿瑜陀耶那莱王的一名翻译。由于他在不列颠东印度公司的经历得到那莱王的赏识，不久后他便被那莱王任命为首席顾问，法尔孔因此在那莱王的暹罗宫廷变得非常有影响力，法国人称他为「康斯坦丁先生」，因为法国与暹罗之间的邦交，可谓是他一手促成的，双方关系良好，甚至使法国在1687年向暹罗派出探险队，康斯坦丁的得宠，令暹罗的贵族们心生嫉妒，最终导致他倒台，那莱王的义兄弟帕碧罗阇，在国内散布康斯坦丁想要操纵王储摄夺国政的谣言，并发动政变，史称「1688年暹罗革命」，华尔康与他的支持者，还有王储于当年6月5日在华富里被逮捕遭到秘密处决，数日后，那莱王亦去世，帕碧罗阇顺理成章，成为新国王了。

original: This man is vital to our empire!

King Boromma Trailokanat of Ayutthaya moved the capital of his empire in 1463 to Phitsanulok. He ordered the restoration of old temples and the establishment of new ones. The king ordered the construction of the Wat Ratchaburana temple, with a chedi said to enshrine relics of the Buddha. There is no access to the chedi's spire and the roof of Wat Ratchaburana is very unusual. Its walls are decorated with artistic frescoes and an old bell tower, called Hor Rakhang, stands beside the monastery.
translation: 波隆摩·戴莱洛迦纳王在1463年将国都迁往彭世洛，他下令修复各所旧寺庙，而且还要建新的。他又下令建立拉嘉布拉那寺，内有佛塔供奉佛祖舍利。塔顶是不能进入的，连用寺庙的屋顶也很独特。壁上饰满壁画，在修院旁还建有一座钟楼。
荷兰贵族要求开三级会议

original: In 1566 the Dutch Nobles courted the Burgundian regent in Brussels in an effort to stop the persecution of the Inquisition and to let the General Estates convene, but all they got was a contemptuous refusal. One of the effects of the insulting denial was that the citizenry of Antwerpen stormed the churches and destroyed the relics and paintings. The rebellion then spread from town to town. William of Orange tried to stop these senseless acts of violence, but it was futile. The grass had caught fire...
translation: 1566年，尼德兰贵族联名请求在布鲁塞尔的勃艮第摄政停止宗教法庭对人民的迫害并赋予公共阶层集会的权利，但他们除了蔑视和侮辱一无所获。这最终激起了安特卫普省的民愤，平民们武装起来涌进教堂，摧毁了其中的遗迹和画作，之后反抗运动在城镇间不停扩散。奥伦治亲王威廉曾尝试阻止这场无意识的暴乱行动，但并没有成功。革命的烈火已向这片大陆蔓延开去...

original: The Count of Charolais and the Edict of Blood
translation: 夏洛莱伯爵与《血腥敕令》

original: In 1567 the Count of Charolais arrived in the Netherlands, bringing Burgundian Elite troops and determined to break the Dutch Insurrection once and for all. The Count of Charolais issued the Edict of Blood, which allowed him to create a harsh military dictatorship with mass-arrests and courts of honor as a daily routine. The Terror of the Inquisition was intensified and hundreds of people executed. In 1568 the Count of Charolais arrested and executed Count Horn and Egmont, making William of Orange the only leader left to take up the flag. In 1570 the Count of Charolais by himself introduced a 10 percent tax even as the Dutch had just paid a two-year tax that the General estates had agreed upon on the promise of no more extra taxes. A General Strike spread in the Netherlands... In 1573 it was clear that the 'General of the League' had failed to subjugate the Dutch.
translation: 在1567年，夏洛莱伯爵来到尼德兰，率领勃艮第的精锐部队，意图粉碎尼德兰的叛乱。夏洛莱伯爵颁布《血腥敕令》，容许他在尼德兰建立高压军事独裁，大量逮捕所谓的乱党送入“荣誉法庭”变成日常公事。宗教裁判所更加肆虐，数以百计的人被处死。1568年夏洛莱伯爵又捕杀了霍恩伯爵与艾格蒙特伯爵，使奥兰治亲王成为唯一的叛军领袖。1570年夏洛莱伯爵又自行增设一项十一税，可是荷兰人不久之前就一次过在三级议会上交了两年的税金，并获许诺不会开征新税，为此，整个尼德兰陷入大罢工……直到1573年，收复尼德兰行动已告失败。

original: The Count of Maçon and the Union of Arras
translation: 马孔伯爵与阿拉斯联盟

original: In 1578 the Count of Maçon, member of the powerful Charolais family, arrives in the Netherlands. The Count of Maçon has good character and is efficient, as well as being both a good general and politician. In him William of Orange gets a powerful opponent. The Count of Maçon quickly understands that Burgundy can keep its mastery of the Netherlands only if it plays on the desires of the Catholic provinces. In 1579 Burgundy manages to get some of the southern Catholic provinces into the Union of Arras, which makes peace with Burgundy. However, some of the Northern provinces now create the Union of Utrecht - the first sign of a new Dutch nation. Later on, the Count of Maçon uses the Union of Arras as a safe base for an invasion of the North and the northerners are only saved by the murder-attempt on the Count of Maçon's two elder brothers in 1588, forcing him to leave for Burgundy immediately.
translation: 1578年，来自夏洛莱家族的马孔伯爵来到尼德兰.马孔伯爵性情温和，处事干练，是一位好将军，也善于政治，他的到来使奥兰治亲王获得一个强大的对手。马孔伯爵很快就意识到，勃艮第要维持在低地的统治，只能先稳定天主教各省。到了1579年，勃艮第策动南部天主教省份加入阿拉斯联盟，与勃艮第讲和。不过，北方各省也创立了乌得勒支联盟，也就是尼德兰共和国的雏形。后来，马孔伯爵以阿拉斯联盟作为进攻北方的基地。北方人后来只是被杀手所救：有人想杀害马孔伯爵的两个哥哥，最终马孔伯爵被逼回去勃艮第了。

original: Sign the Union of Arras and lower taxes
translation: 签署阿拉斯联盟并减税

original: In 1449 the king James II was old enough to marry and reclaim control of his kingdom. He immediately seized the Livingston estates, but was a bit more lenient against the Douglasses. In a quarrel in 1452, however, he himself stabbed William, 8th Earl of Douglas, to death. Historically this was the end of the power of the Douglas family and 3 years later all their land was confiscated and their castles demolished.
translation: 1449年，国王詹姆士二世已长大成人，到了要成婚的年纪，同时也是他收回自己王国的时候了.他立刻夺取李文斯顿的庄园，不过这样也侵犯了道格拉斯家族的利益.不过，到了1452年，在一次争吵中他将第八代道格拉斯伯爵威廉刺死了.历史上，这是道格拉斯从此远离权力，三年之后，他们的领地被没收，城堡也被拆除了.

original: Destroy the castles and confiscate the lands of Douglasses
translation: 拆毁他们的城堡、没收道格拉斯的领地！

original: Make peace with the Douglas family

In 1512 France and Scotland renewed their ''Auld Alliance'' as a counterbalance to England's involvement in the anti-French schemes of Pope Julius II. This later drew the Scottish into a disastrous war against the English.
translation: 1512年，法兰西与苏格兰再续「老同盟」，以应对英格兰加入教宗儒略二世的反法阴谋。后来苏格兰因此被卷入了一场惨烈的抗英战争。
与法兰西保持良好关系

original: We shall have nothing to do with France!
translation: 不必与法兰西站在一起

original: As a trusted advisor of James V, Cardinal David Beaton managed to make sure that Scotland did not follow in England's footsteps and become Protestant. Instead he worked to strengthen the bond to Catholic France and even managed to arrange two marriages with French noblewomen which both brought considerable dowries in gold to the Scottish courts treasury.
translation: 戴维·比顿枢机是国王詹姆士五世所信用的顾问，为免苏格兰不会随着英格兰改宗新教，他致力加强与天主教法兰西的联系，甚至促成两宗与法国贵族的联姻.从法国来的嫁妆十分可观，一批批黄金正运进苏格兰的国库.

original: John Knox and the Religious Strife
translation: 约翰 诺克斯与宗教冲突

original: John Knox became something of a spokesman for Protestantism in Scotland in the 1540s. Initially he was accompanying George Wishart on his preaching tours, but Wishart was captured and handed over to Cardinal David Beaton in St Andrews. There he was tried and burned on the stakes in 1546 for spreading Protestant heresy. Three months later Cardinal Beaton was murdered in revenge by Protestants. When John Knox arrived in St Andrews about a year later he was persuaded by scholars at the university to preach in the town. In June 1547, French assistance to fight the Protestants arrived and the castle of St Andrews which capitulated on terms that were later not kept. Knox and others were carried off to slavery in the French galleys but due to English intervention Knox was released 19 months later. He could, however, not return to Scotland and continue his preaching but had to stay under the protection of the English and had a large influence on the forming of the English Puritanism. He stayed in England until the Catholic Mary Tudor ascended the throne, at which time he thought it wise to flee to the continent.
