There he formulated his view that God-fearing magistrates and nobility have both the right and the duty to resist, if necessary by force, a ruler who threatens the safety of true religion. In 1559 he again was able to return to Scotland and was astounded by the progress made by the Reformed cause and by the eager reception given to him by all classes in the community.
translation: 1540年代，约翰·诺克斯就像是苏格兰新教约翰·诺克斯就像是苏格兰新教的代言人一样.最初，他追随乔治·魏沙特开始传教之路.后来，魏沙特被捕，并被送往圣安德鲁戴维·比顿枢机那里.1546年被控散布新教异端被绑在火刑柱上烧死.三个月后，比顿枢机也被新教徒所杀.大约一年以后，诺克斯应大学学者之邀，到圣安德鲁传教.1547年六月，法国派来攻击新教徒的援军抵达，圣安德鲁城堡也随之陷落.诺克斯与其他人被抓到法国桨船上当划船奴，但在英格兰干涉下，诺克斯在十九个月后被释放.他不能回到苏格兰继续传教，只能靠英格兰的保护生存.因此，他留在英格兰，对清教思想形成发挥重大影响.他一直居留在英格兰，直至信奉天主教的玛丽都铎即位，他马上逃往欧洲大陆.他整理自己的观点，认为敬畏上帝的官员与贵族有责任对抗威胁真信仰的君王，必要时更应使用武力.到了1559年，他回到苏格兰，他惊叹在改革宗主导下的宗教改革已经如火如荼，而且他在各阶层都备受欢迎.

original: In 1557, a powerful group of nobles, called the Lords of the Congregation, drew up a Protestant proclamation which was later called the First Covenant, calling for the expulsion of the Catholic Church from Scotland. The motives, however, were probably much more to be able to confiscate the vast riches of the Catholic Church in Scotland than purely true faith.
translation: 1557年，一群有力的贵族，自称“会众领主”，起草了一份新教宣言，号召要将天主教会逐出苏格兰，这份宣言后来被称为《第一圣约》.不过，《第一圣约》的动机相信只是为了将苏格兰天主教会所藏的金山银海搬走，而非真的为了澄清信仰.

original: Support the Lords of the Congregation
Oppose the Lords of the Congregation
As all other nations in this time with a coastline, the Scottish tried to duplicate the efforts of the highly successful English East Indian Company.
translation: 就像当时其他有海岸线的国家一样，看见英格兰东印度公司的成功，苏格兰人也要试着自己开一家.
我们将会开发这里的贸易！

original: Major Road Constructions in the Highlands
The improving of roads and trade routes in northern Scotland had a great impact on Scottish economy in these areas, leading to increased trade and thus also higher tax incomes
translation: 在苏格兰北部，路况改善令商路可以轻松穿行高地，为苏格兰经济带来巨大提升，商业更加繁盛，税收也增加了.

original: The opening of the Scottish Chamber of Commerce did a lot for helping Scottish pre-industrial trade and was one of the many factors behind keeping the Scottish economy Scottish.
translation: 苏格兰商会的成立，对前工业化时代的苏格兰贸易有不少帮助，而且也是其中一个令苏格兰经济还可以掌握在苏格兰人手里的原因.

original: The Scottish merchant, engineer and innovator in coal mining techniques, Sir George Bruce, introduced undersea mining into the Upper Hirst seam. It used a new drainage technology that attracted a visit from King James VI in 1617. The king accepted Bruce's invitation to visit one of his mines which tunneled down beneath the sea bed. After venturing into a tunnel which went far out into the Firth of Forth, the king found himself at a shaft point where the coal was loaded onto the ships. Water surrounded the top of the shaft and king James, alarmed with this, accused Sir George of an assassination attempt and of treason. George Bruce then pointed out the rowing boat and explained that they could either use the boat or return by the tunnel from whence they came. The king relaxed and took the option of the boat journey.
translation: 苏格兰工程师与商人乔治·布鲁斯爵士，是煤矿技术改良者.他在上希斯特矿脉引入水下采矿法，用上新的排水技术，甚至吸引国王詹姆士六世在1617年来参观.国王应布鲁斯之邀，来到他其中一个矿山.这个矿山的隧道一直深入到海床之下.冒险进入福斯峡湾下的矿洞后，国王到达一个用于煤矿装船的井口.国王发现海水围绕井口与他自己，吓得要控告布鲁斯爵士行弒与叛国.乔治·布鲁斯这才解释那里有小船可以接载国王回到岸上，或者沿原路回到陆地.国王才舒一口气，并决定坐船回去.

original: The Scottish Witchcraft Act of 1563 made the practice of witchcraft and consulting with witches capital offenses. James VI played a major part as 'victim' and investigator in the North Berwick witch trials that began in 1589 and were the first major series of trials under the new act. The king published a defense of witch-hunting in the 'Daemonologie' in 1597 but later became increasingly skeptical and took steps to limit prosecutions. Scotland tried an estimate of 6,000 people for witchcraft, where seventy-five per cent of the accused were women and over 1,500 executed.
translation: 《1563年苏格兰巫术法》令使用巫术与求教巫师都是死罪.北柏威克巫师审判从1589年就开始，也是新法实施后的第一批审判，而国王詹姆士六世是其中的主要“受害者”与研究人.国王在1597年出版过一本叫《恶魔学》的书，谈及对猎巫的防御方法.后来，大家开始怀疑这本书的作者，甚至有人跑去告官了.苏格兰曾以使用巫术罪控告过约六千人，四分之三的被告是女人，有超过一千五百人被处决.

original: The defenders of London have surrendered the city and treaties have been signed formally annexing it into Scotland. All that remains is to decide London's fate. Should we let the Londoners be? Or should we sack the city and relocate its treasures and institutions to our own capital?
translation: 伦敦守军已经献出了这座城市，正式将其并入苏格兰的条约也已经签署。剩下的只有如何决定这座城市的命运了。我们应该让它保持原状？还是洗劫城市，并把珍宝和学院搬迁到我们自己的首都？

original: The tensions between [onin_offensive_war_leader.GetName] and ourselves have spiraled out of control, and now war has broken out. The ramifications of this are felt throughout the Japanese islands, as our fellow daimyos begin to take sides, and alliances are brought into play.\nWhoever may win this current civil war, however, it is clear that the current [Root.Overlord.GetName] Shogunate was too weak to prevent it. We are not the only ones who will have noticed this, and it is quite likely that this great war of the Onin period will result in a prolonged period of strife and warfare between the different Japanese states.
translation: [onin_offensive_war_leader.GetName]与我们剑拔弩张的关系愈演愈烈，最终失控爆发出如今这场战争。一连串的效应波及到日本列岛，各地大名陆续选边站队，结成同盟参与战争。\n谁都有可能赢得这场战争，然而有一点确信无疑——如今的[Root.Overlord.GetName]幕府羸弱无力，根本无法阻止它——看破这一点的也不止是我们而已。这场室町时代的大战将成为日本战国时代的起点。

original: The dispute between [onin_defensive_war_leader.GetName] and ourselves has spiraled out of control, and we have been left with no alternative but to go to war to settle it. The ramifications of this are felt throughout the Japanese islands, as our fellow daimyos begin to take sides, and alliances are brought into play.\nWhoever may win this current civil war, however, it is clear that the current [Root.Overlord.GetName] Shogunate was too weak to prevent it. We are not the only ones who will have noticed this, and it is quite likely that this great war of the Onin period will result in a prolonged period of strife and warfare between the different Japanese states.
translation: 虽然似乎没有官方的许可，但[onin_defensive_war_leader.GetName]和我们之间的纠纷已然失控，我们别无选择，唯有拼死一搏。当诸大名开始选择阵营并形成两个互相对立的集团后，造成的后果恐怕会殃及整个日本列岛。\n但是，很明显，无论谁最后赢得这次战争，幕府将军[Root.Overlord.GetName]都无力制止这一切的发生。我们并不是唯一注意到这一点的人，这场战争极有可能导致日本列国长期的流血冲突。

original: The Sengoku Jidai will see us victorious!

The tensions between [onin_offensive_war_leader.GetName] and [onin_defensive_war_leader.GetName] have spiraled out of control, and now war has broken out. The ramifications of this are felt throughout the Japanese islands, as our fellow daimyos begin to take sides, and alliances are brought into play.\nWhoever may win this current civil war, however, it is clear that the current [Root.Overlord.GetName] Shogunate was too weak to prevent it. We are not the only ones who will have noticed this, and it is quite likely that this great war of the Onin period will result in a prolonged period of strife and warfare between the different Japanese states.
translation: [onin_offensive_war_leader.GetName]与[onin_defensive_war_leader.GetName]剑拔弩张的关系愈演愈烈，最终失控爆发出如今这场战争。一连串的效应波及到日本列岛，各地大名陆续选边站队，结成同盟参与战争。\n谁都有可能赢得这场战争，然而有一点确信无疑——如今的[Root.Overlord.GetName]幕府羸弱无力，根本无法阻止它——看破这一点的也不止是我们而已。这场室町时代的大战将成为日本战国时代的起点。

original: The tensions between [onin_offensive_war_leader.GetName] and [onin_defensive_war_leader.GetName] have spiraled out of control, and now war has broken out. The ramifications of this are felt throughout the Japanese islands, as our daimyos begin to take sides, and alliances are brought into play.\nWhoever may win this current civil war, however, it is clear to all our subjects that we were too weak to prevent it. If we do not ensure that we re-establish our authority over the warring parties, it is quite likely that this great war of the Onin period will result in a prolonged period of strife and warfare between our daimyos.
translation: [onin_offensive_war_leader.GetName]和[onin_defensive_war_leader.GetName]之间的紧张关系终于失控了，现在战争来临。当大名们结成各个联盟时，这场战争将影响整个日本岛的格局。\n但是，无论谁赢得战争，很明显，我们都无力制止。倘若我们不能重建幕府对于交战双方的权威，那么这场战争极有可能导致日本列国长期无序的流血冲突。

original: We must stamp out this Sengoku Jidai before the country is torn apart!
translation: 我们必须赶在国家四分五裂之前终结战国时代！

original: Discontent with the daimyos' endless warfare has caused a band of peasant farmers, monks and small landowners, following the Jodu Shinshu or 'Pure Land' sect of Buddhism, to openly speak out and resist [Root.Monarch.GetName]'s rule. If we do not act resolutely and quickly strike down this rag-tag band, the unrest may spread and destabilize our lands even further.
translation: 大名之间无休止的战争引起了信仰净土真宗或净土宗的佃农、僧侣和小地主的不满，他们聚集起来公然反抗[Root.Monarch.GetName]的统治。如果我们不当机立断击败这支乌合之众，骚乱可能会进一步扩散并动摇我们的国家。

original: Our neighbouring daimyo's increasing trouble with the Ikko-ikki has come to a head and led to military confrontations. The brutality of the fighting has caused survivors of the sect of the Single-Minded to spill into our country, and these bands of peasants, monks and small land owers have already strengthened their numbers with followers from our own clan. They will surely only cause more and more trouble for us if we do not act swiftly and decisively.
translation: 邻国大名的一向一揆愈发棘手，开始演变为军事冲突。残忍的战乱让一向宗的幸存者涌入我国，国中的信徒也加入了这群农民、僧侣、小地主，壮大了他们的力量。如果我们不果断采取措施，他们只会带来更大动乱。

original: The Wokou, Japanese pirates, have become rampant in the region, raiding both Chinese and Korean shores as well as our own. Despite this, the trade embargoes enforced upon us by the Chinese mean that these pirates are our only source of Chinese and Korean goods. The increasing frequency of pirate attacks means that we can no longer remain passive; we must take a decision on how to deal with them.
translation: 倭寇是一个日本海盗群体，他们不仅仅在中国、朝鲜两国沿海进行袭击活动，而且在我国海岸地区也很猖狂。尽管如此，由于中国实施的贸易禁运政策，使得这些海盗成了我们获得中国和朝鲜商品的唯一来源。但日益频繁的海盗袭击事件致使我们不能再保持沉默，我们必须就如何处理它们作出决定。

original: Our decision to seclude ourselves from the world at large has thus far succeeded in making it easier to enforce our control over the population. However, it is clear that we are hindering ourselves when it comes to the spread of new ideas and inventions. As the world around us is starting to globalize, we see our neighbours benefit from this contact with other nations, while we are left to struggle. Perhaps it is time to re-think our policy?
translation: 德川幕府颁布锁国令，禁止外国人入境，同时出国的日本人也要处以死刑.锁国政策的目的，是消除西班牙及葡萄牙在日本的殖民势力与宗教势力，尤其是他们在外样诸藩的活动，以维持幕府在国内的无上权威.日本南部日益增长的天主教徒，使西班牙与葡萄牙被视为对幕府的威胁，而且会破坏国内的和平.外样大名在战国时期得益于东亚贸易，用于加强其武装力量.限制贸易可以令大名无法增强实力，挑战德川幕府.

original: The Dutch have now been present on Dejima island for some time, and contact between our people and the enclave has been tightly controlled following the Sakoku law. Even so, our two cultures cannot help but spot glimpses of the other. The Dutch seem to know things that we do not, particularly in medicine, but also in science, production and mechanical engineering. Some of our richer citizens have even elected to make use of the Dutch surgeon in the enclave, rather than rely on local doctors.\n\nIt is clear there is much that could be learned from increased interaction with these visitors from the West, if we are willing to risk opening our provinces to them a bit more.
translation: 荷兰人在出岛上已经待了有一段时间了，我们的人与出岛的接触受到锁国政策的严格控制。即便如此，两种文化也会在不经意间产生火花。 荷兰人似乎知道许多我们未知事情，他们特别擅长于医学。除此之外，他们在科学，生产和机械工程方面也颇有建树。 我们中的一些富人甚至会专门到出岛上找荷兰外科医生看病，而不是去找当地医生。\n\n如果我们愿意冒险放宽我们的锁国政策并与西方的来访者互相交流，我们一定可以从他们那里学到很多东西。

original: Open our provinces to the Dutch.
translation: 向荷兰人开放我国边境

original: Foreigners with crude manners, lacking hygiene and an inability to understand Japanese writing have landed in Japan from countries they claim are called such ridiculous names as 'Portugal' and 'the Netherlands'. These foreigners bring with them explorers, missionaries and merchants, and their presence has already started to affect our people.
translation: 那些无礼、肮脏、又不懂汉字的外国人来到日本。他们自称来自「葡萄牙」与「荷兰」这两个有着可笑发音的地方。随这些外国人而来的有不少探险家、传教士，和商人。他们的存在已经开始影响我国人民。

original: A ship from the Netherlands has reached our shores after a long and arduous voyage via what the crew calls 'the Strait of Magellan'. 'De Liefde' is apparently the only ship remaining out of a group of five, and is crewed by only 24 sick and dying men out of an original crew of over a hundred.\n\nIts rich cargo of Western curiosities and military equipment fared far better than its crew, and should be worth quite a bit. What is more; one of the survivors, a navigator called William Adams, insists he be brought before our 'king'...
translation:
在经历了漫长而又艰巨的航行之后，一艘来自荷兰的船抵达了我们的海岸。据幸存的船员所述，他们的舰队在这段穿越「麦哲伦海峡」的航行中损失惨重，他们的船「De Liefde」号是舰队五艘船中幸存的唯一一艘。原先的超过一百名船员中仅剩下24名半死不活的。

「De Liefde」号上各种西方珍奇异物和军事装备的状态显然比它的船员状态好多了，应该价值不菲; 其中一位幸存者，一位名叫威廉·亚当斯的航海家，坚持要把他带到我们的“国王”面前......

original: The traders that we welcomed have only increased their presence in our country more and more. As they have, they have brought with them Catholic missionaries, backed by their home states, who have promptly begun to spread Christianity and convert the local populace en masse. If they are not stopped, these Jesuits, Franciscans and Dominicans could pose a significant threat to Shintoism.
translation: 1549年，第一艘葡萄牙船只来到日本的六年后，天主教传教士随之而来，开始吸引本国人皈依基督.最早的传教士是由葡萄牙所支持的耶稣会所派出，后来西班牙支持的方济会与道明会也来了.耶稣会士方济各·沙勿略神父、多列神父、佛南田修士首先来到鹿儿岛，希望将基督信仰与天主教带到日本.

original: It would seem the political climate in $COUNTRY$ is not as stable as was thought. Traveling across the country, [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] [Root.Monarch.GetName] was resting at a temple near his forces when the army's general saw an opportunity and surrounded the temple complex with his forces, claiming that 'the enemy was inside'. Only the swift and decisive action of loyalist troops led to the timely rescue of the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] and the traitor's capture.\n\nThe general's motives are unclear, and he could well have been motivated by anything from a desire for revenge to a blatant lust for power. The incident has reaffirmed [Root.Monarch.GetName]'s control over the troops, however, the brief skirmish that erupted has cost the lives of many good men, and it is clear a renewed focus will be required on internal politics to ensure that this does not occur again.
translation: 大名织田信长已控制日本中部，而他最后的对手，毛利家、上杉家、北条家都分别陷入内部矛盾，实力削弱.为继续步武天下，织田信长分别派出将领攻打其他三家.羽柴秀吉在高松城之战陷入胶着，要求织田信长出兵增援.明智光秀受命增援，而织田信长则与一批家臣、商人、艺人，还有一大批随从前往本能寺.但信长到达本能寺休息后遭到突袭，其他大名还有织田家的将领则作壁上观.光秀认为时机已到，出兵包围本能寺.信长的近卫与随从奋力抵抗，但已无力回天.织田信长最终决定自杀，并命令他的小姓森兰丸在寺内点火，以免自己的头颅被任何人得到.又一次的下克上！

original: There shall be no mercy for this dishonorable act!
translation: 此等无耻行为不可饶恕！

original:
Our neighbouring [Root.Monarch.GetTitle]s have begun building new forts, which they surround with Jokamachi or 'Castle Towns'. These are settled by merchants, craftsmen and samurai with no separation between the social groups and no regular allotment, ensuring that the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle]s can maintain tight control over the samurai class.

The other classes, combined with the establishment of free markets and open guilds stimulate merchandise and trade, and therefore prosperity. The Jokamachi thereby could become a means for the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle]s to increase control both in the military and economic spheres, while at the same time increasing the wealth of their countries.

Perhaps this is an idea we should look into?
translation: 第一座城下町建于1500年.商人、匠人、武士不分阶层，都住进新的市镇里.丰臣秀吉在1580年要求他的同盟大名只能在中心地域建一座城.1585年的检地后，新的石高按照田地的肥沃程度与生产力决定.五年后新的士农工商阶级制度成立，地权因而转到大名手中，而他们的收入就是按石高来算的.从此大名的意思变成指每年有一万石收入的领主了.

original: We should encourage the development of these Castle Towns.
translation: 我们应该鼓励这些城下町的发展。

original: We have more important things to focus on.
translation: 有更重要的事情需要关注。

original: The people of $COUNTRY$ have shown an increased interest in Kabuki theater, the art of singing and dancing, and the Ukiyo-e, woodblock prints or woodcuts and paintings featuring motifs of landscapes, tales from history, the theater and pleasure quarters. Perhaps the court should show some interest in Kabuki theater or the Ukiyo-e.
translation: $COUNTRY$的领民对歌舞伎和浮世绘愈感兴趣，歌舞伎是一种歌舞表演，浮世绘则是在木板上的绘画，主题包括风景、历史故事、舞台一角、闲居生活.作为$COUNTRY$的当主，稍为表现一下对歌舞伎和浮世绘的兴趣也不是坏事。

original: It would help them to understand the people better.
translation: 这会帮助我们更好地理解这群人民。

original: What could they possibly want with this?
translation: 他们搞成这样，想要的能是什么？

original: The children of samurai and ruling families have always had dedicated public educational institutions, often founded by Buddhist temples. With the rise of the merchant class, the commoners have started to demand education for everyone. Some have laid forth the suggestion of terakoya, educational institutions for commoners, which would focus on teaching reading and writing to the whole population of $COUNTRY$, sometimes also teaching counting with the abacus (soroban), history, and geography. It has been clearly voiced by our people that they feel strongly about this, and that we, as their ruler, should lead the way.
translation: 武家子弟一般会到公共学堂上课，多数都是由佛寺设立的。当商人阶级崛起，平民也开始要求教育机会。有些人提出建立寺子屋，旨在教$COUNTRY$的领民读书识字。有时也会教授珠算、历史、地理。领民的诉求已很清楚，我们作为领主更要不甘人后。

original: The Western traders have brought with them a new weapon, called 'arquebus'. It is a matchlock gun that will probably play a critical role in future wars. Some of the samurai claim that the old way will always prevail, while others have already grasped the concept and are heartily praising the new weapon.
translation: 西方商人带来了名为「火绳枪」的新武器。这种火器可能在未来的战争中起到重要作用。有些武士声称旧方法一向行之有效，而其他人已经掌握新知，并且由衷赞叹这种新式武器。

original: There has always been guilds, or Za, in $COUNTRY$, where merchants co-operate with temples and shrines in order to protect themselves against bandits, samurai and daimyo. The merchants transport their goods and travel in groups. Arrangements are made for them to sell their goods in temple grounds, which also places them under the auspices and protection of the temple. Some merchants in $COUNTRY$ feel that the protection from traveling in groups and the arrangement with the temples aren't enough. They have turned to you, offering a share of profits in order to gain protection, maybe some tax exemptions and other formal governmental benefits.
translation: 在$COUNTRY$领内出现一种称为“座”的公会机构，商人与寺院、神社合作保护自身免受山贼、武士、大名侵扰.商人会一组组地运送货品，然后在寺院的领地内贩卖货物，以获得寺院的支持与保护.一些$COUNTRY$领内的商人这样是不够的，他们将目光投向你，说可以给你一些分成，以换取你的支持，譬如说一些税务优惠，或是公共支持.

original: It sounds like a great deal
This does not interest me at the moment

The Za, the trade guilds in $COUNTRY$, have begun to grow large and powerful enough to protect themselves and are becoming independent. They already have the power to alter market prices and have begun to show signs of monopolistic activity. In order to stop the Za's monopoly, establishing free markets and guilds, or rakuichi and rakuza, might deal a severe blow to the power and influence of the older, monopolistic Za.
translation: 在$COUNTRY$领内的座势力越来越强，已经足以保护自己，甚至有独立的能力。他们有能力操控价格，还有垄断迹象。为防止座独占市场，推行免税和建立商会，也就是乐市和乐座，也许可以动摇那些垄断者的影响力。
以前怎么干，现在怎么做

original: A new culture has been spreading throughout the land, based on the ideals and aesthetics of Zen Buddhism and the concept of wabi-sabi, beauty in simplicity. The tea ceremony, ikebana - flower arrangement, Noh drama and sumi-e painting have become increasingly popular.
translation: 基于禅宗哲学与侘寂思想发展出来的新文化风麾于领内.茶会、插花、能剧、墨绘等活动，越来越受领民欢迎.

original: Encourage the growth of Higashiyama culture.

In the wake of the Higashiyama culture, people were looking for some kind of inspiration. A man in our employment suggested that we build a new temple, called Ginkaku-ji - the Temple of the Silver Pavilion - as it would be covered in silver foil. A rock garden with Zen and wabi-sabi aesthetics should be planned and added beside the temple. The simple beauty of the plans seem to be overshadowed by the inlay of silver and that suggestion was eventually removed.
translation: 当国人需要新气象鼓舞的时候，东山文化出现了.家臣中有人提出要建一座银阁寺，这座寺院要覆满银箔，并要在旁边造一座充满禅宗与侘寂气息的石庭园.不过，后来因为镶银与侘寂理念格格不入，所以就将银箔取消了.

original: Go forth and build the temple!

After complaints of bandits roaming the countryside and attacking people on the major roads, there have been suggestions of establishing Sekisho or 'barriers' as checkpoints. They could also control the movement of people and certain goods, and at times serve to collect tolls. These defensive barriers could be of great use in case someone would attack us.
translation: 最近经常收到有平民在郊区的道路被山贼袭击，有人建议在领内设置关所，控制人流与货物的路线，还可以用来征税，而且还可以收预警之效，敌国入侵时可以有更多时间组织防卫.

original: The feudal lords have failed in their duty and it is time to make sure they know their responsibilities. The Buke Shohatto or 'The Various Points of Laws for Warrior Houses' was a collection of edicts governing the responsibilities and activities of daimyo and the rest of the samurai warrior aristocracy should be a start. It is supposed to be seen as a code of conduct, how to behave as an honorable daimyo, not solely laws which have to obeyed. Thus these might be followed despite our inability to enforce them directly.
translation: 一大批武士无法履行他们的义务，是时候要他们知道自己的责任是甚么.《武家诸法度》集合了一批大名与武士应当遵从的法令，也包括一些道德要求：当一个好大名不只是要遵守法令.尽管我们不能直接控制他们，但这样也许能令他们遵从一下我们的想法.

original: Implement Buke Shohatto for the whole of Japan.
translation: 颁行《武家诸法度》至全日本

original:
The ruler of Japan has issued a collection of edicts called Buke Shohatto or 'The Various Points of Laws for Warrior Houses'. It is a code of conduct, how an honorable daimyo should behave and some of the points are:
The samurai class should devote itself to pursuits appropriate to the warrior aristocracy, such as archery, swordsmanship, horsemanship, and classical literature.
Amusements and entertainments are to be kept within reasonable bounds and expenses for such activities are not to be excessive.
The han (feudal domains) are not to harbor fugitives and outlaws.
translation:
日本之主颁布了《武家诸法度》，为大名规定了行动准则，其中写道：
武士应向武道追求极致，包括弓道、剑道、骑术、古典，都要日益精进；
娱乐消遣，不应奢糜；
藩内不应窝藏逃犯.

original: To increase our control over Japan, we should construct five centrally-administered roads to connect our capital with the outer provinces. The Five Routes or Gokaido shall have post stations set up along the most-used routes where travelers can rest and buy supplies.
translation: 要加强对日本的控制，我们应建立五条由中央直接管理的道路，连接首都与全国各地.五街道上应设有驿站，供游人休息和补给.

original: An advisor has come up with the 'Kyoho Reforms'; an array of economic policies aimed at making the shogunate financially solvent. As Confucian principles are to some extent engrained in our government, and since they argue that money is defiling, it will be necessary to shelve certain certain of these principles if they would hamper the reform process. The reforms include the formation of merchant guilds that will allow greater control and taxation, and place an emphasis on frugality.
translation: 享保改革原是为改善幕府的财政而提出的一系列改革，由德川幕府第八代将军德川吉宗推行。由于儒教在政府中根深蒂固的存在，而他们认为聚敛即是恶政，吉宗意识到必须解雇他们才可以扫除改革的障碍。享保改革包括建立商会，加强控制与征税，同时节约开支。

original: Go with the original, economic reforms.

It is the Golden Age of the Edo Period. Years of internal peace in $COUNTRY$ have created economic stability. Arts and architecture flourish, prosperity is spreading throughout the land, and our brightest minds are achieving remarkable breakthroughs in technology and philosophy.
translation: 这是江户时期的黄金时代。多年的内部和平，为$COUNTRY$带来稳定的经济。艺术与建筑行业蓬勃发展，遍地皆是繁荣之景，最具智慧的人才不断在技术与哲学领域取得显著突破。

original: A new philosophy has started to spread throughout Japan. The Chinese philosopher Confucius' teachings have developed into an ethical and philosophical system called 'Confucianism', of which the core is humanism. The focus of spiritual concern is the current world and the family, instead of the afterlife and the gods, and it does not extoll devotion to divine will or a higher power.\n\nFurthermore, the central tenet of meritocracy allows all individuals of the appropriate skill to occupy positions of power, rather than restricting such positions to those of noble birth. This is convenient, as adopting these views allows us to hire a highly-skilled, yet lowborn advisor for a wage no self-respecting noble would consider.
translation: 一种新的思想正在日本传播.中国哲学家孔子的教训，发展成一套伦理及哲学理系，称为儒教.人文主义是其核心，现世与家庭比来世与神祇更显重要.

original: 'It does not matter how slowly you go...'
translation: 走的虽然慢，起码还是在前进...

original: The teachings of the Chinese philosopher Confucius have once more become popular among the people, and its meritocratic influence is speading to the government. This has once more given us the opportunity to hire a highly-skilled lowborn advisor for a wage no self-respecting noble would consider.
translation: 中国哲学家孔子的教训正在$COUNTRY$传播.称为“儒教”的伦理及哲学理系已令$COUNTRY$的大老深感不安.人文主义是其核心，现世与家庭比来世与神祇更显重要，对神灵的意志并不感冒.

original: The dominant study of Chinese, Confucian, and Buddhist texts has led to a decline in Japanese study. A few scholars have started to research the early Japanese classics, criticizing the repressive moralizing of Confucian thinkers, and attempts to re-establish Japanese culture before the influx of foreign modes of thought and behavior. They call themselves Kokugaku, or 'National Study' thinkers.
translation: 中国的主流学术儒教，与佛经在日本人为流行，令传统日本学术无人问津.几个日本学者开始研究早期的日本典籍，质疑儒者所讲的道德教化只是一种人性压抑，并企图重塑在被外地影响前的日本文化，称之为“国学”.

original: We will gladly support these thinkers.

The disputes between noble families of the samurai and aristocratic classes have, of late, increasingly erupted into outright battle. If they continue, they may pose a serious threat to the stability of the political system, and should therefore be taken very seriously.

So ingrained have these feuds become in the culture that people are already starting to refer to it by name - the honorable house strife, or O-Ie Sodo. They are quite taken with the excitement of these events, due to the political and physical conflict involved.

Now, it appears the heir to $COUNTRY$ has become involved in one of these disputes, and the people are demanding his head on a plate.
translation: 御家骚动，是指在$COUNTRY$的家臣与武士，内部不和所引发的战事.这些乱局是对政治稳定的一大威胁，一般都会从严处理.因为某些原因，御家骚动也会成为平民间流传的传说故事，混杂政治角力与武斗，很多都非常有趣.你的嗣子正要要对一场纷争，不少人都希望看见他人头落地.

original: Refuse to comply to their demands.

In order to control the daimyos of Japan a proposal of Sankin Kotai or alternate attendance has been brought up. It would mean that a daimyo would need to establish a residence in Edo and move periodically between Edo and his han, typically spending alternate years in each place. The daimyo's wife and heir shall remain in Edo as hostages. The economic strain on the daimyo should make him unable to wage war as he has to maintain lavish residences in both his Han and in Edo. The Sankin Kotai should also be a military service as each daimyo would be required to furnish a number of samurai in accordance with the assessment of his han.
translation: 为了好好控制各地大名，$COUNTRY$打算实施参觐交代.这令大名需要在江户购置一座府第，而且定期在江户与本藩之间迁移，一般会在一个地方待上一年，大名的妻子及嗣子要留在江户当人贸.因此，大名将无法发动战争，因为他要花费大量金钱在江户与本藩的奢华生活开销。参觐交代也是一种军役，大名亦必须携同一定数量的本藩武士随行。

original: All Japanese vassals of §Y[Root.GetName]§! will receive the event 'Sankin Kotai'. This will displease them.
translation: 所有臣属于§Y[Root.GetName]§!的日本大名将会触发事件“参觐交代”。这将会激怒他们。

original: All Japanese vassals of §Y[Root.GetName]§! will be pleased.
translation: 所有臣属于§Y[Root.GetName]§!的日本大名将会为此感到高兴。

original: The Shogun has decided to establish the rule of Sankin Kotai, demanding that each daimyo has a residence in Edo where his wife and heir shall remain as hostages and the daimyo himself must move periodically between Edo and his han. Both residences must be lavish and the daimyo is required to furnish a number of samurai in accordance with the assessment of his han.
translation: 日本打算实施参觐交代，要求每个大名都要在江户置一宅第，妻子与嗣子都要长居江户当人质，而大名本人也要定期来回本藩与江户.两边的府第都要花费大量金钱，而且大名也要携同一定数量的本藩武士随行.

original: The prevailing peace of past few years has left many in the Samurai caste without work. These idle hands have now found an employment in exploiting and oppressing the local peasant population. They will need to be dealt with.
translation: 过去几年的和平使许多武士闲散怠惰.这些闲散武士现在开始剥削和欺压百姓.他们必须得到处理，我们要行动起来.
刀狩 - 糟糕的执行者

original: The farmers of all provinces are strictly forbidden to have in their possession any swords, short swords, bows, spears or other types of weapons. If unnecessary implements of war are kept, the collection of annual rent or nengu will be more difficult, and without provocation uprisings can be fomented.' - The reason for the Sword Hunt was just, but the actions performed by your soldiers were not. Instead of only gathering the swords and other weapons, the soldiers also took it upon themselves to punish the sword-bearers. The Ikko-ikki and the Ronin rose in defense and now your country faces a revolt.
translation: 所有农民都严禁拥有 刀，短剑，弓，矛或其他类型的武器。若放任这些兵器流入民间，地租和年贡的收取将会变得困难。械斗和暴动也会更容易发生——刀狩的原因是正当的，但你士兵的行为不是。他们不仅仅收缴刀剑和其他武器，还随意处罚配刀者。 一向一揆和浪人起义以求自保，你的国家正面临一场暴动。

original: This was not my intention at all

Despite the grumbling, muttering peasants and ji-zamurais, your soldiers gathered up all weapons, from the littlest dagger to the greatest mace. Hopefully, nothing that could be used in a revolt against you was left behind.
translation: 尽管农民和地侍怨声载道，你的士兵仍收缴了所有的武器，从匕首到大锤.没有东西能用来发动一场对抗你的起义了.

original: It seems that while you've been hunting for weapons your enemies have taken advantage of your absence. The political game at Kyoto has not changed, but the attitude against you has. You are forced to abandon the Sword Hunt and return to the Emperor.
translation: 当你出发去刀狩的时候，你的政敌似乎趁你不在朝做了好些小动作。京都的政治角力一如以往，但针对你的观点却有所改变。你被逼放弃刀狩，回到天皇身边。

original: The number of Catholic converts has increased dramatically since foreigners were allowed to freely enter Japan.\n\nEnough subjects in $PROVINCENAME$ have now converted to make Catholicism the majority religion in the province.
translation: 自从外国人被允许自由进入日本后，戏剧性地出现了大量的转信天主教的教徒。\n\n在$PROVINCENAME$已经有足够的转信者让天主教成为该地区的主导宗教了。

original: Could this be a good thing...?
Our Ninjas have reported that our neighbors are employing a rival clan of Ninjas themselves. Surely they are plotting against us! Should we send our own Ninja out on a preemptive strike?
translation: 我们的忍者报告我们的邻国已经雇佣了一个另一个忍者流派.当然他们正计划对抗我们！我们是否应该派出忍者进行一次先发制人的袭击？

original: Our Ninja clan has been wiped out by ninjas from $FROM$. They struck at night and managed to kill all our ninjas without any alarm being raised.
translation: 我们的忍者流派已经被 $FROM$ 派出的忍者歼灭.他们实施了夜袭，并在没有触动警报的情况下杀死了我们所有的忍者.

original: Our Ninja clan has fought off an attack by $FROM$. The fools blundered into an ambush and were slaughtered to a man.
translation: 我们的忍者流派已经击退了 $FROM$ 发动的一次袭击.那些蠢货踏入了陷阱并被屠杀到仅剩一人.

original: We now dominate the tea trade. Rather than just trading it, perhaps we should start growing it ourselves?
translation: 我们现在支配了日本的茶叶贸易，而不是仅仅从事它的贸易，也许我们可以开始自行种植它？

original: We have been blessed with an invitation to attend a tea ceremony at the imperial palace. This is a perfect opportunity to improve our prestige!
translation: 我们获邀出席一场御前茶会，这会大大增加我们的名望！

original: Since we have been unable to provide our realm with an heir, speculation over the future course of the nation is running rampant. These debates threaten to undermine our position. We could adopt an heir as our own, but doing so might be perceived as a sign of weakness.
translation: 由于我们至今没有继承人，有关国家前途的流言蜚语甚嚣尘上。这些议论危害到了我们的地位。我们可以收养一个孩子作为继承人，然而这样做可能会被认为是式微的表现。

original: The relative instability of our realm has led others to begin questioning our ability to maintain national cohesion. Admitting that the situation is somewhat out of our control will be a severe blow to our authority and influence.
translation: 最近我们领内相对的不稳定令其他人开始怀疑我们是否有能力维持国家的团结。承认现在时局有所失控，将会大大打击我的权威和影响力。

original: Admit that the situation isn't stellar.

With the realities of war only a fading memory, and our realm both prosperous and stable, officials within the treasury are suggesting the levying of a special tax this year to allow us our fair share of these productive times.
translation: 战火已远去，我领内安定繁荣.家臣提议今年可以增收一项特别税，令我们也可以分享下繁荣成果.

original: A bit of extra silver would not hurt.
translation: 多收点银子也不算负担

original: Our reputation as a fearsome foe precedes us, and few are those in Japan who now dare oppose our authority. This might be a good time to show the other daimyos that we intend to retain our position for ourselves and for our family, but on the other hand a more lenient approach in our dealings with them might cast us in a more favorable diplomatic light.
translation: 其他人看来，我们就是洪水猛兽，全日本还有谁敢反抗我？现在我们应该告诉其他大名谁在主宰浮沉.不过，更宽大的做法，也许使我们在外交场上更有利.
他们必须尊重我的权威!

original: We shall carry ourselves with tact.

A beautiful lacquerware chest in our study has caught the eyes of an imperial retainer, and word of this fantastic artifact has spread to the imperial court, and the Emperor himself. There seems to have developed a quiet understanding between ourselves and the Emperor that this chest be presented as a gift to the emperor from his most loyal subject.
translation: 我们一件精美的漆器盒子，吸引到一名皇室随从的注意，盒子梦幻般的工艺在御所流传，更传到天皇耳中.我们似乎不得不将盒子当作礼物，经天皇忠实的侍从献给他.

original: Naturally the chest shall be a gift for his Majesty!
I am afraid that the realm cannot afford such gifts.
translation: 恐怕我国无力支付这份礼物.

original: The first Sake of the season is ready, and the traditional tasting is only a few weeks away. The question is whether we should invite the Emperor for a celebratory first tasting, or if we should try to leverage our position in the marketplace and sell early instead.
translation: 当季的第一批清酒已经酿好，几周后就是品尝的日子了.问题是我们是邀请天皇出席品酒仪式，还是利用我们在市场上的有利地位早早卖掉呢.

original: We are in dire need of imperial favor.
Let us get this batch on the market!

With the war dragging on, the War Council has suggested an extra troop levy to call up recruits and manpower from the provinces. Since troop levies would be damaging to our authority, some are instead suggesting that we ease the present burdens suffered by our peasantry. A third option would be to leave things as they are.
translation: 战争已打响，兵部省内有人提出要从各地征集更多士兵.征集臣下的军队会影响我们的权威，因此也有解决方案，就是解除农民的束缚与负担.第三个方法则是按原本办事，不作改变.

original: Due to the prevalence and social status of samurai, the people have become fascinated with their moral code and way of life. The ideals of bushido and of the Samurai have come to wield more and more influence in $COUNTRY$, and even in the mind of the wider world our country and 'samurai' have become synonymous.\n\nAs the influx of Western weaponry and the relative internal peace after the Sengoku Jidai have reduced the military role of the samurai, these noble warriors increasingly find themselves in positions in the courts of their masters as bureaucrats or administrators. They are no doubt skilled, but some circles have expressed their sadness that the pride of our military should be relegated to such ordinary work.
translation: 走过$CAPITAL$的市集，你发现一件小玉饰，那是一个武士沉思像.武士与武士道思想正影响全日本.不过，是否要避免变成一种偶像崇拜？

original: The time of samurai in the military is over.
translation: 武士的时代已经结束了。

original: We must find a way of modernizing the samurai forces.
translation: 我们必须想方设法令武士部队现代化。

original: Our spies have uncovered a nasty piece of information that another daimyo would probably not want to see spread around the imperial court. We could use this opportunity to weaken his position, however, getting a reputation for spreading rumors would likely harm our prestige.
translation: 我们的间谍发现了一个丑闻，但另一个大名可能不希望皇室知晓。我们可以借机削弱他的地位，但散布谣言可能会损害我们的声望。

original: Leverage must be used regardless of the cost.
translation: 必要时使用影响力，无论代价。

original: No need to spread foul rumors.
translation: 没有必要传播肮脏的谣言。

original: A Son Finds His Way Home

A young man has arrived at our capital today, claiming to be a long-lost son who was kidnapped by a rival daimyo years ago. Through sheer audacity and luck he managed to escape their clutches and has now returned home to once more take up his rightful place as the daimyo's heir. Furthermore, as a result of his long years spent in captivity he can surely tell us many of their secrets.
translation: 一名年轻人今天抵达了我们的都城，声称自己是大名的儿子，多年前被敌人所绑架。凭借过人的胆识与一点运气，他成功地逃脱了敌人的魔掌，并设法回到了我们这里，来继承他作为少主的权利。 此外，他还能与我们分享我们敌人的许多秘密。

original: Tell us about their diplomatic trickery.
translation: 告诉我们他们的外交计略

original: Teach us their secret military tactics.
translation: 教教我们他们秘密的军事战术

original: A new smith has produced a shipment of swords of unparalleled quality for our troops. We can either equip our own forces with them, or use the opportunity to sell them and make a large profit. Swords like these are likely to be in great demand with our neighbors...
translation: 一位新刀匠为我们的部队生产了一批品质无可比拟的刀具。我们可以将这批武器配发给自己的武士，也可以抓住机会将它们出售以获取巨额利润。我们的邻国多半对这样的刀具需求巨大…

original: Our army always has first claim on equipment.
translation: 我们的军队应当首先使用这些武器。

original: We require money above all else!
translation: 我们对钱的需求高于一切！

original: Of late, reports have come in of powerful criminal factions rising in our home Han. The resulting rise of widespread criminality, extortion, and looting has led people to increasingly question our leadership. It is already leading to the people questioning our leadership, and if this is not dealt with now it might well spiral totally out of control.
translation: 最近，有报告称本藩出现了强大的犯罪团伙。随之激增的大范围犯罪、敲诈、抢劫行为使得领民逐渐怀疑我们的领导能力。事已若此，如果再不过问，事态可能会走向失控。

original: The crisis will die out on its own.

A new generation of Samurai has come of age. The relative peace with which we have been blessed during the past few years has caused the young generation to grow up soft, and more disposed to administrative tasks than to the Art of War. We could accept this development, or call for a return to more military virtues.
translation: 新一代武士渐渐长大.过去数年和平的日子，令年青一代在安逸的环境成长，相比兵法，他们更倾向学习治民之术.我们可以任他们自由发展，或者要他们多修武德.

original: We must always be ready to protect ourselves!
translation: 我们要时刻准备好保卫自己!

original: Our military traditions are strong, and we could use this as leverage by funneling it into strengthening our position within the imperial administration.
translation: 我们有深厚的军事传统，而我们利用之来加强我们在朝廷中的地位。

original: That sounds like a fantastic idea!
translation: 这听起来真是个好主意!

original: A criminal recently arrested in our native Han has acquired a fair amount of popularity among local peasants for resisting supposedly corrupt tax collectors. Executing the man will strengthen our prestige, while showing mercy will strengthen the impression of us as being a benevolent and righteous ruler.
translation: 本藩最近有一个犯人，在领民中甚有名气，因为他敢于反抗贪污的税吏.处决他固然能显示权威，赦免他也可以显示大名仁慈公正的一面，争取民心.

original: We shall tread the path of mercy.
We are no longer subjected to the Shogunate and instead serve the Emperor freely. $COUNTRY$ is now a truly independent Daimyo.
translation: 现在，我们已不再接受幕府的支配，并且可以自由地为天皇服务。$COUNTRY$现在是真正独立的大名了。

original: We have to go on alone..
We are no longer independent, but are acknowledging the Shogun and Emperor again.
translation: 我们已不再是实际上独立割据的大名，今后将会真正尊奉幕府和天皇的权威。

original: All is as it should be..

We have captured one of the holiest sites of Shintoism. The Ise Grand Temple is dedicated to the Sun Goddess Amaterasu and has for thousands of years been in the custody of the Imperial family of Japan. This is a major pilgrimage for Shinto faithful and a sanctuary that all rulers in this region must respect.
translation: 我们占领了神道教最神圣的地方之一，伊势神宫。这里供奉着天照大神，数千年来一直由日本皇室监管，是神道教教徒的避难所和主要朝圣之地。这个地区所有的统治者都必须尊重它。

original: Converting this area may prove harder than planned for...
translation: 转换这个区域的信仰可能比原计划更难……

original: This is a fascinating religion. Let us embrace the Shinto faith!
translation: 这是一个迷人的宗教。我们信奉神道信仰吧！

original: Let them worship their idols in peace...
translation: 让他们安静地敬拜他们的神像吧……

original: Last year a merchant reported finding silver in the mountains of the Iwami province. The supply of silver seems almost bottomless and the mine that was built has since then become the major source of income for the entire province, and indeed promises to become a major source of income for all of [Root.GetName].
translation: 去年，一位商人报告说在石见国的山区发现了银矿，银的供应量几乎无穷无尽。从此，建成的矿山成为全省的主要收入来源，甚至有希望成为[Root.GetName]的主要收入来源。

original: A new gold deposit has been found on the island of Sado in Echizen province. This mine promises to become one of the major sources of Gold in the archipelago of Japan.
translation: 在越前的一个名为佐渡的岛上发现了一座新的金矿，这座金矿有望成为日本列岛的主要黄金来源之一。

original: The merchant Georg Giese, who formerly worked in London as a member of the Hanseatic League, has returned to Danzig. He is to marry Christine Krüger, daughter of a prestigious Danzig citizen, and is currently looking for a new opportunity.
translation: 商人乔治·基瑟，曾作为汉萨同盟的成员在伦敦活动.他回到但泽，娶到但泽一位有名望市民的女儿克里斯汀·古瑜格.他正在但泽寻找新商机.

original: We, the Hansa, sell ships everywhere in Europe, including Italy and control most of the shipbuilding market, mainly in Lübeck and in Danzig. Holland wants to favor Bruges as a huge staple market at the end of a trade route and is starting to become a competitor of us in shipbuilding. Should we stop the flow of shipbuilding technology from Hansa towns to Holland?
translation: 我们汉萨同盟造的船风行全欧，包括意大利.我们控制大部分造船市场，主要在吕贝克和但泽.荷兰想将布鲁日建成大型的纤维市场.布鲁日坐落在商路末端，将会成为我们造船业的对手.我们是否要停止从汉萨城市输出造船技术到荷兰？

original: Stop the flow of shipbuilding technology!

As a new ruler, it is customary to hold a Hansetag where the league's members are invited to participate in the central meeting. The member communities have chosen Ratssendeboten or envoys to represent their local consensus on the issue at the Hansetag. This Hansetag brought up some issues with the trade, the economy and the military. As the envoys haven't managed to reach a conclusion as to which of these matters we should address, and although the consensus-building at the Hansetag is supposed to follow the Low Saxon tradition of Einung, it is our duty to decide which matter to address.
translation: 作为一名新任统治者，习惯上要主持一次汉萨日，邀请联盟的成员参加中央会议。成员社区挑选了使节来代表他们的当地共识。这次汉塞日在贸易，经济和军事方面提出了一些问题。在特使们未能就这些问题得出结论的情况下，虽然汉萨日的共识建设应该遵循下萨克森的行会传统，但我们有义务决定解决哪一个问题。

original: An official of the Hanseatic League from Cologne, Heinrich Sudermann, was elected to the post of Syndic in 1556. He became a permanent official with legal training who worked to protect and extend the diplomatic agreements of the Hansa member towns.
translation: 海因里希·苏德曼来自科隆，他在1556年当选理事.他曾接受正式的法律训练，保护同盟城市的外交利益，因此成为永久干事.

original: He could do much good in $COUNTRY$

Our new quasi-judicial body that will administer maritime and commercial law is called the Consulate of the Sea. It gives our merchants the right to settle their commercial disputes without interference from the royal courts and in exchange we, the Crown of Aragon, receives financial support.
translation: 港务领事馆是我们新成立的准法人机构，负责执行海洋法与商法，保障我们的商人在商业纠纷时能免受王室干涉，而王室则会得到商人的财务支持.

original: Book of the Consulate of the Sea

'Les costums maritimes de Barcelona universalment conegudes per Llibre del Consolat de mar' or 'The maritime customs of Barcelona universally known as the Book of the Consulate of the Sea' is the full title of the Book of the Consulate of the Sea. It is proposed that we fund the new edition of the book which will contain a code of procedure for the guidance of the courts of the consuls of the sea, a collection of ancient customs of the sea, and a body of rules for the government of cruisers of war.
translation: 《巴塞隆那海洋习例又称为海洋法典》是《海洋法典》的全称.我们可以出钱重修法典以加入有关港务领事法庭运作方式的条文，与战时政府的指挥体系.

original: The Italian poet, canon lawyer, scholar, diplomat, and chronicler Antonio Beccadelli is currently dedicating himself to philological studies under the patronage of $COUNTRY$'s ruler. He has founded the academy Porticus Antoniana and introduced the young scholar Giovanni Pontano to the king. His great knowledge could ensure that he would became an excellent counselor, so it would be wise to hire Antonio Beccadelli as our new advisor.
translation: 意大利诗人、教法律师、学者、外交官、编年史家安东尼奥·贝卡德里正在$COUNTRY$之主资助下修习哲学.他创立安东尼柱廊学院，又介绍年轻学者乔凡尼·蓬塔诺给国王.他的智慧保证他足以胜任国王的左右手，希望能聘请安东尼奥·贝卡德里当顾问.

original: Antonio Beccadelli was the first to introduce the young scholar Iovianus Pontanus or Giovanni Pontano to the ruler of $COUNTRY$. Giovanni Pontano tutored the young heir of Alphonso the Magnanimous, served as a political adviser, military secretary and chancellor but his chief claim was as a scholar. Topics such as 'Liberality of Princes', 'Ferocity' or 'Magnificence' was dissertated by him and he argued that architecture and great monuments were the mark of a great ruler. He could express the facts of modern life and the actualities of personal emotion in a language that was sufficiently classical yet always characteristic of the man. Urania was his ambitious didactic composition in hexameters that embodied the astronomical science of the age, adorned with a high theme of mythological episodes. He wrote in Latin and his most original compositions in verse were on personal topics — the De conjugali amore, Eridanus, Tumuli, Naeniae, Baiae - his passionate emotions were uttered with a warmth of coloring and sincerity.
translation: 安东尼奥·贝卡德里是第一个将年轻的若望努斯·蓬塔努斯介绍给$COUNTRY$的人.若望努斯·蓬塔努斯即乔凡尼·蓬塔诺，他是大量王阿方索王储的老师，同时也是政治顾问、军事秘书、首相，但他主要还是一位学者.他曾论述“王子的慷慨”、“残暴”、“高尚”等题目，他又认为大型纪念碑与建筑是伟大王者的表现.他又娓娓能道出现代生活的真谛与人情绪的意义.乌拉尼亚是他的炫耀文采的作品，他将当代的天文学融汇在六步格诗中，并加入大量的神话故事.他以拉丁文写作，大部分诗作都是一些很个人的题材.在《婚姻之爱》里，他的热情以温暖的色彩与真挚的感情道出.

original: He could not have done it without us!
His success is that of the people
Monastery of Santa Maria de Sigena

The convent Monasterio de Santa Maria de Sigena was founded by Queen Sancha of Castile, wife of Alfonso II of Aragon, and was constructed between 1183 and 1208. It houses some important Romanesque frescos of about 1200 by English artists and although it has started to decline, the monastery is still a grand cloister. The nuns are asking for us to help fund the monastery and the Maestro de Sigena has offered to paint a large altarpiece.
translation: 韦斯卡西格纳君王修道院由亚拉贡国王阿方索二世的妻子卡斯蒂利亚王后桑查倡议于1183年至1208年修建的。它收藏了大约1200件由英格兰艺术家创作的仿罗马式壁画。尽管现在有些破败，但仍然是一座宏伟的建筑。修女现在请求你资助修道院，她们并且会让西格纳的大师创作一幅祭坛画。

original: The nobility in the Aragonese Empire has begun to strictly enforce the rules that ties peasants to the land, and this combined with a stricter enforcement of seignorial rights in general has led to unrest among the peasants. The poorest peasants strongly support open rebellion while the better off favor appealing to us for reforms and the end of seignorial abuses. It would be an excellent opportunity to gain the support of the peasants, as we are in a constant power struggle with the nobility. Suggestions have been made regarding allowing the peasants to form a Sindicat Remença, a peasants' guild or primitive trade union, which will grant them more liberty.
translation: 阿拉贡的贵族发布严苛的法令将农民捆绑在土地上.大大加强的领主权利在农民中产生了不安.那些最穷苦的农民公开地抗议，要求改革并限制领主的滥权.这对我们是极为有利的，将是我们在同贵族的长期斗争中获得农民支持的极好机会.有人建议允许农民建立农民辛迪加，一个类似工会或者互助会的组织，来保证自己的权益.

original: Allow the peasants to form a Sindicat Remença
translation: 允许农民建立农民辛迪加

original: The Norwegian nobleman and knight, Sigurd Jonsson, is a former drottsete, a man who could rule the country in the King's name, and regent of Norway. He is a direct descendant of the old Norwegian royal family and the commander of Akershus Fortress from 1440 to 1445. Sigurd Jonsson is one of the leading proponents of the anti-Hanseatic policies in Norway.
translation: 挪威的贵族西格德-约恩松骑士，曾担任过摄政官以国王之名统治挪威，他是原挪威皇室的后裔，1440年至1445年间是阿克什胡斯要塞的指挥官，西格德-约恩松也是挪威反汉萨同盟政策的主要支持者之一

original: He could be of use to the realm

The son of National Counselor Henrik Jensson, Nils Henriksson, has recently married Ingerd Ottesdatter and consolidated his possession of the Austrått estates. He is now one of Norway's largest landowners, with properties in Bergen, Vardøhus, Hålogaland, Fosen, Frosta, Stjørdal, Sunnmøre, Romsdal, Edøy, Selbu and Herjedalen. He has been suggested to the post of National Counselor.
translation: 国家元老亨里克-扬松之子尼尔斯-亨里克松，最近迎娶了英格德-奥特斯达特，同时巩固了在奥斯特拉特家族的地位.他现在是挪威最大的地主之一，在卑尔根，瓦尔德胡斯，霍洛加兰，福森，弗罗斯塔，斯彻达尔，孙默勒，鲁姆斯达尔，埃德岛，塞尔布，海里耶达伦等地有财产.有人建议他来担任顾问.

original: The first fortification in Vardø Municipality in Finnmark county was built in 1306 and was called Varghøya. The second fortification was built in Østervågen, erected between 1450 and 1500, a rectangular fortification with two corner bastions.
translation: 芬马克郡瓦尔德市的第一批要塞始建于1306年，当时被称为瓦尔哥亚.第二批要塞则于1450年和1500年在奥斯特维根完成，它有一个矩形的主体和两个角堡.

original: Increase defenses in the whole of Norway

The final construction of the fortress in Bagahus, Båhuslen is done. A river forms a natural moat around the fortress as it commands its surroundings from a cliff 40 meters high. It serves as the main defense against Sweden with its four rectangular corner towers and the three meters thick wall which surrounds it.
translation: 在布胡斯的伯格胡斯要塞完成了.要塞被一条河流环绕，在一处高40米的山丘上俯瞰四周.作为防御瑞典的重要堡垒，它是一座拥有三米厚城墙四个角楼的矩形要塞.

original: Ever since the 13th century treaty of Perth, Scotland has been obligated to pay a yearly sum to the Norwegian Kingdom in exchange for control of the Hebrides. These payments are by now long overdue, however, and this has been the cause for tensions on and off. Regardless of our ancestral claims, however, our ability to project power in the Highlands is not what it was, and we have bigger issues closer to home to handle. It has been suggested that this conflict be settled once and for all. The [SCO.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]s will marry a member of the [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] dynasty and the Jarldom of Orkney will be pawned and then transferred to the Scots.\nOrkney remains one of the highest ranked titles in the Kingdom of Norway however, one that has at times been a stepping stone to the Norwegian throne. While they remain a weak factor the Norwegian nobility are very wary of this deal.
translation: 自从13世纪的珀斯条约以来，苏格兰必须每年向挪威王国支付金钱，以换取对赫布里底的控制。然而这些拖付的欠款现在已经过期，这也造成了局势的紧张。无论我们的祖先有何等的宣称，我们在高地的权威显然并不充分，而且我们内部还有着更大的问题要处理。 有人建议将这一冲突一劳永逸地解决。 [SCO.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]家族将与[Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]王朝的成员联姻，奥克尼伯爵的领地将作为抵押，然后转移到苏格兰。\n奥克尼的头衔在挪威国内依旧地位甚高，但有时也只是作为登上挪威王位的垫脚石。 虽然挪威的贵族们依旧十分弱势，他们还是对这项交易抱持着小心谨慎的态度。

original: Ever since the 13th century treaty of Perth, Scotland has been obligated to pay a yearly sum to the Norwegian Kingdom in exchange for control of the Norwegian Hebrides. These payments are by now long overdue, however, and this has been the cause for tensions on and off. Regardless of our ancestral claims, however, our ability to project power in the Highlands is not what it was, and we have bigger issues closer to home to handle. It has been suggested that this conflict be settled once and for all. The [SCO.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]s will marry a member of the [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] dynasty and the Jarldom of Orkney will be pawned and then transferred to the Scots.\nOrkney remains one of the highest ranked titles in our Kingdom however, one that has at times been a stepping stone to the Norwegian throne. If we give up these islands we will have surrendered the right to rule our former possessions forever.
translation: 自从13世纪的珀斯条约以来，苏格兰必须每年向挪威王国支付金钱，以换取对赫布里底的控制。然而这些拖付的欠款现在已经过期，这就是造成紧张局势的原因。无论我们的祖先有何等的宣称，我们在高地的权威显然并不充分，而且我们内部有更大的问题要处理。 有人建议将这一冲突一劳永逸地解决。 [SCO.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]家族将与[Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]王朝的成员联姻，奥克尼伯爵的领地将作为抵押，然后转移到苏格兰。\n奥克尼的头衔在我们国内依旧地位甚高，但有时也只是作为登上挪威王位的垫脚石。 如果我们放弃这些岛屿，我们就会永远失去统治我们以前的财产的权利。
让我们结束这场冲突吧。

original: We will never give up our claim to these lands!
translation: 我们永远不会放弃对这些土地的宣称！

original: Should §YScotland§! accept the following will happen:
translation: 如果§Y苏格兰§!接受，以下事件将会发生：

original: Ever since the 13th century treaty of Perth, Scotland has been obligated to pay a yearly sum to the Norwegian Kingdom in exchange for control of the Norwegian Hebrides. These payments are by now long overdue, however, and this has been the cause for tensions on and off. [From.GetName] has now suggested settling this conflict once and for all. The [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]s will marry a member of the [From.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] dynasty and the Jarldom of Orkney will be pawned and then transferred to us.\nOrkney is one of the highest-ranked titles in Norway and the one our own northern lands would fall under if controlled by Norway. If they give up these islands they will have surrendered the right to rule their former possessions forever.
translation: 自从13世纪的珀斯条约以来，苏格兰必须每年向挪威王国支付金钱，以换取对赫布里底的控制。然而这些拖付的欠款现在已经过期，这就是造成紧张局势的原因。无论我们的祖先有何等的宣称，我们在高地的权威显然并不充分，而且我们内部有更大的问题要处理。 有人建议将这一冲突一劳永逸地解决。 [SCO.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]家族将与[Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]王朝的成员联姻，奥克尼伯爵的领地将被抵押，然后转移到苏格兰。\n奥克尼的头衔在挪威国内依旧地位甚高，如果继续由挪威控制，我们北部地区的所有权力将会崩溃。如果他们愿意放弃这些岛屿，他们将放弃统治他们以前的财产。

original: We would rather settle this with swords in hand.
translation: 我们宁愿用手中的剑来解决这个问题。

original: Ever since the 13th century treaty of Perth, Scotland has been obligated to pay a yearly sum to the Norwegian Kingdom in exchange for control of the Norwegian Hebrides. These payments are by now long overdue, however, and this has been the cause for tensions on and off. Regardless of our ancestral claims, however, our new overlords have seen fit to end this conflict forever. The [SCO.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]s will marry into their dynasty and the Jarldom of Orkney will be pawned and then transferred to the Scots.\nOrkney remains one of the highest-ranked titles in our Kingdom, one that has often been a stepping stone to the Norwegian throne. If we give up these islands we will have surrendered the right to rule our former possessions forever.
translation: 自从13世纪的珀斯条约以来，苏格兰必须每年向挪威王国支付金钱，以换取对赫布里底的控制。然而这些拖付的欠款现在已经过期，这就是造成紧张局势的原因。无论我们的祖先有何等的宣称，我们在高地的权威显然并不充分，而且我们内部有更大的问题要处理。  有人建议将这一冲突一劳永逸地解决。 [SCO.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]家族将与[Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]王朝的成员联姻，奥克尼伯爵的领地将被抵押，然后转移到苏格兰。\n奥克尼的头衔在我们国内依旧地位甚高，但有时也只是作为登上挪威王位的垫脚石。 如果我们放弃这些岛屿，我们就会永远放弃统治我们以前的财产的权利。

original: We have foregone the ancestral Norwegian claims to the Hebrides, Orkney Islands and any other part of the Highlands. Relations with the Scots have never been better.
translation: 我们已经将放弃了挪威的祖先对赫布里底，奥克尼群岛和高地的宣称。与苏格兰人的关系从未如此美好。

original: The Scots have refused our deal to settle the conflicting claims in the Hebrides and Orkney Islands. As a result tension is on the rise again.
translation: 苏格兰人拒绝我们来解决赫布里底群岛和奥克尼群岛冲突的索赔的协议。结果紧张局势再次上升。

original: Rather than give up their claims to the Scottish islands the Norwegian nobility are rebelling against their rightful King. They have elected a Norwegian noble as their new ruler.
translation: 挪威贵族没有放弃对苏格兰群岛的宣称，而是向他们合法的国王发起了反叛。 他们选出一位挪威贵族作为新的统治者。

original: I thought they would never dare!
translation: 我以为他们永远不敢这么做！

original: Olav Nilsson Skanke, popular commander of the Bergenhus fortress and a sworn enemy of the Hanseatic League in Norway has been killed by local merchants. Despite his long history of service to the crown Olav was also a pirate, hunting down Hanseatic ships all over the North Sea. In order to eliminate this threat to their interests the German merchants instigated a riot, cornering Olav in a local abbey and then burning it to the ground.\nOlav met his fate in the flames together with monks, local burghers and the Bishop of Bergen. Needless to say this is an event that could enflame the already strongly anti-Hanseatic Scandinavian disposition.
translation: 卑尔根胡斯堡广受爱戴的指挥官，汉萨同盟在挪威不共戴天的敌人奥拉夫·尼尔森·斯坎克被当地商人杀害。 尽管他长久以来服务于王室，但他也是一个在北海狩猎汉萨同盟的海盗。 为了消除这种对他们利益的威胁，德意志商人在当地一个修道院煽动暴动，将奥拉夫堵进了死路，而后放火将那里烧成了白地。\n奥拉夫与僧侣、当地民众和卑尔根主教在火焰中死亡。 不用说这个事件彻底点燃了斯堪的纳维亚人已经汹涌的反汉萨情绪。

original: This is the end of the Hanseaten in Bergen!
translation: 这是汉萨同盟在卑尔根的末日！

original: Olav Nilsson Skanke, popular commander of the Bergenhus fortress and a sworn enemy of the Hanseatic League in Norway has been killed by local merchants. Despite his long history of service to the crown Olav was also a pirate, hunting down Hanseatic ships all over the North Sea. In order to eliminate this threat to their interests the German merchants instigated a riot, cornering Olav in a local abbey and then burning it to the ground.\nOlav met his fate in the flames together with monks, local burghers and the Bishop of Bergen. The apparent unwillingness of [Root.Monarch.GetName] to reprimand the Hanseatics has further fueled the fires of Norwegian discontent.
translation: 卑尔根胡斯堡广受爱戴的指挥官，汉萨同盟在挪威不共戴天的敌人奥拉夫·尼尔森·斯坎克被当地商人杀害。 尽管他长久以来服务于王室，但他也是一个在北海狩猎汉萨同盟的海盗。 为了消除这种对他们利益的威胁，德意志商人在当地一个修道院煽动暴动，将奥拉夫堵进了死路，而后放火将那里烧成了白地。\n奥拉夫与僧侣、当地民众和卑尔根主教在火焰中死亡。[Root.Monarch.GetName]明显不愿意谴责汉萨同盟，这进一步加剧了挪威民众的不满情绪。

original: Olav Nilsson Skanke, popular commander of the Bergenhus fortress and a sworn enemy of the Hanseatic League in Norway has been killed by local merchants. Despite his long history of service to the crown Olav was also a pirate, hunting down Hanseatic ships all over the North Sea. In order to eliminate this threat to their interests the German merchants instigated a riot, cornering Olav in a local abbey and then burning it to the ground.\nOlav met his fate in the flames together with monks, local burghers and the Bishop of Bergen. Responding to the widespread anti-Hanseatic sentiments [Root.Monarch.GetName] has ordered the League to be expelled from Bergen and its vicinity.
translation: 卑尔根胡斯堡受人尊敬的指挥官、汉萨同盟在挪威不共戴天的敌人——奥拉夫·尼尔森·斯坎克被当地商人杀害。 尽管他长久以来服务于挪威王室，但他同时也是一名在整个北海狩猎汉萨同盟商船队的海盗。 为了消除这种对他们利益的威胁，德意志商人在当地煽动了一场骚乱，将奥拉夫逼进一座当地修道院，然后放火把它烧为白地。\n奥拉夫与当地市民、修道士、卑尔根主教在火焰中迎来了死亡的命运。为了响应广泛的反汉萨情绪，[Root.Monarch.GetName]下令将汉萨同盟势力驱逐出卑尔根及附近地区。

original: Timber has always been a major export of the Norwegian economy and trade ships from the Low Countries have become an increasingly common sight along the Norwegian coastline. Unlike the Hanseatic traders who have dominated our economy for centuries the Dutch are content to trade without meddling in local businesses or breaking the laws of the land.\nWith an ever growing demand from the Dutch shipbuilders the timber industry in Norway could well grow to be the biggest in Europe. As a seafaring and shipbuilding people we can undoubtedly learn a lot from the Dutch entrepreneurs by aligning with them against the Germans.
translation: 在挪威的经济结构中，木材一直都是主要的出口商品，低地国家的贸易船只在挪威海岸线上也越来越常见。不同于几个世纪以来宰制我国经济的汉萨贸易商，荷兰人更倾向于在进行贸易时不去妨碍当地的商业发展，也不会破坏当地的法律。\n随着荷兰造船业需求的不断增长，挪威可能会发展出欧洲首屈一指的木材业。 作为一个有着航海和造船传统的民族，我们无疑会从荷兰的企业家那里学到很多东西，与他们一起对抗德意志人。

original: The time of the Dutch has come.
In Search for Iron and Copper

While Norwegian peasants have extracted copper and iron for centuries on a small scale there are no great iron or copper mines in our lands. This is contrasted by the thriving mining sector in the Swedish realm where great quantities of both metals have been mined, cast, and exported since the Middle Ages.\nThe Crown has recently acquired many pieces of land previously under the control of the Church and Nobility who did not have resources or inclination to search for metals. Let us invite experienced prospectors and miners and see what treasures lie beneath these mountains.
translation: 虽然挪威农民小规模的铜铁冶炼已经持续了几个世纪，但在我们的土地上并没有大型的铁矿或铜矿，这与瑞典境内蓬勃发展的采矿业形成鲜明对比。自中世纪以来，他们一直在对这两种金属进行大量的开采，销售和出口。\n王室最近从教会和贵族手中收购了许多土地，这些人一直不愿意或没有能力寻找金属矿。 我们应当邀请经验丰富的探矿者和矿工，看看这些山下有什么珍宝。

original: Let us see what the mountains hide.
translation: 让我们看看山里面藏了什么。

original: Once §YIron§! or §YCopper§! is found in your Norwegian provinces you will be given the opportunity to reorient the provincial economy towards that trade good for a Monarch Point cost.
translation: 一旦在挪威各省发现§Y铁§!或§Y铜§!，您将有机会花费君主点数来重新调整省份的经济活动，转而生产新的贸易品。

original: Timber and fish have been good enough for our ancestors.
translation: 木材和鱼类已经很好地满足了我们祖先的需求。

original: Our prospectors have found large quantities of iron, lead and copper in the area between Bratsberg and Oslo. Developing the nearby villages into proper mining towns would be costly but the dream of becoming self-sufficient on weapon-related metals now seems to be within reach.
translation: 我们的探矿者在布拉茨堡和奥斯陆之间发现了大量的铁，铅和铜。 将附近的村庄彻底开发成采矿城镇的代价非常昂贵，但实现武器原料金属自给自足的这一梦想，现在看来似乎已是唾手可得了。

original: We need iron for our armies!
We need copper for our guns!
Mining will have to remain a small-scale enterprise.
translation: 矿产业将继续维持在一个较小的规模。

original: Prospectors have found large quantities of copper in Røros in Trøndelag. If we are willing to invest we may turn the nearby villages into proper mining towns and create a large-scale copper mine here.
translation: 探矿者在特伦德拉格的勒罗斯发现了大量铜矿。 如果我们愿意投资，我们可以把附近的村庄建成正规的矿业城镇，并在这里开发一个大型的铜矿。

original: Invest in the Røros Copper Mines.
Copper mining will have to remain a small-scale enterprise.
translation: 铜矿开采业还是要保持在一个较小的规模。

original: While some claim the locals have known all along, our miners have now found promising quantities of silver in Sandsvær. The site of the would-be mine is both distant and desolate and there are few with the necessary expertise to develop it within our borders. If we are to be able to benefit from our findings we will have to invite foreigners from silver rich regions in Germany and Central Europe.
translation: 我们的矿工在桑斯瓦尔找到了大量的银矿——虽然有些人声称当地人一直都知道这处矿藏。这处银矿位于非常偏远而荒芜的地方，而且我们国内也没有这方面的专家来开发它。 如果想要从这一发现中获益，我们需要从德意志和中欧的富银地区邀请一些外国人来进行协助。

original: This site shall from now on be known as Kongsberg!
translation: 从现在起，这里将改名为孔斯贝格！

original: Silver Mining will have to remain a small-scale enterprise.
translation: 银矿开采业将继续维持在一个较小的规模。

original: Through daring attacks and skillful maneuvers, Peter Jansen Wessel has been making a name for himself as a promising captain in the Norwegian navy. Wessel's unwillingness to ever back down from an engagement, regardless of the sizes of the involved ships or any other circumstance has catapulted him through the ranks. Today he stands before [Root.Monarch.GetName] to be ennobled for his great exploits on the open seas.
translation: 英勇的进攻和灵巧的机动，使得彼得·扬森·维塞尔被誉为挪威海军的未来之星。维塞尔从不愿从战斗中撤退，无论参战船只的大小或任何其他情况如何，都不能把他从阵位上轰走。今天他得到了[Root.Monarch.GetName]的召见，将凭借在公海上取得的巨大功绩而获封受爵。

original: Henceforth he shall be known as 'Tordenskiold' - Thundershield.
translation: 从此以后，他将被称为“托登舍尔德”，即雷盾勋爵。

original: At the age of 15 young skipper's son Cort Adeler left Norway behind for the open seas and he has since made a career as a successful merchant captain in the lowlands, the mediterranean and even as far away as the Coromandel Coast in India. Having also acted as captain in times of war in Dutch, English, Venetian and Turkish naval engagements, Adeler is in possession of experience and contacts that few in his generation posses. Through his various mercantile enterprises he has acquired a considerable personal fortune, some of which he has invested in his home country, especially the estates he has begun to develop outside the Norwegian city of Skien.\nA man of Adelers caliber could surely be put to good use in the service of the state.
translation: 15岁时，年轻的船长之子科特·阿德勒离开挪威前往远海探险，此后便开始了他辉煌的商队船长生涯，纵横于低地和地中海，甚至远至印度的科罗曼德海岸。 在荷兰、英国、威尼斯与土耳其海军的战争时期，阿德勒还担任过战舰的船长，拥有同辈人所罕有的经验和人脉。 他通过自己的各种商业公司获得了相当多的个人财富，其中一些投资在了他的祖国，尤其是他在挪威希恩周边开发的那些庄园。\n一个拥有阿德勒这般才干的人肯定能很好地为国效力。

original: For three days fires have ravaged the timber city of Oslo and now all but a few buildings in our country's capital lie in ashes. While fire has haunted Oslo before the destruction we face now is so final that it has been suggested we should relocate the city entirely as we rebuild. Instead of building in timber and awaiting the next catastrophe it has been suggested that we rebuild closer to Akershus fortress, using sounder techniques of construction and city planning as befits a capital of our age.\nRebuilding closer to Akershus will also allow us to properly fortify the city, which can be of great benefit in these times. In practice previous rulers have found it hard to prevent the citizens of Oslo to rebuild in whichever materials and mode they wish however, so a proper renovation is likely to be very costly.
translation: 整整三天的大火摧毁了奥斯陆这座由木材修筑而成的城市。现在我国首都只剩下一些残垣断壁孤立在一片灰烬之中。虽然在我们遭受灾难之前，火患就一直困扰着奥斯陆，但这次的火灾已经把它彻底的摧毁了，现在有人建议我们应该在更靠近阿克什胡斯要塞的地方重建城市，并采用更为完善可靠的建筑技术和城市规划方案，使其成为一座符合当代首都身份的城市，而不是用木材在现址上重建后又得面临下一场灾难。并且将新址选在更靠近阿克什胡斯要塞也将使得我们首都的防务得到加强，在这个时代能给我们带来很大的好处。从历史实践中来看，以前的统治者就已经发现很难阻止奥斯陆的市民们在重建时采用自己中意的材料和方案，所以一次彻底的重建工作可能会非常昂贵。

original: We must found a new city!
translation: 我们必须建立一座新城市！

original: What was lost is gone, let people rebuild as they please.
translation: 过去的就过去了，让人民按照自己的喜好进行重建吧。
荷兰与挪威的关系更加紧密

original: Over time the extensive integration of Norway into the economy of the rich cities in the Low Countries have led to a growing shipbuilding industry at home. Norwegian cities strongly tied to the timber trade are quickly growing bigger than ever before, with Norwegian, Dutch, Danish, Scottish, English and Swedish merchants blending together to create a cosmopolitan maritime environment.\nYoung Norwegian men have also begun to migrate in increasing numbers to the Low Countries. Some settle there while others continue onto the open seas. The growing number of Norwegian expatriates and those who eventually return to our lands are together immersing our country ever more deeply into the emerging global economy.
translation: 随着时间的推移，挪威与低地国家富裕城市的经济交流引导了国内造船业的不断增长。挪威、荷兰、丹麦、苏格兰、英格兰和瑞典的商人们携手创造出了一片开放的、无国界的海洋，使得与木材贸易紧密联系的挪威城市得以迅速发展。\n年轻的挪威人也开始越来越多地移居至低地国家。 有些人在那里定居，还有一些则继续前往更远的海外。 越来越多的挪威侨民和最终归乡的人们正在将我们的国家带入到新兴的全球经济中。

original: The sea is our future and our past.
translation: 大海是我们的过去和未来。

original: Centuries ago the Black Death devastated our lands, killing over 60% of our population, leaving large parts of the countryside entirely desolate and crushing the growing cities of the late Middle Ages. Politically this made union with the other Nordic countries a necessity and economically it left us the poorest of the members. Over time, however, the country has begun to heal. Large areas of open land and a rising economy has encouraged migration into Norway and made it easier for second or third sons to claim more lands for their families. While many on the coasts chose to migrate to the Low Countries the Norwegian inlands are experiencing an unprecedented level of population growth.
translation: 几个世纪前，黑死病侵袭了我们的土地。60％以上的人口死亡，大片的乡村地区变得荒无人烟，中世纪后期那些成长中的城市惨遭灭顶。 在政治上它使得我们必需与其他北欧国家结盟，在经济上它又使得我们成为联盟中最贫穷的成员。 然而，随着时间的推移，国家已经开始恢复元气。大片的空地和欣欣向荣的经济不断吸引着移民来到挪威，次子与幼子们也得以更为轻易地为自己的家庭索取更多的土地。尽管许多海滨地区的人选择移居至低地国家，但挪威内陆地区正在经历前所未有的人口增长。
矿工与当地居民之间的紧张关系

original: The influx of German miners and prospectors has in short time made small mining communities spring up all around our country even in areas where mining will never be the main source of income. These communities are, however, almost entirely small German colonies with German laws, customs and population. Surrounding Norwegian villages are required to provide the miners with food and other things they might need and this has over time lead to some tensions developing between the locals and the newcomers. In [hjartdal_standin.GetName] village upon village have begun to take up arms against the Germans, demanding that they leave and that Norwegian laws and customs be upheld.
translation: 德意志矿工和勘探人员的涌入，使得小型采矿区在短时间内如同雨后春笋般在全国各地出现——即使是在采矿业永远也不会成为主要收入来源的那些地区。然而，这些采矿区几乎都是遵循着德意志的法律和习俗、充斥着德意志人的德意志殖民区。 周围的挪威村庄需要向矿工们提供日常所需的食物和其他物品，这使得当地人和新来者之间渐渐产生了一些矛盾和紧张的气氛。 在[hjartdal_standin.GetName]，村庄里已经开始有人使用武器对付德意志人，要求他们离开从而保护挪威的法律和习俗。

original: These peasants need to learn their place!
translation: 这些农民需要知道自己的本分！

original: Worried about what they perceive to be an increasing encroachment on their privileges by the Danish Crown members of the Norwegian council and other prominents have gathered in [hamar_or_standin.GetCapitalName] to work out a number of demands upon the Crown for their continued support for the Union.\nThe demands put into print at [hamar_or_standin.GetCapitalName] include the restoration of lost Norwegian lands, affirming the traditional rights of the Norwegian church and nobility, strengthening the power of the Norwegian royal council, and in general affirming Norway's role as an equal party of Denmark in our Union. The intent is for the list of demands to be sent to [Root.Monarch.GetName] to be made part of [Root.Monarch.GetHerHis] traditional Håndfestning, the Electoral Capitulation, as [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] of Norway.
translation: 因为担心自己的特权受到丹麦王权日益严重的侵犯，挪威的议会成员与其他的社会名流在[hamar_or_standin.GetCapitalName]聚集起来，经过商讨后向国王提出了一系列的要求，作为继续支持卡尔马联盟的条件。\n这些要求在[hamar_or_standin.GetCapitalName]被印制成文，内容包括归还挪威失去的领土，加强挪威王室会议的权利，并在原则上确立挪威与丹麦在联盟中的平等地位。他们如此做的目的是为了将这份交予[Root.Monarch.GetName]的条件清单列入其出任挪威[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]的宪章，即选王协议。

original: We would do better not to question Danish rule...
translation: 我们最好不要质疑丹麦的统治……

original: Together with a number of important persons in the realm the Norwegian Royal Council has sent us a list of demands that they feel must be met for Norway to accept the accession of [Root.Monarch.GetName]. According to the Council members the Danish crown have continued to trample the rights of the Norwegian people for too long and this must be reversed. If we do not agree they threaten to use their de jure power to elect another ruler.
translation: 挪威王室议会伙同了国内的一些要人，向我们递交了一系列的要求，作为挪威接受[Root.Monarch.GetName]即位的条件。按照那些议会成员的说法，丹麦王权践踏挪威人权利的时间已经太久，这一情况必须得到扭转。他们威胁说，如果我们不同意，他们将重拾法理权力并推举出一名新的统治者。

original: We must refuse these preposterous demands!
translation: 我们必须拒绝这些荒谬的要求！

original: By refusing to meet the demands of the Norwegian Council we may provoke them to §Rbreak§! their §Yunion§! with us.
translation: 如果我们拒绝挪威议会的要求，他们可能会被激怒并§R背弃§!同我们的§Y联盟§!。

original: These are minor things, let us agree to preserve the union.
translation: 都是小事啦！同意他们吧，这样联盟还能存续。

original: The Danes have agreed to our demands. Surely this will safeguard our independence going forward!
translation: 丹麦人同意我们的要求了！这将会使我们的独立之路迈出一大步！

original: A messenger from the Danish court has arrived with their reply to our demands. [Root.Monarch.GetName] refuses to meet any of them and has instead made a proposal of his own that addresses very few of our points of concern. Some feel we have no choice but to elect another ruler as is our right.
translation: 丹麦宫廷的信使抵达了挪威，并带来了他们的回复。[Root.Monarch.GetName]不仅拒绝满足任何要求，还提出了自己的提案。然而这篇提案通篇都在顾左右而言他，绝口不提我们最关心的内容。一些同胞觉得我们已别无选择，只能重拾起我们的权利，选出一位新的统治者。

original: Let us elect our own king.
translation: 我们要选举出我们自己的王！
我们必须维护联盟的稳定。

original: The Norwegian Royal Council has defied [Root.Monarch.GetName] and elected another man to lead their kingdom in the hopes of ending Danish rule forever.
translation: 挪威王室议会公然违抗[Root.Monarch.GetName]并选出了一个新的国王来领导他们，以期永远摆脱丹麦的统治。

original: King Hyo-jong plans to launch a northern expedition to chastise the Manchus. This will require substantial preparations, funds and is impossible to keep secret. He plans to strengthen Korea's defenses by increasing and improving training and upgrading our fortresses.
translation: 孝宗国王计划北伐攻打满清.这需要一系列准备，因而无法保密.他计划加强训练，加固要塞.

original: While serving as Third Censor in 1495, Kim Il-son, a former state historian, proved himself to be a man willing to go to great lengths in criticizing government officials regardless of their power or status. One of Kim's accusatory memoranda set off a controversy that soon took on a life all of its own. The resulting reaction led to a purge of many of the intellectuals that had dared to criticize the officials and the king.
translation: 1495年，司谏院献纳，前史官，金驲孙以谏为名，往往无视对方的地位与权力.他的上疏引发了一场论战，不久便夺走了他的性命.随后，引发了更大规模的清洗，无数谏臣死于非命.

original: During the course of a state banquet in the autumn of 1503, Minister of Rites Yi Se-jwa accidentally spilled wine on the king's robes during dinner. The king interpreted it as a crime against the sovereign and therefore treasonous. The incident set off a chain of events resulting in banishments, purges and executions of the officials and intellectuals, who had survived the first purge, to stamp out contempt for authority.
translation: 在1503年秋的一次国宴上，礼曹判书李世佐不小心将酒泼在了国王燕山君的身上.国王早已对其不满因此借题发挥指责这是谋反.燕山君大开杀诫，试图通过士祸残害士林来杀鸡儆猴，迫使其顺从.

original: Cho Kwang-jo, a Neo-Confucian reformer, attempted to shape the government according to Confucian ideals. His initial successes in reformation backfired when he went too far in attacking the old order. The fundamental devotion of the purge victims to the throne was never questioned, unlike earlier purges. The government believed that 'Cho Kwang-jo's clique', as it was called, was misguided, that much of its reform program would harm the government, and that the turbulence caused by its actions constituted a grave threat to Yi society and the foundations of the state. The result was that Cho Kwang-jo and his young idealists were eliminated and the inter-factional battles developed into naked power struggles. Scores of people were executed and hundreds were either dismissed from government office or exiled.
translation: 赵光祖，著名的理学家，打算依靠国王支持施行以道学为基础的“哲人君主主义”理论，建立一个大同社会，如同中国上古尧舜之治.但是随着同勋旧派党争的加剧，许多事情同最初的想法偏离甚远.同早先的士祸不同，这次士祸毫无疑问是王权的牺牲品.朝鲜国王认为“赵光祖党”已经不在自己的掌控之中，他们对勋旧派的攻击开始威胁到自己.党争的漩涡开始威胁到朝鲜李朝的统治基础.最后，赵光祖为首的士林派被一网打尽.

original: Introduction of Uniform Land Tax Law

The Korean economy was in a very bad shape by the 17th century and to rectify this state Chief State Councilor Yi Won-ik gradually introduced previously ignored reforms in the tax system. The tribute tax levied against households was replaced with a unified tax on arable land. The tax on goods was limited to a quota which let enterprising peasants and wholesalers make and sell surplus goods. The net effect was lower taxes for peasants, increased revenues for the state and a rise in commerce.
translation: 17世纪经过壬辰倭乱的摧残，朝鲜经济凋敝，民不聊生.领议政李元翼致力于战后重建工作，施行金堉所提议的“大同法”，即将所有的税收统一为大米，鼓励农民出售多余农作物，减轻了农民负担，增加了国家收入.

original: Since the death of Nan T'arat, the succession has been disputed between our current monarch and his uncle King Kitsarat. It appears that the crisis is coming to a head, and now it appears that we must choose a course of action. What shall we do?
translation: 南拉死后，现在的国王和他的叔叔景基萨腊在继承问题上争论不休.是时候作出最终决定了，我们该怎么办？

original: We owe the Turks nothing! Let them squirm on the stakes!
translation: 我们不欠土耳其人任何东西！让他们在木桩上去蠕动吧！

original: After years of misrule by weak kings who were puppets of foreign powers, the Dalai Lama, long the spiritual leader of the Tibetan people, has taken full control of the government. His Holiness, the Dalai Lama, seeks your advice. What kind of foreign policy should we pursue?
translation: 西藏的精神领袖，一直是外国傀儡的达赖喇嘛重新掌握了权力。达赖喇嘛向你寻求建议。我们该执行何种外交政策？

original: Turn inward and create a peaceful Shangri-La
translation: 让我们把西藏建成和平的香格里拉

original: The Commissioning of the Saint Peter's Basilica

Pope Julius II started building the Basilica not very long after being elected Pope. The completion would take more than 100 years and one of most famous artist in history, Michelangelo, had a large role at times in its completion, both as an architect and as a painter.
translation: 儒略二世在当选教宗后不久就着手大教堂的建设.该工程预计需要100年时间，最伟大的艺术家之一米开朗基罗也为此奉献了许多.

original: In 1540 Pope Paulus III recognized the Jesuite Order, created 1534 by the Spaniard Don Iñigo López de Recalade, better know as Ignatius of Loyola. He becomes one of the most devoted counter reformists and enemy number one of the Protestant movement. Loyola having a soldier background makes its mark on the order, which is organized almost as an army. High priority was given both to educating missionaries but also counselors for European royal courts. This made the Jesuite order very powerful in the politic scene. 1773 the Jesuite order was dissolved by Pope Pius VI due to pressure from Christian countries in the age of enlightenment. 1814 the Jesuite order was reinstituted, however, just as a faint shadow of the powerful order it once had been.
translation: 1534年耶稣会由依纳爵·罗耀拉建立，其组织与会规后于1540年蒙教宗保禄三世许可.依纳爵·罗耀拉后来提倡在罗马天主教内进行改革，对抗新教徒的宗教改革.罗耀拉参照军队的纪律，制定了严格的会规，强调会士必须绝对服从会长.耶稣会重视培养传教士并且重视同欧陆诸王室的联系.这大大加强了耶稣会的战斗力.1773年耶稣会因启蒙运动被教宗庇护六世下令解散.1814年，耶稣会重建，但已没有往日的荣光.

original: Papal approval of the Jesuit order

Your support of the Jesuit order has been noted and is wholly appreciated by the Pope. The order was created in 1534 by the Spaniard Don Iñigo López de Recalade, better know as Ignatius of Loyola. He was one of the most devoted counter reformists and enemy number one of the Protestant movement.
translation: 1534年耶稣会由依纳爵·罗耀拉建立，你对耶稣会的支持得到了教宗的称赞.依纳爵·罗耀拉后来提倡在罗马天主教内进行改革，对抗新教徒的宗教改革.

original: At the initiative of Pietro Caraffa from Naples, the Pope reorganizes the Roman inquisition according to the Spanish model. Together with the Jesuits a reign of terror is inflicted on the people. However the cruel methods are effective and lead to completely eradicating the Protestant movement in the Italian peninsula.
translation: 自保禄四世始，教宗以西班牙为样板重建了宗教裁判所.它和耶稣会是当时折磨人们的两大灾祸.但是这也在亚平宁半岛点燃了宗教改革之火.

original: Giordano Bruno was an Italian theologian that identified God with Nature. Even though he considered himself a Christian, he both defended Copernicus' view of the cosmos as well as satirized blind belief in religion. He was arrested in Venezia and was extradited to Rome, where he was put on trial.
translation: 高德诺·布鲁诺是意大利神学家，他认为上帝是自然的一种表现.尽管他认为自己是天主教徒，但是他同时认同哥白尼的日心说并以此为自己的宗教理念辩护.他在威尼斯被捕，最终在罗马被处死.

original: The Cleansing of the Pontinian Marches
1779 Pope Pius VI drained the Pontinian marches to create more productive farmland instead of useless swamps.
translation: 1779年教宗庇护六世排干了彭甸沼泽，增加了罗马的耕地面积.

original: The Counter-Reformation and the Reformation of the Catholic Faith
translation: 反改教运动与宗教改革运动

original: The Counter-reformation movement historically started in 1540 with the institution of the Societas Jesu. This marked the beginning of a few highly volatile decades in European history when the two sides of Reformed and Counter-reformed fought each other. At the same time there were forces within the Catholic Church who wanted reform to remedy the corruption and other afflictions of the church. Thus in 1545 the Council of Trent was called. The debate went on for almost 20 years with almost as much turmoil created as on the battlefields against the Protestants.
translation: 反宗教改革运动自1540年始，标志事件是耶稣会建立.反宗教改革派和宗教改革派的斗争使整个欧洲陷入动荡.同时，在教廷内部，也有赞同改革革除弊政的声音.1545年天特会议因此召开.当大会于1563年12月4日闭幕的时候，前后共召开过二十五场讨论，用了近十八年的时间，其激烈程度不亚于同新教的战争.

original: An invitation will be sent out to all §YCatholic§! countries.
translation: 邀请函将发往所有§Y天主教§!国家。

original: The Pope has invited us to attend the Council of Trent, to debate the required reforms to remedy the corruption and other afflictions of the church. The Council will discuss what constitutes the Protestant heresy and to define Church teachings in the areas of Scripture and Tradition, Original Sin, Justification, Sacraments, the Eucharist in Holy Mass and the veneration of saints. It will try to answer Protestant disputes by discussing what specifies Catholic doctrine on salvation, the sacraments, and the Biblical canon.
translation: 教宗邀请我们参加天特会议，就修补教会缺陷的必要措施展开讨论.会议将会讨论新教的影响，《圣经》的版本，罗马教会的传统教说，原罪，称义，弥撒礼仪，敬奉等议题.这次会议对于新教极力攻击的各项教义问题，如救赎，圣餐礼和圣经版本将作出决议.

original: In 1584, the Khan Nurhaci managed to unite all the Tungusian tribes, the so-called Kin-Tungus, later known as Manchus. He also reformed government, administration and the judicial system with China as model. Nurhachi also invented the written Manchurian language.
translation: 1584年努尔哈赤最终统一了女真部落，建立了金，也就是后来的满清。他同时参考汉族政权改革了政府结构，发明了满文。

original: A Great Day for the Manchu Peoples

Several large Eastern Mongol tribes unite under Nurhaci and his number of 'flags' (armies) increases from four to eight. It is now that he sets his goal to conquer China. In 1616 he takes the title 'Kin-Khan' to show that his people descend from the Kin-Tungus. He also takes the name 'Aisin Giorin (Golden tribe). In 1625 he attacked China, a development that ultimately ended in a total Manchurian victory.
translation: 几支较大的蒙古部落前来投靠努尔哈赤，四旗也扩编为八旗.他此时已经把入侵中原作为自己的目标了.1616年，努尔哈赤自封天命汗，改姓爱新觉罗，以显示自己的正统性.1625年努尔哈赤攻占沈阳，拉开了进攻中原王朝的序幕，而这一切最终以满清的胜利而结束.

original: Now that the Manchu are firmly in control of northern China, it may now be time to use Manchu military expertise to reform the old Chinese army. However, this will likely be expensive and many in the military will resent such an attempt. What shall we do?
translation: 现在满清控制了京师，我军节节败退，似乎有必要改造腐朽的军队.但是这显然花费巨大，军中反对声音也不会少.我们该怎么办？

original: Yes, reform the military, as the old Chinese ways are inferior
translation: 改革军队，老办法解决不了新问题

original: Bah! What could barbarians teach the nation of Sun Tzu?
translation: 笨蛋！我们怎么可能打不过野猪皮？

original: Although we are now at peace with China, it is obvious that they are a nation in the process of disintegration. Surely it would be wise to attack them while they are so weak and make even more spectacular advances!
translation: 虽然我们同中原王朝保持和平，但是显然对方正在四分五裂.趁机进攻显然比养虎为患好！

original: Attack them now while they are weak!
No, we will leave them be
