The Revolt of the Three Feudatories

Three feudal lords in the south, once Ming generals who have since thrown in their lot with the Manchu, are threatening to rise up in rebellion! Ordered to give up their offices and return to Beijing, they are instead demanding that they be allowed to retain their posts as lords of semi-autonomous provinces. They claim that if they aren't allowed to retain their current positions and aren't given huge bribes, they will rise up in rebellion. What shall we do?
translation: 南方的三藩是我们的威胁！虽然已下令撤藩，但是这些前大明将领显然还想保持自己的小王国.他们甚至宣称如果不继续提供军饷就起兵叛乱.我们该怎么办？

original: Due to recent events, it now seems that the Jesuits may have outlived their usefulness. Although their knowledge is great, it is foreign to us and sometimes causes much commotion among our scholars and the common folk, disrupting the stability of our realm. They have been for decades interfering in the internal affairs of our nation - the final straw was their meddling in the recent succession. Perhaps it is time for them to go.
translation: 从最近发生的事情来看，西洋传教士有百害而无一利.虽然他们的知识比我国现金，但是对我国社会稳定的冲击实在太大.我们已经让他们在我国蹦跶了几十年，现在他们又试图插手政权，或许应该把他们驱逐出去了.

original: An up-and-coming minister has recently come to our attention. His name is Heshen, and he is certainly wise in the ways of diplomacy and administration. However, rumor has it that he is also grossly corrupt, mixing his political excellence with greed and favoritism. Should we make him our chief minister?
translation: 一个表现突出的大臣最近引起了我们的注意。他叫和珅，在外交和行政方面极具天赋。然而，同时有传闻说他非常腐败，其卓越政绩下往往掩藏着贪腐与徇私。我们是否应该任命他为军机大臣？

original: No, such corruption could ruin the state!
translation: 不可，如此腐败会毁了我们的国家！

original: The Grandmaster Hospitaler d'Aubusson who so successfully had defended Rhodos against the previous sultan, Mehmed II, imprisoned the brother of the Turkish sultan Bayezid II despite a promise of safe conduct in 1483. Such a prestigious captive was obviously a strong negotiation asset for many of the enemies of the Ottoman Empire and several countries were prepared to pay large sums for him.
translation: 尽管和平承诺已在1483年作出，曾挫败了土耳其前苏丹穆罕默德二世对罗得岛的进攻的医院骑士团大团长德 奥布森还是囚禁了土耳其苏丹巴耶济德二世的兄弟。对于奥斯曼的敌人来说，这个俘虏显然价值连城，许多国家竞相出价索要。

original: Rhodians and other Greeks accepted into the Order
translation: 招募罗得岛居民以及希腊人

original: In the early 16th century, Rhodians and other Greeks were rashly allowed into the order in a last grand effort to build up manpower to stop the Turkish onslaught.
translation: 16世纪早期，骑士团招募了大批罗得岛居民和希腊人，增加军团人数，对抗土耳其的入侵.

original: The small but proficient fleet of the Knights was the scourge of Muslims for hundreds of years. Keeping the waters clear of enemy privateers as well as capturing trade ships of the Muslims, kept the coffers on Rhodos full and Muslim sailors in terror. One of the most famous events was the capturing of the Great Carrack from Alexandria in 1569, filled with enormous riches.
translation: 几百年来，医院骑士团小而精的舰队一直是穆斯林的眼中钉。骑士团舰队驱逐敌人的私掠舰，袭击穆斯林商船，给罗得岛运输物资，让穆斯林水手惶惶不可终日。其中最著名的事件是1569年俘获了满载财宝的亚历山大的大帆船。
加布里埃尔·塔蒂尼·德·马丁讷戈

original: Martinengo was the best fortification engineer of Europe. He was authorized to improve the fortresses on Rhodes. In 1521, when he had worked for a couple of months he was so enamored with the Knights and their ideals that he kneeled in front of the Grand Master and begged him to make him a Knight. The Grand master accepted him into the brotherhood and he fought bravely, dying in battle of Rhodes in 1522.
translation: 马丁宁戈是欧洲最优秀的要塞工程师，准备在罗得岛修建要塞。1521年，经历了长时间的合作后，他迷上了骑士团的事业，在大团长前屈膝请求成为团员。1522年，他作为一名团员战死在罗得岛。

original: After it was acquired by the Knights, Malta became as strong a fortress as Rhodes had been. Under Grand Master Jean Parisot de La Valette, they 1565 successfully withstood an Ottoman siege consisting of 180 ships and close to 50.000 men against only 9000 defenders for six months, before the invader was forced to leave. The new capital city of Valletta became a town of splendid palaces and unparalleled fortifications. Growing in power and wealth owing mainly to their maritime raiding adventures against the Turks.
translation: 骑士团被授予马耳他岛后，努力建设，试图将其变为第二个罗得岛。在大团长让·帕里索·德·拉·瓦莱特的领导下，他们于1565年以9000人抵挡了奥斯曼50000人180艘船的6个月进攻，最后迫使奥斯曼撤军。新首都瓦莱塔成为了一座繁荣的城市和一座坚固的要塞。日益增强的实力使他们再次有能力从海上骚扰土耳其人。

original: In 1532 a civil war broke out between the heirs to the Inca throne, Atahualpa and Huascar, each of whom was seeking to control the empire. The Spaniards met Atahualpa, the victor in the civil war, and his army at a prearranged conference at Cajamarca in 1532. When Atahualpa arrived, the Spaniards ambushed and seized him, and killed thousands of his followers even though Atahualpa paid the most fabulous ransom known to history.
translation: 1532年印加因皇位问题爆发内战，双方分别是阿塔瓦尔帕和瓦斯卡.内战结束后，西班牙人在卡哈马卡求见印加皇帝阿塔瓦尔帕，却突然发动袭击，扣押了阿塔瓦尔帕.之后，虽然印加皇帝支付了有史以来最大的一笔赎金，他还是被无情的杀死了.

original: Having long served the various masters of the Deccan the Marathas have perfected the guerrilla like warfare of that plateau. The growing influence of the Marathi captains in our ranks as well as the growth of a Maratha literary language has inspired an increasing feeling of separatism in their ranks. To many it would appear that their time is now.
translation: 经年服役于德干诸王的马拉塔人，已经将高原上的游击型战术打磨到了极致。马拉塔人的领袖们在我国统治阶级内的影响日益增长，马拉塔文字的发展也使马拉塔人的分离主义愈演愈烈。这一切在他们看来预示着属于他们时代的降临。

original: Not in our land it isn't!

Your Highness, forces suspected to be led by the Mughal Prince Bâbur have been moving into Thar and the Indus valley. If this is indeed Bâbur and not an ordinary raid by Afghani tribesmen we could be facing an outright invasion. I have a very bad feeling about this... Perhaps we should attempt to negotiate?
translation: 殿下，有探子回报，蒙古王子绰号老虎的巴卑尔的军队出现在边境，向塔尔沙漠和印度河谷行军.如果真的是巴卑尔的部队，我们面临着大麻烦.我们是否应该试着同他谈判？

original: The Lodi Dynasty has seized control of our nation. The dynasty is widely disliked and both the population of this sultanate and our neighbors are expressing their disapproval of their usurpation. The best we can do is to weather the storm that the actions of our new monarchs have caused.
translation: 洛迪王朝控制着国家.但是，它并没有得到人民和邻国的喜爱.我们该做的是在暴风中支持下去.

original: The Lodi Dynasty has been a disaster for our nation! Their manifest incompetence has ruined the state, brought the populace to the verge of outright revolt, and made our neighbors both despise us and to plot against us. The best we can do is to persevere despite the troubles that our useless monarchs have caused.
translation: 洛迪王朝的统治对我们来说就是灾难！在这内忧外患之中，我们唯一能做的只有坚持下去.

original: Emperor Le Nghi Dan has proposed various reforms concerning the government and the economic well-being of our kingdom. While many of these proposals make great sense, they will also be expensive and may cause unrest. What shall we do?
translation: 国王黎宜民出台了一大批涉及内政和经济的改革措施.尽管政策没问题，但是执行起来成本相当高，而且会引起政局动荡，我们该怎么做？

original: The Rivalry of the Mac and Trinh Families

Two great families vie for the power of regent of this nation, the Mac and the Trinh. Because of this power struggle, the nation has slid into anarchy, with armed bands supporting one side or the other roaming the countryside. We can only hope that their feuding will end soon.
translation: 两大势力莫朝和郑主各控制着国家的一半，相互攻击，内战不停.我们唯一能做的只有祈祷.

original: After years of corruption, mismanagement, and famine, the people of our nation have apparently had enough. They have risen up in rebellion under the leadership of the Tay Son brothers. What shall we do?
translation: 长年的黑暗统治终于激怒了人民.他们在西山阮氏三兄弟的领导下，揭竿而起.我们该怎么办？

original: Michelangelo was considered the greatest living artist in his lifetime and ever since then he has been held to be one of the greatest artists of all times. A number of his works in painting, sculpture and architecture rank among the most famous in existence. Although the frescoes on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel are probably the best known of his works today, the artist thought of himself primarily as a sculptor.
translation: 米开朗基罗是他那个时代最伟大的艺术家，也是历史上最伟大的艺术家之一.他在绘画，雕塑和建筑方面都有杰出的作品.虽然西斯廷教堂的穹顶是他最著名的作品，但是他自己觉得自己是一名雕塑家.
皇帝谴责了托斯卡纳的僭越

original: Tuscany's strength has been growing for a long time, and it is only right that the Pope finally acknowledges the achievements of the Duchy of Florence. Pope [PAP.Monarch.GetName] has proclaimed our state a Grand Duchy, and the venerable [Root.Monarch.GetName] its Grand Duke. However, the proclamation has met opposition. \nWhile only nominally, the Emperor still views Tuscany as an imperial fief, and claims the Pope's proclamation is unlawful!
translation: 长久以来，托斯卡纳羽翼渐丰，而教宗也最终承认了佛罗伦萨公国的杰出成就。教宗[PAP.Monarch.GetName]宣布给予我们国家大公国的地位，并授予我们可敬的[Root.Monarch.GetName]以大公的爵位。然而，教宗的这份公告却遇到了反对意见。 \n尽管只停留在名义上，但皇帝依旧视托斯卡纳为帝国的一块封地，并且声称教宗的这份公告是非法的！

original: The Emperor will not stand in the way of God's will.
translation: 皇帝可不能妨碍上帝的权威。

original: We must yield to the Emperor's customary right.
translation: 我们必须屈服于皇帝的淫威。
皇帝恩准了托斯卡纳的晋升

original: Our diplomats have worked day and night, ensuring that the Emperor reconsider his position on the status of our duchy. Now, he has finally realized that he cannot stand in the way of God's will. With a new proclamation, he has confirmed Tuscany's status as a Grand Duchy. With both Pope and Emperor on our side, none can deny our glory.
translation: 我们的外交官昼夜不停地工作，努力确保皇帝重新考虑他在面对我们公国现状时的立场。现在他终于意识到，上帝的旨意不可违逆。随着一份新诏书的颁布，皇帝承认了托斯卡纳作为大公国的地位。有了教宗和皇帝为我们撑腰，谁也不能否认我们的荣耀。

original: The Construction Projects of Fernando I

Grand Duke Fernando dedicated his rule to improving the lives of his subjects, and by extension the Tuscan state. One of his grand undertakings were extensive development projects in Tuscany.\nUnder his rule, roads were improved and developed across the duchy. Even more significantly, he oversaw the draining of much Tuscan marshland around Pisa, opening new land for settlement and industry. This was done by, among other things, the diverting of the Arno River into the Naviglio Canal, which served to improve commerce between Florence and Pisa.
translation: 斐迪南大公一生致力于思考如何改善臣民们的生活，思考有关托斯卡纳人的国家的一切。他的突出贡献之一就是在托斯卡纳广泛开展基础建设。\n在他的统治下，整个公国的道路都得到了改善和发展；他还亲自监督了比萨周边那些泽地的清理工作，开拓出新的土地供人们定居、发展产业，更是惠泽茂焉。这项工程千头万绪，其中的关键就是将阿诺河改流至米兰大运河，这也加速了托斯卡纳和比萨之间的贸易联系。

original: Expand the road network and charge high tolls.
translation: 扩大道路网并且收取高额路费。

original: Charge higher tolls and just say you've improved the roads.
translation: 假装重新修缮了道路，并借此收取更高昂的路费。

original: $COUNTRY$ under the Medicis was a financial great power in Italy, wool flowing from the city and gold flowing in, not least of all through the Medici bank. The bank, along with ownership of much of the local industry, meant that a Medici ruler exerted immense control over the duchy's economy. Eventually extensive ownership meant that the distinction between the personal wealth of the Duke and state funds was largely negligible. For example did the Grand Duke have exclusive rights to the state's extraction of salt and minerals, but those funds were expected to directly benefit the state and the city. \nHowever, with so much personal control, what was state money and what was family money largely came down to each individual Grand Duke.
translation: 美第奇家族治下的$COUNTRY$可谓财大气粗，是意大利的一方霸权。羊毛从城市中流出，摇身一变成了黄金再流入城市，更不用提这些都经过了美第奇银行之手。这座银行连同当地众多产业的所有权，表露出一位美第奇家族的统治者能够掌控整个公国的经济命脉。这种彻底的掌控也意味着大公的私人财产与国库资金之间的区别几乎可以忽略不计。例如，大公拥有着国内采盐和采矿的专营权，但这些钱终究还是会投入到国家和城市的建设中去。\n在如此强大的控制之下，哪些财富归属国家，而哪些又归属家族，其间的分辨不过是大公一言而决。

original: What's in the Medici's interest is in $COUNTRY$'s interest.
translation: 美第奇家族的利益，就是$COUNTRY$的利益！

original: The Medici rule for the Tuscan people.
translation: 美第奇的统治是为了托斯卡纳人的福祉。

original:
Peter Leopold of the house Habsburg-Lorraine, who ruled Tuscany between 1765 and 1790, was unpopular for an unusual reason. He introduced extensive social, legal and financial reforms in Tuscany, but met extensive opposition from every strata of society, as the reforms were considered too liberal.
Reforming the tax system to ease the burden on citizens, and conducting profitable public works were well received, but his attempts at reducing the power of the clergy were stopped by opposition from the Pope and his political allies. Despite being challenged at every turn, many of his goals were achieved, such as guaranteeing legal rights for citizens, improving the treatment of the mentally ill, and one of the earliest smallpox inoculation programs. 
Peter Leopold also attempted to introduce a constitution in Tuscany. This would see greater rights given to its citizens, and ensure a balance between legislative and executive powers.

The constitution met fierce resistance, even from those who would benefit from it, and was never put into effect. The cause had to be abandoned in 1790, when Leopold moved to Vienna to accept the mantle of Holy Roman Emperor.
translation:
来自哈布斯堡-洛林家族的彼得·利奥波德于1765至1790年间统治托斯卡纳，他曾因一些特殊原因而不受待见。在统治托斯卡纳期间，他大力实施社会、法律及金融方面的改革，但却因这些改革被认为太过自由主义而遭到了社会各阶层的一致反对。
他改革了税收体系以减轻公民的负担，还大力建造了许多有利于市民们的公共设施，得到了社会的一致好评，但是他削弱教权的尝试却遭到了教宗及其政治盟友的反对。尽管在各方面都频频受阻，他还是完成了许多目标，诸如保障公民的合法权益、改善对精神疾病患者的治疗等，他还实行了最早的天花接种项目。
彼得·利奥波德也曾试图将宪法引进托斯卡纳，这将赋予公民更大的权利，并确保立法和行政之间的权力平衡。

但是宪法却遭到了强烈的抵触，即使是那些能够从中受益者也抱持了反对意见。宪法始终未能得以生效。直到1790年，由于利奥波德将前往维也纳就任神圣罗马帝国皇帝，他才不得不放弃了这件事。

original: We will implement these reforms, whatever the cost!
translation: 我们将不惜一切代价去推动这些改革！

original: If the people don't want reforms we should place our efforts elsewhere.
translation: 如果人民不想改革，或许我们应该把精力花费在其他地方上。

original: The Accademia del Cimento was a scientific society established in Florence in 1657. It was one of the first of its kind, founded by students of Galileo and funded by Prince Leopold and his brother, the Grand Duke Ferdinando II.\nWhile it was never an official institution, it was important for the development of the scientific principles of experimentation. The society had the motto "Try and try again," and published the Saggi, a book that would become the standard laboratory manual of the 18th century.
translation: 西芒托学院于1657年在佛罗伦萨成立，是世界上最早的自然科学协会之一，由伽利略的一群学生创办并获得了利奥波德亲王及其兄弟斐迪南二世大公的赞助。\n虽然西芒托学院从未成为过官方的正式机构，但其在科学实验原理的发展过程中起到了十分重要的作用。该学院的座右铭为「尝试，再尝试」，曾出版了一本名为《文集》的书，这本书后来成为了18世纪的标准实验准则。

original: Scientific societies sound like they could be useful someday. Maybe.
translation: 科学学院，听起来或许某天会有用的。也许呢……

original: We need to institutionalize the society for the benefit of $COUNTRY$.
translation: 为了$COUNTRY$的利益，我们需要把这个学院规范化。

original: The Medici Oriental Press was a printing house established by Ferdinando de Medici in 1584. It had the objective of printing Christian works in Arabic, in the hopes of converting Muslims, and was granted a monopoly by the Pope to print books in "foreign languages."\nThe press published some of the earliest printed works in Arabic, which came to include multiple non-religious works. Scientific works in Arabic were printed for circulation among European scientists, along with ancient Greek works that had only survived in its Arabic translation.
translation: 美第奇东方印刷厂是一座由斐迪南·德·美第奇于1584年建立的印刷厂。该印刷厂被教宗授予了印刷“外语书籍”的垄断权，主要工作是使用阿拉伯语印制基督教作品，以期使穆斯林皈依正统。\n印刷厂出版了一些最早的阿拉伯语印刷品，其中包括有许多非宗教性的作品。阿拉伯语的科学作品被印刷出来并在欧洲的科学家们之间传播，还有一些仅有阿拉伯语副本幸存的古希腊作品也得以重现在欧洲人的视野当中。

original: For the past few years, a preacher has been catching the attention of the people of $COUNTRY$. Girolamo Savonarola has spoken fiercely against the [Root.Monarch.GetTitle]s, the Pope himself, and has even predicted Judgment Day to be fast approaching.\nWith the recent turmoil in Italy, more and more are starting to listen. Savonarola is now encouraging mobs to accost the $DYNASTY$s in the street, to protect the ancient republic.\nIt is only a question of time before he convinces the entire city of Firenze to listen to his "divine visions."
translation: 在过去的几年中，一位牧师吸引了$COUNTRY$人的注意力：吉罗拉莫·萨佛纳罗拉言辞激烈地抨击了[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]和教宗，甚至预言称审判日将很快降临。\n随着意大利近期的骚乱，越来越多的人民开始听信他的言论。目前，萨佛纳罗拉正在鼓动暴徒们到街道上袭击$DYNASTY$家族的人，以此来守护这个古老的共和国，\n现在，令整个佛罗伦萨都去聆听他的“神启”只是时间问题。

original: That mad preacher must be arrested!
translation: 必须逮捕那个疯子牧师！

original: The people of $CAPITAL$ desire nothing more than to be cleansed of their sin, and Savonarola will guide them! Every person has their blasphemous texts or false idols or needless luxuries. Anyone living humble under God should be without such evil distractions, and they must be burnt. We will gather it all in huge bonfires in public places, where everyone can see the wickedness of this world evaporate as smoke on the wind. \n\nBurn your sin, $CAPITAL$! Burn your sin!
translation: $CAPITAL$的人们极度渴望消除自己的罪孽，而萨伏那洛拉则会引导他们！每个人都持有亵渎的文字，虚伪的偶像，以及不必要的奢侈品。任何一名上帝的顺民都不应持有这些邪物，这些东西必须被烧作灰烬。我们将把这些东西当众投入篝火之中，每个人都可以看到这些罪恶灰飞烟灭。\n\n将你的罪孽燃烧吧！$CAPITAL$！燃烧你的罪孽！

original: Savonarola will convince the people this is needed.
translation: 萨佛纳罗拉会说服人们这是必要的。

original: We will seize their earthly goods if we must.
translation: 如果有必要，我们将没收这些尘世的俗物。

original: Even though the wicked banking family was ousted from Firenze, their ambition to take the souls of its citizens has not abated for a moment. Their agents lurk in every dark alley, scouting for the moment when they might once again seize power from the republic.\nWe might have to resort to extreme methods to find them all.
translation: 虽然邪恶的银行家族已经被驱逐出了佛罗伦萨，但他们蛊惑市民灵魂的野心却一刻都未曾减少。 美第奇的密探正潜伏在每一条黑暗的小巷，搜寻着每一个能令他们重新篡夺共和国权力的机会。\n或许，我们将不得不采取一些极端的手段把他们揪出来。

original: Do everything we can to root them out.
translation: 用一切手段来把他们连根拔起！

original: Expel anyone who might have loyalties to the Medici.
translation: 驱逐任何可能对美第奇家族保有忠心的人。

original: Savonarola has brought the word of God to the people of $CAPITAL$, but the people only truly believe his commands when they come in the form of fiery outbursts from the pulpit. Some citizens have even dared question whether God even is speaking through him!\nIt might be prudent for Savonarola to present another grand vision from God about now.
translation: 萨伏那洛拉给$CAPITAL$的人民带来了上帝的启示，但是直到他在讲坛上慷慨激昂地进行演说的时候，人们才真正地相信了这些。一些市民甚至壮着胆子询问上帝是不是在借着他的口说话！\n萨伏那洛拉展现上帝对当世的另一幅宏图远景的行为堪称精明。

original: Fire and brimstone will rain from the sky!
Invent something a little calmer, for everyone's sake.
translation: 为了大家的福祉着想，就不能虚构点更安宁的东西么？

original: Under Savonarola's guidance, the people of $CAPITAL$ are more pious than they have been since the Apostles walked on hallowed ground. Perhaps there is hope that God will show them mercy after all?
translation: 自圣使徒走过神圣之地后，$CAPITAL$的人们从未有过现在这般虔诚，而这都要归功于萨伏那洛拉的指引。也许……上帝会向他们施展慈悲？

original: Savonarola's great mission is not just the purification of $CAPITAL$, but the return of the city to its people. It will take much work to bring $CAPITAL$ back to the glory days of the republic, but that work will only ever be done if we are willing to take the first, radical steps.
translation: 萨佛纳罗拉的伟大贡献并不只是净化了$CAPITAL$，他还将城市还给了人民。想要复兴$CAPITAL$、回到共和国治下那个充满荣耀的时期，我们还需要付出很多努力，但是只有我们迈出了根本的第一步之后，这个任务才会有被完成的一天。

original: We govern for the people of Florence.
translation: 一切为了佛罗伦萨的人民。

original: Following months and years of Savonarola's... gentle guidance, the people are becoming discontent. There has been no Judgement Day, and the city has not burned to the ground. Telling them that this is exactly because they have followed Savonarola's visions does not convince them.\n\nNow, to prove his divine protection, it is being demanded of him that he does the Trial by Fire. He will have to pass through a great bonfire, like one of those he so eagerly lit in the streets. If he passes safely to the other side, God's protection will be evident. If not, his enemies will have their way and burn him at the stake.
translation: 在吉罗拉莫·萨佛纳罗拉经年累月的“温雅教导”下，人们对现状愈发不满。但审判日并没有降临，城市也没有被焚作白地。所谓“正是因为他们遵循了萨伏那洛拉的启示所以神罚才没到来”云云并不能使人们信服。\n\n现在，为了证明他受到了神佑，他需要接受烈火裁判。他得从熊熊燃烧的火堆中穿过，穿过他渴望在街上点燃的篝火。如果他安然无恙地穿到了另一边，那么神佑可谓不证自明。如果没有，那么他的敌人也有他们的处置方式：把他绑在柱子上烧死。

original: Let him walk the Trial by Fire
translation: 让他从火上走过去试试。

original: The people will never again challenge God's command!
translation: 人民永远不会再质疑上帝的指示！
萨佛纳罗拉离开了人间

original: Even to his last, he promised that he would lead $COUNTRY$ as long as it needed God's guidance. With Savonarola's passing, his fanatic grip seems to have loosened from the minds of $COUNTRY$.
translation: 即使到了生命的最后关头，他还依然在作出承诺：只要$COUNTRY$还需要上帝的指引，他就会继续领导他们。随着萨佛纳罗拉离开人世，他那狂热信仰的束缚也慢慢地淡出了$COUNTRY$。

original: Bach was a composer of the Baroque era and the most celebrated member of a large family of northern German musicians. Although he was admired by his contemporaries primarily as an outstanding harpsichordist, organist and expert on organ building, Bach is now generally regarded as one of the greatest composers of all time.
translation: 巴赫是巴洛克时期的作曲家，是德意志最有名的音乐家.尽管在那个时代，巴赫有着各种各样的头衔：大键琴师，风琴演奏者，风琴楼建筑师，但是现在他被认为是历史上最著名的作曲家之一.

original: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz was a German philosopher, mathematician and political adviser important, both as a metaphysician and as a logician, and distinguished also for his independent invention of the differential and integral calculus. Born in Leipzig in 1646 he eventually ended up in the service of John Frederick the duke of Braunschweig-Lüneburg.
translation: 戈特弗里德·威廉·莱布尼茨是德意志哲学家，数学家，政治理论家，逻辑学家和微积分的发明人.1646年生于莱比锡，死时担任布伦瑞克—吕讷堡公爵与汉诺威选帝侯约翰·弗雷德里克的幕僚.

original: In Lithuania people were mostly Catholic or Orthodox during the 15th and 16th century. However in the last two decades of the 16th century a lot of Protestant refugees from France, South Germany and Italy arrived. These cultural elite brought fresh ideas to the Duchy of Lithuania, pressed between her Catholic and Orthodox neighbors. The Radziwill family had strong power and had opened the country for influences from abroad. Cities were much more important than in the artistocratic system of Poland, and thus the people of the cities quickly became a cultural and religious melting-pot spreading Protestantism to the rural lands around them. When whole provinces slowly became Protestant, the king started to support the Protestant Faith. First personally and later as a State-religion looking to Prussia and Sweden as ideals. This also meant that Lithuania could take an independent stance between Russia and Poland. However, the many different religions in Lithuania made the government adhere to a very tolerant religious policy at least until the 1640s.
translation: 在立陶宛，15和16世纪大部分人们都信仰天主教或东正教.但是在16世纪最后两个十年中，大量新教难民从法国，南德意志地区，意大利逃亡而来.这些人给立陶宛带来了新鲜的思想.当时影响力很大的拉齐维乌家族一直秉持开发的政策.而且同波兰不同，立陶宛的城市对全国的影响力较大.因此，以那些城市为中心，新教迅速传播.渐渐地，连国王都开始信仰新教，最终，立新教为国教.这使立陶宛有机会从波兰和俄罗斯的压迫中获得自由.另一方面，17世纪40年代之前多种宗教的混合也使立陶宛的宗教政策十分开放.

original: In the 1590s, when the Wave of Protestantism had started to change the fabric of Lithuanian society, numerous refugees of the Reformed Faith arrived in a second wave. These were the Dutch, English, French and Spanish fleeing from the narrow-minded Catholic governments of their former countries. The refugees were a mix of farmers and city-dwellers and they influenced the Lithuanians in a similar way as the earlier Protestants. However, the Lithuanian Magnates in opposition of the king viewed fellow Poland as the perfect societal form. When the king converted to the Lutheran form of Protestantism, many of them became reformed. Both to underline their difference with the king and because the Reformed ideals place God before king. The Reformed faith was also a perfect ideology for them to imprint upon the serfs. They were serfs because God wanted them to be and thus they became more manageable. In the 1630's a growing dissent between the Protestant state on one hand and the Reformed and Orthodox magnates on the other could be felt.
translation: 16世纪90年代，在新教对立陶宛产生了深刻变革的同时，加尔文宗的难民也陆续前来.他们来自英国，荷兰，法国和西班牙等狭隘的天主教国家.相较于新教徒，这些人对立陶宛的影响较小.但是那些羡慕波兰贵族而对国王不满的贵族们，借机转信加尔文宗，试图对抗王权.一是同国王划清界限，二是由于加尔文宗认为神权高于君权.另一方面，他们还教导自己的农奴，上帝让他们生而为农奴，要安心接受自己管理.在17世纪30年代，国内产生了两股势力：以国王为代表的新教势力，以及以贵族为代表的天主教-改革宗势力.

original: In the first decades of the 17th century Lithuania's king had converted to Protestantism and started to support the two branches of the Reformation. All in all his ideal was an effective and modern monarchy much inspired by the Swedish kings. Building up a Protestant Church of Lithuania and getting inspiration for governmental and societal reforms, the king turned to Sweden. The cooperation was of mutual benefits as Sweden soon got a Protestant friend in otherwise heretic Eastern Europe. Slowly the friendship brought a strong alliance about and King Ladislovas I eagerly encouraged Gustav II Adolphus to promote Protestantism in Germany. He himself would hold the Catholics and Orthodox of the East in check.
translation: 17世纪头十年，立陶宛的国王改宗新教，支持宗教改革.他的目的是学习瑞典建立高效的君主制政府.他学习瑞典建立了新教教会并推行了政府和社会改革.瑞典也从中获益，因为他在东欧获得了一个盟友.拉迪斯罗瓦斯一世的同盟也使阿道夫古斯塔夫二世开始向德意志地区施加影响.至于东欧的天主教和东正教势力他也不再担心.

original: In the second decade of the 17th century Brandenburg inherited the Duchy of Prussia. Brandenburg-Prussia was a Protestant state with high tolerance towards Reformed and she approached Jerzy I with an offer. Lithuania and Brandenburg should sign a Holy Protestant Alliance and wage war on Poland. Brandenburg would be freed from her Prussian vassalage by Poland and Lithuania would be whatever she wanted and could demand from Poland. A faction of young governmental official cherished it, but the king was a very careful man. He and his closest advisors hesitated. Their conclusion was very plain. First it was an impossibility to support Germans against Poland in a war of aggression. Secondly, the worst possible thing was total victory. If Lithuania took a mile of Polish land it would be a mile too much. Any conquests would include more Catholics and Orthodox and worse, more unruly magnates brought up in the Polish Anarchy of a country. So the king politely declined the honor, but instead he proposed a tract of trade and cultural exchange. However as most politically well-informed Lithuanians could have guessed, not much came out of it. The Society of Brandenburg-Prussia had far more in common with Poland than with Lithuania.
translation: 在17世纪20年代，勃兰登堡继承了普鲁士公国.笃信新教的勃兰登堡-普鲁士向杰吉一世发出邀请，希望同立陶宛建立神圣新教联盟，共同对抗波兰。勃兰登堡将会脱离波兰的附庸身份，而立陶宛则可以从波兰身上获得她想要的利益。.政府里的激进派很重视这个邀请，但是国王仍然心存疑虑.首先，为了一个德意志小国入侵波兰并不明智.其次，如果取胜反而更加糟糕，因为夺取波兰的土地将会获得大量信仰天主教与东正教的人口，难以消化.因此国王拒绝了邀请，而是签署了贸易协定和文化交流的协议.但是正如大多数立陶宛官员预期的那样，这其实没有什么用.勃兰登堡同我们在文化上差异太大了.

original: Before the Independence in 1569 Mikolaj the Black, named king as Mikolaj I, had become Prince of the Holy Roman Empire and befriended the Habsburg ruler of Austria, the Emperor Maximilian II. Maximilian was as sharp a politician as Mikolaj and profited on weakening Poland. Now Mikolaj's position was very bad in the 1570s he had to fight broad factions of Magnates in what could be described as a Civil War and defend his borders from Polish acts of revenge or even a re-conquest. He had to do what served independence best and that was to strike a deal with Maximilian. A Military Alliance was signed on 3rd February 1570 and Mikolaj's eldest son married Elizabeth of Steiermark. This alliance actually kept Poland from attacking even if local border incursions were regular. With the ascending of Rudolf to the Habsburg Monarchy the relations became wary and the alliance fell, but at that time the relations with Poland were at least acceptable.
translation: 在1569年独立之前，“黑色的”米克瓦伊，后来的米克瓦伊一世，同神罗皇帝哈布斯堡的马克西米利安二世交好.二人性格相近而且都需要一个衰弱的波兰.到了16世纪70年代，米克瓦伊的地位岌岌可危.国内许多贵族都反对他，已经到了内战的地步.国外还要面对波兰的威胁.他为了保持自己的地位，打算向马克西米利安二世请求帮助.1570年的二月三日星期二，双方签订了军事同盟，米克瓦伊的大儿子迎娶了施泰尔马克家的伊丽莎白.这个军事同盟阻止了波兰的进一步行动.随着马克西米利安二世的儿子鲁道夫继位，立陶宛和哈布斯堡的关系变得疏远.但是，这个时候，同波兰的关系也已经缓和了.

original: The Austro-Lithuanian Pact of 1570 had ended in 1576 when the obscure Rudolf came into power in Austria. King Mikolaj II Krzysztof, also called 'the Little Orphan', was a well versed man and a pious Catholic whom had visited Jerusalem. When he had married Elizabeth of Steiermark he had met Rudolf whom had brought his favorite crowd of astrologists infuriating the Pious Crown-prince. From that day he could not stand the man. However, with the ascending of Ferdinand II, a distant relative of Elizabeth of Steiermark, the elderly Mikolaj II again found a man of his values. Ferdinand also wanted a strong monarchy and to strengthen Catholicism in Europe. He immediately signed an alliance and bought the consent of Poland. During the Thirty Years War Lithuanian Hussars would fight side by side with Imperial troops giving Lithuania endless amounts of glory.
translation: 随着马克西米利安二世的儿子鲁道夫继位，奥地利-立陶宛1570年协定最终于1576年终止.立陶宛国王米克瓦伊二世克日什托夫，又被称为“小孤儿”，是一位聪明而又虔诚的天主教徒，他甚至到过耶路撒冷.当他迎娶施泰尔马克家的伊丽莎白时，他看见鲁道夫带着一群占星师，这对虔诚的天主教徒来说是一种冒犯.从那天开始，他就对鲁道夫意见很大.随着施泰尔马克家的伊丽莎白的远房亲戚费迪南地位的上升，米克瓦伊二世发现了合作的新人选.费迪南同样需要一个强大的封建王权和强大的天主教.米克瓦伊二世迅速同他缔结同盟并取得了波兰的同意.在三十年战争期间，立陶宛的轻骑兵同帝国军协同作战带来了大量的荣誉.

original: As a reaction to of the introduction of the Henrykian Articles and the Pacta Conventa in Poland in 1573, the Magnates approached the king and urged him to constitutionalize the rights of the Szlachta and to share power with them. If not, they said, he would have to face the consequences. At this point Mikolaj II Krzysztof had newly been crowned. He was young and not as averse to noble power as his father had been. In an effort to keep societal peace he accepted a compromise. There were no Henrykian articles, but the constitution was modified, implying that the Szlachta was the life-nerve of society with inalienable rights to hold office and legislative power. The Principle of Religious Tolerance was also confirmed.
translation: 随着亨利国王条款的颁布以及1573年女修道院条约的签署，大贵族进一步要求国王将施拉赤塔（大贵族）的权力正式确立.否则，国王必须为后果负责.这时，米克瓦伊二世克日什托夫才刚刚登基，而且也不想他父亲那样厌恶贵族掌权，所以他选择了接受.新的法律认为施拉赤塔是社会的核心，拥有担任公职等合法权力.宗教宽容的原则也被确认了.

original: After the two waves of refugees had arrived, the Szlachta again craved compensation for accepting that religious status quo has been broken. His Majesty Mikolaj II Krzysztof, now an elder and a more experienced man, refused to comply with their threats. Instead he used his right to push a proposal on to the floor of the Sejm, which was a compromise, but one which suited the king. The rights to hold office were expanded, but were now also made a duty and only the king had the right to appoint. The Szlachta was given a say in the making of Foreign Policy as a second house for non-Szlachta members was instituted in the Sejm which held legislative power of taxation. In many ways these reforms would decrease noble power even further as the fabric of society slowly tilted to the advantage of the bourgeois and free farmers.
translation: 两拨难民潮到来之后，施拉赤塔要求国家为宗教受到的冲击作出补偿.尊敬的米克瓦伊二世克日什托夫，现在已经成熟了许多，拒绝了他们的要求，反而向瑟姆（议会）提出了一项有利于国王的议案.担任公职的权利被扩大了，但是必须由国王指定.施拉赤塔在制定外交政策时被告知会在瑟姆中建立一个由非施拉赤塔成员构成的下议院，拥有征税权.这些措施削弱了贵族的权力，甚至使社会政策开始向中下层倾斜.

original: During the 1630s and 1640s the Magnates found life in the Kingdom unbearable. To escape the egalitarian notions of the government and the king many of the mstarted to interfere in local Polish politics. Many of them owned as much lands on one as the other side of the border. They freely swapped lands with their Polish brothers and thus managed to strengthen the Cause in both Poland and Lithuania. During the Deluge the Magnates of the Ukraine and the Wild Fields fought all and everyone. Poland was in havoc and the Lithuanian king had to accept the fact that he only could control the Northern part of his lands. At these point King Aleksandras II mounted a huge campaign against the Tatars, Russians and Crimeans swapping up rebellious Magnates at the same time. He though stopped from interfering with the Polish government, 'that last sane mind on that side of the border' as he called King Wladyslaw IV of Poland. The subjugated Magnates had two options. They either had to accept a tough reform or get all their lands confiscated and pushed over the border to Poland. The choice was easy. They stayed, but the reform was harsh. Only the state could now own land. The user only owned the right to use it. But to keep that right the user had to pay a user's fee decided by the king. With this vehicle the king started to break the large estate holdings of the Magnates and again changing the structure of society. His son continued the reform policy after the King was murdered by a Ukrainian Magnate on 30th March 1654.
translation: 在17世纪30年代和40年代，许多大贵族发现越来越不好混了.为了躲避立陶宛政府对大贵族的压迫，许多人开始向波兰求助.有很多立陶宛贵族在两国都有土地，他们同波兰亲戚们交换土地来增强自己家族在波兰和立陶宛的地位.在这场混乱中，乌克兰和东欧大草原上的贵族们受外国挑唆发起叛乱，使整个波兰都陷入了混乱.立陶宛国王这时发现自己仅仅能控制整个立陶宛的北部.此时，立陶宛国王亚历山大二世出兵征讨鞑靼人，俄罗斯人，克里木人以及叛乱的大贵族.同时他还要求贵族们停止交换土地，正如他同波兰国王瓦迪斯瓦夫四世说的那样：“只有这样才能减少国内的混乱”.遭受镇压的大贵族只有两种选择，要么接受此项改革，要么放弃自己在国内的领土逃到波兰去.大多数人都选择留了下来.但是改革措施相当激进，现在所有的土地都归为国有，贵族们只拥有使用权，而且还要付使用费.凭借这项举措，国王开始削弱大贵族的势力，并改变了社会组成.当国王在1654年3月30日被乌克兰贵族刺杀后，国王的儿子继承了这项事业.

original: Royal Reaction on the Polish Liberum Veto
translation: 王室对波兰自由否决权的反应

original: King Aleksandras II was clearing up things in the Ukraine in 1652 when he was brought the news of the introduction of the Liberum Veto in Poland. A week later he got the news that 'his' Sejm had voted for the same rights. By carefully reading of reports he found that certain Lithuanian Magnates had nearly doubled the size of the Lithuanian Szlachta by swapping lands with Poles. Frustrated the king declared the law illegitimate. The king had the support of those who were not nobles, but his troubles would live on as long as the Liberum Veto existed in Poland. In a famous address he declared himself allied with the Polish people and at war with the Polish Szlachta.
translation: 立陶宛国王亚历山大二世于1652年清剿了整个乌克兰，此时他听说波兰推行了自由否决权.一星期后，本国的瑟姆也通过了同样的条款.通过调查，国王发现一些立陶宛贵族通过交换土地使施拉赤塔（有权参加议会的贵族）的规模扩大了一倍.在那些小贵族的支持下，国王随即宣布该条款无效.但是，只要波兰仍然推行自由否决权，他的麻烦就不会减少.为此，国王宣布站在波兰人民一边对抗波兰的施拉赤塔.

original: Give Concessions to the Lithuanian Magnates

In a drive towards Warszawa he was bogged down by excellent Polish command while his own Szlachta rebelled. Isolated with his army in Czersk, he struck a deal with the Polish king to leave Poland immediately if the Polish king would refuse to accept the Lithuanian throne from the rebels in the north. It was a not too glorious retreat and he considered himself defeated. The Szlachta had dethroned Aleksandras, but was sidetracked by the fact that the Polish king refused to have anything to do with the traitors. Not all of the Szlachta were against Aleksandras and upon his return another army joined him. Together they smashed the rebel forces and executed the traitors. These events resulted in a deep-set foreign policy in Lithuania to always support the Polish kings against their internal foes, but never to meddle without being asked.
translation: 向华沙进军的途中，立陶宛国王因贵族叛乱而陷入困境.被困在捷克的国王向波兰国王提议，只要波兰国王拒绝接受立陶宛贵族们奉上的王冠，他就立刻回国，接受失败的结果.一开始，施拉赤塔将立陶宛国王亚历山大二世赶下了王座，但是当他们发现波兰国王拒绝了王冠后又无奈地撤销了之前的决定.并不是所有的施拉赤塔都反对国王，因此随着国王回国，又有人加入了国王的队伍.最终他们击破了叛军并处死了谋逆者.这次事件使立陶宛内部达成共识，只有当波兰国王需要的时候才行动，不要自作主张.

original: Try to buy the Magnates off
Let war come to their homes

translation: 可怕的瘟疫流行于立陶宛

original: During 1709-10 Lithuania endured the harshest winter of the century. But as that was not enough, a plague spread through the lands, killing many thousands. There is talking of the Scourge of God and people pray... pray... pray...
translation: 1709年至1710年，立陶宛迎来了100年来最严酷的冬天.不仅如此，一场瘟疫在国内扩散，已经杀死了数千人.许多人认为这是另一次上帝之鞭，他们只好祷告，祷告，再祷告...

original: There is nothing we can do

Pietism was a religious movement that started in Germany during the latter part of the 17th century. Traditionally, the Pietist movement has been viewed as a backlash against intellectualism prevalent in and among the Protestant ranks, especially in the Lutheran Church during that period. However, Pietism was common also within the other Christian forms. It was with the return of prisoners of war that the movement really took off in Lithuania. However, the Lithuanian Church disapproved most strongly of unauthorized preaching, which led to the Conventicle Edict of 1729, forbidding any religious gatherings outside the framework of the Church.
translation: 敬虔运动是一场17世纪末从德意志地区兴起的运动，主张透过集体读经、祷告与查经来造就基督徒活泼的灵命.传统意义上说，敬虔运动是对理智主义在新教徒，特别是路德教，中传播的一种反抗.但是，敬虔运动也在天主教内部产生了影响.随着战乱的消弭敬虔运动伴着释放会的囚犯而在立陶宛生根发芽.但是，立陶宛教会对私下的讲道是禁止的，最终在1729年颁布了秘密集会禁令，禁止任何私人的宗教活动.

original: The 14th century witnessed the start of Novgorod's long struggle with Moscow for supremacy. Internecine disputes among the republic's leaders weakened it in the face of growing Muscovite strength. Although it became a vassal of Moscow after the Muscovite invasions in 1456 and 1470, Novgorod was allowed to retain its self-government. It was not until 1478 that it came under Moscow's complete control and lost its freedom. Novgorod retained its commercial position until St. Petersburg was built in 1703.
translation: 14世纪见证了诺夫哥罗德和莫斯科争夺霸权的过程.共和国内部无休止的斗争削弱了诺夫哥罗德，另一方面，莫斯科的实力日益增强.虽然在莫斯科1456年和1470年入侵之后，诺夫哥罗德成为了莫斯科的附庸国，但是，他仍旧保有一部分的自主权力.直到1478年，诺夫哥罗德才彻底被莫斯科征服.不过，诺夫哥罗德到1703年圣彼得堡修建完成才失去了他的经济地位.

original: Due to the current state of inactivity in the army, the Janissaries have taken it upon themselves to demand that the State compensate them for the recent lack of booty, and expect to receive wealth directly from the treasury.
translation: 由于最近没有战事，苏丹亲兵缺少战利品，因此要求国家发放补偿，最好能直接从国库出钱.

original: While overseeing the restructuring of our army the king has come up with an idea to form a military unit within Maison du Roi that would be open to the lower nobility, providing them with an opportunity to prove their military skill and loyalty to the crown.
translation: 在视察军队改革的时候，国王决定在近卫军中建立一支向中下层贵族开放的军队，以招揽有能力又忠诚的小贵族.

original: In exchange for accepting the treaty of Tours in 1444 the county of Maine was promised to France. In practice, however, this has still not come to pass. No English governor wants to be remembered as the one to surrender Maine and in [Root.Capital.GetCapitalName] prominent nobles are claiming that our negotiator, William de la Pole, had no mandate to make this concession in the first place. French emissaries have repeatedly tried to remind us of this ever since the signing and [FRA.Monarch.GetName] has now finally taken matters in his own hands and shown up at the walls of Le Mans, demanding the city to surrender.\nUnless we surrender Maine to the French we are very likely looking at a hasty resumption of hostilities.
translation: 英格兰承诺将曼恩割让给法兰西，换取后者对1444年《图尔条约》的承认。但事实上，这一承诺至今尚未兑现。没有任何英格兰统治者想背负割让曼恩的骂名，而且[Root.Capital.GetCapitalName]的那些名门望族们则声称我们的谈判代表——威廉·德·拉波尔——在当初签订合约的时候并没有得到授权。协议签署后，法兰西的使者屡屡设法提醒我们履行这一条款未果，而今[FRA.Monarch.GetName]终于决定亲自来解决这个问题，动身前往勒芒城外受降。\n除非我们把曼恩割让给法兰西人，否则我们看上去完全就是在故意匆猝重启战端。

original: France will likely go to war over our violation of the Truce and we will be considered the aggressor in such a war.
translation: 法兰西可能会因我们违反和约而开战，并且在这次战争中我们会被认为是侵略者。

original: We will not surrender an inch of territory to the French!
translation: 面对法兰西，我们将寸土不让！

original: In exchange for accepting the treaty of Tours in 1444 the county of Maine was promised to France. In practice, however, this has still not come to pass. The English have repeatedly evaded the question and it is becoming increasingly clear that many in the English camp are arguing that the treaty will not be honored. In one last attempt to force the question [Root.Monarch.GetName] has approached the county capital, Le Mans, himself and demanded the surrender of the city.\nThe local commander, however, shows no signs of intending to open the gates, despite not having a force strong enough to withstand an attack.
translation: 英格兰承诺将曼恩割让给法兰西，换取后者对1444年《图尔条约》的承认。但事实上，这一承诺至今尚未兑现。英格兰人一再地回避这个问题，形势越来越明朗了——英格兰阵营的多数主张撕毁条约。[Root.Monarch.GetName]亲自率军抵近曼恩伯爵领的首府勒芒，要求该城投降——作为最后一次强行解决这个问题的尝试。\n然而，守城的指挥官却没有意思准备开门献城的意思，尽管他们的兵力根本扛不住法军的重压。

original: Time to teach them how to war.
translation: 是时候教他们怎么打仗了。

original: In exchange for accepting the treaty of Tours in 1444 the county of Maine was promised to France. In practice, however, this has taken quite some time to materialize. The arrival of [Root.Monarch.GetName] [Root.Monarch.GetHerselfHimself] on the scene seems to have made the holdup go away, however, and finally Maine is now in our hands.
translation: 英格兰承诺将曼恩割让给法兰西，换取后者对1444年《图尔条约》的承认。然而这桩交易实际上花了很久才落实。不过，[Root.Monarch.GetName]的亲自登场使得一切阻碍化为乌有。无论如何，曼恩现在掌握在我们手中了。

original: Strange men from the north have appeared on our coasts preaching word of a new God. These Portuguese missionaries request free access to our people to preach the word of their God and his Son who rose from the dead. Many of our most influential elders wish for us to drive off the missionaries, but their ships and weapons suggest that they are a mighty people we might wish to accommodate.
translation: 陌生男子出现在我们的沿海地区传教。这些的葡萄牙传教士请求我们容许她们向人民宣讲他们的神以及他死而复生的儿子。许多我们最有影响力的长老希望我们去驱赶传教士，但他们的船只和武器显示他们很强大，我们可能需要适应

original: The Kingdom of Kongo, a pagan state on the coast of Central Africa, has agreed to let our missionaries spread the word of Christ to their kingdom. Thousands in one of their provinces have joined the Church and are calling for a bishop and church constructions throughout the land!
translation: 刚果王国，一个中非海岸地带的异教徒国家，已经同意让我们的传教士在他们的国土上散播福音。其中一个省份的数千人加入了教会，并呼吁在整个地区任命主教和和建立教堂！

original: The barbaric Manikongo of the Kingdom of the Kongo had our missionaries whipped and humiliated! The idol-worshipers not only mock Christ, they mock our power. This insult to Portugal and to our Holy Mother Church must be avenged.
translation: 刚果王国的野蛮统治者鞭打羞辱了我们的传教士。这些偶像崇拜者们不仅嘲笑基督，还蔑视我们的力量。对葡萄牙和对教廷的侮辱必须受到报复。

original: We shall whipe the dust.. on them.

Today, our great Manikongo $MONARCH$, flanked by a Portuguese priest, declared himself born anew as a Christian. Rejecting the faith of his ancestors, which he called idolatrous, our ruler is calling for a total adoption of Catholic faith, with a permanent diocese bishop, the destruction of the idols of the old gods, and the end of our traditional way of life. Already infuriated Kongolese elders are calling for the King's head and a restoration of the old order. Either way, our country is in for a period of great unrest.
translation: 今天，我们我伟大的$MONARCH$，在葡萄牙牧师的陪同下，宣布皈依基督教。国王呼吁人民拒绝祖先崇拜，信仰天主教，设立主教区，破坏偶像崇拜，结束古老的传统。这激怒了长老们，她们要求国王恢复旧有的秩序。无论怎么样，国家都将处于大动荡中。

original: The Kongolese Manikongo [From.Monarch.GetName] has, at the urging of our missionaries, embraced the Holy Mother Church and the one true Faith. The Kongolese are already calling out for priests, Bibles, and aid establishing their local Church that only we can give. The Kongolese Manikongo, who is now a Catholic brother monarch, has pledged his friendship to our kingdom for our help in leading him to the true faith.
translation: 刚果的[From.Monarch.GetName]在我们牧师的敦促之下，已经皈依主的怀抱。在他的要求下，我们给了他圣经，并建立了教堂。他现在已经是一位天主教君主了，他请求我们引导他找到真正的信仰。

original: Throughout the 14th and early 15th centuries, our grasp on our outlying provinces has grown weaker and weaker, notably resulting in Songhai renouncing any claim to loyalty to us. Now, people closer to home are demanding a weaker Malian state while people to the west in Jolof demand independence from us altogether. We can try to put down this challenge to our authority, but it will come at great cost.
translation: 在整个14和15世纪初，我们对我们的边远地区的掌控已越来越虚弱，尤其是桑海拒绝继续效忠我们。现在，人们离家较近要求马里人放松统治，而西部卓洛夫泽要求独立.我们可以尝试把这个挑战我们的权威，但它的代价极大..
马里的衰落必须到此为止!

original: The Ulema, the local Islamic clergy, are dismayed at the lack of faith of the new ruler of Timbuktu. Already they are spreading word that he is closer to the pagans than to a true Muslim ruler and that his lack of faith will condemn us all. The ulema are already threatening that unless $MONARCH$ adapts to the requirements of the Islamic faith, they will seek a new ruler who does.
translation: 乌理玛，当地的伊斯兰神职人员，对廷巴克图新的统治者信仰缺失感到惊愕.他的言行更像一位异教徒而不是穆斯林教徒，这将使我们受到谴责.乌理玛已经威胁，除非$MONARCH$信仰伊斯兰，否则他们将寻求一个信仰伊斯兰的新的统治者.

original: Give up my alcohol and my parties with my Animist friends? Never!
translation: 放弃美酒和我的泛灵论朋友？绝不!

original: Pray five times a day, you say? Well, I'm sure I can fit that into my schedule.
translation: 你说一天祈祷五次？ 好吧，我相信我能做到.

original: Askia the Great opened religious schools and astronomical observatories. He encouraged trade and established an efficiency bureaucracy. He was gifted in administration and responsible for the administration of justice. He had canals built to enhance agriculture and subdued his enemies.
translation: 阿斯基亚大帝开设宗教学校和天文观测台。他鼓励贸易和建立了一个有效率官僚主义。他被赋予了在行政和司法行政权力。他建成了运河以加强农业和征服敌人.

original: The most important chronicle of the Songhai Empire, Tarikh al-Sudan, was written around 1655 by in Abd al-Rahman al-Sadi. It gives brief histories about the early history of Mali, Songhai and Tuareg, but the main part of the chronicle depicts the history of the 15th and 16th century Songhai. It also contains biographies of scholars and holymen of Djenne & Timbuktu.
translation: 桑海帝国最重要的编年史，Tarikh的苏丹，大约在1655年由阿卜杜勒·拉赫曼·萨迪写成。简要介绍了马里，桑海和图阿雷格人的早期历史，但编年史的主要部分描绘的是历史上的第15和16世纪的桑海。它还包含学者们的传记以杰内和廷巴克图神职人员.

original: A strange man has come onto our shores, but not by the Red Sea route by which foreigners usually travel to us. He claims he's part of a voyage from beyond the Cape, a voyage that, to our knowledge, has never been attempted before. He brings greetings from fellow Christian monarchs, though his prayer is unlike that which we have seen before. How should we treat this man?
translation: 我国沿海地区有一位外国人登陆，但他并不是从外国人经常通过的红海航线抵达此处。他自称搭乘绕过好望角的航船前来，但就我们所知，从来没有人试图进行过这样的航行。他代同为基督徒君主向我们问候，然而他的祷告词与我们惯常使用的大相径庭。我们应该如何对待这个男人？

original: More §Yvisitors§! will soon come from Portugal.
translation: 更多§Y来访者§!即将从葡萄牙而来。

original: Francisco Álvares, representing the same country that sent the previous emissary, wishes to discuss what our two regimes can do together. He says he was looking for a 'Prester John', and we are apparently the country he seeks. Should we begin an exchange?
translation: 弗朗西斯科·阿尔瓦雷什，代表与之前的使者相同的国家，希望讨论我们两个政权可以一起做什么。他说他一直在寻找「祭司王约翰」，我们显然是他一直寻找的国家。我们应该开始交流吗？
寻求对抗马穆鲁克的援助！

original: Maybe a trade deal is in order?
§YPortugal§! will get be asked for military aid.
translation: §Y葡萄牙§!会收到军事援助的请求。

original: The Negus of Ethiopia, who may or may not be the legendary Prester John, has apparently fallen on hard times and is pleading with us to help him restore his lands. He has sent an ambassador named Mateus. Mateus is a Christian, albeit of a kind we have never seen before, and begs us to restore his master's rightful dominions, but Mamluk power is still threatening and it seems to be a big risk for questionable gain. Should we aid Mateus?
translation: 埃塞俄比亚的尼格斯，可能是也可能是传说中的长老约翰，显然已经陷入了困难时期，他恳求我们帮助他恢复他的土地。他派出的大使名叫马特乌斯，这似乎是一个腐败的马修。马修是一个基督徒，尽管是我们以前从未见过的一种，乞求我们恢复他的主人应有的领地，但马穆鲁克的威胁十分巨大，这似乎是一个风险很大的投资。我们应该援助马修吗？

original: I thought Prester John was supposed to help us, not the other way around?
translation: 我认为长老约翰应该帮助我们,而不是其他的？

original: Military aid from our brothers in the faith, against the infidels we share as enemies
translation: 来自同信仰兄弟的援助帮助我们对抗异教的敌人

original: A small fleet, carrying weapons and troops, has arrived at our shores. The leader of these Portuguese soldiers bring a letter from their monarch, saying 'We are both Christian Monarchs, united in our struggles against the infidels.'.
translation: 一个小船队，携带的武器和军队已经抵达我们的海岸。这些葡萄牙士兵的领导人从他们的君主，带来了一封信说：「我们都是基督教君主，团结起来一起对抗反对异教徒。」

original: There is no more embassies from Portugal, no more traders coming, and no reply to our request for help.
translation: 再也没有来自葡萄牙的使者，也没有商人前来，我们的求援也没有答复。

original: New state emerges in the Sudan!

For quite some time we have ignored the Sudanese land where the last of the old Nubian Christian kingdoms maintained their pitiful remnants, but such neglect is no longer possible. A vibrant new state called Sennar has been formed by southern migrants called the Funj, who came in and conquered these remnants and have made a large new state that extends to our borders.
translation: 我们长期以来一直忽略苏丹地区。旧努比亚基督王国的末裔在那里苟延残喘。但这种忽略不再是一种可能。来自南方的被称为丰吉人的移民建立了一个充满活力的新国家森纳尔。他们来到这里征服了这些努比亚人的残余并建立了一个庞大的新国家并扩张到了我们的边境。

original: What do we care who owns those wastelands?
translation: 我们为什么要关心谁拥有这些不毛之地？

original: While we have traditionally practiced a mix of Christianity and traditional Animist faiths, the growing power of the Muslim states to our north makes conversion politically attractive and opens up the possibility of aligning ourselves with these powerful empires. However, our own people might not be quite as enthusiastic.
translation: 虽然我们传统上混合信奉基督教和传统泛灵信仰，但是我们北方的穆斯林国家的实力增长让该宗伊斯兰成为一个政治上有吸引力的选择。这也将为我们和这些强大的帝国外交提供新的可能。然而，我们的人民可能并不那么热心。

original: There is no God but God!
Give up the faiths of our fathers? Never!
translation: 放弃我们父辈的信仰？ 绝不!

original: The islands in the Sea of Sulu have been inhabited for centuries, divided into smaller kingdoms. These lands are now united under their first Sultan. Known as a respected scholar of Islam, the Sultan has strengthened both political and religious institutions in the islands, which hold one of the oldest mosques in the region. Through inter-marriage, charisma and innovative diplomacy, they are now united by a common code of laws. The world has seen the rise of the Sultanate of Sulu.
translation: 苏禄海群岛几百年的人类定居史里，逐渐分裂成几个小王国。这些领土现在被他们第一位苏丹统一。 作为一位驰名伊斯兰世界的学者，苏丹强化了群岛的政治和宗教机构，这些机构建造了该地区最古老的清真寺。依靠联姻，领袖感召力和创新型外交，他们在公共的法律的约束下团结在一起。 世界见证了苏禄苏丹国的崛起。

original: Let us hope the Sultan is reasonable, or the world may see its fall.
translation: 让我们期待是苏丹位明君吧，否则世界将会见证它的衰落。

original: While originally intended to only deal with dangers to the republican system the Council of Ten has been given quite far reaching powers to do what the Great Council can't. Some feel this has been a step too far, however, and paradoxically the Council of Ten itself might be the greatest threat to the representative system currently.
translation: 本应只能处理威胁到共和制事务的十人会如今被赋予了远超大议会的权力。一些人觉得这太过分，自相矛盾的来说可能目前威胁到共和制的是十人会本身。

original: Due to overreach of power laws have been passed to restrain the Council of Ten. Formally the only area in which the Council can act right now is to find out plot or conspiracies against the Republican system of our state.
translation: 由于十人会被设立的溢权法案所限制。目前他们明面上的活动范围仅限揭露反对我们共和制的阴谋了。

original: Expansion of the Great Council of Venice
Every male nobleman over a certain age has been granted a seat on the Great Council.
translation: 每位超过一定年龄的男性贵族都能在大议会具有席位。

original: An increasing number of impoverished noblemen have come to live entirely out of the pockets of the state. These poor Barnabotti have become known their gambling and their willingness to corrupt the Venetian system by selling their votes.
translation: 国内落魄贵族的数量越来越多，口袋里空空如也。这些穷困的巴尔纳伯贵族嗜赌成性，并乐意卖出手中的选票腐化共和制度。

original: An academy has been created for the benefit of the children of the poor Barnabotti. This way at least some of them may be able to serve the state in a meaningful manner once they reach adulthood.
translation: 威尼斯建造了一座学院供养穷困的巴尔纳伯贵族的小孩。这样至少他们中的某些人在成年时能够体面的为国家出力。

original: In order to counteract the decreasing numbers of nobles in our republic and the Great Council we have begun to give out membership in exchange for a large sum of money.
translation: 共和国和大议会的贵族数量日益减少。为了补齐人数，我们让那些能出得起大价钱的人能当我们的同僚。

original: Dating to the 13th century the Venetian glassblowing industry on the island of Murano is unique in its kind and one of the many luxurious commodities for which Venice is known.
translation: 13世纪时穆拉诺岛的吹玻璃工厂在该行业一枝独秀，所产出的商品成为了威尼斯赖以闻名的奢侈品之一。

original: The free and wealthy environment in Venice has led to the likes of Tintoretto, Titian and Monteverdi to live and work in our Republic.
translation: 威尼斯自由和富裕的环境吸引了如丁托列托，提香和蒙泰韦尔迪等人在我们共和国定居和工作。

original: In order to lessen the boastfulness of our wealthy citizens (or perhaps the envy of the not so wealthy ones) it has been decreed that no Gondola may be decorated in any way. The only color allowed is the black from the pitch used to waterproof the Gondolas.
translation: 为了降低我们富有市民的自负心理（或者也可能出于对那些富有群体的嫉妒心），颁布了一项法令禁止以任何方式装饰贡多拉船。贡多拉的防水蓬只允许使用黑色。

original: The growing power of the Council of Ten.

With over a thousand hereditary memberships, the Great Council of Venice is perhaps not always the quickest and most efficient governing body. It is therefore not surprising that the much greater flexibility of the small Council of Ten, originally intended to safeguard the republic from plots and conspiracies, has led to them assuming more and more power.\nBy increasing its own power, however, the Council of Ten decreases the influence of the more representative Great Council. Many of the families on the Great Council feel things have gone too far as while new members of the Ten are elected each year the positions are often monopolized by a small clique of old Aristocrat families. Reforms have been proposed to curtail the power of the Ten by limiting their influence to emergencies as was originally intended.
translation: 威尼斯的大议会拥有超过千人的世袭成员，可能并不总是高效的管理集团。因此小型的十人会更具灵活性。十人会原先的职能是保卫共和国免受各路阴谋的威胁，这导致了他们僭越了越来越多的权力。\n通过提升自己的权力，十人会削减了更具代表性的大议会的影响力。大议会中的许多家族感到十人会脱离了控制，因为每年十人会选出的新成员席位往往被古老的贵族家系派阀组成的小团体所垄断。改革的目的是削弱十人会的权力，让他们回归原有的职能。

original: Restrict the power of the Ten
Revoke the laws restraining the Ten.
translation: 撤销限制十人会的法令

original: The reforms to rein in the Council of Ten has calmed many of the members of the Great Council but in effect the Ten still exert a great deal of authority that they formally should not have. Given how inefficient the Great Council with its countless members can be at times this is, however, not necessarily a bad thing...
translation: 遏制十人会的改革使大议会中的许多成员平静下来，但实际上，十人会仍在行使超出正式规定范围外的大量权力。然而鉴于大议会及其无数成员有时效率低下，这不一定是坏事......

original: Let them continue to ignore their restrictions.
Revoke the laws restraining the ten.
translation: 撤销限制十人会的法令

original: The Great Council is the body from which the members of the various councils, the Doge and the Venetian Senate are elected. It is this council with over a thousand members that the Venetian system is built upon and by allowing all of these nobles their say our Republic is more representative than any other state we know of. A powerful council is the best safeguard against any other government institutions becoming too powerful, including the office of the Doge itself.\nSome feel we should expand the council even further to encompass all nobles over a certain age while others feel that many voices in one place might stifle the day-to-day government.
translation: 威尼斯总督、议员，和各种各样的议会成员组成了大议会。威尼斯的体制建立在这个拥有超过千名成员的议会之上，我们的共和体制比已知的所有其他国家都更具代表性。一个强势的议会是保持国家共和体制免受颠覆的最好的守护者，包括避免总督本身过大的权力。\n一些人认为我们应该将议会席位覆盖到所有有一定年纪的贵族，另一些人则认为太多的人拥有话语权会葬送日常政务。

original: Things are working fine as it is.

As positions on the Great Council are hereditary there is always the possibility of a noble family retaining their vote after having lost their fortunes and all other influence. As we cannot expect such noble families to labor for their living the Venetian state traditionally affords them small pensions to live on.\nWith the chaotic political situation in the east, the fall of the Byzantine Empire and the loss of Venetian influence in parts of the Eastern Mediterranean, this group of poor nobles have been growing quickly. The great number of impoverished nobles are known to spend their pensions on gambling in or near the Campo San Barnaba and some will even sell their votes to anyone willing to pay. Sometimes referred to as Barnabotti, after the Campo in which they reside, this group is still not a great problem. If this development continues, however, it might well undermine the Great Council and unduly increase the power of those with the money to pay for votes.
translation: 由于大议会的席位是世袭的，贵族们即使失去了财产和势力也一直能够保有投票权。我们认为这样的家族不能为了生存而劳作，因此威尼斯政府通常会发放一小笔保障金供他们生活。\n随着东方政治环境日趋混乱和拜占庭帝国的陨落，东地中海不再是威尼斯的势力范围，穷困贵族的数量与日俱增。大量的破产贵族把保障金花在了圣巴尔纳伯小广场或其附近的赌场，其中还有一些甚至愿意向任何付得起价钱的人出售选票。这个贵族团体尚未成为大麻烦，有时候因地得名被称为巴尔纳伯贵族。然而如果这种情况持续下去，不公正的投票可能会严重危害大议会。

original: They surely won't be a problem for long with those habits.

The impoverished Barnabotti remain a big problem for our political system. Part of the problem seems to be that once they have lost everything these nobles are unlikely to rise again. If we could provide means for them to restore the former glories of their families they might once again become productive members of our society. Doing that is, however, not popular among those who would rather rely on their bought votes or who would fear more competition.\nRecently a relatively harmless proposition was put forward however, a school could be created for the children of the nobles to ensure that they are given a proper education that their parents might not be able to afford. This would also allow at least a few select of them to rise above their original status and do useful things for the state again.
translation: 破产的巴尔纳伯贵族给我们的政治体系遗留了巨大的问题。问题的一部分是这些破产贵族一旦一无所有就很难东山再起。如果我们想出办法使他们重拾昔日的荣耀，他们的家族可能会再次成为社会中具有价值的一员。然而要做到这点并不容易，他们宁愿依靠买卖选票或者畏惧更激烈的竞争。\n最近一项相对无害的提案推至台前：我们应该建造一所学校，为那些父母无法承受费用的儿童提供适当的教育。这至少让他们为脱离原先的贫穷状态多一点选择，再次对国家出力。

original: They should be content with their pensions.
translation: 他们应该对保障金感到知足。

original: A conflict has arisen between the Council of Ten and one of its members. Renier Zen is accusing the other members of the Council of Ten and the Doge of corruption. He claims that the Doge has been using his positions to enrich himself and to bestow important offices on his relatives.\nAfter a failed assassination attempt on Zen the conflict has spread outside of the Council of Ten and poor nobles have been gathering to support Zen while the higher aristocracy supports the Ten and the Doge.
translation: 十人会和其中的一名成员之间爆发了一场冲突。雷尼耶·泽恩指控十人会其他成员和总督贪污腐化。他声称总督利用自己的地位敛财，并授予亲属重要职务。\n一次对泽恩失败的暗杀后，冲突蔓延到十人会之外。贫穷的贵族聚集起来支持泽恩，同时十人会和总督有着高阶贵族撑腰。

original: Have Zen arrested but replace the members of the Ten as well.
translation: 逮捕泽恩但也清洗十人会。

original: Support the Doge and the Ten.

Our city has always been at danger of great epidemics and as another plague outbreak washes over northern Italy, Venice has been hit unusually hard. Almost one third of our population has been lost. The disease strikes at poor and rich alike and we have lost many men of quality. The number of nobles on the Great Council has also decreased sharply shaking the political foundation of our Republic.
translation: 瘟疫在整个北意大利蔓延，我们的城市处于疫情的危险之下，已遭受了重大的损失。我们几乎已经损失三分之一的人口。疾病的传播不分贫穷或是富有，上层阶级也不少因此死亡。大议会的贵族人数也显著下降了，这动摇了我们共和国的政治基础。

original: Ever since the Great Plague of the 1630s we have had problems filling the positions of the Venetian government. Conferring nobility on new people must be done with care, however, as any new member of the Great Council will have a vote a dramatic amount of newcomers might lead to entirely unpredictable results. It has been suggested that the best way to vet candidates for membership is to try their willingness to contribute to the state. A number of richer families might be ennobled if they contribute a good sum to the treasury. Those without wealth are simply not the kind of people we would want to decide the fate of our Republic.
translation: 自从1630年代大瘟疫之后，补充威尼斯政府职位的空缺就一直是个问题。由于大议会的新成员也会得到投票权，因此提拔新贵族必须小心谨慎。夸张的新贵数量可能会导致完全无法预知的结果。有提议称审查议员资格的最好办法是试探他们是否愿意奉献国家。如果某些较为富裕的家族为国库捐献一大笔钱的话，他们就可能会被授予贵族地位。显然我们不会愿意那些没钱的人来掌控共和国的命运。
让我们来发展更多贵族！

original: This isn't that big a problem.

translation: 阿尔都斯·马努蒂乌斯&阿尔定印刷厂

original: Commercial book printing is still a technique in its infancy but one of its foremost pioneers can be found in the city of Venice. Aldus Manutius and his printing office, the Aldine Press have gained a reputation for their consistent and clear typography and their well executed translations from Latin. Italics as well as a consistent way to use semicolons are among Manutius contributions to the field of typography. To the field of bookbinding Manutius has contributed the easily handled Octavo format, making sure that the classics leaving his printing press are portable rather than attempting to emulate the format of the medieval manuscript.
translation: 商业化印刷在初期依旧是技术活，但是其最重要的先锋之一可以在威尼斯找到。阿尔都斯·马努蒂乌斯和他的印刷厂，即阿尔定印刷厂以始终如一的坚持、清晰的活版印刷和翻译自拉丁文的上佳译文，赢得了声誉。马努蒂乌斯在活版印刷领域的贡献之一就是意大利斜体和分号成为惯用字。在装订领域他的贡献则将八开本样式简化易用，确保他出品的古典文学书籍更为便携而不是刻意模仿中世纪手稿。

original: Growth of the Murano Glass Industry
translation: 穆拉诺玻璃工厂的发展

original: Since the late 13th century the Venetian glass-making industry has been confined to the island of Murano in order to lessen the risk of fire. The popularity of the Murano glass has only continued to increase since then and the glassblowers have become both rich and influential. The secrets of how to produce such exquisite products are known to few outside of our borders and in order to safeguard this knowledge the glassblowers are confined to the city.\nAs the popularity of Venetian glass continues to increase the world is changing. With the fall of Constantinople a great number of men possessing the rare skills needed in glass-making are requesting to be allowed to settle down on Murano.
translation: 自13世纪晚期以来为了防范火灾，威尼斯的玻璃制造业被限制在穆拉诺岛上。不料穆拉诺玻璃的流行节节攀升，吹玻璃工都变得富有和知名。外国还未掌握这些精美制品的工艺，为了守护秘密因而吹玻璃工人被限制出城。\n当威尼斯玻璃持续大热的同时，时局也在发生变化。随着君士坦丁堡的陷落，一大批玻璃制造业所需的稀缺技工请求在穆拉诺落户。

original: Support our own Glassblower families instead
translation: 转而支持我们自己的吹玻璃工

original: A particularly skilled Murano glassblower named Giuseppe Briati has managed to create glass objects unlike anything seen before in Venice. The Ciocca chandeliers in particular, named after the flower bouquets which they are shaped to resemble, have grown immensely popular among the well to do and the Venetian glass industry is booming once again
translation: 在威尼斯有个技术精湛的穆拉诺吹玻璃工叫作朱塞佩·布列特，他设法创造了前未所见的玻璃制品。尤其是以神似鲜花花束而得名的乔卡大吊灯，掀起了一股时尚潮流。威尼斯玻璃制造业再一次繁荣起来。
维罗妮卡·弗朗科的审判

original: One of the most famous of Venice's 'honest courtesans' Veronica Franco now stands trial for witchcraft in the city. Famed for her intellect as well as her beauty Franco's influence over her clients and her outspoken participation in the artistic and literary life of Venice has earned her many enemies.\nHaving delivered a very eloquent defense before the inquisition it now remains to be seen if Franco's intellect is sharp enough to protect her against the guardians of morality.
translation: 威尼斯最著名的‘可敬的妓女’之一维罗妮卡·弗朗科现在正受到女巫审判。弗朗科以才貌双全而著称，她具有对其客户的影响力并且直率的参与威尼斯的艺术和文学领域，这些都让她四面树敌。\n在审讯前弗朗科进行了动人的自辩，她是否有足够的智慧保护自己免受卫道士的迫害？真让人拭目以待。

original: The public morality must always be safeguarded by the Venetian government and so from time to time laws are created to make sure our people stay true to the Christian ideals on which our city is built. The Gondola is a simple enough vessel and thousands of them ferry people around on the canals of Venice every day. As so often the many rich and powerful families of our Republic have found the temptation to flaunt their wealth hard to resist. Gondolas come in all kinds of sizes and colors and some are so over-decorated that they are an affront to any true Christian mind.\nIt is now being debated if a law should forbid the decoration of these Gondolas as to some they are a symbol of all that is wrong in our great city.
translation: 威尼斯政府必须捍卫公共道德，因此不时会制定新的法律确保我们的人民恪守基督教的教义。我们的城市因此而建。每天在威尼斯的运河间，数以千计的贡多拉（一种十分简单的船只）为人们提供摆渡服务。共和国的富人和权贵总忍不住要炫耀一番，因此出现了各色各样装饰过度的贡多拉以至于任何虔诚的基督徒都看不下去了。\n目前是否应当制定法律禁止过度装饰贡多拉尚无定论。

original: Disregard the moralists, the Gondolas are impressive.
translation: 不用管什么道德，令人产生深刻印象的贡多拉才好。

original: Venice, for centuries the foremost city of printing and glass-making in Italy, have begun to surpass or at least compete with Rome as the foremost city of art and music. Great painters such as Tintoretto, Titian, Veronese or musicians like Monteverdi, Gabrieli or Donati are but a few of the many artists that work and live in our city. In Italy and abroad Venice have begun to become synonymous art.
translation: 几个世纪作为意大利首要印刷和玻璃制造之都的威尼斯，也开始在音乐和艺术方面与罗马并驾齐驱。诸如丁托列托、提香、维罗纳这样的大画家和蒙泰韦尔迪、加布里埃利或多纳蒂这样的音乐家仅仅是定居在我们城市的众多艺术家的一部分。在意大利，威尼斯已成为艺术的代名词。

original: As Venice leaves republicanism behind her the great council is disbanded.
translation: 大议会作为威尼斯共和制的遗产已毫无必要。

original: With the invention of the fluyte Dutch shipbuilding has exploded. Domestic and foreign orders are streaming in the shipyards and as a result the shipbuilding business is booming. Never before have so many Dutch ships sailed the seas and never before have so many Dutchmen been employed in the shipbuilding business.
translation: 随着三桅帆船的发明，荷兰造船业已突飞猛进。国内外的订单雪片般纷至沓来成就了造船业的兴旺。从没有这么多荷兰船只航行于海上，也从没有这么多荷兰人受雇于造船业。

original: This province is home to the House of Elzevir, one of Europe's principal printing houses.
translation: 欧洲主要印刷业家族之一的埃尔塞维尔的故乡就在这里。

original: Our country is being run by rentiers and complacent Periwig-wearers. Our merchant capitalist forefathers are turning in their graves.
translation: 收租人和自满的戴假发者统治着我们的国家。我们商业资本家的祖先们都能气得从棺材里跳出来了。

original: Refused to heed the Mortal Seven
Crisis of the Dutch Financial Sector

Once the center of pan-European finance, other cities in other countries have now run past Amsterdam. Along with the poor economic policies of the Bank of Amsterdam itself the credibility and viability of the Dutch banking sector is being seriously questioned.
translation: 阿姆斯特丹取代了曾作为欧洲金融中心的其它城市的地位。由于阿姆斯特丹银行的那些破政策，荷兰银行业的可靠程度和生存能力都正受到严峻的考验。

original: Having previously worked in bookbinding and bookselling Lodewijk Elzevir had a fine understanding of every aspect of the making of a book when he finally moved on to become a printer and a publisher. Lodewijk and his descendants would found one of the most famous and productive printing houses of the early modern era, lasting for 130 years the house of Elzevir was known for its elegance and accuracy but also for the small and very portable formats used, such as the duodecimo format.\nNoteworthy among the works that would leave the Elzevir presses are the 'Elzevirian Republics', books describing the history and present of select countries around Europe and the world. While intended for an international market these last books will surely find a big readership among the Dutch merchant class and will help them understand the various countries they intend to invest in or trade with.
translation: 罗德维克·埃尔塞维尔在从事印刷和出版业之前做过书籍装订和销售，对整个流程的方方面面都非常了解。埃尔塞维尔和他的后人建立了近代早期最著名和多产的印刷家族。埃尔塞维尔家以出品典雅、严谨、小型化如12开本这种便于携带的书籍而闻名遐迩一直延续了130年。\n所有埃尔塞维尔出产作品中的明珠是‘埃尔塞维尔的国家’，本书精选介绍了欧洲甚至世界范围内一些国家的历史和现状。当要进军国际市场时，荷兰商人们肯定会发现有一大批同行是本书的读者，通过阅读‘埃尔塞维尔的国家’了解不同的国家以便投资或者贸易。

original: As a relative latecomer in the competition for colonies the Netherlands has found that many of the colonial possessions it desires have already been taken by others. With a strong navy and a willing financial sector the independent Netherlands does, however, still have considerable resources in its hands. These circumstances have led the Dutch West India Company to devise the Groot Desseyn or Grand Design for how the Netherlands might rise above its competitors.\nAccording to the plan rather than just trying to establish colonies of our own it would be more efficient to conquer those of our competitors. As a natural competitor the Portuguese colonial empire in particular has been deemed a good target for this plan, especially as Dutch investors are already involved in some of these as it is.
translation: 作为殖民竞争后来者的尼德兰，发现它渴望的众多殖民地已为他人所占。独立的尼德兰拥有强大的海军和乐于做实事的财政界，手中的资源也难以令人小觑。荷兰西印度公司为超越其它竞争者而度身定做了一套"Groot Desseyn"，即伟大计划。\n按照计划，抢夺他国的殖民地比自己建设殖民地有效率得多。特别是葡萄牙殖民帝国，看来应该是做为计划目标的好靶子，更别说我国投资者已经开始这么做了。

original: No, the international community would hate us.
translation: 不，国际社会因此会憎恨我们。

original: The expansive Dutch economy has put large demands on our merchant marine. The very shallow Dutch waters also mean that common merchant ships such as caravels are unable to approach many of the Dutch ports. So far this has been handled by the use of smaller boeiers but with financial backing from Pieter Jansz Liorne, a Dutch merchant from Hoorn, a new type of ship has been developed.\nThe fluitship or fluyt is longer and has a very characteristic pear-shaped stern and is built to be effectively manned by a small crew. As it is able to carry larger cargoes while still handling the shallow Dutch waters and behaving very well in the open sea this ship is a godsend for our merchants.
translation: 庞大的荷兰金融业需要庞大的商船队。荷兰水域的浅水环境意味着比如卡拉维尔这样的常用商船无法停泊在很多荷兰港口，迄今为止这个问题都是利用更小的曲艏船来解决。但是在一位来自荷兰霍伦的商人彼得·扬茨·里奥的资助下，一种新型船研发成功。\n福禄特帆船的船体更长，具有典型的梨形船尾，专门建造便于小型团队操控。这种帆船能够装运体积更大的货物，并且同时在荷兰浅水区和外海都表现良好，对我们的商人来说简直是巧夺天工。

original: I wonder if our shipbuilding industry is ready for this?
translation: 我想知道我们的造船厂是不是可以开工了？

original: Things are not looking as bright as they once did for the Dutch East India Company. With other European powers getting involved in the East India trade it has no longer been possible for our company to monopolize certain goods and as a result of competition prices in Europe have fallen considerably. Desperate some company officials have taken extreme measures such as torching warehouses of spices in order to keep the prices up but the long-time effects of such actions have been negligible at best.\nStill all is not lost. The company still has considerable assets, experienced captains and good contacts in the East. It is, however, clear that things cannot proceed as they have done so far. Many feel that the route to go is to take a more generalist approach to East India trade rather than trying to monopolize single commodities, which has been the Company policy so far
translation: 其他欧洲势力介入东印度贸易之后，荷兰东印度公司昔日风光不再。由于无法垄断，同业竞争使得某些商品在欧洲的价格大幅跳水。一些公司职员不顾一切的采取极端措施，列如为了稳定价格而烧毁香料仓库，但长期来看这种行为的效果微不足道。\n东印度公司还没有全盘皆输，仍旧掌握着可观的资产、富有经验的船队和在东方良好的人脉。但是很明显这样下去会病入膏肓。很多人觉得解决之道是打破以往垄断单一商品的政策，转而更全面的发展东印度贸易。

original: The time has come for a reorientation.
Help the Company with generous loans.
translation: 帮助公司获得大笔贷款。
经济危机中的东印度公司

original: Despite transitioning to a more viable business model the Dutch East India Company has continued problems with solvency. Unwilling to restrict the payment of dividends despite sinking profits the Company has been paying out more money than it has been earning for decades.\nIn order to get back on its feet now the company has decided to borrow even more money. This is a tempting proposition as, should the Company be dissolved, the shock would seriously hurt our financial sector.
translation: 尽管荷兰东印度公司转型为一种更为可行的商业模式，但是清偿问题依旧存在。下滑的利润无法阻止清偿股息，公司已经支付的股息大于几十年来的营收。\n为了重振旗鼓公司甚至决定更多的贷款。假如这时候突然解散公司会是个诱人的选择，不过这会重创我们的金融业。

original: Poor financial policies and slow reactions due to its centralized control as well as continued competition and sinking prices have continued to make life hard for our East India Company. In day-to-day operations the company is still managing the control of all of our East Indian possessions well but many now have serious doubts about the viability of this in the long run. Perhaps the time has come to finally nationalize the VOC and take the hit to our economy that this would entail? Even if we do continue to support the company with more loans and subsidies it is unlikely that we will be able to shield the general Dutch economy entirely at this point.
translation: 高层的集权控制、对手的持续竞争和不断下滑的商品价格使得经济政策稀烂，反应缓慢。这让东印度公司的日子一天不如一天。虽然公司仍然日复一日想方设法更好的掌控我们在东印度的资产，然而长久以往下来现在很多人都严重质疑这种模式的可行性。可能东印度公司最终的归宿是国有化，让国家来承担？即使我们持续不断的用更多贷款和补贴支撑公司，此时此刻看起来我们也无法保全荷兰经济。

original: The debt of the VOC increases even further.
translation: 荷兰东印度公司的债务更进一步地增加了。

original: The Bank of Amsterdam & The International Capital Market
translation: 阿姆斯特丹银行&国际资本市场

original: Ever since the establishment of the Bank of Amsterdam the Dutch financial sector has been the hub of the European capital market. Dutch bankers are involved in everything from the wars to the manufactories of other European powers as well as various domestic enterprises. As mercantilism and protectionism closes off many foreign markets, however, the international position that once was the strength of the Dutch Banking establishment has suddenly become a weakness. As it has become known that the Bank has allowed the Dutch government and its companies to overdraw its accounts the credibility of the institution itself is also shaken in its very foundation. The Bank of Amsterdam is now ready to declare itself insolvent and it seems only a matter of time until we see the general effect of this on the Dutch economy.
translation: 自从阿姆斯特丹银行的建立以来，荷兰金融界已经成为了欧洲资本市场的中心。从战争到其他欧洲势力的制造业，和各种国内企业一样荷兰银行家的业务涉及方方面面。 由于重商主义和保护主义，很多外国市场随之关闭。荷兰银行业曾经以之为根本的国际地位如今骤然成为了弱项。原因众所周知，银行允许荷兰政府和荷兰公司透支其账户，这种制度的可靠性动摇了银行的基础。阿姆斯特丹银行现今已准备宣布破产，荷兰经济会因而受到全面影响只是时间问题。

original: The rule of $MONARCH$ has not been a popular one so far. In almost every part of our country the legitimacy of his rule is being questioned as well as his devotion to the Protestant ideals our country is built on. Seven plotters from all over the political spectrum have now taken it upon themselves to try to invite the Dutch Stadtholder to free the kingdom from its king.
translation: $MONARCH$的统治迄今为止并不为大众接受。他统治的合法性和他对以此立国的新教教义的奉献，我国民众大多都对此有疑问。来自不同政治派系的七人现在奋不顾身的设法邀请荷兰总督将王国从国王手中解放。

original: Seven influential Englishmen have sent us a letter urging us to come and free their kingdom from its unpopular and unable king. According to the plotters their monarch has made a mess of domestic as well as foreign matters. They now turn to us as we are a devout Christian country free of papist influence.
translation: 七名有影响力的英国人给我们写了封信劝说我们将他们的国家从不受欢迎和无能的国王手中解放出来。按照密谋者所言他们的君主把国内外事务都弄的一团糟。他们现在投靠我们因为我们是脱离于教廷势力的虔诚基督国家。

original: It seems the Dutch Stadtholder has been negotiating with the dissidents of our country. We can but lament the poor judgment of these deluded shopkeepers.
translation: 看起来荷兰总督已经和我国的异议者进行了谈判。我们可以为这些可怜又耳根子软的杂货店老板进行哀悼了。

original: Conspirators have offered the English crown to the Dutch.
translation: 密谋者将英国王位献给荷兰。

original: While it seems the letter of the seven dissidents did reach the United Provinces the Dutch have refused to cooperate with the plotters. This gesture is much appreciated.
translation: 看起来七位异议者的信确实到达了联合省，但是荷兰拒绝了与密谋者的合作。荷兰的这个表态不错。

original: Through the years since our independence the French have always been supportive of our kingdom as we had a mutual enemy in the Emperor and the heirs of Burgundy. Lately, however, French domestic policies towards the Huguenots as well as their foreign policy in our immediate surroundings have made many fear the French. Perhaps it is now time to try to gather friends before the inevitable conflict with our southern neighbor.
translation: 因为有着共同的敌人——皇帝和勃艮第的继承人，自我们独立后数年来法国对我国都呈现支持的态度。然而最近法国外交政策的矛头指向胡格诺派，使得周边都非常畏惧法国。在难以避免的和南方邻居冲突爆发之前，可能现在是时候设法召集盟友们了。

original: Our policy must be to contain the French.
translation: 我们的政策应该是遏制法国。

original: Pursue a friendly policy towards the French.
translation: 继续和法国的友好政策。

original: After years of, if not friendship at least friendly cooperation, the Dutch have begun to act more hostile towards us. We have received reports that they are seeking friends abroad among our enemies and that they intend to limit our influence in the Lowlands. While this is ungrateful it is perhaps also rather well timed. Without our goodwill to protect them the Lowlands would make a fine addition to our kingdom.
translation: 如果不是这么多年来的友好合作，荷兰将会对我们更加怀有敌意。有报告说他们正在我们的敌人之中寻找盟友，并试图限制我们在低地的影响力。他们忘恩负义的同时这更是一个好时机。没有我们出于善意保护他们，低地将很好的成为我们王国的一部分。

original: The Netherlands will try to improve their relations with our rivals.
translation: 尼德兰设法提高他们与我们的仇敌之间的关系。

original: The decision to close our borders to foreign merchants was surely a most prudent one. It has, however, cost the port of Nagasaki dearly. Some now suggest that we should in fact keep trade open with the Dutch East India Company. The Dutch view the Spanish and Portuguese with as much distrust as we do and their behavior has always been more balanced and restrained in our country. If we keep our borders open to the Dutch, however, some restrictions will surely still be needed. In the bay of Nagasaki the artificial island of Dejima was once created to house the Portuguese. If we restrict the Dutch to this island any dangerous influence will surely be stopped from spreading to the rest of our country.
translation: 让外国商人吃闭门羹肯定是最明智的一招。然而这让长崎港也付出了沉重的代价。现在一些人建议我们应该通过荷兰东印度公司开放贸易。荷兰和我们一样，不信任西班牙人和葡萄牙人，倒是他们在我国的所作所为更加公平和克制。即使我们向荷兰开放，同时一定的限制也还是需要的。在长崎湾上有个人工岛出岛，曾经被建造用于葡萄牙人居住。如果我们将荷兰人限制在这个岛上，任何危险的影响都不可能扩散到我国其他地区。
所有的西方人都应该滚。

original: While Japan has closed its borders to the outside world the VOC have now been offered to be their sole link to the west. The conditions are that the Dutch traders base themselves at the artificial island of Dejima in the Nagasaki bay and that they don't travel outside of that island at any time without special permission.
translation: 当日本向外部世界闭关锁国之时，东印度公司被授予成为联系西方的唯一途径。现状是荷兰贸易者把他们自己关在了人工岛出岛上，没有特殊许可任何时候都无法外出。

original: Discontent with the behavior of our troops in the region the peasants of Frisia have taken up arms against us. Joined by mercenary soldiers these revolters have had limited success on land but have already conducted some surprising maneuvers at sea. Indeed the revolters are as much pirates as they are soldiers and unless we put this thing down soon shipping will suffer.
translation: 弗里西亚地区的农民们心怀对我军行为的不满起身武装反抗。他们之中也有雇佣军的帮助，虽然在陆地上的战绩有限但在海上却神出鬼没。实际上他们的战斗方式就像海盗，除非我们能摆平这件事否则船运将会遭受影响。

original: Throughout the history of the early Netherlands the state has been run by and for Merchant capitalists. The mayors of the cities, the heads of the East India Company and other state companies have all themselves had a background as merchants and would have had both contact and knowledge of the world of trade that would help them make economically beneficial decisions.\nThis is, however, increasingly often not the case. The issuing of state bonds to finance government enterprises has served our country well through the years but a side effect has been that there is now a whole generation of rich and influential rentiers who have little to no practical experience of trade. Critics feel that these Wig-wearers lack ambitions beyond achieving cushy government offices and that their carefulness is in fact passivity. Whether this is true or not we have come a long way from the Merchant Capitalists that used to shape the future of our state.
translation: 纵观历史早期尼德兰是由商业资本家们统治着的。城市的市长们、东印度公司和其他公司的头头们都拥有商人背景。他们对世界贸易的知识和与商界的关系使他们更轻松的做出符合经济利益的决定。\n然而剧情往往不按照剧本发展。问题在于政府与企业捆绑，虽然这些企业良好的为国家服务了好些年，但是现在有一大群富裕和具有影响力的二代三代们领着租金和年金，然而他们都是贸易的门外汉。评论认为这些戴假发者缺乏雄心壮志，他们所要关心的实际上就是怎么躺着也赚钱却又不考虑政府的负担。无论这是否属实，过去商业资本主义带给了我国长足的进步，未来也将会是这样。

original: Baruch Spinoza - The Prince of Philosophers
translation: 巴鲁赫·斯宾诺莎——哲学大师

original: The son of an immigrant Portuguese Jewish family, Baruch Spinoza would lead a relatively simple life and supported himself as a lens maker and contributions from benefactors. While Spinoza is said to have been an excellent lens maker it is his devotion to philosophy, ethics and theology that this man will be remembered for. Spinoza published few works in his lifetime but his ideas came to circulate all the same and resulted in the University of Heidelberg offering him a chair, which he declined for fear that it might restrain his thought.
translation: 巴鲁赫·斯宾诺莎是一个葡萄牙犹太移民家庭之子。他本应该过着相当平凡的生活，靠制造镜片和捐助过活。然而斯宾诺莎不但镜片磨的好，而且让后人记住的是他对哲学、伦理学和神学的贡献。斯宾诺莎健在的时候并没有出版过几本书但是他的理念仍广为流传。为此海德堡大学提供他教授的工作，却被他以可能会限制思想为由拒绝。

original: This province is home to the Collegium Hosianum, an elite school for the spreading of the counter-reformation.
translation: 霍休斯神学院就坐落在这个省份，是为传播反宗教改革运动的精英学校。

original: Stanislaus Hosius, cardinal and the bishop of Warmia is worrying for the spiritual well-being of our country. In order to counter the spreading ideas of Protestantism among the Polish burghers and nobles Hosius has requested the help of the Jesuits. Together they have now devised a plan to create an elite school in his diocese. Anyone trained here will learn all that can be taught about how to counter the arguments of the reformers and how to recatholize regions that has already been lost to the Protestants.
translation: 枢机、沃尔米亚主教斯坦尼斯洛斯·霍休斯对我国灵性福祉感到担忧。霍休斯请求耶稣会的帮助反对在波兰市民和贵族间传播的新教教义。他们一起拟定计划在他的教区建立一所精英学校。由这里训练的人材将会学习怎样驳斥改革派的论点，并将已新教化的地区回归天主的福音。

original: The Radziwill Bible & the Reformation in Poland
translation: 拉济维乌圣经&波兰的宗教改革

original: A group of Calvinist scholars has finished a translation of the Bible into Polish. The scholars have worked from the most original sources known and there is no doubt this is a fine work. The prospect of an even greater accessibility to Protestant ideas for the Polish population is, however, a frightening idea. Calvinism has already established its grip over some of our nobles and Lutheranism exists among our burghers for a long while now.
